name: BattleTech: Reinforcements 2
description:
Expansion for the BattleTech game.

From the box cover:
"All 96 BATTLEMECHS, including the new Star League and CLANS 'MECHS described in the BATTLETECH TECHNICAL READOUT: 3050, await your command. Included are 192 full color playing pieces depicting the front and back views on heavy stock, along with card stands. Also included is a book of 96 prepared records sheets, one for each 'Mech."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Enchanters: Rage and Laughter
description:
An expansion for the fantasy card-drafting game Enchanters (or the stand-alone expansion, Enchanters: Overlords) featuring two brand new unique 25 card Kingdom Decks.

The Barbarians: The best defense is a good offense. Trade protection for power, accumulate as many attack points as you can, and challenge the fearsome Frost Dragon for victory.

The Faeries: These tricksters will reward you with great wealth and power.. but they'll reward your opponents as well. Balance what you gain against what you're forced to give up, use what you've won to defeat the capricious Faerie Dragon, and seize victory.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Boss Monster: Mirrax Promo Card
description:
Promo card given away at Gencon 2015.

Mirrax is a new Boss that can be added to either Boss Monster or Boss Monster 2 giving more versatility to the boss deck.

Card text: "Level Up: Choose another Boss. For the rest of the game, this Boss also has that Boss's treasure icon. (The icon remains even if that Boss dies.)"

Foil version available in Boss Monster 2 Collector's Edition
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Gemblo Expansion Set
description:
This 18-card expansion alters the play of the basic game by giving players cards used to bend the rules in various ways.

It also addresses the disadvantage that later players have in larger games by giving them greater choice of cards.

Contents:

18 Special Cards (2 each of 9 different cards)
1 vinyl zipper (ziplock) bag
1 instruction sheet (in English and Korean)

The cards are still in die-cut sheets, and have to be punched out by hand.

The expansion seems to be included with most games purchased from vendors in the United States; it isn't clear if that applies elsewhere in the world.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game
publishers: DG Games (I), Gemblo Company, Wisemen Games

name: Ugly Gryphon Inn: Innployees
description:
As you carry a tower of twenty filled pint glasses across a bar filled with fighting, smelly patrons you have an epiphany – you need to hire some help!

You may only hire one employee per round. If you hire an employee, flip over the top card from the deck. Then, check the quirk on the employee – it combines with the other patrons at the bar and trigger a bad effect.

After the employee is added – and any bad effects are resolved – when the player adds a patron to the inn they must resolve the employee’s special action as well. Their special actions are shown on the card. After the special action is resolved, the employee card is discarded.

By the end of the game, the player must have hired all three employees into their inn. For an employee to be considered ‘hired’ their special effect must have been resolved.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Steamwatchers: Fuel For War
description:
With Fuel For War, the Clan chiefs set Europa ablaze. They may stay in the Conclave to accrue more and more power, but can leave for the frozen battlefields, bolstering their army and boasting an incredible strength. However, should they stay too long in their seat, they will find only ashes.

—description from the publisher

Fuel For War gives you access to war chiefs. These powerful units start off the board and replace your regular Conclave tokens. Each time they spend a round in the Conclave, they acquire a new ability. You may also send your war chief to the battlefield with all of the powers they’ve gathered. If you’re too late, there will only be ash, but be too early and your war chief won’t matter as much on the board. This dilemma is at the core of the expansion.

You’re going to draw three neutral cards at the beginning of the game and will add them to the cards from your clan. You’ll be able to choose from all of the pool of upgrades.
Creating interesting ability combinations is important, but the crux is also to know when to go to the battlefield.

This expansion also includes new Scenario and Archon cards for the main game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Order Counters, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Magic: The Gathering – Exodus
description:
The crew of the Weatherlight is dead set on recovering all that Rath has taken from them: their captain, their companions, and the stolen artifacts of the Legacy weapon. Meanwhile, Ertai works to open the arcane portal, so they can escape. Disaster threatens Dominaria. Will they be able to warn it in time?

Exodus, the third and final set in the Tempest block, features 143 new expert-level cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Zooloretto: Skunk
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 9.
Also a promo for Spiel 2016.

The first player who fills his 6-space Enclosure takes the enclosure with the Skunk as a bonus.

Once per game, If it is the owners turn he can pay 2 coins to discard all tiles of one animal type from his barn as an additional action before or after his usual action. The player puts the coins on the Skunk enclosure and they remain there until the end of the game. In turn order, all other players may then pay 1 coin to the bank to purchase 1 of the discarded tiles and add it to their zoo. The tiles that were not purchased are removed from the game.
Scoring: The coins on the Skunk enclosure are not considered during scoring
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: Vault Wars: Mirrored Chest Promo Card
description:
Promo card that was first available during the Kickstarter campaign for Vault Wars.

Card effect:
AUCTION MASTER
Draw Items face-down. You may peek at 2 Items. The opening bid is 1 Gold, you may continue to bid.

WINNER
Split all Items into two piles, revel 1 Item from each pile. Second place player selects 1 pile to keep, the Winner keeps the other. Both players must pay their bids as normal
categories: Card Game, Fantasy

name: Tramways: Grand Station
description:
Grand Station is the first set of mini expansions for Tramways.

It contains:

3 new tiles with special abilities:
Grand Station
Stock Exchange
Park

4 new building cards
1 Station Master


This expansion is released in a cover flap that explains how the Grand Station of Tramways was built.
categories: City Building, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Kingdom of Solomon Promo: Levite Camp
description: Promo card from Essen 2011. Card reads: "Levite - Build a Temple Block for Free", is worth 14 vp, and costs one cube of each color
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game

name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Dragon's Den
description:
The first adventure pack expansion to the base board game of "New Easy to Master Dungeons and Dragons". The world of the base game and the expansions is called Thunder Rift. There were 3 expansions created for the base game. Dragon's Den, Dungeons & Dragons: The Goblin's Lair , Dungeons & Dragons: The Haunted Tower. A dungeon crawl and monster bashing adventure for beginners.

The dragon laughs and prepares to strike. But you were nearly defeated by his minions, and you are now too weak to wield your sword. Your magic-user is out of spells; your other comrades, too, have lost their fighting spirit. What hope have you of defeating the vile dragon? Do you run, or do you try one last, desperate plan...?

Inside this box you'll find three complete adventures, each featuring a different dragon. But before you and your friends can confront a fiendish black, green, or red dragon, you must fight off hordes of evil lizard men, troglodytes, bugbears, and more! Then it's up to you to escape from the dungeon alive!
In addition to the three adventures, there's also a stand-alone board game that uses all the game pieces and poster maps inside. You and your friends will enjoy hours of high excitement with the three adventures and the bonus game, too!

The expansion includes 3 16 page adventure booklets, 3 full color fold up maps, 1d6 and d10, new counters, new floor tiles to enhance the maps, 72 new monster stand-ups, and 8 more character stand-ups. The three adventures can be played separately or as a series of connected adventures.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die Taverne von Andor
description: This mini-expansion is included with the novel "Die Legenden von Andor: Das Lied des Königs." It consists of a single card that allows you to gain different advantages by bringing farmers to the Tavern (space 72) rather than the castle.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: BattleCON: Ernie the Geek Promo
description:
Ernie the Geek, mascot of BoardGameGeek, joins BattleCON as a promotional character.

Ernie begins the game by distributing his game counters across the board, then collects them back over the course of a duel to gradually increase his capabilities. Will you prioritize certain stats to take advantage of your enemy's weaknesses, or try to build up gradually for a solid, well-rounded fight? And how will your enemies respond to your attempts to collect more? With his signature attack "Tableflip" and his finisher "Raise the Stakes" (that forces you to play another game from your collection in order to resolve), Ernie is a force of geekdom to be reckoned with!
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Kaosball: Team – Boomtown Cowboys
description:
“Bullseye. Good luck in the afterlife.”

-Stalwart Jack, coach

They come from the frontiers of Boomtown, and they came armed! Nobody knows how, but this impressive team sports their Hammer&Smythe six-shooters into the field and can take down opposing teams from a distance! Will Kaosball ever be the same?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Hidden Compartment Pack: Expansion for Cards Against Humanity and Exploding Kittens
description:
The Hidden Compartment Pack is a Target-exclusive expansion for both Cards Against Humanity and Exploding Kittens.It is so named because the only way to get it was to flush it out of a hidden compartment of the big box stands.

Cards Against Humanity
The pack contains 14 white cards. None are blank cards. No black cards are included.

Exploding Kittens
Instruction for the 'Blind As A Bat' card, and 5 'Blind As A Bat' cards are included. The 'Blind As A Bat' card content is identical, the card backs are different for use with different versions of Exploding Kittens.
- 3 copies of the 'Blind As A Bat' card are included for use with the Exploding Kittens Party Pack (1st and 2nd edition). They also work with foreign language editions of the original game using this cardback.
- 2 copies of the 'Blind As A Bat' card are included for use with the original Exploding Kittens game (regular and NSFW). They also work with up to medium-sized games of the Party Pack's English 3rd edition.

From the product packaging:
"Whoa! Way to go, champ! You found our hidden pack. This pack contains new cards for both Cards Against Humanity and Exploding Kittens. The Exploding Kittens cards introduce a whole new mechanic to the game. The Cards Against Humanity cards serve absolutely no purpose."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult

name: Kaosball: Team – New Edo Samurai
description:
“Those who win at Kaosball walk with Truth. The champions of Kaosball understand Truth’s fluidity.”

-Shoujiki, coach

New Edo is a city rich with tradition. Their stalwart Samurai runners and bruisers defend its honor and heritage, and are truly devastating on the field. Dazzle your opponents by honorably declaring your cardplay choices ahead of time for points … but are you telling the truth?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Starfire III: Empires
description: Starfire III, Empires was the second expansion to the original pocket game Starfire. Starfire III, Empires is a set of campaign rules allowing players to create their own races, colonize planets, research technologies, using the original Starfire tactical space combat of the Starfire system.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Castle Panic: Tower Promo 2017 Tabletop Day
description:
From the publisher:

The International Tabletop Day 2017 Tower is the third in the series for Castle Panic fans. Players replace 1 of the original Towers with this collector's Tower. When it's destroyed during the game, everyone draws up to a full hand and trades a card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Eve's Mystery Mead
description:
A limited release promo for The Red Dragon Inn first released at Gencon 2014 and available at the SlugFest Games booth. Shuffle or replace a card in any Red Dragon Inn Drink Deck with Eve's Mystery Mead to add a bit more excitement to your game!

A second edition of this card is part of the The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox (Collector's Edition).
categories: Card Game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Faith and Firepower
description:
Expand your battles with Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Faith and Firepower! This 112-card set includes two new armies for Munchkin Warhammer 40,000. The Sisters of Battle are some of the most elite Imperial soldiers around, and the T'au make terrifying enemies...or stalwart allies in the war against Chaos. Plus lots of new loot and horrible monsters to fight!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Delta Vision Publishing, Hobby World, Pegasus Spiele, Steve Jackson Games

name: Battlestations: The Planet of Dr. Moreau
description:
This expansion/mini-campaign lets the characters play two different sides. Players can choose to be "animal men" serving Dr. Moreau or play the U.R.E.F. exploring the strange happenings in this sector of space.

Expands:

Battlestations
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: London 1888: Whitechapel
description: This extension to London 1888 adds new characters, action cards and weapons to the original mix. New event cards will allow the players to change the course of the game. Also a new mechanic is introduced to increase the tension between the players.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery

name: Escape Room: The Game – Da Vinci's Telescope
description:
While studying Leonardo Da Vinci’s many paintings, drawings, sketches and notes, collector Sam Anoli came across a gem; a totally unknown telescope! Judging by all the well-hidden clues in Da Vinci’s works, this special telescope must contain a great important secret that can only be discovered while watching the solar eclipse…

—description from the designer
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., Noris Spiele

name: Concept: La Recharge
description: Concept: La Recharge is the first expansion for Concept. It contains a deck (as big as the base game) of new theme cards (that's 990 new words and expressions) to diversify and expand the amount of concepts players must guess.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Napoleon's War: Battle Pack I
description:
From the publisher's website:

Includes the Battle of Alexandria March 21, 1801 on a desert map. Jena October 14, 1806. Auerstadt October 14, 1806 and Busaco 1810. Each battle has it's own game board on card stock. The battle pack requires ownership of Napoleon's War Vol. I to play.

La Rothiere, February 1, 1814 on a winter snow map, was originally going to be included but was dropped.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: EONS: Cosmic Expansions
description:
As Neil DeGrasse Tyson says, "We have a one-way ticket" to an expanding universe, and so it is with EONS: Cosmic Expansions, a set of three expansions for EONS that adds three distinct expansion decks that can be used together or individually, in conjunction with the base game.

Cosmic Bodies, expansion 1, expands the EONS universe to include Orange Dwarves, Asteroid Fields which the players can "throw" at other players to destroy planets, and Binary Star Systems. Cosmic Technology, the second expansion, grants civilizations the ability to colonize other planets with fewer resources or become space-faring and no longer vulnerable to player action. Finally, Cosmic Destruction adds a Rogue Black hole that is high victory points, but has to be fed element cubes or the player loses their victory points. It also adds a Red Supergiant, which becomes a black hole when destroyed and the brown dwarf, which try as it might, will never make star status and will die after a set number of rounds.

Together, these expansions give EONS more options in both competitive and cooperative play and has shown to decrease both the PvP and play time of the game, due to players making more strategic decisions that affect themselves instead of others, in an effort to use the new cards that are very valuable to build towards.

EONS: Cosmic Expansions also includes more cooperative scenarios and adds printed secret agendas to the game, so it is almost five expansions in one small box.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Castle Dracula Expansion
description:
This expansion introduces the legendary Vampire Lord, Count Dracula, his Elder Vampire Brides and his Human Minion Renfield.

Box contains
4 Highly detailed plastic miniatures:
• Count Dracula.
• The Brides of Dracula.
• Renfield, his trusty servant.
• Dracula’s Coffin.
2 Double-sided Map Tiles.
20 Dracula Activation Cards.

Rule book
1 Campaign and 4 Hunts.

The true story of Dracula is well known to the Order of Vampire Hunters, at least the Victorian history, although they have done well to shield the world from this information. You have only heard stories, half-truths and lies.

Jonathon Harker and Quincey Morris, renowned members within the Order, tracked Dracula with initially promising, but finally disastrous, results. Their work came to an end in 1886, when Harker left the Order, on the day the Hunt for Dracula was officially closed. It’s true that months before, Harker slashed the Vampire’s throat while Dracula lay in his coffin. The Order was convinced that Morris’ firsthand account of the Hunt was accurate and the pair of Hunters did indeed destroy Dracula. Harker maintained that his blow was not fatal and since it was made close to sundown, they could not stay in the Den and make sure. The Order suggested that Harker’s grief over the turning of his fiancée, Mina Murray, had turned his Hunt into an obsession, one that he could not give up. And since Dracula has not been seen for over a century, perhaps they were right all along.

So what of the infamous novel? Forsaken by the Order, Harker took it upon himself to warn the world of the threat posed by the Night. Working with an unknown writer, Stover Bram, on his biography, Harker believed that a detailed and truthful account of his dealings with Vampires and the Order would both alert the public and force the Order into bolder action.

But the only action they took was to block Harker and Bram at every turn. Finally, 2 years after Harker’s death in 1895, Bram managed to get their opus published under a pen name, as a work of gothic fiction, with virtually every detail changed. The facts are that Harker was a skilled Hunter until Dracula broke him, Mina turned but was destroyed by Morris, and Dracula was grievously wounded but escaped with most of his minions. The preposterous Van Helsing was, of course, entirely fictional.

Harker had no descendants, but Bram’s bloodline eventually joined the Order, finally acknowledging that they could do more inside the fold than out. Could they be all that remains of Dracula’s legacy?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board
publishers: Dark Gate Games LLC, DG Games Entertainment (Dark Gate Games)

name: China: Das Duell
description:
This expansion to China allows the game to be played by two players. It adds a third, neutral, player (the Emperor) which players alternate playing pieces of onto the board. Five new influence cards indicate for which player the Emperor's pieces score. Additionally, each player has three special action cards which allow them to break certain rules when surrendered.

Expands:

China
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: RWBY: Combat Ready – Villains Expansion
description: Replaces base game generic villain token with 3 villain specific miniatures, 10 new cards for each base game villain, 6 new cards for each of the five base game main characters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Spawn of Madness Asylum Pack
description:
In Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game - Spawn of Madness, chaos explodes through a series of powerful events and support cards. "The Sleeper Awakens!" for the Cthulhu faction will clear the board of characters while Yog-Sothoth's "Revelation of the Spheres" will steal characters before opponents have a chance to play them. Madness, Disasters, Monsters, and Servitors lurk in Spawn of Madness!

Spawn of Madness first appeared as an Asylum pack when that game was being published in a CCG format. In 2011, Fantasy Flight Games revised Spawn of Madness to fit its Living Card Game format, with three copies each of twenty different cards. The card text has been updated to reflect the most recent FAQ and errata.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Crowbar!: The Rangers at Pointe Du Hoc – Vorwarts!
description: "Vorwarts!" is a complete, boxed wargame expansion for Crowbar. The expansion includes a sheet of new counters, including Ranger machine gun emplacements, German offensive units, and much more. Also included are six beautiful new scenarios including a shortened main scenario, smaller scenarios for each of the Ranger companies, and two counterattack scenarios in which you play as the German, counterattacking the Ranger positions. The expansion also comes with a rules booklet and a pretty box to keep it all safe.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Risk Édition Napoléon: Extension Empire Ottoman
description:
This is an extension for Risk Édition Napoléon that introduces the Ottoman Empire as a sixth player.

It consists in a map overlay, 4 new Mission cards, 8 more Risk cards (for the Ottoman areas) and an additional set of figures. In addition to the Ottoman tokens, the extension also adds tokens for Neutral Fleets (a supplied optional rule) and tokens for optional named Generals (for those who'd like to increase the historicity of the game by actual using the right generals).

Expands:

Risk: Édition Napoléon
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Starship Catan: 3. Mission – The Diplomatic Station
description:
Description from www.catan.com:
"There will be a big celebration in honor of our new membership to the Galactic Council! We are asked to organize the celebration and will need to build a Diplomatic Space Station for that purpose. 1000 guests are expected to show up!"

Content:
12 "diplomatic station" adventure cards
5 module cards
2 manufacturing markers
2 crest tokens

This is a download expansion set for Starship Catan which can be obtained from the Starship Catan website.

Part of the Catan Series.

Expands:

Starship Catan
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Zombies Keep Out: Night of the Noxious Dead
description: The goblin bodgers’ workshop is on the verge of being overrun by a teeming mob of zombies—and now foul Stinkers have joined the ranks of the shambling dead! The stench of these vile zombies is so strong it practically glows, forcing even other zombies to keep their distance. Luckily the bodgers have a stockpile of new parts to build canny new defense contraptions. That might be just what they need to make it through the night!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Zombies

name: Cards Against Humanity: Vote for Hillary Pack
description:
We’re letting America choose between two new expansion packs about either Hillary Clinton or Donald Trump.

At the end of this promotion, Cards Against Humanity will tally up the sales of both packs, and depending on which pack gets more support, we will donate all the money in support of Hillary Clinton.

The Vote For Hillary Pack contains 15 cards about Hillary Clinton, who has served our country as Secretary of State, Senator of New York, and First Lady of the United States.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: L.A.M.A.: No Drama Sonderkarte
description:
Special Card for Llama

The No Drama Lama is put in the middle of the table at the beginning of every round. Once you pass, take the card. If another player already has the card, take it from him. Only the last remaining player can't take the card.

When the round is over, by usual rules (everybody has passed or someone played his last card), the owner of the No Drama Lama may discard one card before counting his points. If that card was his last card, he can discard one token (black or white).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Stew: Fungus Among Us
description:
Legend has it that if you cook with mushrooms, you might get visited by a gnome! Don't mistake this for good luck, as it's quite the opposite when your bellas start to go missing.

Components:
4 Bella Ingredient Cards
1 Mutant Ingredient Card
1 Gnome Vermin Card

Gameplay:
Add these new cards to your games of Stew to mix things up.


Released in the April 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $20+ package.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming

name: Cards Against Humanity: 2000s Nostalgia Pack
description:
Dude, where’s my car? The 2000s Nostalgia Pack comes with 30 new cards capitalizing on the surge of dopamine that floods your brain when you think about your childhood.


Chunky highlights.
Butterfly clips.
Bootcut jeans.
Bush did 9/11.
You’re such a Miranda!


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: When Darkness Comes: Hell Unleashed
description: This is the second expansion for When Darkness Comes. It features additional rules and scenarios, more encounter disks and two additional miniatures. Also contains part three of the GM campaign.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Spirits of the Forest: Solar Terms Cards
description:
This is a pack of 3 promo cards for Spirits of the Forest.

The cards add 3 more wishes to the game.

The pack was originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 2 Kickstarter campaign in 2018. ThunderGryph made them available to purchase during the pledge manager for Spirits of the Forest.

Each purchase of the pack helped contribute to plant a tree.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game

name: Epic Card Game: Keira, Wolf Caller Promo Card
description:
The box comes with 200 Epic Card Game card sleeves and 4 corrugated cardboard dividers, one for each faction, as well as a single promo card:

Keira, Wolf Caller
Wild Human Champion
Cost: 1
Ability: Ambush • Blitz Your wolf tokens have blitz, +1 attack and +1 defense. Tribute → Put two wolf tokens into play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: 1825 Regional Kit R3: North Norfolk
description:
1825 Regional Kit: R3 - North Norfolk is an expansion for 1825 Unit 1, an 18xx game. It includes:


Game board
1 minor company (4 share certificates, 2 tokens and 1 pawn)
3 Yellow Tiles: 1 of 8; 2 of 9
2 Green Tiles: 1 each of 11 & 14
3 Russet Tiles: 1 each of 35, 37 & 38


1825 Unit 1 is required to play this expansion.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Modular Board, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Rise of the Kage: Docks of Ryu
description:
Rise of the Kage: Docks of Ryu expansion sees the ninja of the shadow wind clan come up against the brutal Minato and his trusted dock guards. Make your way through junks, warehouses and markets on your way to the summit of Ryu. With new maps, custom missions, guards and ninja the adventure continues in Rise of the Kage: Docks of Ryu.

This expansion includes:

20 plastic miniatures

1 double sided game board

16 game cards

4 player mats

Note: Rise of the Kage: Docks of Ryu is an expansion and requires the base game of Rise of the Kage.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Team-Based Game

name: Compounded: Methamphetamine
description:
Designed as an exclusive promo for Unpub4. The Compounded Methamphetamine compound was made for those clamoring for an expansion based on a wildly popular television show. This is probably the closest to that becoming a reality.

The Methamphetamine Compound can be used as a Lab Partner card, following the same rules for that expansion (which is included in all copies of the base game).
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Nightmare III
description:
Welcome to the witching hour! Another 60 minutes of spell-binding interactive entertainment with Anne de Chantraine. Nightmare III- the Sequel to The Video Board Game Nightmare that turns a maiden into a monster!
This is hot-tempered HI-FI horror in a VHS cassette, with new sets of Time and fate cards, twice the dice and three times the fun.
We are on a witch hunt and ugly has a new name. Anne de Chantraine.
Anne de Chantraine was 17 years-old when convicted of witchcraft and burn alive at the stake. She was, naturally, innocent, hence the players response of "Mea Culpa Anne". Latin for "I am culpable".
Simply insert the new cassette, press play and meet the girl of your dreams in your worst Nightmare.
Anne de Chantraine. Witch. Nightmare. "Time to turn up the heat!"
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: A Couple 'A Cowboys, Borras Plana S.A., Chieftain Products, Schmidt Spiele, Spear's Games

name: Solomon Kane: Against the Vampires
description:
2 new adventures in the Vampire's lair
5 Acts - 50 Chapters
27 Miniatures
12 new 20x20 cm map Tiles
150 Chapter cards
200 Discovery cards
Story Book
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Flamme Rouge: Team Trial
description:
Promotional card offered by "Man vs Meeple Season One Kickstarter".

New stage card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: CVlizations: Promo Cards
description:
A set of three cards given out at Essen 2015 as a promo.
These are extra "idea cards" that add variety to the game.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Fluxx: Creeper Pack
description: Fluxx: Creeper Pack includes War, Death, Taxes, and a Radioactive Potato — cards dropped from version 5.0 of Fluxx, which removed the the Creepers that had been introduced in version 4.0. In addition to these cards, this expansion pack includes Goals, Actions, and New Rules related to these cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Secrets of the Lost Tomb: The Elite Missions
description:
September 22nd, 1935: “We’ve been successfully completing expeditions to the Tomb for generations, however in all of my years of experience, I’ve never witnessed challenges like these!. I’ve been to the Tomb more than anyone else, and I’ve survived more than you could imagine; from supernatural otherworldly beings of awe-striking power, to power hungry fascists, to beasts of myth and stories of old. I’ve held in my hands priceless artifacts, as well as the heads of my dying brothers and sisters. We were given a mission, one that we felt confident we could achieve. But when we got to the Tomb ... Nothing could have prepared us for what happened next...”

Mission Briefing: The previous quote was taken from a
veteran adventurer that attempted an elite mission...
Proceed with caution!

Secrets of the Lost Tomb: The Elite Missions, adds a whole new level of depth and challenge to the already Epic experience. Fun to play and simple to add, players are able to use one or more Elite Mission cards to overlay any existing Secrets of the Lost Tomb scenario. Contained within this special expansion are 12 Elite Missions to choose from, each with a diverse storyline and deadly consequence. Many will attempt these missions, few will survive... will you?
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Steamwatchers: Spark of Hope
description:
With Spark of Hope, you'll be able to use mobile structures, the Caravans, to make your Clan stronger and more influential. Have your Caravans evolve each turn to gain even more adaptability. But beware, only Careeners can build them, and they will certainly remind you of what you owe them.

—description from the publisher

Spark of Hope is all about a new type of miniature: Caravans.
These vehicles are like mobile structures, but they come with a cost: you need to provide upkeep to benefit from their powerful abilities.

The three vehicles will allow you to specialize your caravan to better your production, your military prowess, or your logistic ability. First and foremost, the caravan is a mobile algofuel production unit. When on a steam column during Thaw, it may produce algofuel barrels with which you can further develop your vehicles by installing Kits on them, or by improving existing Kits.

This expansion also includes new Scenario and Archon cards for the main game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Order Counters, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Martinique: Mini Expansion
description: A small, postcard-sized expansion, containing twelve 4-points souvenirs and a special Joker tile.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: Cthulhu Wars: Unique High Priests
description:
This freely downloadable PDF consists of eight Unique High Priest loyalty cards that can be substituted for the standard High Priest loyalty card. A normal High Priest miniature (or some sort of stand-in) is used to represent each Unique High Priest.

They are:

Asenath Waite
Crawford Tillinghast
Ermengarde Stubbs
Herbert West
Joseph Curwen
Keziah Mason
Lavinia Whateley
Pitpipo
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery – House Calavius
description: The mini-expansion Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery – House Calavius consists of a new single house card for use with Spartacus. Initially available only to winners of Spartacus tournaments at Gen Con 2014, House Calavius is also included in Spartacus: The Shadow of Death.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Shitenno: Geisha Promo Card
description:
The Geisha is a promotional add-on role for Shitenno.

Set up : Place the Geisha Card on the Tohoku province.

Rule : When a player places a Kamon on the province where the Geisha is, he gets 2 additionnal points and the Geisha moves to the following province clockwise.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Quadropolis: Ludo Fact
description:
A promo tile featuring Ludo Fact with a factory symbol (factory), which requires 1 inhabitant for activation and grants 2VP. From round 2 it replaces factory tile 2209.

Ludo Fact is a German company that produces up to 13 million board games and puzzles per year for 170 games publishers worldwide.
categories: City Building
mechanics: Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Veggie Garden: Harvest Festival Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

It's time for the Harvest Festival!
Fall is best known as the harvest season... and the time when competition is the fiercest at the community garden!

Veggie Garden's first expansion keeps the game fresh by adding three new veggies to the mix.

So get your green thumbs ready again, and dig in!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Farming

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Rock Paper Wizard – Levitate
description:
Levitate is a new spell card for Rock Paper Wizard.

The image shows a hand showing "thumbs up" and the text reads:
"Target advances 1, then caster advances 1 per wizard closer to the hoard"

Instead of having a card number in the lower right corner, the card is marked "promo" there.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Terrain tiles
description: This pack of three terrain tiles is a mini-addon to Neuroshima Hex! 3.0. The terrain tiles (jungle, swamp and hills) can be placed on the board before play and they will affect the Units, their attacks, abilities etc. in a various ways.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Thunderbolt Apache Leader: Expansion #1 – Nap of the Earth
description:
"Nap of the Earth" is a double expansion pack with 64 cards, 42 counters, and a rule sheet to reinforce your Thunderbolt-Apache Leader game!
—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: King of New York: Hibernation
description:
King of New York: Hibernation is a promotional Keep card for King of New York. You are forbidden from buying this card in Manhattan (too noisy!). It prevents you from taking damage, but the only rolls you can use are ♥ and ⌁ — using anything else wakes you from hibernation.

Part of the King of Tokyo series.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination
publishers: Egmont Polska, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, IELLO Games, Reflexshop

name: Dice Forge: Mother of Monsters
description:
This card replace one of the Hydra deck. This card has no effect, you win only victory points.

During the setup, if you are playing with the Hydra cards, replace one of the Hydra cards by the promotional card in question.
The cards will be placed in the pile in ascending order:
Hydra > Harpies > Chimera > Mother of monsters

This card is given out by the publisher during official Dice Forge tournaments.
categories: Ancient, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Citadels: Scenic Route Mini Expansion
description:
Set of 14 new district cards

New rules excerpts: Facedown districts have no building cost or effects, but they do count towards your completed city.

Some cards affect components in the box. Keep unused components nearby when playing with these cards.

Each card has different card text affecting the game in different ways.

Promo available with purchase of the new 2021 edition of the game in participating outlets.

The 14 cards are:

Architects' Guild
Avant-Garden
Ballroom
Clockworks
Consulate
Dragon Roost
Excavation Site
Festival Ground
Forum
Labyrinth
Royal Coffer
Shadow Chamber
Sinkhole
Trade Bridge
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Drafting, Open Drafting, Set Collection
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Hans im Glück, MINDOK, Z-Man Games

name: Splendor: Cities of Splendor Promotional Tile
description:
A promotional city tile initially given away with demos of Cities of Splendor at Gen Con 50 (2017).

This is a single-sided city tile. Acquiring the card requires 28 points, less the total count of your purchased development cards.

This tile is meant to be used with no other city tiles in play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: The Metagame: The Games Expansion
description:
It’s a brand new expansion for the card game The Metagame, about games. Now, finally, you can enjoy the ultimate creative indulgence and play a game about games. The Metagame gets even more meta, and board game scientists tell us they’ve never seen anything like this before. It’s off the scale.

These are the cards you've been looking for. 100% curated and written by the unhinged geniuses at Shut Up & Sit Down, the smartest tabletop site there is. Who else could bring you all-new Metagame cards about your favorite videogames, tabletop games, even the most dangerous games?

This is our third expansion for The Metagame, so what better time to get seriously meta? The new expansion includes 40 culture cards and 16 opinion cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Centauri Saga: Abandoned
description:
In a future where the solar system is ruled by a tyrannical government, a band of outcasts escapes to a star system light years away. There they discover an ancient human colony with a dark secret that threatens to destroy the Earth itself. You are all that stands between the Earth that abandoned you and its total destruction.

Take command of a ragtag space fleet and fight to save the Earth with nothing but a handful of outcasts and your ingenuity. Build, explore, and fight as you try to survive long enough to warn the Earth of the coming menace.

Centauri Saga: Abandoned is a legacy expansion for the sci-fi/4X co-operative board game for 1 to 4 players. All physical changes will be applied ONLY to expansion material itself.
categories: Adventure, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Pixel Glory: Pets Expansion
description:
Pets are awesome companions that join you on your quest for Pixel Glory! Pets stay by your side every turn to help you slay monsters in the dungeon. You acquire a pet in the town/drafting phase by choosing to draft one instead of a spell. Before the town/drafting phase, one pet for each player is shuffled into the spell deck - players may only use one pet.

This expansion is exclusive to Kickstarter and conventions.

Base-game reminder:
Pixel Glory is a fast-paced dungeon crawling card game for two to four players that plays in 20 minutes and takes five minutes to learn. Team up with fellow wizards to vanquish the sinister monsters that lurk in the dungeon, and save the nearby village. This is a noble and honourable quest, and... oh, who are we kidding? In reality, you're a greedy wizard who is all about fame and personal gain, and your fellow wizards are cut from the same cloth! Prevail over your opponents by learning the best spells and using that knowledge to out-manoeuvre and kill-steal in the dungeon, so you can gain admiration of the townsfolk, fame across the realm, and achieve Pixel Glory.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Hierarchy: Emissary
description:
Solo expansion for Hierarchy.


Two noble families have been fighting over the throne for years, and the people of the kingdom have suffered. You’ve been sent to make sure there is an uneventful transition into a new age of peace. To be a successful Emissary, you must play all 14 cards.

Hierarchy: Emissary comes with 3 double sided Edict cards that give special abilities, as well as three alternate game cards (Impostor, Tower, and Surgeon) to swap in for solo play.

At any time, you may discard an Edict card to use its printed ability. You must be able to resolve the card in order to use it. For example, if there are no cards left in the deck, you cannot “Return a card to the bottom of the deck.”

It also comes in three levels of difficulty. In the Standard and Expert difficulties, after you fully resolve the Edict, you must remove the bottom card in the line and place it on top of its deck, extending the length of the game.

While it's not required, we also made a sweet playmat for solo play. If you like to go all out, the playmats are always really nice.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer: Storm of Magic
description:
[Publisher website]
Storm of Magic is an expansion for Warhammer, the Game of Fantasy Battles. Launched in July 2011, Storm of Magic describes what happens when great eldritch maelstroms roil across the lands. Magic becomes far more powerful and there is a whole range of Cataclysm spells to cast, unleashing untold devastation on the enemy. Arcane Fulcrums burst from the ground, not only acting as loci for the swirling energies that pervade a battle fought amidst the Storm of Magic, but changing the way a Warhammer tabletop looks and interacts with your armies.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Go Nuts for Donuts: Apple Fritter
description:
Go Nuts for Donuts: Apple Fritter is a Kickstarter Limited Exclusive promo card for use with Go Nuts for Donuts.

This is a green card for use with 2+ players. It grants 3 points "if there are 13 or more cards in the discard pile."
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Convoys in Flames
description:
Convoys in Flames (CoiF) includes all the escort carriers, sub chasers, and specially fitted ASW aircraft that fought the battle of the Atlantic.

Facing them are the specialist subs designed throughout the war to try to bring Britain to her knees. These include the Schnorkel, the Walther, the Milch cows and even the first ever guided missile submarines to roll off the production lines.

All the major powers of World War II thus have vastly enhanced capability to fight this most deadly of naval battles.

Also included are the German auxiliary cruisers and the tankers and convoys produced by all the major powers and minor countries. At last you can slink silently between the convoys or hunt down those wolf packs until final victory is achieved.

Convoys in Flames includes 400 counters, rules and charts.

(from ADG's Description)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: T.I.M.E Stories: Special Reward promo
description:
Contained in the Deutscher Spielepreis 2016 Goodie Box

Includes 3 beacon tokens

You may only use these beacons in the third run of a mission.

After entering a location, but before reading the "A" card, you may decide to use the beacon. If you do, flip all the cards on the location except those with state tokens or other special restrictions, and read them.

Once read, flip them back over and proceed as normal.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order, Voting

name: Red Alert: Space Fleet Warfare – Meteor Storm Escalation Pack
description:
Escalation packs present additional starship models, rules, and terrain to add to the RED ALERT core game.

This escalation Pack contains:

1 rulebook containing special rules and 2 new scenarios
2 punchboards of meteors
2 six-sided dice
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Ragnarocks: The Winds of Chaos Expansion
description:
The Winds of Chaos Expansion adds 9 new Mythology cards with some super fun powers supported by the extra components included, adding even more variability to your game sessions!

The 2 Custom Dice will be used to randomly determine a direction for you to make additional moves, summon additional runestones, or manipulate your opponents depending on the Mythology card you are using.

The 6 Viking Cards included will allow you to select a specific figure on the board in secret to receive a bonus or hindrance at the end of the game - again based on the Mythology cards in play.

And the 10 adorable Mountain Minis pair with other Mythology cards to allow for extra movement or even stand in as a strong and immovable Viking!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology

name: Agricola: The Legen*dairy Forest Deck – Chuck the Wood Chuck
description:
Chuck the Wood Chuck is a special promo card from the SPIEL 10 in Essen and expands the Agricola The Legen*dary Forest Deck.

Description of the card:

Whenever Chuck the Wood Chuck would chuck wood, Chuck chucks more wood.

If an action gives you wood as the only resource, you get 1 more wood.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Formule Dé Circuit № 1: Grand Prix de MONACO
description:
The first course was included in Ludodélire's french version of Formule Dé. For other countries, he was sold standalone too.

38" x 24"; 167 spaces long; 10 corners (one "3", two "2"); straights 28, 23, 18; longest straight starts from "3".

PLUE : 1 A 7 VARIABLE : 8 A 12 SOLEIL : 13 A 20
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Sports

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault – Mirrored City Boards Pack
description:
Expand and enhance your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault with this pair of double-sided board sections. The Mirrored City boards, previously found in the Warhammer Underworlds: Shadespire box, provide an opportunity for different tactical challenges and increase your options for multiplayer board layouts when added to your Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault games.

This board is exactly the same dimensions as those provided in the Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault game, and constructed from the same durable card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Ultimate Werewolf: Hunting Party
description:
Description from the publisher:

What better way to rid your village and the surrounding lands of the werewolf menace but to head up a powerful hunting party, designed to do just that? The Huntress is a one-shot wonder guaranteed to kill her target. The Mad Bomber takes out the two players closest to him if he’s killed. The Revealer has the ability to kill every single werewolf in just one night...unless he’s wrong about who’s a werewolf, in which case he dies. The Mystic Seer knows the exact role of her target. The Mentalist knows if any pair of players are on the same team or not. Not to be outdone by all the newfound power of these villagers, the Werewolves have a new wolf: the Alpha Wolf, who can turn a player into a wolf at night instead of eliminating him.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Dungeons & Dragons Fantastic Locations: Fane of the Drow
description:
D&D Miniatures Fantastic Locations Map Pack: Includes Scenario and 2 printed maps

Expands

Dungeons & Dragons Miniatures
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Lost Valley: The Yukon Mini-Expansion
description:
The mini-expansion includes 2 new triangle tiles, 3 new skills to be incorporated into the base game. 4 tiles (2 triangle and 2 diamond) are also included to correct misprint and miscut tiles in the base game.

The New Skills Include:


The Squirrel Hunter: lets you hunt next to an animal trap even if there are no animals present.
The Expert Miner: makes building a mine easier.
The Well Builder: which lets you find a water source in the middle of the wasteland.


The New Triangle Tiles Include:


Treasure Hill: adds a fun wrinkle to the buried treasure mechanic.
Workshop: lets you switch out your earned skills with new ones.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: BioShock Infinite: The Siege of Columbia – Enraged Songbird
description:
A special promo card that was released both with pre-orders of the board game through the Plaid Hat Games website and with the BioShock Infinite Limited Edition Strategy Guide from Brady Games.

This card adds a usable advantage to the founder player and can be used in place of the regular songbird action card included within the regular game. Card text: "You may discard this card and another card from your hand to place Elizabeth on the location Songbird is currently on. Elizabeth is now under your control."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme

name: Leviathans: French Fleet Box
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Leviathans simulates combat between warships that have taken to the air in an alternate history/steampunk 1910. The king leviathans, battleships, are the largest vessels. Maneuvering in support are light cruisers, destroyers and other vessels. Will you captain your ﬂeet for king and country, expanding your nation's power and becoming legend? Or will you fall from the sky, forgotten? You determine the outcome!

Leviathans: French Fleet Box contains the French battleship, light cruiser, and two destroyer high-quality plastic ship miniatures from the Leviathans Core Box Set, but with four new, unique variant Ship Cards. Players can instantly expand their faction fleet after purchasing the Core Box Set for larger games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Dark Dealings: Overlords
description:
The Overlords Expansion adds 9 Overlord personalities (each with unique art) for players to assume as they play.

Each Overlord has a unique ability, giving players new and powerful powers they can use to fight against the meddlesome heroes.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Crisis: Spies
description:
Two promo tiles that can be added to the Employee mix at the beginning of the game.

When drawn, they are assigned to the player last in the VP grid, and can be used during Production to gain money, resources or VP for their employer.

After each round, they are assigned to the player last in VP.
categories: Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Political, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Pandánte: Light & Dark
description:
Pandánte is a gambling game played by the Pandas of the Pandalands. In this game, lying is encouraged (humans use the softer term “bluffing”). You’ll often have to claim you have a hand that you don’t really have. Be careful though, because other players can call you out for fun and profit.

Pandánte: Light & Dark expansion adds different Light and Dark Panda abilities to the base game for players who want fun and joy or misery and woe! The expansion also adds several extras that can be mixed and matched, including:

Casino Cards:
Each gambit, your group visits a new casino in the Pandalands. Each casino plays the game a little bit differently!

Panda Champions:
Each player takes on the role of a famous Panda. Choose Pandas however you want before the game starts and stick with your Panda throughout the game. Each Panda gives a different special power.

Diamond Dreams:
The blue diamond chips are power ups in this mode. Spend them wisely to get big boosts when you need it.

The Light & Dark abilities, Casinos, Panda Champions, and Diamond Dreams mode options give you 16 possible combinations of game modes. In addition to that, the 17th mode is a seriousface gambling mode. Are you Panda enough to risk real money?
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Variable Player Powers

name: Legends of Andor: The Stranger
description:
The Stranger
The Stranger is a new hero for "Legends of Andor". His special feature is, that you can design him by yourself. You decide which name, special ability and colour he has.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Briefcase: Government Bonus
description: Briefcase: Government Bonus, a small expansion for Briefcase, includes eight new goals which increase competition between players, who now receive government rewards for being the first to achieve specific goals during the game. The package also includes two Rules cards.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Doomlings: Overlush
description:
Each Doomlings: Overlush Mystery Expansion Box will come with 4 packs, each containing 15 cards. The exact cards in each pack are a mystery.

All Overlush cards are divided into a new 5-tier rarity system. The first 7 cards you’ll see when you open a pack will be from the Common tier. These are standard traits and ages to expand your Doomlings experience.

The next 5 are Unusual cards. The traits and ages in this tier feature more intricate effects for seasoned Doomlings players.

The 2 cards that precede the final card will be from 1 of 3 tiers: Scarce, the first tier with dominant traits; Endangered, featuring more unique and exciting cards; and Legendary, a tier reserved for the most elusive traits and ages.

The last card in every pack will be a guaranteed holofoil version of any 1 of the 170+ cards in the Overlush collection. It can be a trait or age from any of the aforementioned rarity tiers.

Doomlings: Overlush Mystery Expansion Boxes are designed to work just like any other expansion: simply open your packs, add the cards to your game, and you're ready to play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Events, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Loop Inc.: Expansion Cards
description:
This Limited Edition expansion adds 14 new cards to the game.

Anomalies (4 cards)
Every time you go back in time, anomalies are added to the game. More anomalies means more variability!

Future (5 cards)
Instead of going back in time, you have the option of going into the future. Futures add a bit more complexity to the game, as each future trip allows you to take a bonus action. If you play the future right, you can unlock some fantastic combinations!

Office (5 cards)
The Office action cards replace the simple Trash action cards in the game. Now, instead of merely removing components in order prevent the loss of points, you can time your actions to gain points.

These cards were included for free for all backers of Loop Inc. on Kickstarter. However, these extras are available for purchase separately. None are Kickstarter-exclusive.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Travel

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Curse of the Jade Emperor Asylum Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Great Old Ones' insidious reach continues to spread and Curse of the Jade Emperor, the second Asylum Pack of the Ancient Relics cycle, follows the tendrils of evil into the Far East. Prepare for restless dead, secret societies, and unholy artifacts!

Ancient Relics is based on the theme of the global influence of the Ancient Ones and their cults and moves the action from H.P. Lovecraft's dread-filled New England to the wider world. In Curse of the Jade Emperor players will find exotic, yet hauntingly familiar characters and tales, pulled from the myths and legends of ancient China. The Middle Kingdom's undying past collides with a present made all the more uncertain through the interference of diverse otherworldly actors.

The pull of China is strong and in Call of Cthulhu it attracts academics from Miskatonic University, eager to study the history and artifacts of one of the world's oldest civilizations. The forces of law and order also come to do battle with some of the world's deadliest criminal organizations. Curse of the Jade Emperor also follows Ancient Relics' over-arching theme of artifacts with great and terrible power reoccurring throughout history. Pack your bags for a voyage to the Orient in Curse of the Jade Emperor!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Expedition: The Horror
description:
Description from the publisher:

The first expansion to Expedition: The Roleplaying Card Game.

Battle against all-new Cthulhu-inspired enemies and grow your character with the new "Persona" mechanic. Will your adventurer be brave and bold in the face of danger, or will cower in fear and hopelessness?

As your persona changes through abilities, enemies and the story, your adventurer could burst forth in courage, dealing extra damage or boosting allies. Or, as you suffer from stress and fear, you could suffer roll penalties or take additional damage.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Onitama: Steer and Lobster Promo Cards
description:
A set of 2 cards packaged together in Pack A of The Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

These cards provide new movement options for your pieces.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game

name: When I Dream: Bonus Cards
description:
There are 5 bonus cards, one of which has been published as a promo in spielbox 5/2017 and Tabletop Gaming 12/2017.

One shows a candle-lit lantern and a fairy on one side and tiny animals in a spaceship surrounded by floating astro-bunnies strawberries on the other side. The others show a vampire monkey and Death at girl's tea party, dancing scissors and a house on robot legs, a golden monkey surrounded by dwarves and a girl among hedgehogs, a saddled fish flying over a desert and a ghost riding a motorcycle.

The cards come without texts and are therefore language independent.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Crossbows and Catapults: Dragon
description:
Dragon expansion adds the green dragon to Crossbows and Catapults. The dragon acts like a Catapult in the game (though I feel it is slightly more accurate than the actual catapults). The dragon also adds the wizard carom, which is used for special rules in game play.

May be used in a standalone game or added to C&C basic set as an expansion.

CONTENTS:
1 Dragon, 4 Warriors(2 each), 6 battle caroms, 2 wizard caroms, label sheet
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Heroes Wanted: 2016 International TableTop Day Promo Pack
description: This pack of 7 cards (6 different Hero A cards and one bonus card) is exclusively in the 2016 ITTD event kit. The cards include cards Wil Wheaton and Felicia Day, as well as the four main characters from Titansgrave.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Farlight: Launch Pack
description: Farlight: Launch Pack adds ten new cards featuring new missions and ship parts to the Farlight base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Dwar7s Fall: The Troll's Bridge Expansion
description:
"Once upon a time there was a moody troll that lived under a bridge. He was fearsome... and yet kind. But curiosity drove him to explore dwarfs lands."

Dwar7s Fall: Troll's Bridge Expansion introduce
- A new tile: Troll's pond
- The Roaming Deck
- The Mood Deck
- 3 Pre-painted Meeples!
- New Ogre cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: DiceWar: Rise of Xeladron
description:
Step through magical portals to foreign worlds and let Xeladron shake the Warlands.

DiceWar: Rise of Xeladron is the third expansion for the DiceWar series, and it can be used in combination with all other expansions. In this expansion are six new creatures with new effects. You can step through portals, fly over you enemies, and destroy your own creatures to eliminate several creatures together.

—description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: Imperius: Enmity
description:
The ruling house of the empire is in decline & in their weakness an opportunity presents itself. The throne is within the grasp of any rival faction bold & cunning enough to grab power for themselves.

Imperius, from acclaimed designer Grant Rodiek, puts you in charge of one of the rival factions trying to seize control of the throne of Imperius. Use clever drafting, secret information, special faction abilities, and varied planet effects to give yourself the edge.

Imperius: Emnity is a limited quantity expansion that includes all the stretch goal content unlocked during the 2018 Kickstarter campaign. Containing 8 new Elder cards, 7 new Event cards, 4 new Planets, and an alternate art Elder for each faction. This expansion is only available direct from Kolossal Games!

Key Points
- Expands Imperius with new content.
- Highly tense and rewarding interactive gameplay.
- Packed with new interchangeable content to keep your games fresh and exciting!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen 2 – The Magic and Monsters Expansion
description:
The second in a series of sequel decks to the original, UK Games Expo Award Winning Lords of War games, this expansion adds a huge number of new Unit Types, new Ranks and new rules to the base game.

Alongside adding in new gameplay functions and mechanics, this expansion also introduces Moving Units to the Elves and Lizardmen Factions.

The first of the major new Unit Types included in this expansion are Magic Units, capable of buffing allies and damaging foes using Elemental Attacks and Spell Tokens.

The game introduces Monstrous Units - extremely tough cards with 'Monstrous Defence' which allows them to ignore low damage attacks.

Finally, the Magic and Monsters Expansion also introduce Flying Units which are only vulnerable to Ranged Units and other Flying Units.

While primarily designed as an addition to Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen, this expansion is also compatible with all other Lords of War Factions and adds additional Command Cards, Special Units and Elite Units to the base game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Louis XIV: The Favourite
description:
The Favourite expansion includes 4 Favourite Tablets and a Favourite figure.

Each player takes a Favourite tablet and put it in front of him, in view of every player. Then each player takes one influence marker from the general supply and places it on one of the 4 space of his Favourite tablet.

This expansion has not been released separately, but can be found in the Treasure Chest.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Renaissance
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Abyss: Anglerfish
description:
Contained in Plato Magazine n°73.

This promo card is a new sea monster. You just include it in the ally deck. When it's drawn, you have this choice:


Fight. It ends your turn. The threat token goes back to the first space, but you don't take any reward!! (you just lose your turn)



Continue exploration. To do so, first pay what's in front of the threat token. Then, move the threat token one step forward.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Vudù: Mostri vs Alieni
description:
Scary Monsters from the most famous horror movies and ruthless Aliens seeking domination of the Earth are ready to battle!

In Monsters vs Aliens you will find two new wizardry schools: the Monsters spells with unlimited sequels and the dominant Aliens spells.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS: Banu Haqim Expansion Pack
description:
1 Double Sided Tile
1 Character Board & Sheet
1 40mm Miniature
30+ Cards & Tokens
2 Playable Scenarios
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Marco Bohno
description:
Now you can play Bohnanza on a voyage of discovery! Following in the footsteps of Marco Bohno, the adventurous bean gardeners not only have to pull in successful harvests, but also fulfill special tasks on their journey along the Great Wall of China. Each task brings the adventurer one step closer to their destination.

Marco Bohno can be played only with the Bohnanza base game or the Ladybohn base game. The game contains both a two-person variant and solo variant. This extension was previously published under the title Bohnröschen, but for a different player count with different materials in it.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming

name: Half-Pint Heroes: Happy Hour
description:
It‘s happy hour at Half-Pint Pub, and the rules are changing. Experience a totally new way to play this trick-taking game! During play, attach (removable) stickers to the cards to change their value or modify other game rules. The longer you play, the more new effects are added to the game. It's a riot!

Half-Pint Heroes: Happy Hour is the first ever legacy trick-taking game. Each player gets a sheet of stickers. Depending on their prediction, each player may place one sticker per round on one of their cards.

By putting more and more stickers on the cards, players not only change cards values but also some rules in the game. All stickers remain in effect until the end of the game, then they can be removed easily.

The expansion also adds material for two more players, so Half-Pint Heroes can now be played with up to nine players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Car Wars Expansion Set #9, Muskogee Fairground & Family Emporium
description:
"Racing thrills in the BIGGEST arena ever published! Four full-size maps, fourteen scenarios, lots of track layouts, and there's the flag!"

"Not a stand-alone game. You need either the basic Car Wars set or Car Wars Deluxe to play. Since the main topic of the expansion set is racing and gas-powered vehicles, the supplement Dueltrack is also highly recommended - though you could play most of the scenarios in this set without Dueltrack, in a pinch."

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
Dueltrack: A Car Wars Deluxe Supplement
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000 Expansion: Planetstrike
description:
From Publisher's Website:

Warhammer 40,000 Expansion: PlanetstrikePlanetstrike is a game of glorious invasions and desperate last stands set in the battle-ravaged universe of the 41st Millennium. Will you take the role of the defender, repelling the enemy's vanguard with heavy weaponry and heavier fortifications? Or will you play the attacker, raining hellfire and damnation upon the foe before sending an army of your best troops to claim the smoking remains of his strongholds? This is truly a war on all fronts in which the enemy can appear at any time, from anywhere - especially from above!

This 80-page expansion book contains all of the rules and information you need to play games of Planetstrike; including: full rules for configuring your forces for planetary invasion, a full-colour hobby section on preparing your defences, and a comprehensive background section detailing some of the most infamous planetary assaults.

You must possess a copy of Warhammer 40,000 in order to use the contents of this book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadowrun: Sprawl Ops – Co-Op Expansion
description:
The Co-Op Expansion introduces a threat that the usually combative teams of shadowrunners within the sprawls of the Sixth World cannot ignore. This turns Shadowrun: Sprawl Ops from a competitive game into a fun cooperative experience where players either work together toward victory or lose together.

From the Sprawl Ops KickStarter description: "This is an exclusive product only, which means it will only be available here on Kickstarter, through the pledge manager and through Catalyst or Lynnvander directly and/or at a variety of conventions while supplies last. This is a limited print product."
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Exoplanets: Gravity
description: Expansion: Gravity includes 1 new "Special Effect" tile, Gravity, which allows you to negate the effects of Space tiles underneath "Planet" tiles in Exoplanets. The included black “crystals” act as a “wild” resource when creating life.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Horse & Matchlock: Prelude to an Era
description:
Horse & Matchlock is the prologue to Horse & Musket: Dawn of an Era. This volume will cover warfare from 1618-1682, when the armies of Europe shifted from heavy pike formations to linear lines of musketeers. Warfare moved towards firepower, although firepower was curbed by the limitations of the matchlock musket. In addition, bayonets were rare and the pike was the infantry's best defense against cavalry. It was also the last time in this era that religion was a major factor in the causes and ferocity of European warfare. The volume includes battles from the Thirty Years War, Franco-Spanish War, English Civil Wars, The Fronde, Franco-Dutch War, and Scanian War.

The scenarios include...

White Mountain - November 8, 1620 – Last Stand of the Bohemian Revolt

Wimpfen - May 6, 1622 – Slow Grind to Victory

Fleurus - August 29, 1622 – "Altera Restat"

Lutter am Barenberge - August 17, 1626 – Tilly’s Greatest Victory

Breitenfeld - September 17, 1631 – Gustav II Adolf’s Masterpiece

Lützen - November 17, 1632 – “I was the King of Sweden.”

Edgehill - October 23, 1642 – “For God and King Charles!”

Rocroi - May 19, 1643 – El Ultimo Tercio

First Newbury - September 20, 1643 – Essex’s Finest Hour

Cheriton - March 29, 1644 – “The best shifter and chooser of ground.”

Marston Moor - July 2, 1644 – “…he will fight, whatever comes of ‘t!”

Aberdeen - September 13, 1644 – The Craibstane Rout

Auldearn - May 9, 1645 – Slaughter on Garlic Hill

Naseby - June 14, 1645 – “Will you go upon your Death?”

Kilsyth - August 15, 1645 – Slaughter Howe

Lens - August 20, 1648 – The Peace of Westphalia

Worcester - September 3, 1651 – The Royal Oak

The Dunes - June 11, 1658 – The Tides of Battle

Sinsheim - June 16, 1674 – Turenne Invades the Palatinate

Seneffe - August 11, 1674 – Condé’s Last Bloody Hurrah

Lund - December 4, 1676 – Return of the King

Landskrona - July 14, 1677 – The Småländska Peasantry Wins the Day

—description from the publisher

NOTE: This game’s title is actually Horse & Matchlock. Please use this title for any discussion or writing about the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Red Alert: Space Fleet Warfare – Space Rift Escalation Pack
description:
Escalation packs present additional starship models, rules, and terrain to add to the RED ALERT core game.

This escalation Pack contains:

1 rulebook containing special rules and 3 new scenarios
2 punchboards featuring space rift hexes
3 six-sided dice
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Hive War
description:
This is the Tyranid expansion to the Space Marine Game.

The supplement contains a 72-page soft-bound rule-book with 16 colour pages and colour covers. Contents include:

Rulebook
82 swarm cards
24 mycetic spore chits
24 hive mind cards
45 instinct counters
22 wound markers
12 spore mine markers
50 spore markers
1 energy pulse template
6 tragón bio-shock templates
1 pyro-acid spray template

Rules are given for building an epic tyranid force and for the new tyranid troop types (carnifex, zoanthrope, haruspex, dactylis, gargoyle, lictor, hormagaunt, termagants, genestealers, trygon, exocrine, tyranid warriors, biovore, dominatrix, harridan and hive tyrants) plus the bio-titans (hierophant and hierodule). A force's organisation is represented by a collection of hexagonal tiles.

Expands

Space Marine
