categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Yomi: Cursed Cards
description:
The cursed cards are a set of new, alternate character cards for Yomi. Yomi is a card game that simulates a fighting game. It tests your ability to predict how your opponents will act and your ability to judge the relative value of cards from one situation to the next.

You can use these cursed cards as a handicap to play against weaker or beginner players, or you can play cursed vs. cursed characters for a kind of hilarious lower-powered game.

The cursed characters all have a different epithet, too.

Grave, Wind Warrior -> Rusty Warrior.
Jaina, Phoenix Archer -> Phoenix Arsonist
Midori, Mentor Dragon -> Scrub Dragon
Setsuki, Ninja Student -> Outfoxed Ninja
Rook, Stone Golem -> Tiny Golem
DeGrey, Ghostly Diplomat -> Debaucherous Diplomat
Valerie, Manic Painter -> Depressed Painter
Geiger, Precise Watchmaker -> Careless Watchmaker
Lum, Gambling Panda -> Unlucky Panda
Argagarg, Water Shaman -> Savage Shaman
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Elixir:  Alambic
description:
This first expansion for Elixir provide new spells, new magic items, a new transaction and a set of component.
A new card named Alambic help to cast spell.

Expands

Elixir
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Don't Mess With Cthulhu: Necronomicon
description:
Three mini-expansions in one. Extra cards allow up to 10 to play, Necronomicons replace some Elder Signs but win the game for the cultists if they are uncovered before the first Elder Sign, and Objects of Power tweak the rules.

Originally a kickstarter extra, given out as a promo at Essen 2016.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Horror, Negotiation

name: Flick 'em Up!: Blacksmith
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 9.

Adds a Blacksmith building to any Flick 'em Up! scenario. Activating the Blacksmith gives players a free action of flicking a horseshoe. If the horseshoe hits a cowboy, then the next time that cowboy is knocked out and when the cowboy gets back on his feet, the player activating that cowboy must close his/her eyes before each action.

Components:
1 blacksmith workshop
2 feet
3 horseshoes
1 rules pamphlet (English & German)
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Cards Against Humanity: TableTop Pack
description: This expansion for Cards Against Humanity is an Indiegogo reward for people who backed Season 3 of TableTop. Contains 3 Black Cards and 12 White Cards specific to the Geek and Sundry show, TableTop!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Rey Paparajote y la Picaza del Destino
description:
Rey Paparajote was published in 2017 thanks to a successful crowdfunding campaign with more than 200 patrons. Again, a year later, comes Rey Paparajote y la pOc an expansion of 50 new cards that will be added to the 160 cards of the original game.

Rey Paparajote y la Picaza del Destino is the expansion of Rey Paparajote, so you'll need the original game in order to play the expansion cards. The new cards and expansion skills coupled with the cards from the original game will make each game to Rey Paparajote different from the previous one.

In Rey Paparajote y la Picaza del Destino you'll find new creature cards, territories, specials, and new abilities; plus a new type of card, the Legendary Cards.

Narciso Yepes, el Rey Sabio, Maria Cegarra, Ibn Arabí, los Caballitos del Mar Menor y el Tio Juan Rita are some of the new and powerful heroes who join the resistance against Rey Paparajote.

—user summary
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Negotiation
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Fleet Battles: Campaign Designer's Handbook
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

From the back of the cover:

Campaigns are the ultimate expression of Star Fleet Battles. Only in a campaign setting does everything – cost, fleets, technology, availability, movement, economics, deployments – come together into a complete picture of war in space!

The Campaign Designer’s Handbook provides options allowing you to create a campaign that suits your own tastes and interests.

Strategic Arena: Maps and ideas on how to lay out your universe for conquest! Historical, hexagonal, octagonal, large, or small, it’s up to you!

Economics: How to buy, build, and supply your massive space fleet, while keeping the amount of paperwork under control so you can focus on the battle. New SSDs are provided for Naval Construction Docks and Warp Gates. The innovative TechBlock system provides players with the opportunity to buy the technologies that will win battles, or gamble on the technology to win wars! Everything is covered, including repairs, refits, upgrades, plus new improvements and variants. Wars are fought for money – design yours so you can play to win!

Scenarios are the whole point of a campaign; everything else is designed to deliver your ships to the battle. This handbook includes several options and concepts for generating, setting up, and controlling the size of scenarios.

Races: How to fit them into your campaign so that each can strive to fulfill its destiny.

And More: Strategic Sequence of Play, legendary officers (including several new types), outstanding and poor crews, and entirely new rules on espionage, sabotage, and random events!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Board Royale: The Island – Skills Expansion Pack
description:
You may be on a deserted island but at least you know things, things that can help you to survive. Take one out of seven personas and become more ready to handle what island and other players can throw at you!
This pack comes with 56 cards to give your game more depth then ever before. Be a scavenger, medic even a diplomat to find your way up to the top!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Haunted Tower
description:
The third adventure pack expansion to the base board game of "New Easy to Master Dungeons and Dragons". The world of the base game and the expansions is called Thunder Rift. There were 3 expansions created for the base game. Dungeons & Dragons: The Goblin's Lair , Dungeons & Dragons: The Dragon's Den, & The Haunted Tower. A dungeon crawl and monster bashing adventure for beginners.

Inside this box you'll find three complete adventures. The adventurers are challenged to explore and solve the mysteries of three frightening graves. The most terrible and eerie foes of the D&D game are featured in these three adventures: undead (skeletons, zombies, ghouls, mummies, ghosts and even vampires!)

The expansion includes 3 16 page adventure booklets, 3 full color fold up maps, 1d6 and d10, new counters, new floor tiles to enhance the maps, 72 new monster stand-ups, and 8 more character stand-ups. The three adventures can be played separately or as a series of connected adventures.

Expands:

The New Easy to Master Dungeons & Dragons
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Square Grid

name: +6 Bag O' Munchkin Zombies
description:
Description from the publisher:

Show off your brain-eating munchkinosity in style with Munchkin Zombies: +6 Bag O' Munchkin Zombies. Use these six different colored zombie pawns, based on the Munchkin Zombies illustrations by John Kovalic, in your Munchkin games — or in any game! — to mark your place and get some special munchkiny benefits while you're at it.

Munchkin Zombies: +6 Bag O' Munchkin Zombies also includes two new cards for use in any Munchkin game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Zombies

name: Games of Art
description:
Beyond Tic Tac Toe (1975) is the original form of this book, and contains the following seven games meant to be played with coloured pencils or markers. The games are named after the artists whose works they most resemble graphically: Vasarely, Miro, Mondrian, Arp, Delaunay, Klee, and Springer.

It is part of a series of five paper-and-pencil game books by Sid Sackson, including Beyond Competition, Beyond Solitaire, Beyond Tic Tac Toe, Beyond Words, and Calculate!.

Games of Art (2014) is the new edition of Beyond Tic Tac Toe that was published on Kickstarter by Eagle/Gryphon Games in the form of a reusable book with laminated pages and dry erase markers.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Book
publishers: Eagle-Gryphon Games, Hugendubel Verlag, Pantheon Books, Penguin Books, Starstream Products

name: Harbour: Ice Viking
description:
Promo character card that comes packaged inside every English copy of Bottlecap Vikings.

ICE VIKING

Character Ability: When ANY player ships goods, you may freeze one good at it's current selling price. The rest of the market resolves around the frozen good as normal.

Flavor Text: Yes, He carries an axe with him to negotiations. But give him half a chance and he'll talk your ear off about business - hostile takeover this, frozen assets that... - Dockmaster Schlibble

THE WHARFS (on the back of every character)

Character Ability: Gain 2 good of different types -or- Buy a building.

Flavor Text:
"This may sound crazy but, don't try to split up the orders! You know how terrible those ogres are at counting? Last week I told one of em to take three barrels of fish to the pier. The thick brute took all fourteen! Best just point at a load of one type of good and tell em to take em all. It'll save us all a headache. At the most we'll lose a unit or two. Trust me it'll be worth it." - Dockmaster Schlibble

"Those darned Gnolls will steal anything that isn't nailed down! If you have maxed out your storehouse's room for any of the goods types, you'll have to leave the rest outside. Don't expect to see them in the morning." - Constable O'Brady
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Into Tartarus Asylum Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Into Tartarus explores the kernel of truth at the root of every myth with 60 new cards (three copies each of 20 unique cards) for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. The fifth Asylum Pack in the "Ancient Relics" cycle, Into Tartarus transports archaeologists, investigators, cultists, and criminals to Greece where each faction uncovers new chaos while searching ancient ruins for powerful relics.

Several of the cards from Into Tartarus enable players to stir up all new manners of chaos. Agency decks gain cards to work against the chaos, while Cthulhu and Shub-Niggurath decks gain terrifying new attachments. Several factions gain powerful new Relics, further expanding deck-building options centered around these strange and powerful items.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Legends of Andor: Garz, the Dwarf Merchant
description:
A promo card for "Legends of Andor: The last hope" for legends 12-17.
"Kaum ein Chronist erwähnte den kleinen gerissenen Handelszwerg und es scheint auch mehr als abwegig, dass er sich dem Tross der Andori anschloss. Unwegsames Gelände ohne Städte oder sonst jemanden der mit ihm Handel treiben könnte.
Nun, der Legende nach gab es großartige Edelsteine in den Höhlen des Grauen Gebirges. Und ja, es könnte sein, dass die Gier nach diesen Gemmen die Furcht des Handelszwergs bezwang ..."
Available at SPIEL'16 or as download the KOSMOS website after the fair.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Noch mehr Ärger
description:
This is an expansion for "Mensch Ärgere Dich Nicht" (Pachisi, Aggravation). It adds more possibilities to this classic game. Instead of rolling the dice you can draw a card. The cards can dramatically change the game.

Expands:

Pachisi
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Four Roads to Paris
description:
Annual 2015 Issue

Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east....

But why, exactly, did France fall? This ATO Annual edition features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question. They’ve each settled on a single overriding theme to focus on. Yes, here is an issue not just featuring a game or two, but four complete simulations that provide hours and hours of challenging play and comparison. Don’t miss it!

Steven Cunliffe with Strange Victory - A solitaire design, this game illustrates how the smaller but nimbler Germans got "inside" the Allied decision cycle to constantly impose small delays and major "rethinks" producing a catastrophic failure on the Allied side - though the better the Germans do may well panic their own High Command into halting them.

Michael Rinella with Springtime for Hitler - Explores the angle that the Germans at this time were quite simply indeed "supermen" at the top of their game. Possessing the best tactical airforce, the best plans and doctrine, and well motivated by National-Socialist ideology, they were unstoppable. Or were they?

John Prados with The Seeds of Disaster - Examines how pre-war plans and on-going intelligence and counter-intelligence efforts, deceit and deception, and foolishly projecting one's own motives on the enemy were THE key factors in explaining what happened in 1940.

Roger Nord with Betrayal! - The most unusual of the four games, the two players are Britain and France respectively, nominally allies, against an automata German player governed by the game system. Did the French do themselves in by folding up early on? Or were they also done in by their British allies choosing to bug out early without informing their "hosts" and refusing any extra help, instead husbanding their resources for defense of Great Britain? Both players may cooperate to win, but absolutely must position themselves to secure their national interests if France does fall.

Four Roads to Paris offers four complete simulations that will provide hours of challenging play and comparison. And as always, the Annual features an "extra-size" magazine, with an in-depth look at the history behind the games, plus other articles. Make yourself the proud owner of this challenging look at the campaign that shocked the West.

Maps - Four full color 17"x22" mapsheets
Counters - Over 300 full color 9/16" die-cut counters
Cards - 24
Rules length - Around 8 pages each game
Charts and tables - Averages 1 page each game
Complexity - Medium
How challenging is it solitaire? - Poor to Excellent, varies by title
Playing time - Up to 3 to 4 hours for each game, 12 to 16 hours to play them all

Designers - Mike Rinella, Roger Nord, Steven Cunliffe and John Prados
Development - Lembit Tohver
Graphic Design - Mark Mahaffey

from the publisher's website
categories: Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Bohnedikt (2016 Edition)
description:
With Bohnedikt, an expansion for Bohnanza first released in 2009 by Lookout Games, players now have two specialized fields in which to plant their beans: The Monastery Garden and "Gottesacker" (or "God's Acre", a colloquial name for a graveyard).

The name "Bohnedikt" is derived from Pope Benedikt, and this expansion introduces Bohn-edict cards that can be planted solely in the Monastery Garden. This expansion also has "victim" cards that depict two types of beans. Shuffle the Bohn-edict cards with the regular Bohnanza cards, then deal everyone starting hands. Players then each take one victim card and place it at the back of their hand.

Gameplay changes as follows: Bohn-edict cards serve as a joker and can be played onto either of your bean fields, but they have no beanometer, so if you must harvest a field with a Bohn-edict on top, you earn no gold! If a Bohn-edict is flipped during the trading phase, then the rule on the card comes into effect, changing the trading phase solely for that turn.

If you have the two bean cards in hand — or in the hand and in trade — that match your victim card, you can discard the victim card and plant both of those beans in your graveyard. You can plant cards in the graveyard only if they match the top card on your graveyard, and when you harvest, you use the beanometer of the graveyard's top card and convert the most recently played cards into coins.

The AMIGO version of Bohnedikt features more victim cards than in the Lookout Games version.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Negotiation

name: Thunderbolt Apache Leader: Expansion #2 – Air Assault!
description:
This expansion adds UH-60 Black Hawks, V-22 Ospreys, air assault soldiers, air assault enemy battalion missions, and air assault rules for your forces!
—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Generator Pola
description:
The Field Generator is a single tile supplement for Neuroshima Hex! and it is one of the prizes which can be acquired only by participating in Polish Championships in Neuroshima Hex 3.0 ongoing in 2015.

Controllable Token - Until under control of another token, it doesn't belong to any faction and is treated by every player as enemy's token: it blocks line of fire, cannot be moved by an own Move tile, own Modules cannot be connected to it, wounds every target within its range and vice versa, it can be pushed away, netted, taken over etc. If controllable token is connected to any unit of any faction (also HQ or Module), it immediately becomes a unit of this faction and is treated by it as its own. Controllable token is always connected with adjecent token, indicated by connection icon (identically as in the case of modules).

Enters play at the cost of 1 token from the draw - At the beginning of the game the token lies by the board and waits to be entered to the game by any player. To do it, player must additionaly discard one more token from his 3-token draw. Player then puts this token on any empty field on the board. After elimination of this token, it is again put next to the board and any player can again put it into play at the cost of 1 token from the draw.

Description of Field Generator
A Field Generator is a unit that operates continuously, irrespective of the initiative phase (similar to Nets).

Field - Field Generator affects every token within its line of fire (similar to Gauss Cannon). The effect of the Field is only Temporary Paralysis, working on a target as long as it is within Field Generator's line of fire. Temporary Paralysis deprives the target of possibility of any attack. The rest of the abilities of paralysed unit remains unchanged (Modules, Nets, Toughness, Armor etc. works normally). If the Field Generator is nobody's, then it affect all units of all players. If the Field Generator is under control of one player, then it only affects opponents units.

Rotation - When controlled by a player (see Controllable Token above), Filed Generator can be rotated in any direction by the controlling player once per his/her turn, including the turn when a controlling unit is placed adjacent to Filed Generator's connection icon.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: UNO Ultimate Marvel: Add-on Pack – Doctor Strange
description:
With UNO Ultimate Marvel Add-On Dr. Strange Pack, players can swap a new character into the core UNO Ultimate Card Game (sold separately, subject to availability). The Dr. Strange Pack has an entire deck of UNO Ultimate cards, with graphics and special rules, designed specifically for this Super Hero to play as Dr. Strange!

—description from the publisher

Doctor Strange
Being the master of the Mystic Arts lets Doctor Strange control the playing field. Try to change the active color as much as you can to maximize his character power. Use his Wild Cards for both supporting his character power and stopping players from playing certain cards.

Included in this add-on pack:

One Uno Ultimate Doctor Strange Deck
Character specific Wild Cards
Danger Deck Cards with Villains and more!
2 Chase Foil Cards
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: Liberation: Warped World
description:
Long-distance scans of the planet Galvicil show a giant fissure emitting strange gases. Could they truly have the power to reshape surrounding planets?

A 5 card expansion that introduces a new planet and two new missions that can rotate and flip map cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Cosmic Colonies: Monumental Achievement Expansion
description:
This mini-expansion contains 9 monumental tiles, 5 new basic workers and 5 new advanced workers. It's the original extra content that was created during the KS-campaign (and given for free to KS-backers) and will be available afterwards.

You add as much monuments as there are players at the start of the game. If you can create the exact shape of a monument with free squares on your board, you can claim the corresponding monument tile, which will be worth 5 VP at the end of the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Unreliable Wizard and the Unstable Spirit Towers
description:
The adventure fantasy Unreliable Wizard is a story about becoming a poor magician who has a good chance of becoming a different magic, saving heroes and princesses, and defeating the demon king at the end of the world... 20 stories. A card game for one player that can be enjoyed in minutes.

In this expansion set, you can enjoy adventures different from the basic set with new elements such as new maps, equipment to strengthen yourself, and enemies that change every time.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
publishers: Salt & Pepper Games, TITANHEADS (チタンヘッズ)

name: The Haunting House 2: The Second Story
description:
From the publisher, Twilight Creations:

It's time to hit the Breitenstein house again, since you and your friends never got around to the second floor. The goal is the same: first one to escape through the second floor exit wins the bet. Sounds easy enough. But, unfortunately, your meddling has awakened the sleeping evil... and it wants you dead! The Haunting House 2 adds new strategic elements, hidden bonuses, and automatically turning halls. Oh... and ghosts!

Expands

The Haunting House
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Racing

name: Federation Ship Recognition Manual
description:
The Federation Ship Recognition Manual expands on the ships types seen in the base game Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator, adding new variants for every Federation ship in that product, including new shuttles, starships, freighters, and starbases.

As with the base Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator itself, this is ostensibly an "expansion" for the Role Playing game, in that it provides more data than just the combat element requires. 3-dimension views are provided for all craft, along with extensive historical notes and background. The cover of this 42-page product features a cutaway of the Federation 'Remora' escort craft.

No counters are provides with this product, however, the last page is a fold-out diagram showing a time line of the service lifetimes of the various ship classes, as well as silhouettes of all ships showing relative sizes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Epic Resort: Dungeon Master
description:
Replace a Skilled Worker set with this one during game setup.

Dungeon Master
Skilled Worker
Work Units: 2
Cost: 5 Gold
Discard: Choose which Attraction a Monster is Attacking (at the same resort). This may be performed during an ATTACK.
Quantity: 4 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Zooloretto: King K.
description:
A special post card containing an exclusive expansion tile like the Polar Bear only for the Strategicon convention series where Michael Schacht was the Guest of Honor for Orccon 2009.

Please use the original rules with the following exceptions: the first player who fills his 6-space enclosure takes the enclosure as a bonus* and places it below his zoo board near his barn

As a money action, a player can discard a tile out of the game from a delivery truck. This costs 1 coin and may be done twice during the game. Keep track of usage by placing the spent coins on the King K. enclosure. Coins remain there until the end of the game and are not involved in the final scoring.


If King K is played with Grizzly, Polar Bear, and / or other similar expansions, the players filling their 6-space enclosures may select these enclosures in any order they want.


Expands:

Zooloretto


Home Page & Newsletter:

www.zooloretto.com


(German, english, dutch, hungarian, spanish, swedish)
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: Harbour: Market Owner
description:
Promo character card that comes packaged inside every English copy of Cthulhu Realms.

Character Ability: Before shipping goods, you may spend 1 of any good to move any one good type to the highest value position in the market, adjusting the others as necessary.

Flavor Text: Oh, you... probably don't want to deal with him. He dreams big, you see, but his business practices will drive you insane. Anyway, he spends most of his time managing his offshore holdings. - Dockmaster Schlibble
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: HeroCard: Rise of the Shogun – Miko Expansion Deck
description:
Miko Expansion Deck

The Miko Matches her spiritual power with her mental and physical strength to fulfil her destiny.

The Miko is a HeroCard expansion deck for HeroCard Rise of the Shogun, an epic battle for feudal Japan. The Miko can compete in any HeroCard game or can be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

Expands

HeroCard Rise of the Shogun
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Formule Dé Circuit № 6: GRANDE PREMIO DE PORTUGAL – Circuito do Estoril
description:
Sixth course for Formule Dé by Ludodélire.

38" x 18"; 188 spaces; 8 corners (one "2"); straights 62, 29

cCHUVA : 1-4 VARIAVEL : 5-10 SOLE : 11-20
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Sports

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module D3 – Booms & Saucers
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

This module adds SSD's and scenarios for Federation, Klingon, and Tholian ships that are able to separate part of the vessel.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Catan: New England
description: Catan: New England is an expansion for The Settlers of Catan that requires all of the components from that game in order to play other than the hex-shaped resource tiles. Instead of creating an island from those tiles, players compete for resources and building locations on a fixed map that features the six states that comprise New England in the U.S.: Maine, New Hampshire, Vermont, Massachusetts, Connecticut and Rhode Island.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Legions of Darkness: Expansion Kit 1 – Book of Magic
description:
The first expansion to the popular States of Siege game, Legions of Darkness. The Book of Magic introduces new spells, guardians (a new type of hero), and enemy bosses to wreak havoc on the defenders of your castle. There's even talk of a necromancer who walks the land, raising the dead to fight against the castle.
Plenty of new things await you in the Legions of Darkness expansion #1: Book of Magic!

Note, the Legions of Darkness Expansion Kit 1: Book of Magic is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Legions of Darkness to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:

Complexity: 2.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit represents one Dark Legion, each turn represents a few hours, and each space represents several meters.

Game Components:

• One two-page full color rules sheet
• 12 Event Cards (8 Day and 4 Night cards)
• 13 double-sided 5/8" round markers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rolling Realms: Millennium Blades Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Millennium Blades.

To play this realm, you must use your dice to mark cards and gain their rewards. These rewards include new dice to use elsewhere. But you will have to spend resources to manipulate your dice, as the cards go from 0 to 9. Mark all cards to complete this realm.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Agricola: Changelings
description:
Promo set handed out at Essen Spiel 2018.

These 5 cards are to be mixed with 5 other small improvements to form an extra stack. Upon family growth, you draw one of these cards and if it is a changeling, attach it to the new worker.
categories: Animals, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: MidEvil Deluxe
description:
If you thought the Zombies!!! were bad well, let’s just say, you ain’t seen nothing yet!

MidEvil is the first game to be based on, and an extension of, the award winning Zombies!!! system from Twilight Creations. Players have escaped the modern-day zombie horde only to find themselves transported back in time and faced with a whole new set of problems!

MidEvil Deluxe combines all the skull cracking fun of the complete MidEvil Game in one convenient package. The set includes everything from the MidEvil base set, MidEvil 2 and MidEvil 3. It features updated packaging, improved art and updated figures (including over 100 HEAVILY ARMED AND ANGRY SKELETON WARRIORS!!!) The whole game is done with the same realistic but very tongue-in-cheek style you have come to expect from Twilight Creations.

Part of the MidEvil/Zombies!!! series
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Barker's Row: Attraction Pack #1
description:
From the Kickstarter campaign page:

The Attraction Pack includes 8 attraction cards achieved by unlocking stretch goals. The Attraction Pack was provided exclusively to Kickstarter backers for a limited time and will eventually be available in the BGG Store and the publisher's website.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Cards Against Humanity: Ass Pack
description:
Back it up. Now bring it down. Lower. Down to the floor. Now wiggle it all around. Now get out your wallet and buy the all-new Ass Pack!


30 new cards regarding butts.
Includes cards by visionary ass connoisseur Sir Mix-A-Lot.
Round.
Juicy.
Spank it!


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Twilight Beckons Asylum Pack
description:
The Twilight Beckons is the first Asylum Pack in the Rituals of the Order cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. This cycle introduces new Ancient Ones, Cthonians, Criminals, and Lunatics, as well as cards for the Order of the Silver Twilight. A new story begins as Lucy Jennings, a rich socialite, stumbles upon a secret that will change her life...

The Twilight Beckons is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Myth: Orcneas, Master of Masters Expansion Boss
description:
From the publisher's website:
Muckers who continually survive combat grow in size and strength until they become a warchief. Orcneas, called “Master of Masters” by the Grubbers and Muckers who follow him, is one such leader. Riddled with scars and wielding two axes the size of men, Orcneas charges into combat felling any who stand against him. His roars of rage and command affect heroes and minions alike. Those who dare to harm Orcneas find he has many surprises in store for them.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Munchkin Pathfinder: Truly Gobnoxious
description:
Description from the publisher:

Is your goblin horde more of a goblin clique? Not for long! Swell your goblin ranks with Munchkin Pathfinder: Truly Gobnoxious, a booster pack with ten new monster cards and five goblin-related treasures for use with Munchkin Pathfinder or any other Munchkin title.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Somraw Expansion Pack
description:
The IKS Somraw was a Klingon Raptor-class scout that was in service with the Klingon Imperial Fleet in the mid-22nd century.

In 2151, the Somraw attacked and raided a Xarantine outpost. Among the goods the Somraw crew stole from the outpost was some Xarantine ale. After drinking the ale, however, the crew became infected with a deadly toxin. Sometime later, the Somraw was disabled in an attack by a Xarantine ship and forced to hide in the atmosphere of a class 9 gas giant while they made repairs. Before the repairs could be completed, however, most of the crew fell victim to the toxin from the Xarantine ale and collapsed, leaving the Somraw in a decaying orbit.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Escape Room: The Game 2
description:
Not to be confused with Escape Room: The Game 2, this is actually the Spanish version of Escape Room: The Game (Escape Rooms II).

Both the English and Spanish editions contain Secret Agent, Space Station, and The Dentist, but the Spanish version also contains The Casino.
categories: Electronic, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: Vault Wars: Pitch Black Cavern Promo Card
description:
Promo card that was first available during the Kickstarter campaign for Vault Wars.

The card says:
Pitch Black Cavern
Blind-bid Auction:
After setting the opening bid, players will secretly select their bid amount, then simultaneously reveal them.

The payer with the highest bid is the winner. If tied, continue as a normal auction.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy

name: Jim Henson's Labyrinth: The Board Game – Goblins! Expansion
description:
Goblins! is an expansion for Jim Henson's Labyrinth: The Board Game.

When you open the box you will find five beautifully sculpted miniatures and 5 cards that can be added into the deck to change the Labyrinth game.

From here on in you will have two choices, either you can forge on as before using the new models to replace the standees that come with the Labyrinth game, making your Labyrinth experience more immersive but not changing any rules. Your second option is to replace some cards of the Labyrinth deck with Goblin cards giving you a chance to encounter the mischievous blighters throughout the game. A goblin on the game board cannot be travelled past unless they are defeated adding a new set of choices whenever you decide which way to go, don’t let yourself be hemmed in!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Crazy Pawn Games, River Horse (Europe) Ltd

name: Trek 12: At Home – Semaine 1
description:
Trek 12: At Home is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in November 2020 (during the confinement in France).

It consists in three game modes: "À l'intérieur: multi" (multi), "À l'intérieur vs JiMINy" (solo) and "Cookie Challenge" (solo or multi).
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Chaining, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Random Map Expansion (fan expansion for Small World)
description:
This unoffical print & play expansion replaces the game board from Small World with a randomly generated map every time you play. This provides greater variation in how the various race/power combinations are valued, and results in a wider variety of tactical choices and overall deeper gameplay.

The updated expansion includes rules and components for increasing the maximum number of players from 5 to 6, plus a number of special map templates/scenarios for more varied gameplay.

Much of the artwork in this expansion is copyright, and used with permission from Days of Wonder, Inc., for non-commercial purposes only.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Enchanters: As Above So Below
description:
An expansion for the fantasy card-drafting game Enchanters (or the stand-alone expansion, Enchanters: Overlords) featuring two brand new unique 25 card Kingdom Decks.

The Angels: The blessings of the heavens descend in this kingdom deck. Heal your opponents for the power you need, risk ongoing wounds in exchange for the most powerful of equipment, and conquer the mighty White Dragons.

The Troglodytes: Nothing stays buried forever. Fight powerful monsters that bury your equipment in their death throes, find more equipment, and do it again in order to take on the powerful Subterranean Dragon.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: XenoShyft: Onslaught – 6-Player Add-On
description:
An expansion that make it possible to play with 5 or 6 players.
The Kickstarter edition included 2 fold out cardboard boards similar to the 4 included as a bonus for the Kickstarter campaign.

It also includes:

68 cards -
20x 1 XenoSathem
20x 3 Xenosathem
20x 6 Xenosathem
8x Militia

40 Plastic tokens -
20x Red wound markers
20x Blue ability markers
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Pandoria: Realms
description:
As the Five Realms make their new home in Pandoria, they discover that they are not alone! The magic of the island has created a race of Golems out of the different land forms. Centaurs from other parts of the island have journeyed through the mountain passes to settle the same fertile plane. The Spirits of the Ancients who once inhabited Pandoria have been awakened. One ship of Goblins who crashed while pursuing the Five Realms must now coexist with the other realms in this new land. And finally the Fairies, which are gifted with higher powers, who live in forests, in rock caves, at springs or waters.

Each player can choose one of these new realms instead of one of the original Five Realms. Each realm adds a new special power that changes the tactics for the player who controls them—and those of the players who must compete with them!

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Pizza Box Football 2006 Expansion
description:
The Pizza Box Football 2006 Expansion Game Booster updates all teams based on the 2005-2006 season. The pack also includes the additional expansion plays previewed in Pizza Box Football games as well as the additional gray expansion die.

The booster requires the original Pizza Box Football game. These cards do not require the original Pizza Box Football Expansion Game.

Expands:

Pizza Box Football
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Night Hunter
description:
A 1-tile mini-expansion for Neuroshima Hex! The tile is treated by each player as their own tile - it does not block the line of fire, it can be moved by a Move tile, can be connected to Modules etc. By sacrificing one HP of their own HQ, a player can trigger the Night Hunter's special attack against a neighboring enemy tile.

NIGHT HUNTER

Perfect hunter. It appears, inflicts death and disappears into the darkness. It avoids light. Nobody knows who it really is. Nobody knows how it looks like. Nobody can face him.


TILE TYPE:

Common tile - it belongs to every army at the same time and is treated by every player as their own: it doesn't block the line of fire, it can be moved by an own Move tile, own Modules can be connected to it, it cannot be damaged (except with Bomb, which is also damaging own units), it cannot be pushed away, netted, taken over etc.
If it gets destroyed, Night Hunter is removed from the game.



Placed on the board at the beginning of the game - at the beginning of the game, before placing HQs, this tile is placed on any hex on the board except edge hexes and the center of the map.


NIGHT HUNTER DESCRIPTION:

Devour - A player can trigger a Night Hunter's special attack at the cost of 1 Toughness point of HQ to destroy a tile adjecent to Night Hunter indicated by the the Devour icon (it can also be an own tile of the player who triggered Night Hunter's attack).
Devour does no harm to HQs.
Night Hunter does not attack during normal Battle.



Mobility - A player, during his turn, may move Night Hunter by 2 fields and turn him freely. However player can move Night Hunter by one field and turn him freely, then activate Devour (at the cost of 1 wound to his HQ) and then move Night Hunter by the second field and turn him freely.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Baltimore & Ohio: Maine Lumber Expansion
description:
Baltimore & Ohio: Maine Lumber Expansion is the smallest expansion Winsome has ever produced, but it has a big effect on the base game.
This is part of Winsome's Essen 2010 set.
Winsome Games' 2010 Essen Set
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Codex Titanicus
description:
The book Codex Titanicus is a suplement for both Adeptus Titanicus and first edition Space Marine. It introduced additional races such as Orks and Eldar to the game. It also contained eratta and corrected a few minor problems with incompatability between the two previous games.

Expands

Space Marine
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Alien vs Predator: Predalien Expansion
description:
From the publisher:
The Predalien is a Xenomorph spawned from a Predator host. It is the death that nearly all Predators fear, allowing themselves fall victim in such a way is deemed a dishonorable death.

The Predalien is much larger and stronger than the human-spawned Xenomorphs and appears to hold no role within the Hive and instead acts independently hunting and killing until Death!"
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: BANG! The Great Train Robbery
description:
Expansion for BANG! card game. This expansion is co-designed with Czech and Slovak players and brings new mechanics, new cards to be shuffled with the basic deck, and 8 brand-new characters.

The expansion focuses on a track of Railroad cards and a Locomotive card: Each Railroad card is coupled with a Station tile; every time the Sheriff’s turn begins, the train moves and the value of the Railroad cards change depending on the Station tiles. Once during their turn, players may pay the cost shown on a Station to take the corresponding Wagon.

There are two kinds of Railcars: blue-bordered Railcards stay in play until discarded, and take effect immediately; while green-bordered Railcars stay in play but have no effect until the owner decides to discard them during their turn. If a Railcar is taken, the other Railcars on the train slide up to cover the gap, and a new one is added to the end of the train. As soon as the first Railcar behind the Locomotive goes past the last Station, the Locomotive card’s special effect triggers for all players. Then a new track of 5 Station tiles, as well as a new train, is built in the center of the table.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination
publishers: ABACUSSPIELE, Albi, DV Games, Gém Klub Kft.

name: Covil: The Dark Overlords – The Outposts
description:
The Outposts is adding 8 Outpost meeples to Covil. These add a new strategy, allowing you to deploy your troops directly either from your Castle or from any of your Outposts. To build an outpost you need to control a territory and pay the relevant cost in Gold Coins.

Having an Outpost at the end of the game gives you extra Victory Points. Also during the "Night" phase, if there are no enemy forces in the territory of your Outpost, then that territory is considered to be controlled by you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers

name: +6 Bag o' Radioactive Munchkin d6
description:
+6 Bag o' Radioactive Munchkin d6 contains six Munchkin-head dice and four new Munchkin Apocalypse cards. Three of the dice are fluorescent green with orange pips, and three are fluorescent orange with green pips. The cards all require the use of the dice, although you could substitute regular dice if necessary.

The cards are as follows:

Classified - (Treasure) An item enhancer that gives a variable bonus based on rolling a radioactive d6.
Carpet Bomb - (Treasure) An item that gives combat bonuses to the players and monsters, based on rolling all of the radioactive d6s.
The Beast - (Door) A level 20 monster that has an additional effect based on rolling all of the radioactive d6s.
Lots of Luck! - (Door) Based on the roll of all of the radioactive d6s, either open a Seal, close a Seal, or go up a level.


Part of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Historia: Capitals Expansion
description:
In Historia, the players guide their civilization through 12,000 years of human history, from the first sparks up to the development of Singularity. Civilizations discover new technology and expand over the planet; they trade with more developed neighbors to import new technologies or exploit the land to have more power for future actions. Civilizations develop their military and wage wars with each other. They build wonders to make their civilization stand above others and to eventually attract tourists and newcomers to their land to follow their leaders and use their national advisors.

The Capitals Expansion introduces 7 Capital tiles and 14 Treasure tokens. During the game a player can build a Capital to gain Treasure tokens to spend in abilities and special powers.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Federation & Empire: Carrier War
description:
From the back of the cover:

Federation & Empire Expansion - Carrier War

The first expansion of Federation & Empire, with:
- Federation SWACS electronic shuttles
- Individual carrier & escort counters
- Klingon swarm attack groups
- Set up charts for scenarios

Carrier War also includes two major scenarios: The Four Powers War and Gale Force. The Gale Force scenario is divided into seven sectors which can be played individually in one session, linked to create a scenario of any size, or combined to create a savage Campaign!

Contents: 48-page rulebook with scenarios and completely revised Annexes listing dozens of new units.
32-page book of Set-Up charts for the historical scenario and for the seven sectors of Gale Force.
324 Die-Cut Counters including carriers & escorts.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Juggernaut: Great Battles of Alexander Module
description:
"Juggernaut simulates Alexander the Great's final, major battle - The Hydaspes. Having gained hegemony over virtually all of the civilized western world through a series of stunning victories the late, Great King of Persia, Darius III, Alexander heads east, mostly to satisfy his compulsive curiosity and need for conquest. Gobbling up tiny tribes, running into a few pockets of guerrilla resistance, but pretty much advancing at will, the Macedonian juggernaut heads into what is now known as India, only to be met at the River Hydaspes (today the Jelum) by the army of the local - and powerful - rajah, Porus. His crossing thwarted by the presence of Porus' elephant corps ling the banks of the deep and swift river, Alexander uses a ruse to effect an upriver crossing and force Porus into pitched battle."

100 red and blue die-cut counters that must be augmented by counters from previous modules.

Expands:

The Great Battles of Alexander
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Extra Pilots: An Expansion for Far Space Foundry
description:
Extra Pilots: An Expansion for Far Space Foundry provides 6 additional neutral pilots for Far Space Foundry. These neutral pilots count as a "wild" faction; they'll go with any freighter. Each pilot has its own ability.

This was included as a free stretch goal in the initial Kickstarter campaign for Far Space Foundry, but very likely will be available for purchase later.

Components

6 neutral (white) Alien Pilot cards
2 instruction cards


Neutral Pilot Abilities

Mercenary — Whenever you use this pilot, you may bribe the dock master for free.
Miner — Whenever you use this pilot, you may take 1 ore from the supply.
Pirate — Whenever you use this pilot, you may move any number of items from one of your freighters to your others.
Scavenger — Whenever you use this pilot, you may use the ability of any one alien in your discard.
Specialist — Whenever you use this pilot, you may take the docking bay action twice.
Thief — Whenever you use this pilot, you may take 1 credit from the supply.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Dice Brewing: Pre-release Bonus Cards
description:
These are 6 bonus cards that add to the game play options and create a whole new aspect to the game. They are an interesting way to spice up your interactions and help in developing strategies. These extra effects allow you to discover new ways of influencing the outcome of the game.

Before beginning the first round of the game, the player with the season/priority token takes 3 random cards from the pool of extra effects cards that have been obtained for Dice Brewing. Then these 3 cards are placed face up above the recipe cards, side by side, and the effects themselves can be used in every round by any of the players for the rest of the game.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Red Booster Deck
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Killer Bunnies are back and continuing their conquest with red companions who each have a special power! Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Red Booster Deck adds new cards to the existing Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot set, as well as a red 12-sided die.

New cards include: "Orbital Missile Platform" for eliminating bunnies from orbit, "Kentucky Avenue" which allows players to steal a new Red bunny from an opponent, "Shuffleboard" for a quick Carrot grab and "Guardian Angel" to protect against Terrible Misfortunes. New mechanisms include a new Killer Bunnies market to buy back weapons for more fun and destruction, the election of bunny Senators to vote on game outcomes, and four new Carrots!

If peace and salvation is what you crave, you'll love the card "Everybody's Dead, Dave". Want some vengeance against a foe? Drain his resources with "Scotty Doesn't Know". Hilarious good times are surely ahead, with the exciting new booster deck cards of Red!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation

name: Car Wars Arenas
description:
Description from the publisher:

You've got to beat the best — and that means taking to the many different autodueling arenas across the Car Wars world and testing yourself under all kinds of conditions.

Car Wars Arenas gives hardcore autoduelists more exciting locations to showcase their skills and blow away their opponents. The boxed set contains five one-sided 22" x 34" arena maps and a booklet detailing the special features of each arena. The rules will also cover revised versions of popular variants like corporate team dueling, an AADA pro circuit, and more.

The arena designs in Car Wars Arenas have appeared in various Car Wars supplements (including the Car Wars Arena Book and The AADA Duel Circuit: L'Outrance), but only as scaled-down maps. In this set, they come out of the box ready to play in full Car Wars Classic scale.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing

name: Frantic: Supercharge Add-On
description:
More breathless moments and frantic reactions!
With the second Frantic Add-On, Rulefactory brings you a brand-new card type and 24 additional Special and Event Cards.

With the 24 new Power Cards, you can charge your hand cards with extra effects. At the start of the game you get 2 Power Cards each. Every time you play a card during your turn, you can also activate one of your Power Cards – but these only once.
Block a colour, prevent a counterattack, or ask for black!
It’s still Frantic. But supercharged!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Duel in the Dark: British Searchlight
description:
The Luftwaffe was not the only service that used searchlights to aid their night defenses. The British, too, employed these over England to protect the bomber stream and guide their night fighters to intercept the German planes.

Searchlights "blind" German fighters and reduce their score by -1VP if in the same hex as the bomber on a "one for one" basis. They also guide the Mosquito towards the night fighter; the Mossie earns +1VP per German plane and searchlight combo in the same hex to a max of 2VPs.

Expands:

Duel in the Dark
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Historia: Golden Era
description:
Includes 14 tiles which allow the civilization to speed up its growth, but they work only for a short period.

This expansion will never be available in retail, it will be available only by Kickstarting the project. Backers received a little baggie separate from the game box, with the tiles and instruction sheet.

The instructions gave the names as follows:

- The Golden Era Expansion (English)
- Historia Erweiterung Spielregein (German)
- L'Espansione Golden Era (Italian)
- L'Extension Golden Era (French)
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Town Center: London / Hong Kong
description:
Town Center: London / Hong Kong is comprised of 4 double-sided player boards, with the all-new London expansion map on one side, and the also all-new Hong Kong expansion map on the other. There's also an A5-sized rulesheet/cover that explains the special rules of each map.

Both maps are something new and challenging (in fact, very challenging), as players will have to manage their budget (London), and their building plans (Hong Kong) very, very carefully.

Expertly designed by Alban Viard and beautifully illustrated by Todd Sanders, these highly thematic maps were developed to showcase just how deep this game can be, while taking advantage of each city's unique characteristics.
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building

name: The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary – Expansion 1: What Lies Ahead
description:
Hope is fading. The walkers seem to have devoured all sign of life and civilization. But you have no choice but to press on, if only to survive one more day. The chaos of Atlanta lies behind you—a horrid nightmare that continues to haunt your group. But what lies ahead?

What Lies Ahead is an exciting expansion to The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary, taking players from the grim streets of Atlanta and its surrounding environs to the rustic and secluded landscapes of the countryside. However, peace will not be found easy.

With scenarios that pull from season two of the AMC’s hit show, The Walking Dead, this expansion takes players on a dangerous search for a missing member of the group, a desperate mission into an overrun school, and other iconic dilemmas that’ll put the group’s fading hopes to the ultimate test. Featuring new mechanics for stealth, fire, and even flaming walkers, What Lies Ahead adds a variety of new ways to face the horrors of The Walking Dead!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies

name: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon – Gang Bangers Expansion
description:
This is the first expansion for Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon. Players can now be in charge of one of five gangs, like the aggressive and straightforward Merkin, or the more controlling and in-depth Kthulhu Kids. They have to meet their Gang's requirements by buying certain card types or inflicting damage on their opponents, and then, players can recruit Gangsters from their hideout to bolster their builds. Also, the expansion replaces the original 12 Legends from Annihilageddon with 30 new Legendary Treasure cards.

—description from the publihser
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That

name: Red Alert: Space Fleet Warfare – Vice Admiral Flagship Escalation Pack
description:
Escalation packs present additional starship models, rules, and terrain to add to the RED ALERT core game.

This escalation Pack contains:

1 Commonwealth Vice Admiral flagship
3 Commonwealth cap fighters
1 Confederation Vice Admiral flagship
3 Confederation cap fighters
1 rulebook
1 punchboard of counters
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Delve: Peril Awaits
description: 30 additional encounter cards plus 10 additional treasure cards for Delve. Initially available only as part of the King's Blade pledge level on the KickStarter for Delve in 2017.
categories: Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: 6 qui prend!: L'extension vachement bien
description:
Description from the publisher (translates):

10 extra cards that add a dose of cowardice and twists to your games of the famous 6 nimmt. With these new cards and two rule variants, the game will be even more spicy.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: Aeroplanes: Charters
description:
This official Mayfair promo expansion was included as a convention and retail give-away on a tile sheet titled: Game Variants & Mini Expansions Set #1. The expansion is also included in Game Trade Magazine #185 (July 2015).

This expansion adds ways to enter a city without being closed out.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Economic, Expansion for Base-game

name: GROWL: Curses + Spells
description:
GROWL: Curses + Spells is a double-expansion in one box, and the expansions may be played individually or combined with each other or other expansions.


CURSES allows for a more complex, longer game experience. It is recommended for 5+ players. After players have been dealt their initial card (Gold or Bite), shuffle all 14 Curses cards into the main deck. Deal the additional 3 cards to each player, prepare the Night cards, and proceed as usual.

Icons only negate other icons, not the entire card. For example, if you have a Cursed Charm (adds 1 wound icon and 1 charm icon) and a Hex (negates all your charm icons), the Hex cancels the charm icon but not the wound icon. If you have a Super Salve (adds 2 salve icons) and a Cursed Gold (adds 2 gold icons and a wound icon), then one of the salve icons negates the wound icon, but you still have your gold icons and an extra unused salve icon.

Holy Water symbol: (Holy Water is bad for werewolves, so if you “turn” while holding this, you might also find yourself dead!)

Infinity symbol: (While in your hand, this negates ALL of a specific type of icon. Infection negates salve icons, Hex negates charm icons.)


SPELLS adds static (ongoing) abilities, plus effects you can trigger by discarding Gold cards. Recommended for 5+ players.
SETUP: After all players have been dealt their starting hands (but before preparing the Night cards), shuffle 3-5 of these expansion cards into the deck. Then prepare the Night cards, and proceed as usual.

Cards with a [SPELL] icon in the upper right are called “spells” and never go to a hand; instead, they are placed face-up in front of the player they are given to. Their effects are either ongoing (like Wolfsbane or Tanglevine), or else may be triggered as described in the text of the card. When a player with one or more cards in front of them takes their turn, they must FIRST review and resolve their spells in any order, then proceed to draw and give a card as usual for their turn.

Some spells are triggered at unusual moments, such as after a Night Phase, or at the moment a player dies. If need be, pause the game by calling out “Spell!” and resolve its effects before proceeding.

The main text on a spell card is not directed at the player who draws it on their turn, but to the player they give the card to.
Icons in the upper left of your spell cards are considered part of your hand, and may negate (or be negated by) icons on cards in hand.
Some other cards (for example, “Silver Bullet” and “Séance”) are played as spell cards, and there are some card effects that can move or discard them. If a card effect lets you discard a card with a certain icon, you may discard any card of yours with the icon, including a spell card. If a spell is discarded, publicly remove it from play, just as you would discard a resolved Night card.
TIMING: If a card says “once per turn” then it should be interpreted to mean “on your turn only.” Spells usually remain active unless the player dies. If the spells (or the players!) move positions, the spells affect new players instead. If multiple players’ cards conflict, resolve them logically and thematically. In the rare case of complex timing issues, resolve the cards clockwise from the Start Player (1). Finally, if a single player has conflicting cards, they may resolve them in the order they wish.
©2019 Joey Vigour
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Kaosball: Team – St. Cloud Paragons
description:
"The game may have changed, but our principles have not" - Coach Z

The Paragons are a beacon of truth and righteousness in the bloody sport of Kaosball. By focusing their team’s collective soul, they can temporarily sacrifice themselves to boost their teammates to superhuman feats and score like you wouldn’t believe!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Chimera Station: Interactive Modules Promo
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 7.

2 Interactive Tiles for the English Edition
2 Interactive Tiles for the Euro Edition

The 2 interactive tiles are Giant Billboard and Underground Clinic

Mix these interactive tiles into the supply for a slightly meaner game!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
publishers: Frosted Games, Game Brewer, Tasty Minstrel Games

name: Ekö: 3 small expansions
description:
Temple of the Moon (N)
Use the large tile with the Temple of the Moon on it (N) during setup to replace the large tile that is basically identical to it (E).
The Temple of the Moon space is a construction space equivalent to a Reg.

If you have a building on the Temple of the Moon, then during your Reinforcement phase, you can destroy two discs from your reserve (put them in the box) to place a solitary disc in reinforcement, wherever you like on the board, ignoring the usual reinforcement rules. That is to say that you can place this disc by itself on an empty space and/or on a space adjacent to an enemy building, and/or on a tempest space.

The Emperor cannot be sacrificed to use the Temple of the Moon.

Temple of the Sand (O)

Use the large tile with the Temple of the Sand on it (O) during setup to replace the large tile that is basically identical to it (B).
The Temple of the Sand space is a construction space equivalent to a Reg.

If you have a building on the Temple of the Sand, then one time during your turn, before your Action phase, you can destroy two discs from your reserve (put them in the box) to return an enemy disc (other than an Emperor) from the board to its owner’s reserve.

The Emperor cannot be sacrificed to use the Temple of the Sand.

The Beacon of Eon (U)
The Beacon of Eon tile (U) is intended to be used with the variants that use Tempest tiles. During the setup, add the Beacon of Eon tile wherever you like.

The Beacon of Eon tile is a Tempest tile (see base game rules, page 6).

Whoever occupies the most of the spaces around the Beacon of Eon ignores the rules for Tempest tiles (in the event of a tie, no player benefits from this effect). This player therefore treats Tempest spaces like normal spaces: She does not lose a disc by moving into or through them, and can reinforce her stacks there.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Magiczny Miecz: Gród
description:
Another expansion for Magiczny Miecz based loosely on a Talisman theme.

Grod (Town) is very much like Talisman City.

It brings a new board and cards to encounter and few professions (Steward, Chieftain of Thieves, Duke's Envoy, Master Wizard).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Silver Saw-off
description:
Ca$h 'n Gun$ Silver Saw-off is an extension to Ca$h 'n Gun$. Limited edition (500 prints) presented at Essen 2005.

The shotgun allows you to fire between two players and if you shoot at them, you toss two plaster counters (one for each player) - if it lands with the plaster side up that player gets wounded, otherwise nothing happens. So, you can hit 0, 1 or 2 players at once.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mafia, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Magiczny Miecz: Labirynt Magów
description:
Sfera released a number of expansions for Magiczny Miecz, three of which were very similar to expansions for Talisman.

Labyrint Magow (Mage's Labyrinth) was similar to the Talisman Dungeon.

It added a board and new cards to encounter. It also added Alternative Endings to the game, much like Talisman's Adventure expansion.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Rise of Rome: Republican Rome at War – Field of Glory Gaming Companion
description:
The first army supplement for the Field of Glory: Ancient and Medieval Wargaming Rules miniatures wargame. This supplement covers the armies of Republican Rome as well as their allies and enemies. There are eighteen separate lists, each with a sample starter army and point cost chart for making your own force.

The book itself is 72 pages printed in full color with photos of miniatures and paintings from various other Osprey books used throughout.

Armies included:
- Mid-Republican Roman
- Late Republican Roman
- Gallic
- Pyrrhic
- Later Carthaginian
- Illyrian
- Ancient Spanish
- Later Macedonian
- Attalid Pergamene
- Numidian or Early Moorish
- Later Seleucid
- Later Ptolemaic
- Pontic
- Spartacus Slave Revolt
- Early Armenian
- Parthian
- Later Jewish
- Bosporan
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: First Martians: Extra ROI Tiles Promo
description:
This mini expansion for First Martians: Adventures on the Red Planet board game includes two Ring 1, two Ring 2 and one Ring 3 new, extra tiles to enhance your Mars experinece!

Ring 1 ROI tiles are: Utopia Planitia & Moreux Crater. They allow you to gather samples, find new Points of Interest, but at a cost of paying additional energy cost or re-rolling your action dice.

Ring 2 ROI tiles are: Arabia Terra & Pavonis Mons. They allow you to get even more samples, but a similar costs.

Ring 3 ROI tile is Kasei Valles. It allows you to gather samples and even have an adventure while doing so!
categories: Adventure, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Hordes: High Command – Savage Guardians
description:
Bolster your armies with Savage Guardians, the first expansion for Hordes: High Command!

Savage Guardians contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warlock cards, to bring new strategies to your Trollblood, Circle Orboros, Skorne, and Legion of Everblight decks.

Requires Hordes: High Command core set to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: A Touch of Evil: Krampus
description:
Much of the folklore that the original settlers of Shadowbrook practiced in the old world also made the journey across the ocean. One such tale is that of Krampus, the Holiday Devil. Krampus is said to wander the countryside one night a year, punishing naughty children that fail to do their chores by whipping them with rods of birch. Those that he deems especially naughty, he throws in his old sack to be taken back to his lair.. and eaten! Of course, all folklore has its roots somewhere in fact.

Krampus is the fourth web villain for A Touch of Evil, released for Christmas 2014 as a free print & play expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Bohemian Villages: Special Action Tiles
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2016 for Day 16

Adds 9 tiles (3 different tiles)

Rules: With a total of 13 or more, you may take one of these special tiles. you may have each of these tiles at most one time.

Tiles:
Special Action 2 Dice
Special Action +1
Special Action -1
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Vault Wars: Brass Lamp Promo Card
description:
Promo card that was first available during the Kickstarter campaign for Vault Wars.

The card says:
Auction Master
After revealing Items, select 3 players. Starting clockwise from the Auction Master, each selected player Peeks at all remaining items, places one face-down on the Item Pile, then passes the rest to the next selected player. After the third item is placed, shuffle the Item Pile.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy

name: The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary – Expansion 2: Killer Within
description:
Possible salvation lies beyond those walls—behind those bars that may provide relief from the nightmare the world has become. Your mind races with thoughts of peaceful nights, protective walls, and a fresh start. This could be home. But who knows what lies within…

Killer Within is a deadly expansion to The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary, giving survivors the keys to the iconic prison featured in season three of AMC’s The Walking Dead television show.

Included in Killer Within are even more challenging scenarios, pitting survivors against new armored walkers, crumbling fortifications, a deadly plague, and dangerous new neighbors!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Duel in the Dark: British 3.7in QF Anti-Aircraft Gun
description:
British air defenses remained strong following the Battle of Britain. The RAF, understanding the importance of guarding the bomber airfields, ensured they were heavily protected with anti-aircraft guns.

Shell splinters from the AA gun damage German fighters by reducing their fuel line by one for each hit. An AA gun can only hit one fighter in its hex but multiple AA guns can hit the same or other fighters.

Expands:

Duel in the Dark
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume Five (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
From the publisher:

Volume Five of the unofficial 3rd-party expansion to the hit party game Cards Against Humanity.

When we first created Crabs Adjust Humidity, they said we were crazy. "Doomed."

I like to think we weren't, at first. But it's too late now, for us. Far too late. All we can do now is complete the ritual, and hope that when the Old Ones come, they pass up our shrunken, withered husks in favor of more... succulent meat.

To that end, we bring you Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume Five. Here's another 112 cards, stuffed to the gills full of blasphemy, vitriol and the foul gibbering of the irredeemably insane.
Includes: 80 white cards, 32 black cards
Professionally printed on linen-finish, casino-quality cards.
100% compatible with Cards Against Humanity.
Custom serialized hologram on every box, so you know you're not getting a counterfeit.
Loves you just the way you are.
Best if used by 07-23-3015.
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Kleine Helden: Schurken & Halunken
description:
The battle of little heroes continues, but now they get really evil: At this basic game you control rogues & scoundrels.
"Little Heroes - rogue & scoundrel" is a fast action card game.
Scenarios, evil deamons and 180 brand new card will bring you lots of fun in the world of little heroes!

This is a stand alone game, but of course you can combine it with the other games of little heroes for more fun.

Players each control a party of 2 different fantasy stereotype heroes (or scoundrels). They obtain cards which allow them to acquire equipment, potions and combat moves during the course of the game to help them try eliminating all other characters. The last hero still alive wins.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Humans!!! 2: Sea Food
description:
Twilight Creations is pleased to announce our first expansion for our popular Humans!!! line. Humans!!! 2: Sea Food is set on a naval base and features 16 new event cards, 16 new tiles, rules and 10 new zombie navy figure pawns with player card. Map Tile art is by Kurt Miller, and Event card art is by fan favorite David Aikins.

Part of the Zombies!!! series.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Supremacy: The Unconventional Forces
description:
The Unconventional Forces expansion focuses on Assassins, Spies, Saboteurs, Biowar, Chemwar, and Envirowar. There are three new decks, Assassins and Spies, Saboteurs, and Special Weapons. There are 15 Assassin cards and 25 Spy cards in one deck. The Assassins are used to kill an officer in a specific territory or sea. The spy can identify a player's amount of money on hand, location of resource cards, type and tech level of any advances, and names and locations of officers. The saboteur does exactly what you'd expect. The Special Weapons cost $500 Million to research and develop. The various Bio/Chem/Enviro warfare techs can be targeted against troops, territories, or resources.

Expands:

Supremacy: The Game of the Superpowers
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Wargame

name: Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City – Motor Pool
description:
The Kickstarter Exclusive Motor Pool Expansion adds 10 vehicles, vehicle opportunity cards, and a brand-new story to play in Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City.

Vehicles move with any friendly unit and follow them from one district to another. This means they're not tied to any specific unit type and can be utilized by any member of your gang. Each vehicle comes with its own ability, and each gang can have up to 2 vehicles, so carefully choose the ones that complement your play style.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CD Projekt RED, CMON Global Limited

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Soong Expansion Pack
description:
Designated by Starfleet as the Borg Type 03, this class of Borg starship was used by a rogue faction of Borg led by Lore. This unusual design was asymmetrical and totally unlike the previously encountered Borg cube and Borg scout, causing Captain Jean-Luc Picard to speculate whether it was something they constructed or an alien vessel they captured and assimilated. Whatever its origins, the vessel was still heavily armed and massively armored, capable of great destructive power.

This ship is part of the 6th wave of expansion packs for the Star Trek: Attack Wing game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: HeroCard: Rise of the Shogun – Prince Expansion Deck
description:
Prince Expansion Deck

The Prince uses bribes, dirty tricks, and court intrigue in his quest for power.
