The Prince is a HeroCard expansion deck for HeroCard Rise of the Shogun, an epic battle for feudal Japan. The Prince can compete in any HeroCard game or can be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

Expands

HeroCard Rise of the Shogun
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Happy City: Grozilla
description:
A WICKED expansion for Happy City!

Grozilla and his terrifying friends have arrived in town … and they are about to wreak havoc! They are hiding in a 4th pile, amongst new multi-coloured buildings. Do you dare to poke the beasts?

A wicked add-on with:


Interaction
Destruction
Risk-taking
And PIOUPIOUZILLAAAAA!
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: 6 nimmt!: Even/Odd
description:
For the 25th anniversary of 6 nimmt!, publisher AMIGO held a design contest to add something new to the game.

Guillaume from France submitted the winning entry, which works like this: At the start of play, place the 6 nimmt!: Even/Odd card to the left of the row with the lowest card, flipping the card so that its even/odd status matches the adjacent card, e.g. 13 - Odd. As long as this card is next to this row, only odd cards can be played into it — which means you might be forced to play into a different row!

When any row is claimed, the player takes the five cards from that row, starts a new row with their sixth card, then moves the even/odd card to one of the other three rows, specifically the row with the lowest card in its rightmost position. Flip the even/odd card as needed to match the even/odd state of this numbered card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: Mexican Hold'em Poker
description:
52 new cards for your Texas Hold'em poker games!
Before dealing a new hand, you discover a card that will change the rules for the next hand.
Only funny cards like "Shared Secrets", instead of dealing two cards to each player, you deal one card between each player and you play with the cards on your left and on your right, then knowing one card of each of your left and right opponent.
Another one is "Weedkiller" which will remove all clibs cards which will be replaced by another one when you are dealt a club (same for the board).

This is a good extension to introduce new poker player you would otherwise beat too easily!

Expands:

Poker
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Chocobo's Crystal Hunt: Chocobo's Dungeons & Monsters
description: Receive the blessing of the Crystals and send your brave companions into the depths to defeat legendary monsters in this fun and fast-paced expansion!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme

name: Lap Dance Kickstarter Stretch Rewards and 5th Player Expansion
description: During the Kickstarter several new Dancers and Staff members were unlocked. These were not included in the first print run and could be pledged for in the Kickstarter alone.
categories: Dice, Mature / Adult, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Singing

name: Kaosball: Team – Salem Warlocks
description:
“Kaosball is magic. Pity for those that refuse to learn.”

-Kid Lightning, coach

‘Ribbit.’ That’s about all the defeated enemies of the Warlocks can muster after a crushing defeat by these ancient arcanists. While other teams are bound by the petty rules of reality, the Warlocks take advantage of their tradition and heritage, and bend the very nature of the game to their will.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Avignon: Indulgence Pack 1
description:
Six new cards that can be added to Avignon: A Clash of Popes.

Cards included are:

Guildmaster x 2
The Guildmaster cards are affected by other cards as if they were Knights.

Evangelist x 2
Evangelists are affected by other cards as though they were Cardinals.

Priest x2
Priests are affected by other cards as though they were Nobles.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Print & Play, Religious

name: Dungeon Drop: Trials & Tools Mini-Expansion
description:
Treasure Trials and Lockpick Toolkits provide new challenges with great rewards! Comes with 4 Treasure Chest dice and 2 cards with special flick zones and rules.

This mini-expansion came out of Phase Shift Games' design contest in 2020. Many thanks to the contest winner, Silverlightning, for these excellent ideas!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Fantasy

name: GiftTRAP Geek Edition
description:
"Exklusive Mini-Erweiterung" (exclusive mini expansion) for Gift Trap by Heidelberger.

Ziplock bag, 21 double sided gift cards with English and German text, 2 rule cards for standalone or expansion play (German only), 1 blank card.

The gifts are 'geeky' things like "Learn to paint minis" or "A collection of Hentai Mangas".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Autoduel Quarterly
description:
Autoduel Quarterly is a quarterly magazine that provides campaign seeds, scenarios, vehicles, "mock" advertisements, new weapons and accessories, as well as rules questions and answers. Subscribers received a bonus in the form of an extra cutout or cartoon on the protective mailing cover. The quarterly magazine was started by Steve Jackson Games to support the worldwide group of players, officially known as The American Autoduel Association (AADA).

40 issues were published before magazine was folded into Pyramid magazine, which itself shifted to online publication only a few years later.

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Autoduel Quarterly and Pyramid has now been listed on the RPGGeek.

Expands:

Car Wars
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Dice Forge: Harpies
description:
This card replaces another one from the Hydra deck. This card has no effect, you only gain victory points.

During the setup, if you are playing with the Hydra cards, replace one of the Hydra cards with the promotional card in question.
The cards will be placed in the pile in ascending order:
Hydra > Harpies > Chimera > Mother of monsters

The different promo cards can be added in individually.

This card was included in the first printing of the game.
categories: Ancient, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Speed Cups: Fan-Edition
description:
Speed Cups: Fan-Edition consists of six different color-coded booster packs for Speed Cups or Speed Cups², with five different cards in each booster. The cards were created by fans of the game and were selected from among 1,200 submissions for inclusion in this set by designer Haim Shafir and publisher AMIGO Spiel.

In Speed Cups, each player receives a set of five plastic cups, each a different color; a deck of 24 cards is shuffled and placed face down in the center of the table next to the bell. One player flips over the top card, which depicts colored objects – trains, birds, cups, etc. – stacked vertically or horizontally, then everyone tries to recreate this colored sequence with her own set of cups. The first player to do slams the bell, revels in the soul-brightening "ding", then (if correct), claims the card. Someone then reveals the next card, and the players start shuffling cups once again.
categories: Action / Dexterity

name: Chaos Isle: Fresh Meat Expansion Set 1
description:
Chaos Isle is a Mission-Based Card Game (MBCG) that can be played Solo or by 2-6 players using just a single deck. Fresh Meat is the first expansion available for the game and introduces six new Characters accompanied by two new Equipment cards and two brand new Missions. Fresh Meat also gives players two new ways to play the game. Requires the original Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck to play.

Expands:

Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies

name: Spring Meadow: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo
description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo for Day 3.

Includes 2 tiles. Mix these tiles in with the rest of the tiles and proceed as normal.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Qwirkle Mega Pack
description: Compilation of Qwirkle and Erweiterung 1+2. This includes the base game, Qwirkle Select, Qwirkle Connect and Pick 3!. This Compilation does not include The Qwirkle Erweiterung 2 (2016).
categories: Unspecified

name: Star Realms: Assault Shuttle
description:
Promo card for Star Realms.
Most recently given out at Gen Con 2019 and SPIEL'19.

Cost: 2
Faction/Color: Red and Yellow
Primary ability: 4 Damage
Ally Ability: Destroy target base

Flavored text: These formidable ships have taught the Blobs to be more careful where they establish bases.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Back to the Future: The Card Game – Pizza Hydrator
description:
(from the Publisher site)
This is an Item that you can add to your Back To The Future Card Game deck.

It says, "If you had this on the table during your previous turn, you may discard it instead of playing a card, to draw 5 cards."

This card was published in 2010 to promote the release of Back To The Future: The Card Game. It is a card that peels off a postcard. The front of the card is shiny, due to the peel-off method, but this will not affect gameplay, since the cardback matches the regular game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Steamwatchers: Peace With Wolves
description:
Trade the Diplomacy cards from the Peace With Wolves expansion to benefit from other Clans' technologies. Alliances make everyone stronger, but do not forget betrayal is one-sided.
This expansion also contains a new game mode: the Alliance mode for 2-3 players.

—description from the publisher

Peace With Wolves includes a set of Diplomacy cards for all clans to start with. These will be traded and bartered with other players for advantage. Trading all of your cards may result in great power, but it can also open up a tremendous weakness.

Steamwatchers can handle up to 5 players normally, but at lower player counts, this expansion facilitates an "Ally" mode for each of the clans in the game. In this mode, each player at the table controls two Clans. This provides a unique opportunity for a crowded map at a not-so-crowded table. All ally cards have an alternate side for increased variability.

This expansion also includes new Scenario and Archon cards for the main game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Order Counters, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Pizza Theory: Anchovy Expansion
description:
The Pizza Theory: Anchovy Expansion, consisting of a set of 16 anchovy toppings and a rulebook, is used with the Pizza Theory board game to present players with an additional challenge.

In addition to removing the opponents' toppings, each player must now work to keep the anchovies from taking over the pie, too. If all 16 anchovies end up on the pie before any player places his toppings, then everyone loses and the anchovies reign supreme!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game

name: Звёздные империи: Гамбит (Star Realms: Gambit)
description:
This compilation includes five expansions:

Crisis – Bases & Battleships
Crisis – Heroes
Crisis – Events
Crisis – Fleets & Fortresses
2014 Gen Con Gambit Set (with 20 cards)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Board Royale: The Island – Disasters Expansion Pack
description:
A deserted island is a dangerous place. It is hard to survive even without other players trying to kill you. So be prepared to face the wrath of Mother Nature!
This 60 card expansion pack gives extra flavor of being on a wild and dangerous island. It even has an optional game mode where every player works together to survive!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Pay Dirt: Old Timer, 1899er Mini-Expansion
description:
This Expansion will take you back to the Klondike Era!

It will give players a set of equipment, gear, claim and personnel that will be tied thematically to the gold rush of the 1800’s.

Kickstarter supporter bonus.
categories: American West, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): Doppelganger
description:
Fantasy Flight Games produced two bonus Adventure Cards which were made available as preorder bonuses when people ordered Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion via the FFG website or from their FLGS.

The Doppelganger Adventure card is an Enemy - Monster originally included in the Talisman Expansion Set for Talisman.

Though the card is unlikely to be reprinted in a future expansion, a similar card was released as a Dungeon card called the Mimic in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Dungeon Expansion.

It was available in various languages from FFG's international partners and given away either with preorders or at launch events.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Fantasy Flight Games, Galakta, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Hobby Japan, Nexus Editrice, Pegasus Spiele

name: Ascension: Darkness Unleashed – Covetous Kraken Promo Card
description:
Promo released when Ascension: Darkness Unleashed is coming out, that is compatible with all so-far released Ascension products.

Card text:
Covetous Kraken - Needs 6 Attack
Monster

Fate: When this enters the center row, each players puts the top card of their deck face down under this card.

Reward: Gain 6 Honour. Acquire all cards under this and put them into your hand.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Nidavellir: Jarika The Rogue Promo Card
description:
Jarika The Rogue is a promo card to add to your deck of Hero Cards
It was first published in French in MaGRRREzine #3 (April 2020), then in the German and English versions of Spielbox 7/2020.
It was later included in the Thingvellir expansion released April 2021.


This Dwarf Countess, ruling the distant deserts, took longer than expected to reach the Kingdom. A highly respected aristocrat, Jarika owes her nickname to her talents as a speaker and a merchant, which has enabled her to significantly increase the wealth of her county. Some even say she might have greater wealth than Grid and Astrid combined! Anyway, if you start talking exchange and trade with her, she will always find a way to come out on top!
As in negotiation, her power will increase in strength as the game goes, allowing you to gain a large fortune and recruit the best Dwarfs!


She adds 8 points to your Final Bravery Value.
As a neutral Hero, place her in your Command Area.
During a coin transformation or a coin trade (Royal Offering, Warrior Distinction, Grid), increase the value of the desired sum by 2.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Constrained Bidding, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Auction, Victory Points as a Resource
publishers: Blackrock Games, GRRRE Games, Pegasus Spiele

name: Digganob
description:
Digganob is the expansion to the humorous Gorkamorka game.

It adds three types of mob to the basic games and contains new scenarios with which to exercise them.

The box contains a 96-page soft-bound rule-book and cardboard models for 4 mutie tents and a crashed spaceship along with a number of counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Time Traveler
description:
Take your Age of Steam experience to the next dimension! Age of Steam: Time Traveler Expansion comes with several new maps that represent not only different locations, but also different times as well, and adds an exciting twist as players travel from one map to another using time portals. Rather than the usual board with one single large map, the game features multiple considerably smaller maps, each representing a different era of time, and together make up the game board. In addition to building routes within a particular smaller map, players will be able to `travel' from one map in time to another map.

Game-play and theme is similar to that of Railways Through Time, the forthcoming expansion for Railways of the World.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Brook City: Delta Keys
description:
Join the Murdock brothers as they visit the beautiful islands of the Delta Keys, facing off against a new criminal and two new cases, as well as a new island sideboard.

Components: 2 cop miniatures, 1 suspect miniature, 12 crew miniatures, 145 cards (25x2 Cop cards, 22 criminal cards, 21 x2 Case cards, 25 Smuggling cards, 6 vehicle cards), side board, tokens, and rulebook
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – "Adventure in Neverland" Junior Scenario
description:
It is called Adventures in Neverland and is - obviously - inspired by Peter Pan story. This family-oriented scenario let players fight Captain Hook, feed TikTak gator and do all things inspired by the book. It's filled with theme and kids who know the story will be in heaven.
—description from the publisher

A fourteenth scenario, included in the loot box. It is an introduction to Robinson Crusoe: Mystery Tales.
—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Super Ninja Ambush!
description:
Super Ninja Ambush! is a deluxe crossover warband that is playable in games of Super Dungeon and Ninja All-Stars. Featuring three ronin useable as Super Dungeon Heroes, four Elemental Shrine spawning points, eighteen ninja, and two monstrous oni mini-bosses, Super Ninja Ambush! expands player options with exciting ninja adventure like no other!

Thanks to unique team building elements, Super Ninja Ambush! is incredibly versatile. Players can use all the included miniatures to create Ninja All-Stars themed games of Super Dungeon, use the included air and earth ninja in games of Ninja All-Stars, and even hire out any of the three ronin for their clans in standard and league play games of Ninja All-Stars.

Both novice and advanced players will enjoy the wide range Super Ninja Ambush! offers. Ninja Division Publishing is also committed to the growth of Super Dungeon with thrilling expansions and also greatly supports organized play communities of Ninja All-Stars with an impressive array of tournament and league kits that feature unique narratives and fun prizes for participants. Whether playing amongst friends or family, Super Ninja Ambush! is sure to be a hit with all!

Contents:
27 Assembled Ninja Models
1 Mochizuki
1 Komuso
1 Momotaro
2 Oni
4 Elemental Shrines
18 Elemental Shrine Ninja
6 Assembled Samurai Models
32 Super Dungeon Cards for Classic and Arcade
3 Ninja All-Stars Ronin Cards
1 Mochizuki Card
1 Komuso Card
1 Momotaro Card
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Nexum Galaxy: Asteroids
description:
In the Nexum Galaxy "Asteroids" Expansion you will find a greater depth of gameplay in the story and asymmetric features of the Civilizations, with technologies, exploration, new resources, wormholes that will connect us to other Sectors, etc.

With this expansion, Nexum Galaxy becomes a 4X game (eXplore, eXpand, eXploit and eXterminate).

It also introduces an asymmetry in factions, technology, new resources. It increases replayability by adding new Systems to those included in the base game, as well as Event and AI cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Game System, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Connections, Cooperative Game, Map Addition, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Ownership, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Carcassonne: Spiel Doch Mini Expansion
description:
Issue 2/2018 (autumn/winter 2018) of the german boardgame magazine SPIEL DOCH! published in september 2018.

As usual, the magazine offers a lot of content for all game fans and everyone starting to discover this hobby. Two new tiles, one with a donkey stable and one with a garden for the Abbott, for the original Carcassonne are included in this issue; you can use them to play the variant where the player who manages to place the two new tiles in the correct order immediately receives five extra points.

Two additional tiles for the brand new Carcassonne Safari show an elephant/lion and a zebra/giraffe.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
publishers: Hans im Glück, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: FITS Expansion #2: LOTS – Letters On The Spaces
description:
LOTS: Letters On The Spaces take the FITS game in an entirely new direction, with four different letter and word-based games.

Expands:

FITS
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle

name: Starcadia Quest: Build-a-Robot – Companion Pack
description:
This companion pack brings 3 full new Robot Companions, comprised of 3 Top Parts and 3 Bottom Parts. These offer even more options when playing with the Build-a-Robot expansion, since all Robot Parts are interchangeable!

Contains 3 robot miniatures and 6 robot part cards.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Convoy: A Programmed Car Wars Adventure
description:
Lexington to Memphis. 400 Miles. Thirteen Hours. If you make it, you'll earn a quick $100,000. If you fail, a city dies.

Convoy is a Car Wars adventure for 1 to 6 players.

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Magic: The Gathering – Fallen Empires
description:
Devastated by the Brothers' War, the southern continent of Sarpadia is getting colder. Alliances crumble and wars flare as factions compete for dwindling resources. The only goal left is survival.

Fallen Empires takes creature generation to a new level featuring Thrulls and Fungus alongside perennial favorites like Goblins, Elves, Merfolk, and Soldiers. The common cards in this set were each printed in three or four different versions, each with its own unique art.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Deadwood: On Location
description:
The only thing worse than acting at Deadwood Studios, debasing yourself for a tiny paycheck by playing such memorable roles as "Man on Fire", is having to go somewhere else to do it. If the gig at Deadwood Studios wasn't bad enough, now you're working "on location"

Deadwood: On Location is a set of new boards for the Deadwood game, representing six different sets and the bus stops that connect them. You'll need the rules from Deadwood to play, as well as those cards. On Location is also compatible with the four "Another Day, Another Dollar" card expansions.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hippos & Crocodiles: Buffalos
description:
Buffalos is an expansion of Hippos & Crocodiles that allows a 3rd player to play the game. It comes with a new 16×20 board and 8 buffalo pieces.

The buffalo can be used for 2 player games too, thus bringing new combinations and strategies to the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: GROWL: 7 Sins + Undead
description:
GROWL: 7 Sins + Undead is a double-expansion in one box, and the expansions may be played individually or combined with each other or other expansions.



7 SINS adds some light punishments and rewards to the game experience. It is recommended for 5-10 players.There are 7 sin cards and 7 virtue cards. After all players have been dealt their starting hands (but before preparing the Night cards), shuffle 5-7 cards into the deck. Then prepare the Night cards, and proceed as usual. Cards with a [SPELLS] icon in the upper right are called “spells” and never go to a hand; instead, when drawn they are placed face-up in front of another player. Their effects are ongoing for that player – some good and some bad – and must be taken into consideration at all times, especially when checking for death or turning into a werewolf.

Icons in the upper left of your [SPELLS] cards are considered part of your hand, and may negate (or be negated by) icons on cards in hand. In addition, some cards affect your neighbors to the left and right of you (skipping over any dead players)! There are virtue cards and sin cards; most of the virtues reward the virtuous players, and most of the sins punish the sinful.

When drawing a sin or virtue on your turn, you must give the card to ANOTHER player (even if you yourself would have qualified to receive it if someone else had drawn the card). If the card has only white text, give it to the player of your choice, to place face-up in front of them.

READING A JUDGMENT: The 7 Sins expansion cards contain two possible colors of text. The YELLOW TEXT is to be read aloud by the player who drew the card on their turn. (Just like in other aspects of the game, players must be honest when queried during a judgment. You may be asked, for example, about the total number of Gold icons you have, or the number of cards in your hand.) After giving the card to another player, they place it in front of them. The WHITE TEXT is the reward (or punishment!) that the player who received the card must accept. Most card effects are ongoing and permanent for the game (unless other cards move them, or move the players themselves). Once a sin or virtue card has been given to a player, they need to only reference the white text, plus any icons. It does NOT move positions, even if a new player would have otherwise qualified for it (for example, the player with Gluttony retains the spell, even if a different player later acquires the most cards).

TIMING: Conflicting cards are resolved clockwise from the left of the Start Player (1). If a single player has conflicting cards, they may resolve them in the order they wish.

UNDEAD adds a third faction which allows dead players to take unique turns instead of being eliminated.

It is recommended for 5+ players. When playing with only 4 or 5 players:
• Remove the 2 Undead cards with the (6+) label in the lower left.
• Final Night cards that automatically would kill players instead only inflict a wound on them.

SETUP: Determine in advance if you are playing with this expansion. Shuffle the Undead cards (they have a zombie on the back) and form a small face-down Undead Deck near the play area.

When a player dies, they are no longer a human or a werewolf. They are now on the undead team, and can never win with the humans or the werewolves. The undead can’t change teams or return back to life, even if they give their Wound cards away. Since Undead players are still considered dead, they do NOT take part in Night Phase or draw cards from the main deck. However, during player turns, undead players instead get a special turn. When killed during the game, announce you are undead, place a green “I Died” card on top of your home tile, and await your undead turn.

UNDEAD TURN: Draw a card from the Undead Deck and read it privately. You have two choices: 1. Resolve any yellow text (and if the card is a spell card give it to a living player to be placed face-up as an ongoing effect for them). 2. If you don’t like the card you drew, you may instead discard it and place any card from your hand face-up on top of the main deck for the next (living) player to draw. Then player turns (and undead turns) proceed as usual.

The undead win the game at any time if there are only 2 (or fewer) players left alive. When they win, the undead should make moaning noises or yell “...Brains....” The player(s) whose death triggered the ending do not win with the rest of the Undead.

If there are 3+ players still alive after you have resolved the Final Night, proceed to The Growl and determine the winning team (werewolves or humans) as usual.

©Joey Vigour
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Neuroshima Hex! Duel Chain Reaction Cards
description: The Chain Reaction cards, given out as a freebie at Essen 2009, as well as with preordered copies of the game enhance the effect of Terminals in Neuroshima Hex: Duel. 2 out of the 5 cards can be used in a game, and the players may both purchase energy from the cards and use their special abilities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Seven Dragons: Shuffle Hands
description:
This is an Action that you can add in to your Seven Dragons deck.

When played, you gather up all players' hands, shuffle them, and deal them out among the players, starting with yourself. It has part of the rainbow dragon's image in the center, and when played to the top of the discard pile, it causes the Silver Dragon to act as a wild card.

This is the action card from the game's predecessor, Aquarius, that was left of the Seven Dragons re-implementation.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Saboteur: Selfish Dwarf
description: Saboteur: Selfish Dwarf is a single card expansion for Saboteur distributed during the 2016 Saboteur World Championship, and the player who holds this character card wins only when they themselves connect the start card with the gold card.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Compendium: The Overlord – Tome III (fan expansion for Mythic Battles: Pantheon)
description:
A collection of fan-designed scenarios.

The third compendium was originally offered only at GenCon 2018.

The compendium is a magazine whose content is mostly made by the The-Overlord fan community.
This issue is mainly dedicated to Mythic Battles: Pantheon with:

some scenarios
a campaign
strategic advice
a tutorial to make a 3D rock
a painting guide
ambient texts

You will also find a preview gameplay for Mythic Battles: Ragnarok and an article on Stephane NGuyen's sculpture work on a Claustrophobia 1643 demon.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Fighting, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Wilki i Owce (zawiera dodatek Grube Ryby)
description:
Each player tries to make the largest pens with his own sheep inside by placing his own tiles. You can easily close small pens, or you can be ambitious and try to build large farms... but if you cannot enclose the fields, your sheep are likely to be eaten by the big bad wolves roaming in the nearby forests. Each player's animal is secret at the beginning of the game, but the soonest you reveal it, the more points you get.

This edition includes the expansion.
categories: Animals, Children's Game

name: Thunder's Edge: Demon Canyon
description:
The first and only expansion for Thunder's Edge introduces Gryphon and Siege Squadrons, Bombardment Shields, Fleet Cards that affect control of off-world locations, and five new factions. It also adds 13 new map-board tiles, including Demon Canyon itself (effectively an on-world wormhole) and the off-world Graban Shipyards.

Expands:

Thunder's Edge
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Elfenland: Der Elfen-Zauberer
description:
This promo pack consists of 4 Wizard cards and a rules card for Elfenland.

The wizards are shuffled into the deck and act as joker cards - playing a wizard allows a player to teleport to any city on the map.

Contained in the 1999 edition of Elfengold.
categories: Fantasy, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Hollywood: Stretch Goal Cards
description:
41 new cards for Hollywood unlocked with stretch goals of the Kickstarter project. Most of these cards are Kickstarter exclusive.

Contents:
PR Specialist (2), Lawyer (2), Method Acting Teacher (2), Singer (2), Gaffer (2), Dance Choreographer (2), Movie Critic (2), Actress / Director (2), Actor / Director (2), Actor / Actress (2), Director of Photography (1), Location Scout (1), Second Unit Director (6), Player aid cards (6), Movie Legend cards (7)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cacao: Die Lichtung
description:
Small post card expansion for Cacao. This was first distributed to all Patreon supporters of the German Bretterwisser podcast. It's not made of thick cardboard like the tiles of Cacao, it's just like a regular postcard.

Rules:

This move can be played by each player in the game once.
Instead of placing a worker tile next to a jungle tile, a player has the opportunity to place a 1-1-1-1 worker tile on the grey space on the postcard.
Subsequently the player may now choose 2 from the 4 adjacent jungle tiles on the card an execute their action once.
Afterwards the worker tile is placed face down next to the postcard, for other players to see, who already used the postcard.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
publishers: ABACUSSPIELE, uplay.it edizioni, White Goblin Games

name: This Accursed Civil War: The Battle of Cheriton, 1644
description: This C3i Magazine Nr17 Module by RBM Studio contains the battle-specific counters and a new mapsheet to simulate the battle of Cheriton. To play this battle module you must have the boxed game This Accursed Civil War.
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Stratego Legends: Qa'ans Resurgence
description:
Expansion set for Stratego Legends that adds a 30 piece army (gray side), 2 new boards, and 12 (of the 30) new characters.

Expands:

Stratego Legends
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Biru Biru & Scrag
description: Biru Biru and Scrag appear to be two sides of the same coin, but they are indubitably different and distinct entities. Biru Biru is almost universally loved by Kaosball fans and is the unofficial mascot of Kaosball, while Scrag is a close runner up even if he does have a bigger vocabulary.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Hostage Negotiator: Ana Langston
description:
Negotiator Cards each add a power that can be used once per game. Ana Langston allows getting an additional Conversation card after purchase of another card.

This card was included in all copies of the Veteran pledge level of the Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Second World War at Sea: East of Suez
description:
The British Pacific Fleet fought alongside its American allies in the final stages of the Pacific War, advancing from its Indian Ocean bases to Tokyo Bay.
This Second World War at Sea scenario book adds more than three dozen new scenarios to the game system and includes 210 new playing pieces.
The Second World War at Sea games Leyte Gulf, Strike South and Eastern Fleet are needed to enjoy all of the scenarios in East of Suez.

Planned and actual operations by the British Eastern and Pacific Fleets from 1943 to 1946. The Soviet Pacific Fleet is also covered by article and scenarios.
East of Suez is a 64-page scenario book.

(from the back cover and user's description)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Resident Evil 2: The Board Game – The Retro Pack
description:
The Retro Pack is for the old-school Resident Evil fans out there, recreating the artwork and style for each of the item, enemy, and character cards to appear as they did in the classic video game. It also includes a series of additional iconic tiles and scenario items to customize your play experience. If you’re a series veteran who played the game the first time around and want to indulge your nostalgia for the good old days, then this expansion is definitely for you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: No Game Over: Expansiones – Nientiendo, Play & Greatest Hits y Retro
description:
A PACK WITH 3 EXPANSIONS is created that can be played with No Game Over, which is necessary to play them. As we wish, we can play with 1 expansion, with 2 or with 3. The duration of the games is still 15-30 minutes approximately, except for some games that are played with the Retro expansion, which may be longer.

El pack de 3 expansiones temáticas nos aportará 78 nuevas cartas al juego base (es necesario el juego base para poder jugar las expansiones). Podremos jugar cada expansión junto a No Game Over de forma independiente o juntando 2 o 3 expansiones, según nos apetezca. La duración de las partidas sigue siendo 15-30 minutos aproximadamente, salvo algunas partidas que se jueguen con la expansión Retro, que pueden alargarse algo más.

Las expansiones son las siguientes: "Nientiendo", "Play & Greatest Hits" y "Retro". Cada una de ellas consta de 26 nuevas cartas diferentes que incluyen: 2 Final Bosses por cada expansión, cartas de equipamiento (algunos de ellos con efectos especiales), nuevos efectos de objetos de único uso, nuevas formas de fastidiar a los demás con maldiciones y algunos toques de mecánicas nuevas para potenciar más la jugabilidad y diversión que No Game Over ofrece.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: The Zorro Dice Game: Heroes and Villains
description:
This first expansion to The Zorro Dice Game broadens the player count in both direction bringing it down to 1 player and up to 8 players. It has more villains, more scoundrels, more premium equipment, and more common equipment. Whereas the base game kept everything very simple and straightforward, the expansion adds some more complexity, which also opens up more opportunity for combos and strategies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Sudden Death Ending

name: Shadowrun: Sprawl Ops – 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
5-6 player expansion for the Shadowrun: Sprawl Ops base game.

Contents: Rulesheet, 6 Starting Shadowrunner cards, 11 Shadowrunner cards, 10 Gear cards, 15 Upgrade cards, 10 Mission cards, 2 Runner boards, 8 pawns for two unique runner teams.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Helsinki: Deluxe
description:
Deluxe edition contains base game and expansion 1 in acrylic.


The famous Senate Square in the center of the Finnish capital is surrounded by government buildings, the
university, the cathedral and the Sederholm House. The players ́ task is to design pavilions across the square to protect pedestrians in the rain. Helsinki is based on the design of Copenhagen by the same design team, but with some added complexity.

The center board depicts the Senate Square with 8 spaces (two per side) and 8 cards, with each card connected to two spaces. The player on their turn advances their pawn 1-3 spaces, then must choose to take cards or build a pavilion. Each space is connected to two face up cards, and the player may choose to draw these into their hand (making sure to respect the 7 card hand limit, a key challenge in the game). The cards are in one of 5 colors and show a shape of size 2 to 5. To build a pavilion, the player plays a card showing the piece they want to play, and then must play an additional number of cards of the same color to match the size of the piece. Finally, the piece must be "slid" onto their game board (which also represents the Senate Square) from the side of the Square their pawn is on on the main board. Covering certain spaces earns a coat of arms, which may be spent to use one of the 15 one-time special actions.

Players score points for completing rows and columns, and the player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

—description from publisher
categories: Unspecified

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module C4 – Fleet Training Centers
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

From the back of the cover

This product adds new rules, races and ships for Star Fleet Battles:

- The Frax: Based on "wet navy" warships with FX and RX firing arcs. Their subs use the gravitic Axion Torpedo.

- The Britanians: Their cruiser mounts no less than eight disruptors - four on each side! Cross the T to victory.

- The Sharkhunters: A cloaked ship's nightmare, they use flashbombs for lock-on and wire-guided plasmas for the kill!

- The Qaris: Their ships mount rapid-fire kinetic cannons in rotating turrets. Their gigantic Scud missiles kill bases.

- The Flivvers: Float like a butterfly - and kick like a mule! Speed-640 Huperdrones cannot be stopped easily.

- The Barbarians: Their ships have option mounts able to hold weapons and other systems to simulate any enemy.

- The Triaxians: Their ships move in three direcions (rather than two) and mount the versatile Type-A Plasma Torpedo.

- The Deltans: Designed for ONE mission - base busting! They are the fastest ships able to hold overloaded photons.

- The Canadi'ens: Their Maple Leaf Maulers will hit you coming and going, right and left, up and down, in and out.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: De Ontembare Stad: Het Verraad
description:
Het Verraad (Treason) is the first expansion to the game De Ontembare Stad (The Indomitable Citadel)

The tactical and strategic alternatives of Treason have grown significantly in comparison to the original "De Ontembare Stad". Luck is just a small factor in the game. The character of the Dark Master is an important new feature in the game, in fact introducing an extra player in the game. Each player becomes a chance to support the dark side or the good side. Investing in dark power increases the attractiveness of the Dark Master. New playing pieces as Watchtowers allow players to defend themselves against the attacks of the Dark Master. Giving money to the church improves the power of the good forces and gives some protection against the Dark forces. New castle cards and income blocks are a valuable new asset to the game, because the players are able to monitor their income in each category.

As the Citadel is prosperous and the number of citizens grows, rumor has it that a dark character will come inside the Citadel's walls. The Dark Master must be countered by the five Grand Masters to save The Citadel from destruction. But which of the Grand Masters are strong enough to withstand the attraction of the dark side. Since each one of them would like to increase their influence in the Citadel, one or more traitors are more likely to reveal their real character when the game draws to a thrilling finale.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: Kontor: Das Exportlager
description:
This is an expansion to Kontor. Each player gets an exportlager (export warehouse) and every time that a dock tile with warehouses is placed one of the warehouses may be added to the export warehouse instead of staying in that dock area. At the end of the game each warehouse majority (tea, spices or wine) in the export warehouse is worth one victory point.

This expansion can be printed from the web. Two copies of the expansion along with the Kontor: 3 & 4 player expansion would allow 3-4 players. One copy would be sufficient for team play.

Expands

Kontor
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Initiations of the Favored Asylum Pack
description:
Initiations of the Favored is the third Asylum Pack in the Rituals of the Order cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. This cycle introduces new Monsters, Servitors, Rituals, and Items, as well as cards for the Order of the Silver Twilight. The story of Lucy Jennings, Silver Twilight initiate, continues in the serial tale by Jeff Tidball.

Initiations of the Favored is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS: The Ministry Expansion Pack
description:
1 Double Sided Tile
1 Character Board & Sheet
1 40mm Miniature
30+ Cards & Tokens
2 Playable Scenarios
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Scout 608 Expansion Pack
description:
The Borg Scout Cube was a smaller ship used by the Borg to explore and evaluate information on species unknown to the Borg Collective.
The Borg Scout Cube 608 was sent to the Argolis cluster. He has a crew of 5 Borg drones, including Three-of-Five, the drone who would later be known as “Hugh”. the name given to him by Geordi La Forge while aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-D.
This expansion adds new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Pioneers: Queenie 3 – The Farmers
description: The Farmers is a mini-expansion for Pioneers that contains one special coach which has space for two farmers and is worth 4 VP.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: Munchkin: Unicorns and Friends
description:
Munchkin mini-expansion loaded with unicorns, cows, and the undead! We're bringing even more wacky cards to Munchkin games everywhere. And this time around, to make things just a little more ridiculous, we've brought three of our favorite Munchkin artists together in a single set: Say hello to Munchkin Unicorns and Friends, illustrated by Katie Cook, Ian McGinty, and Len Peralta

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Axis & Allies Miniatures: Eastern Front 1941-1945 Map Guide
description:
Battle in ruined cities and out on the open steppe with the Axis & Allies Miniatures Eastern Front 1941-1945 Map Guide. This companion item to the Eastern Front 1941-1945 expansion will equip players with battle maps, scenarios, and terrain specific rules to recreate battles fought on the Eastern Front.

Battle scenarios challenge players on either side of the battlefield, putting tactical skills and strategic planning to the test. Double-sided battle maps feature detailed artwork and allow players to make use of maneuverability and tactical placement of units. Eastern Front 1941-1945

Map Guide expansion includes:

- 3 full color, double sided, 21" x 30" battle maps
- 2 Eastern Front 1941-1945 battle scenarios
- player aid
- Eastern Front 1941-1945 expansion set list

The maps are 3" hex size and are compatible with the Expanded Rules map sets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Lost Temple: The Mandarin
description:
Released in October 2011.

The bonus card 'The Mandarin' gives you the opportunity to play Lost Temple with even up to 9 players! It consists of the extra card 'Mandarin' (in 4 languages) as well as an extra pawn and card (brown) for a 9th player. The special ability of the Mandarin: move forward as many spaces as your rank in the race.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Racing

name: Dice Brewing: Mr. Hop in Essen
description:
Mr. Hop in Essen is a special promo card for Dice Brewing, which was available at Spiel '14, in Essen.

Mr. Hop in Essen is a recipe card which requires the following basic recipe:

1 hop die (green) with the minimum value of 2;
2 light malt dice (yellow), one with a minimum value of 3 and one with a minimum value of 5;
1 dark malt dice (black) with the minimum value of 3;
1 special hops token.


The player's reward is 5 master points and 6 gold coins. The card's enhancements are:

1 blue die for 2 mastery points;
2 gold coins for an action token.


Mr. Hop can also be found in the rule book, as an employee from the Training Department who helps players navigate through the rule of the game.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Loony Quest: Bonusplättchen Skier
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 6.

Contains:

1 alternative score token, to record points on the score track
1 alternative character token, to identify the player
4 bonus tokens "ski", which allows a player to rapidly catch the player ahead of him in points.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze, Real-time

name: The Near East
description:
The Near East, Europa IX, is a module of maps and counters covering the countries of the Near East.

Three maps cover Asiatic Turkey, Syria, Iraq, and Western Iran, at the standard Europa scale of 16 miles per hex. They display the diversity of terrain in the region, from sandy desert to high mountain peaks, from the marshy lowlands of the Persian Gulf to the rugged, wooded coast of the Caspian Sea, from the wadis of Syria to the karst of Turkey.

Counters cover the armed forces of Turkey, Iraq, Iran, and Egypt, at standard Europa scales of divisions, brigades, and regiments. Air units represent groupings of 40 to 60 aircraft, organized by type (such as fighters or bombers) and model (from Gladiator biplanes to 4-engined B-24 bombers). Naval units represent individual large warships or flotillas of smaller vessels. The counters also include British and Indian forces which do not appear elsewhere in Europa.

The charts give the orders of battle for the countries of the Near East, and a set of guidelines for combining The Near East with Western Desert (Europa Game VI) is included.

Game Components:

three 21" x 27" maps (Europa Maps 20, 21, 22)
240 die cut counters (Counter Sheet #35)
chart set
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
publishers: Game Designers' Workshop (GDW Games), Hobby Japan

name: Bohna Nostra
description:
Promises, promises! Everyone knows the situation: You get offered some great beans, but cannot offer anything in exchange. Now you can offer favors for later to try to strike a deal now.

Bohna Nostra offers new trading opportunities for Bohnanza and Ladybohn, and you need one of those base games in order to use this.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Sebastian Cross
description:
Few would suspect the dour Sebastian Cross to be an avid Super Dungeon Explore player. Yet he is renown for his cunning tactics and exceptional party management. A party led by Sebastian is an unstoppable juggernaut, battering through the Consul's minions with grim determination.

Contains:
Sebastian Cross Hero Model
25mm Base
Game Card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

description:
1 Double Sided Tile

30+ Cards & Tokens
2 Playable Scenarios

description: Character pack that adds 12 new characters to the base game.

mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Perilous Trials Asylum Pack
description:
From the publisher's website:

Perilous Trials is the second Asylum Pack in the Rituals of the Order cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. As Lucy struggles to remember the details of the party, she is approached by the mysterious Mr. Dart who invites her to join a very old, selective order.

Perilous Trials is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

This is not a stand-alone deck; you must have additional Call of Cthulhu LCG cards to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Marvel: Remix – Squirrel Girl Promo Card
description:
Originally given with the base game at Essen Spiel 2022. Promo Card for the base game.

Effect:
Ignore the text box for all VILLAINS. All negative VILLAIN base powers become positive.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Rockwell: Diamond Cards
description:
Set of 8 cards that was an exclusive stretch goal for those who backed the game at Kickstarter.

Description from the Kickstarter-page: "During the extraction, this card allows you to earn money instead of resources."
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Industry / Manufacturing, Number
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Zooloretto: Kiwi
description:
An expansion for Zooloretto, given out by Abacus at Spiel 2014 in Essen.
This expansion consists of 1 tile with a kiwi.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for: the first player to fill his 6-space enclosure takes the enclosure with the kiwi as a bonus. If it is the owner's turn he can pay 1 coin to rearrange all tiles on the delivery trucks instead of taking an action (only once in the game).
Scoring: A coin on the kiwi enclosure is not considered during scoring.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: Numbers League: Infinity Level Expansion Deck
description:
From Bent Castle Workshop webpage:

"A new breed of villainy descends on Infinity city. To defeat it you will need more skill than ever before. Armed with division and decimals see if you are up to the challenge. The 60 card expansion deck includes Rules, 24 new villains (12 cards), 11 new superheroes (33 cards), and 15 new weapons."

Expansion for Numbers League.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Number

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Rumblefist
description:
"Your foe's spirit is your strength."

Rumblefist is Kaosball's most celebrated martial artist. Having not only mastered every traditional form, he has invented at least a dozen of his own, usually based on focus and reaction. In his own words, awareness is victory. And the scoreboard proves it.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Heroes Wanted: Dice Promo Card
description: You’ll have to roll with the punches when you go to the mattresses with this villain! Featuring a random die roll element to his attacks, Dice is a promo Villain A card offered through the Dice Tower Season 11 2015 Kickstarter campaign. It will also be available at conventions later in 2015.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Archon: Glory & Machination – BGG Mini Expansion
description:
This mini expansion includes:

2 x alternative ability tiles for the House of Arts.
2 x alternative ability tiles for the Laboratory.
2 x alternative artwork card for Mechant.
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Sexy Red Flags: A Seductive Expansion to Red Flags
description:
Sexy Red Flags adds 75 sexually explicit, but definitely desirable perks to your game.

Here are some heavily censored examples:
Always brings a friend to bed.
Having [CENSORED] with them is equivalent to eight hours of sleep.
[CENSORED] can grow or tighten at will.

This deck isn’t for the prudish or easily offended. We apologize in advance for the awkward situations you're about to put your friends in.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: The AADA Duel Circuit: L'Outrance – A Car Wars Supplement
description:
Welcome to the heartland of Autoduel America -- the L'Outrance Duel Circuit! Blaze your way through the toughest arenas in Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Ohio and Wisconsin!

Featuring:


14 action-packed arenas, 5 track layouts and a double-sided 22" x 44" map for your added dueling pleasure.



Advice on running your own AADA Annual circuit. Duel your way to the top in a rags to riches odyssey -- or play rough with the professionals in Corporate Car Wars! Learn how the pros are listed in the annual AADA Duellist Handbook -- and earn the right to include your name, too!



All the racing schedules and track restrictions you need to run a complete campaign in one of the AADA's deadliest circuits. You can become an Ace on the L'Outrance Circuit, but be sure your Gold Cross is paid in full...


Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Racing

name: Stratego Legends: Celestial Vengeance
description:
Expansion set for Stratego Legends that adds a 30 piece army (beige side), 2 new boards, and 12 (of the 30) new characters.

Expands:

Stratego Legends
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Wrong Chemistry: Expand Your Lab
description:
In Wrong Chemistry, players want to collect as many points as they can by forming molecules based on the cards they draw. The expansion Wrong Chemistry: Expand Your Lab adds to the action of the base game, first by allowing for play with up to five players, and second by adding new element cards that expand upon the tactics of the base game by giving you new ways to earn points and by using both sides of the hex tiles.

In addition, new scientists have been added to the game; each player chooses one at the start of play and can use the power of this scientist up to three times during the game. Two new cards – "The Element of Surprise" and "Transmutium" – can be played in combination with the scientists to let you play during your rivals' turns.

Finally, five new cards – each worth 5 points – are placed face up on the table, waiting to be claimed by any player who can form these difficult combinations. As soon as the final card is claimed, the game ends – but the game can end in other ways as well as you'll discover during the game!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board
publishers: Enigma (Bergsala Enigma), Lex Games, MAGE Company

name: Ca$h 'n Guns (Second Edition): The Fast Gun
description:
Ca$h 'n Guns (second edition): The Fast Gun is a new character card for use with the Ca$h 'n Guns (second edition) base game.

Special ability: After the Courage phase, you will resolve your Bullet card before any player. If your target didn't lie down and you played a Bang!, the targeted player lays their Character down, take a wound and discards their card face down. They will not shoot this turn and will not take part in the sharing of the loot. Reveal the remaining cards afterwards.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mafia, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: King of New York: Force of Unnature
description:
If you roll 4 of a kind, gain 1 (star) in addition to their effect, +1 (star) for each additional identical die.

Part of the King of Tokyo series.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination
publishers: Egmont Polska, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, IELLO Games, Reflexshop

name: Eclipse: The Galactic North
description:
Holiday Special 2014

Breakthrough in the Wormhole Stasis Travel Stabilization technology has opened up the possibility to travel to the dark and cold distance of the Galactic North -- a system where even time itself is frozen, but which brings power and glory for the worthy. The journey to the Galactic North is a very long one, but the sooner you arrive, the greater the benefit...

Eclipse: The Galactic North is a print and play expansion. It adds Galactic North Bonus Tiles where the players' Ships can move to gain VP.
categories: Civilization, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Jolly Jumbo D6
description:
Munchkin: Jolly Jumbo D6 is an expansion for any of the numerous Munchkin games and it comes in two colors: red and green. The packs include a 25mm die (colored red or green respectively) and four new cards (two Doors and two Treasures, with different cards in each pack). In addition, a special rule is written on the card stock backing of the package. See the publisher's note about this card stock rule before opening the package.

Note that the publisher has released several additional variants of the Jolly Jumbo d6, in various color schemes. These dice do not come in a package, have no special rules, and do not include any cards. They aren't available through standard retail channels and must be purchased directly from Warehouse 23, the Steve Jackson Games online store. For the purposes of BGG versions and collection tracking, these dice lacking rules and cards are mere accessories and should not be listed with this entry.

See the individual board game versions for a description of the cards and special rules.

Part of the Munchkin series
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: LUNA Capital: Promo 1 – Special Sponsor Tiles
description:
This Promo contains four new Sponsor Tiles for LUNA Capital.: Royal Space Cruise, Astro Burger, Luna Taxis, Moon PAradise Real Estate.

The companies investing in the LUNA Capital project are hard hitters at the top of the game and are willing to do anything to take home the prize.

If you decide to use these Special Sponsor tiles, then at the beginning of the game you will take the Sponsor cards, place them face down, and mix them up. After shuffling them, distribute them randomly to the players and each takes the matching Special Sponsor tile. Each player must put their Sponsor tile on their Sponsor card. To activate these tiles, when the player chooses a Delivery, they may immediately discard one of the Project tiles they just acquired to immediately use their Special Sponsor tile.

The new special sponsor tiles are:

Moon Paradise Real Estate: This tile is placed on the table next to a Building Site on one of the player’s cards that has already been placed (thereby “enlarging” the settlement). Later, the player may place any Project tile on top of it as though it were an empty site. However, it cannot be moved and no Construction card can be placed on top of it. It does not affect any of the restrictions regarding the placement of cards.

LUNA Taxis: When a player places this tile in their Settlement, they may move one of the Project tiles they have already placed to any other empty site in their Settlement, in accordance with the standard placement rules.

Astroburger: When a player places this tile in their Settlement, they may reserve one of the Project tiles that they have taken this turn by putting it on their Sponsor card. They may then place that tile in their Settlement during any subsequent turn, after choosing their Delivery.

Space Royal Cruise: When a player places this tile in their Settlement, they may choose a Construction card in one of the 4 Deliveries and put it into their hand*. Replace the removed card with the top card from the deck.

*NOTE: The printed rules are translated incorrectly to "and place it at the bottom of the deck".
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Lords of War: Weather and Terrain Expansion Pack
description:
An expansion released off the back of the Lords of War: Templars versus Undead Kickstarter Campaign, this expansion adds no new Units to Lords of War but instead adds two modifier decks to the base game.

The Terrain Deck enables players to build custom battlefields using cards which have a number of effects on the Units placed on top of them. This includes building 'Walls' and 'Gates' which may be destroyed or landscape features such as 'Hills' which increase damage dealt by Ranged Units or 'Marshes' into which Cavalry cannot be placed.

The Weather Deck meanwhile creates dynamic weather conditions, including 'Night' during which players can play two cards instead of one in their turn or 'Mist' which allows Infantry Units to deal more damage.

These decks can be used together or separately, and the expansion also includes a 'Retrieve The Dragon Egg' minigame which operates much like a 'Capture The Flag' mode.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Phase Order

name: L'osti d'jeu: Souvenir
description:
Game description from the publisher (Translated):
Relive your youth. Souvenir is the second expansion for L'osti d'jeu. It makes you relive the best and the worst from the 60's to the 90's in Québec. As a bonus, 10 blank cards to write your own sillyness.

Game description from the publisher (French):

Revivez votre jeunesse! L'extension souvenir est la deuxième extension de L'osti d'jeu. Elle vous fait revivre le meilleur et le pire du Québec des années 60 à 90. En prime, 10 cartes vierges pour écrire vos propres niaiseries.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Flames of War: Cobra
description:
From the Publishers website:

After weeks of battling through impenetrable hedgerows for a few yards of French soil, the US Army has broken out of the beachhead. Operation Cobra has cracked the German front lines.
The veteran 2nd ‘Hell On Wheels’ Armored Division smashes through German divisions still flattened by the bombing. Beside them the 3rd ‘Spearhead’ Armored Division races into the disorganized rear of broken German formations. Everywhere American task forces roll down roads, opposition crumbling before them.
However, not all of the Germans are done with fighting. As the Americans begin to encircle German forces cut off in the Roncey Pocket, the hardened 2. ‘Das Reich’ SS-Panzerdivision strikes south, breaking free of the trap. The two forces clash in the dark, each struggling to accomplish their mission and deny the other side victory. When morning light comes, both sides now know that the fight has only just begun, neither willing to relinquish the field of battle to the other.

INSIDE YOU WILL FIND:
• History of Operation Cobra, the US breakout from Normandy.
• History and complete organisation of the German 12. ‘Hitlerjugend’ SS-Panzerdivision, one of the most well equipped and combat ready divisions in Normandy, and 2. ‘Das Reich’ SS-Panzerdivision, full of tough Eastern Front veterans.
• Options to field Panzer, Panzergrenadier, Panzer-pionier, and Panzerspäh companies.
• History and complete organisation of the US 2nd ‘Hell on Wheels’ Armored Division and 3rd ‘Spearhead’ Armored Division.
• Options to field Tank, Armored Rifle, and Armored Recon companies.
• Exploits of Oberscharführer Ernst Barkmann, one of the greatest tank aces in history, and Staff Sergeant Lafayette Pool, America’s top tank ace.
• Three new linked scenarios.

- - - -

Flames of War current rulebook range

For use with the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game.

Metal Mario's Power-Up (activated by rolling a Lightning Bolt) is: After all other players drop 1 Coin, roll the numbered die, and move again. Follow the rules of that space.

description:

Fortunately for the citizens, the Liberty Patrol is not the only group of superheroes fighting the menaces that keep us vigilant. Here comes The Night Squad!

Guardians' Chronicles: Night Squad, an expansion for Guardians' Chronicles, sets the stage for a new group of heroes to take their turn in the pursuit of Doktor Skarov. With this expansion, you can control new characters with new powers and unique combat styles!

name: Napoleon at Waterloo: Advanced Game Expansion Kit
description:
An expansion Kit for SPI's introductory game Napoleon at Waterloo.

From the rules introduction:

"This game is an escalation of the basic game into more complex rules and game procedures, which represent more realistic detail, though both games are equally valid in results. The real purpose behind behind this greater complexity is to more accurately reflect the influences affecting command decisions, by presenting the complexity of tactical detail facing the original commanders."

The Kit consists of a set of expansion rules and new counters.

Most of the rules of the original basic game continue to apply in the advanced game. The mapsheet remains the same (and is not included with the expansion kit), although terrain effects are changed. The unit counters are more numerous, since brigades are the basic level of combat units, rather than divisions as in the basic game.

Changes to the basic rules include:


Artillery may only attack by means of bombardment and all artillery attacks are resolved separately from other combats. All Artillery attacks are resolved before other (non-artillery) attacks.
Zones of Control are "sticky" (not "rigid" as in the basic game).
Stacking of units is allowed.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Glorantha: The Gods War – Cosmic Monsters
description:
Cosmic Monsters spawn once the great compromise is triggered. Leviathan and Androgeus generate victory points for players in their areas but never attack. At the end of each turn though the leviathan will travel the map and start eating units. Androgeus runs around the map spawning units for different players. The Juggernaut rolls around the board pulling units with it.

Contents: 3 Huge Miniatures
3 Cosmic Monster Loyalty cards
3 Cosmic Monster Gift Cards

During the Kickstarter campaign this was Glorantha: The Gods War – Monsters, but during production it was split into 3 separate boxes due to size constraints: Glorantha: The Gods War – Dragons, Glorantha: The Gods War – Chaos Monsters, and Cosmic Monsters.

One Dragon is placed on the map at the start of the game. One Chaos Monster is placed on the map when the Chaos Rift Opens. One Cosmic Monster is placed on the map when the great compromise first triggers.

description: Two new and growing kingdoms have recently been discovered in the land of the Fables, and now with Upon a Fable: New Kingdoms up to 7-8 players can explore the fairy tale Realms in a single game of Upon a Fable. In addition to the two extra Story Boards, two Realm Boards, and dozens of Fable and Wonder tokens in this expansion, you’ll also find over 100 new game cards, including two new card types: Enchantment cards that allow you to disrupt your opponents’ strategies while defending your own, and Ever After cards that mimic Story Board spaces and earn you Magic Wonders each round.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Command Tokens Resource
description:
The Command Tokens set is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "The Battle of Chin'toka," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, The Dominion War. It is considered a Resource.

Resource:

Beginning with Month 2 of the Dominion War Organized Play Event, "The Battle of Chin'toka," each player may equip their fleet with exactly 1 Resource. The Squadron Point Costs for Resources are located on the Resource Reference Cards. Players may choose from among any available Resources for the Dominion War Storyline OP, but cannot change Resources between Battle Rounds.



The Command Tokens set allows a player to choose 5 tokens from a set of 10 and place them on the token bar. Once each round, that player may use the ability of 1 Command Token and flip it over, not to be used again during that battle. Each token allows the player to either take one of several free actions (Evade, Battlestations, Scan, or Target Lock), re-roll attack or defense dice, add one attack or defense die to their own dice pool, or predetermine the outcome of one attack or defense die in a roll. The Command Tokens set may be added to a squadron for 5 Squadron Points.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Round House: 1st Expansion – Additional Tiles
description:
This expansion provides 4 kinds of new tile.


Pirate Smuggling Tiles


During game setting, choose place side A or side B of this tile facing upward on the game board where the pirate icon is marked. Now when executing the pirate smuggling action you will have the additional choice of executing the promo main action.


Expert Card Discard Pile Tile


During game setting, place the expert card discard pile promo tile beside the expert card deck. Draw 5 expert cards and place face up on the tile to make the expert card discard pile. When executing hiring expert action, player may choose to hire action from the top of the discard pile.When end of game scoring, sort the cards in the discard pile according the type (Phoenix, Tiger, Horse) and calculate the numbers, for every remaining card of the same type that player has, receive honor points equal to the number of cards of the same type in the discard pile.


Bao-Chao Banknote Tile


Game Accessory: Bao-Chao Banknote, the front have a value of 5 coins, the back is bonus points calculated the end of the game.
During game setting, place Bao-Chao Banknote face up in the coin supply.Anytime when a player receives 5 coins or more, player can choose take a Bao-Chao bank note instead of 5 coins. Player must immediately decide to flip to the back side for scoring and place below the player board. Flipped tiles cannot be used as 5 coins.
1.Receive 2 honor points for every 3 coins
2.Receive 2 honor points for every gold
3.Receive 2 honor points for every 2 basic resource of any kind.


Calculation goods Tile


Player can calculate the quantity of goods more.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Transport Hub
description:
The Transport Base is a single tile supplement for for Neuroshima Hex! 3.0. It was given away, with rules only in Polish, to participants at a Neuroshima Hex tournaments. This is a unique tile and the only way to obtain it is to participate in tournaments.

The Transport Base belongs to every army at the same time and is treated by every player as their own: it doesn't block the line of fire, it can be moved by an own Move tile, own Modules can be connected to it, it cannot be damaged (except with Bomb, which is also damaging own units), it cannot be pushed away, netted, taken over etc.
If it gets destroyed, the it is removed from the game.
It is placed on the board at the beginning of the game - at the beginning of the game, before placing HQs, this tile is placed on any hex on the board except edge hexes and the center of the map.

Transport Base is a module common for every player. Every unit connected with Transport Base can make an additional move and/or turn in identical way as it would have a Mobility ability. Unit can even make such a move, after which it would not be adjecent to Transport Base. Transport Base cannot move itself.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Klingon Ship Recognition Manual
description:
The Klingon Ship Recognition Manual expands on the ships types seen in the base game Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator, adding new variants for almost every Klingon ship in that product, as well as adding a number of new fighters, ships, and bases.

As with the base Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator itself, this is ostensibly an "expansion" for the Role Playing game, in that it provides more data than just the combat element requires. 3-dimension views are provided for all craft, along with extensive historical notes and background. The cover of this 48-page product features a cutaway of the Klingon D-20 'Deathrite' cruiser.

Indicating the clear tie to the wargame, the last page presents a sheet of counters that you can photocopy and mount on cardboard for use with the tactical game.

Expands

Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator

description: Want to raise the stakes? The novel, Dance of the Damned, introduces a mythos card of the same name that begins in play, presenting a persistent challenge for investigators. Like a ticking time bomb, the Dance of the Damned is ever increasing in power, growing stronger every time an investigator spends a Clue token or resolves a Headline mythos card. If the team can meet its lofty requirements in time, they can forever seal an inter-dimensional gate... but if they dawdle too long, a grim curse will fall upon them.
