description:
You are so marvelous.
If I could, I would give you 5 stars.
I would grind you up
into a paste.
I would put that paste on a hoagie
and take slow, thoughtful bites.
I would relish you
as a submarine sandwich.
Because you're great
and you backed our Kickstarter.
You made our game a reality.
Thank you

P.S. Inside this sleeve is your very own Exclusive Backer Card. You can use it in place of the Bear Heads in the game, or use it to add an extra player.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: 6 nimmt!: Luggage Promo Card
description:
Spielbox Add-on 4/2014

The "suitcase with hot goods"
This special card in celebration of the 20th anniversary is a throwback to the very first prototype in which there were cards with regular and "hot" goods. The ownership of "hot goods" had to be avoided, and if you had any, you had to get rid of them quickly. More than 20 years ago, with suitcases full of such "hot goods", Wolfgang Kramer went on a trip to the publishers and presented his game. In April 1993, that journey ended at AMIGO...

Preparation
Before dealing, shuffle the card into the top 20 cards of the deck.
If you draw it, place it face up in front of you and redraw from the deck.

Gameplay
The next time you're forced to take a row, pass the card to the player on your left, who now places it face up in front of himself. Continue doing this until the game ends.
At the end of the game, the card scores 10 negative points for the player who has it.
Exception: If that player managed to end the game without having to take a card/row, he/she was a successful smuggler and is rewarded with 10 positive points instead.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Number
publishers: AMIGO, PaperGames (III), W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Chaostle: Melee Expansion Set
description:
The Chaostle Melee expansion introduces eight new characters including the Dragon Maiden with the ability to summons the powerful red dragon to aid her in battle, and the Centaur that can allow another character to ride along on its back. Other characters include the Ogre, Gargoyle, Prince, Warrior, Ghoul, and Enchantress.

Besides the eight new characters, the expansion allows the castle card to attack back. Of course, you will be able to purchase some siege weapons on your player card to take care of that problem. You could also purchase some health and movement potions for your characters from the merchant if needed. In addition, collect Magic and Summons cards to boost your forces or cast spells on your opponents (even on their turns).

As a bonus, the expansion includes a solitaire version of the game as chapter 3 entitled "Black Stones". This version utilizes clips to connect the castle pieces into different configurations.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Pyramid Arcade: Sandships
description:
Sandships was initially offered as the Looney Christmas surprise for 2016; however, it also has pricing for individual sale.

Description from the packaging:
Set a thousand centuries ago on Mars, Sandships is a conquest game by Andrew Looney. It was designed to be an add-on to Pyramid Arcade, but can be played with any Looney Pyramids and some six-sided dice.

RULES

The goal is to control three cities (circular spaces on board [but not including one's home city]) by arranging a stack of one's pyramids whose pip count is higher than every other players' stack (including dead ones) on that space.

SET UP: Each player gets three trios of pyramids, one color to a player, and pick which corner space to place their starting stack (called a spire, in tree formation) on. Spare pyramids are kept in a bank next to the player. Black pyramids are used to represent dead cities: unused spaces during set up and the remaining spires of players removed from the game. In a four-player game, the central space is a dead city (with its own spire). In two- and three-player games two opposing corners are dead cities.

PLAY: On one's turn roll the three dice and perform the three actions in any order. The options are: Transform: take a piece from one's spire and turn it into a sandship by placing it on its side in a city's port (triangular notch in circle); or, turn or add a sandship into a spire of yours in another city. Build: add a piece (using the smallest pieces first) to your home spire. Unfurl: replace a sandship with the next largest piece. Move: move a sandship to another port, either in the same city, or travel to a port of another city in the same zone. If there is already a sandship there of a smaller size it can be pushed to the next port in that city. Zap: remove a smaller piece from another player's spire using your sandship docked in that city. Wild: choose any of the other actions to perform. If you roll two-of-kind, one is treated as wild. If three-of-kind, two become wild with a bonus wild action. If an action cannot be performed treat the roll as wild.

If a player's home spire is completely zapped away all that player's sandships are removed and any of that person's spires in other cities are replaced with black pyramids.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Territory Building

name: Adventure Time Card Wars: For The Glory! Booster Pack
description:
Adventure Time Card Wars: For The Glory! contains expansion cards for both Adventure Time Card Wars: Finn vs. Jake and Adventure Time Card Wars: BMO vs. Lady Rainicorn, with the cards coming in randomly packaged booster packs of nine cards.

For The Glory! includes cards to improve every landscape type — including the Nicelands, which will be released in a later set — as well as cards that let you use your opponent's landscapes to your advantage and cards that promote the use of multiple landscape types in a single deck.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Goblin's Lair
description:
The second adventure pack expansion to the base board game of "New Easy to Master Dungeons and Dragons". The world of the base game and the expansions is called Thunder Rift. There were 3 expansions created for the base game. Dungeons & Dragons: The Dragon's Den , Dungeons & Dragons: The Haunted Tower, Goblin's Lair . A dungeon crawl and monster bashing adventure for beginners.

Players are pitted against the Goblin King and his three armies during his bid to conquer Thunder Rift.

The expansion includes 3 16 page adventure booklets, 3 full color fold up maps, 1d6 and d10, new counters, new floor tiles to enhance the maps, and more character stand-ups. The three adventures can be played separately or as a series of connected adventures.

Expands

The New Easy to Master Dungeons & Dragons
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Piraten kapern: Sonderkarten
description:
A mini-expansion for Piraten Kapern, released in a promo pack at the "Stadt, Land, Spielt"-Event in Germany and Austria.

This blister contains two sorts of special cards which can be added to the game. Each special card is available 4 times.

The function of the first special card, called "Nach dem Sturm" ("After the storm!), is: You are allowed to roll any amount of dice just 2 times. You are still not allowed to reroll any skulls, but even with more than 3 skulls on first roll, you are allowed to reroll. You are not allowed to go to Skull Island and only receive points for each diamond and each gold coin, but twice the amount.

The second card is "Frieden" ("Peace"): You have to end your turn without any sabre. If you succeed, you get double the points, else you get -1000 points for each sabre, you had rolled and no points for your other rolls. You are allowed to go to Skull Island, but even there you are not allowed to roll sabres.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: A Book of Sandhurst Wargames
description:
An large format book, measuring '9-3/4'-inches by '13-1/2'-inches with a slick-coated front & back cover. It has a general background article regarding gaming going on at the time of its publication (1982). There are extensive background materials related to the enclosed games. 64 pages, including rules for the various games contained within:


Aquitane - the Black Prince (a.k.a. Edward) goes on a war ride through France circa 1355~1356.
Craonne - a Napoleonic game of a Battle against the Russians in 1814.
Fjord - a Campaign level game of Arctic Convoys during WW-2.
Men Against Fire - a role-playing sort of game set in the WW-2 Pacific Theatre.


The game pack contains: 4 game boards and 4 printed sheets of playing aids (32 battle features; 476 die-cut counters; 16 playing cards; 3 personal aiming sheets)

The Arcane Bakery received a package of 3 new recipes using ingredients we haven't seen before. For some added bite, try the Sharkuterie! For a suprise, try the Pinata Bomb! And if you are watching what you eat, maybe you'll want the Omen Biscotti!

1 Pinata Bomb recipe card
1 Sharkuterie recipe card

description: Lady Werewolf's Revenge is an expansion for Lupus in Tabula, dV Giochi's version of the popular party game Werewolf, that adds new roles and other elements to the base game. Components include ten new special characters, a werewolf and two villagers, seven wicked Auras and seven innocent Auras, the zombie Baron Samedi, Hamlet's skull, the "Picture of Dorian Wolf", Dr. Jekyll's potion, and a werewolf's claw.

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Aspirations of Ascension Asylum Pack
description:
Aspirations of Ascension is the fourth Asylum Pack in the Rituals of the Order cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. Lucy is able to complete her assignment, but in the process, she learns some forbidden knowledge and is captured.

Aspirations of Ascension is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

This is not a stand-alone deck; you must have additional Call of Cthulhu LCG cards to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Black Knight (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
A print and play scenario for T.I.M.E Stories:

The Black Knight satellite has been orbiting the Earth for years. Recent events and new information has convinced the government that it is time to bring it down for study. Safely tucked away at Edwards Air Force Base (more commonly known as Area 51), they try to unlock its secrets - but there are some problems ...

BEFORE YOU PRINT (a note from the designer):

This is a long scenario, 208 cards. I tried a smaller size to save ink and paper, but it didn't work with a couple different scenes.

After several conversations with other players, I would like to emphasize this point: There are several extremely difficult codes and puzzles. The puzzles are not technically needed to win, but solving them will help immensely. You will also miss part of the story if they aren't solved. If you are intent on solving them then plan on spending just as much time on the codes/puzzles as actually playing the game. Also, I have not offered any hints or clues on the forums. This scenario was created to be hard.

You will need a device with a QR reader.

There is no time loop--it's do or die.

There is no combat. Challenges, yes; combat, no.

It is playable with 2, 3, or 4 players (it will even work solo, except for one card that is not totally necessary).

It is hard, but family-friendly in all other ways.

It is long, and there is no good stopping point. Be prepared to use the save option in the box, finish in one long session, or have a table where it can be left out.

Some duplex printers work better than others. You may want to try hand feeding paper for better alignment. A tedious job, but it often helps.

Please be sure your printer is set to 100% not "scale to fit." If the cards appear too small this is likely the problem.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pay Dirt: The Last Frontier Mini Expansion
description:
The Alien Frontiers Themed Mini-Expansion takes your Pay Dirt to another level!

This expansion takes inspiration from the designer of Pay Dirt's other game; Alien Frontier and add this to new a deck of new Equipment and Personnel cards.

Stretch reward from the Kickstarter campaign.

name: Arcane Bakery Clash: Boss Bake-Off
description:
A 3-Card Solo Expansion for Arcane Bakery Clash.

SETUP
Select a Gaius card and place it face up. Take the other two cards and play them face down, tucked under Gaius in any configuration you like.

Remove the Cheesequake card. Shuffle the remaining recipe cards and remove a number of cards based on the left boss card. They will not be used.

HOW TO PLAY
Play using the standard game rules, adding any rules listed under Curse.
After your turn, Gaius will take a turn. Roll the die and if the number matches one of the Gaius' actions, take the action.
If Gaius is reduced to 0 energy, you win! If you are reduced to 0 energy, Gaius wins!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: BattleTech Tactical Handbook
description:
From the back of the book

The BattleTech Tactical Handbook is an advanced-rules supplement for the BattleTech game universe. The Handbook provides advanced rules and equipment that enable players to add new depth and intensity to their games. Guidelines for creating long-term campaigns and double-blind games, formulas for calculating the combat values of all BattleTech combat units, detailed descriptions of advanced weapon systems and more make the BattleTech Handbook a necessity for the serious BattleTech player.

description: Coney Island: Giant Wheel, a promotional postcard for Coney Island first available at Spiel 2011, replaces one of the two existing Grand attraction tiles of size four.

name: Prawo Dżungli: dodatek
description:
Did you feel you were the monkey king? Remember that in the jungle everthing changes like in a kaleidoscope...

"Prawo Dżungli - dodatek" is translated to "Jungle Law - expansion". Unlike the base game, this is not an unauthorized production. The graphics and the mechanics are unique.

Prawo Dżungli - dodatek adds 80 new cards which provide one new color (pink), 8 new symbols and 3 new special cards. The special cards are:
a) "different colors, different symbols" - when this card shows up each player who has a card which has unique color and shape has to grab the sceptre
b) "second hand" - when this card is face up every player has to play with his second hand
c) "cards switch" - the player who grab the sceptre first may switch his face up cards with any other player
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Llamagedón: 2da edición
description:
Houston, we have a problem! Meteors incoming! In this card game you will have to save your llamas from the Apocalypse, use the shelters and destroy those of your opponent. The definitive Peruvian game for lovers of llamas and meteorites.

The second edition includes the Safe Zone expansion!

Llamagedón is a light, slightly strategic card game that combines mechanics such as hand management, take that and set collection. On their turn, a player draws a card from the deck. If they draw a Shelter card, then they have to play it immediately by placing it down. Shelters can also be built by combining resources. Beside playing shelters or building them, a player can use one action card which might involve attacking or stealing shelters, swapping one card for another, skipping the next player's turn, protecting their shelter, drawing two cards from the deck or even canceling the action of another player.

Eventually, a player will draw the Llamagedón card from the deck (which was randomly shuffled into the lower half of the deck) and this means everyone gets another two turns. After that, whoever has the most shelters is the winner.

With the expansion Llamagedon: Safe Zone, the goal will no longer be the player who ends the game with the most shelters, but rather the player who ends the game with the most Safe Zones under their Control.

The game consists of 55 game cards for the base game, and 6 Safe Zone cards plus 50 tokens in 5 different colors of the expansion. All the content is bi-lingual (Spanish and English).

If you like llamas, meteors and sheep, then Llamagedón might be a good fit for you.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Animals, Card Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That
publishers: Endemic Games, Salta Pal Lao, Valor Mountain Games

name: Netherlands (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks (though there some 'lucky' cards in with the Tourist cards which offer this facility) - but you can travel by air, BNG express or Rotterdam light railway for extra advantage.

There are many new options in the rules: run 2 routes into 1, exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Resident Evil Deck Building Game: George Hamilton & Jim Chapman Promo
description:
George Hamilton & Jim Chapman Promo will be available with Nightmare expansion.

George Hamilton

Level 1 (2): During your turn, you can trash a card with "Herb" in its name from your hand. If it was a green herb, you get +1 Action this turn. If it was a red herb, you get +1 Explore this turn.

Level 2 (6): At the beginning of your turn, you can reveal X cards with "Herb" in its name from your hand. In that case, you get +X number of cards.

Jim Chapman

Level 1 (3): When Jim Explores, you can flip a coin. If heads, 1 weapon Jim uses this turn deal double Damage this turn. If tails, Jim takes 10 Damage.

Level 2(7): During your turn, when an infected is reveled, you can gain 2x "Ammox10". In that case, move all Reveled Infected to the bottom of the Mansion
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme, Zombies

name: Villages: Distant Lands
description:
From publisher blurb:



It's time to explore!You've conquered the known world. Now it's time to explore! Send 9 all-new units into the great unknown in order to claim even more land for your kingdom. Use the sneaky Scout to take a peek at your opponent's cards, protect your Kings and Princesses with the handsome Prince, and stage a revolution with the unassuming Peasant.

This expansion also introduces the Distant Lands locations deck. As you begin each round, draw one of these cards to discover a new place for you and your rivals to fight over. Each new land has its own special properties that change the rules of the game. For example, Rogue's Retreat lets hired units escape to the discard pile, while the Peasants at Revolt Volcano begin their uprising before you even start to play.

Each deck of Villages: Distant Lands includes 48 standard cards, 12 location cards, and a sheet of rules.

name: Bruxelles 1897: Leopold II Promo
description:
Leopold II promo is a new Noble card.

During setup, add the Leopold II card to the pile of Noble cards and shuffle the pile.

Leopold II activates just like any other Noble, through the Influence or City Hall actions.

Effect: copy the effect of an opponent's Noble card (tap this card if it isn't already). Then give Leopold II to this player.

Note: unlike other Noble cards, Leopold II is never tapped which means he can be activated several times in a single round.

You may not discard Leopold.

—description from the publisher

Leopold II. von Sachsen-Coburg und Gotha

Regeln für die Karte Leopold II.:
Fügt die Karte beim Spielaufbau zu den anderen Mäzenen hinzu. Für Leopold gelten bis auf zwei Ausnahmen die gleichen Regeln wie für die anderen Mäzene, auch er wird durch die Rathaus-Aktion aktiviert.
Effekt: Leopold nutzt (kopiert) die Aktion eines Mäzens, der vor einem anderen Spieler ausliegt (egal ob dieser gedreht ist oder nicht). Drehe den so genutzen Mäzen um 90°, falls er nicht ohnehin schon gedreht war. Dann gib Leopold diesem Spieler.
Ausnahmen: Man muss Leopold II. behalten, man kann ihn nicht abwerfen. Dreht Leopold nicht um 90°, wenn ihr ihn aktiviert; er kann in der gleichen Runde mehrfach aktiviert werden.

description:
"I'm lost."

Straight out of legend, the one and only Minotaur from the Final Labyrinth has joined the ranks of Kaosball. His ability to make the field more like his native dungeon will devastate any opponent unlucky enough to face him.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports

name: Antidote: Lab Alliance
description:
Description from the publisher:

“DANGER, DANGER!” The unwavering emergency voice on the loudspeaker reminds you again-and-again of the deadly airborne toxin contaminating your lab. If you’re going to survive, you’ll need to find the antidote…fast. The flash of the warning lights gives you just enough visibility to find your teammates and compare notes about what the antidote could be, but you suddenly realize there may not be enough of the antidote for all of you. Will you be willing to give-up your dose so your teammates can live?

Antidote: Lab Alliance expands the world of Antidote with five new ways to play including support for up to nine players, team-play, new turn actions and special cards, and sinister new Lab Romance characters.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Duel in the Dark: Skilled Gun Crew
description:
As the war progressed, medals were awarded to gun crews who excelled in shooting down Allied aircraft. The "Skilled Gun Crew" marker represents an experienced flak crew.

Skilled Gun Crew markers are awarded for scoring victory points against a bomber crew in a single hex (3VP for a Silver marker, 4VP for a Gold marker). These markers can be placed on a subsequent turn; the markers count as flak and their placement overrides the maximum 40 ground defense unit limit in the basic game.

Expands:

Duel in the Dark
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Great War at Sea: Zeppelins
description:
For a brief period, Ferdinand Graf Zeppelin's giant gas-filled airships ruled the world's skies. Though conceived as passenger craft, during the First World War rigid and semi-rigid airships performed long-range scouting and bombing missions.

Great War at Sea: Zeppelins includes die-cut-and-mounted playing pieces, but these are special, oversized ones: 2/3-inch by 1-and-1/3-inch large pieces depicting famous airships of Germany, Great Britain, the United States, Italy, Austria-Hungary and France. These are used with the new tactical and operational rules provided; unlike the standard game rules that treat all airships the same, with the Zeppelins module, each airship class has its own range and endurance qualities.

Every airship that played an important role in the First World War is present, both German Navy and German Army machines that scouted for the High Seas Fleet and attacked naval targets. The ultra-long-range "Africa Ship" L59 is present, along with the big, modern L100 class canceled by the war's end.

The Royal Navy maintained a large fleet of airships, and the British get the Italian-built semi-rigid airship SR-1 along with the many rigid airships built at war's end. Italy built a large number of semi-rigid airships (with a solid keel rather than a complete frame as with a true zeppelin) and these are also included.

The United States Navy gets its Shenandoah and Los Angeles, and the United States Army the big semi-rigid airship Roma. The French Dixmude, a former German zeppelin, is here as are Austria-Hungary's small contingent.

New airship-centered scenarios, or modifications of current scenarios, are included for many of the Great War at Sea series games: Mediterranean, Jutland, U.S. Navy Plan Gold, U.S. Navy Plan Red and Dreadnoughts.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

This year for Black Friday, we taught a computer how to write Cards Against Humanity cards. Now we put it to the test. Over the next 16 hours, our writers will battle this powerful card-writing algorithm to see who can write the most popular new pack of cards. If the writers win, they’ll get a $5,000 holiday bonus. If the A.I. wins, we’ll fire the writers.

The A.I. Pack consists of 30 cards actually written by a machine learning algorithm trained on our brainstorming documents.

—description from the publisher (from Black Friday, 29th November 2019)

name: Dungeon Twister: Purple Dragon
description:
Purple Dragon is a mini-expansion for the Dungeon Twister series of games. The character comes in blue and orange colors.

For 2 AP's (plus a song) the Purple Dragon (stats: 2/6) can invoke an acid rain to destroy all portcullis in a room. The Dragon is worth 2 VP when destroyed.

The expansion was given out at the 2006 Essen fair.

Dungeon Twister

Get out of my room, NOW!

This expansion is all about sharing your love (or hate) with your annoying siblings. Tidy up that spare guest room because this expansion takes Garbage Day to 6 players.

Includes 15 new cards!

description:

5 trains of type 3T (phase 3).
3 trains of type U3 (phase 3).
2 trains of type 4T (phase 4).
3 trains of type 2+2 (phase 4).

description:
Corto: The Secrets of Venice takes players into the maze-like boroughs of Venice. There, we will experience the mystery that surrounds the city, meet its surprising characters, and discover its secret hiding places filled with treasure.

This expansion includes a new adventure that can be played along with any of the adventures from the base game, thus enabling new game configurations.

name: Historia: Path of Destiny Expansion
description:
In Historia, the players guide their civilization through 12,000 years of human history, from the first sparks up to the development of Singularity. Civilizations discover new technology and expand over the planet; they trade with more developed neighbors to import new technologies or exploit the land to have more power for future actions. Civilizations develop their military and wage wars with each other. They build wonders to make their civilization stand above others and to eventually attract tourists and newcomers to their land to follow their leaders and use their national advisors.

The greatest nations have been led by Leaders and wise Advisors able to choose and influence the Destiny of their nation.

In the Destiny Expansion, there are 16 Destiny tokens, with walls or arrows symbols, to place on the development matrix. A wall will prevent an improvement way on the matrix, while an arrow will facilitate the movement allowing to the player token to jump a space in a predeterminated direction.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Spirits of the Forest: Arctic Wolf
description:
The rarest of them all. These two Spirit tiles introduce a new mechanism that consist in pushing columns, that completely change the way you play the game.

The two Arctic Wolf tiles will introduce a pushing mechanism in Spirits of the Forest. These tiles will replace two random tiles from the forest that will be put aside. When one of the Arctic Wolf tiles becomes available, the active player can take it for free and use it to push up or push down any column in the forest by one tile.

One or more tiles that were locked will become available, and the Arctic Wolf will be back in the forest available for someone else to use.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – R.I.S. Vo Expansion Pack
description:
The RIS Vo was a Theta-class Romulan scout starship in service of the Romulan Star Empire's Star Navy in the 24th century.

In 2366, the Vo was stolen by Admiral Alidar Jarok and used to flee to Federation space. After being rescued by the crew of the USS Enterprise-D, Admiral Jarok scuttled the ship to prevent it from being captured.

description:

description:
Promo card that was first available during the Kickstarter campaign for Vault Wars.

The card says:
Artifact
Before storage fees: Discard 1 non-junk item and equip Cursed Idol to another player. That player may not use this ability this round.
After storage fees: Gain 1 [corruption icon]
categories: Card Game, Fantasy

name: Midevil II: Castle Chaos
description:
Well, it wasn't as easy as you expected. You were told that the only way to get back to the present was to go to the graveyard, find the Necronomicon and take it to the altar. Yeah, right! Now they want you to bring it back here! Of course, you do get to kick some Skeleton butt on the way and that's always fun!

Part of the MidEvil/Zombies!!! series

Expands:

MidEvil
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures

name: Dschingis Bohn
description:
In Dschingis Bohn (Genghis Bean), Bohnaparte gets some serious competition. The Mongols overrun the Bohnreich and provide for new tactical challenges.

Hanno Girke's new Bohnanza expansion is suitable for 3-5 players. The Bohnanza base game is needed. By combining Dschingis Bohn with Bohnaparte up to 7 players can fight over the Bohnreich.

Dschingis Bohn is part of the Bohnanza family of games.

Expands

Bohnanza

name: Garbage Day: Office Expansion
description:
Synergy! Delegate! Buzzwords!

This expansion is all about decreasing that workload so you can enjoy that nice corner office. Also, take on a new employee as this expansion takes "Garbage Day" up to 6 players.

Includes 15 new cards!
categories: Action / Dexterity

name: Chez Geek: House Party edition
description:
In this light, humorous, and fast-paced card game that parodies geek culture and co-habitation, players are roommates just trying to get through life with as little work as possible.

At setup each player is dealt a Job card which lists their free time, income, a special ability that they possess and their Slack goal. Players are also dealt five Life cards. The space directly in front of a player is their Room, where cards will be played during the course of the game. Slack can be represented using any available chit or counter, but every player begins with a Slack total of zero.

Players take turns as follows:

Draw Life cards until they have six in hand. (NOTE: Some Jobs vary this to five or seven cards.)



Make "variable" rolls. Some Job cards have variable free time or income; their values for this turn are decided in this phase (rolling a 1-3 gives them the first amount; rolling a 4-6 gives them the second). If there are any "uninvited" people in a player's room, he or she may also roll to "get rid of" them (by rolling a 4, 5 or 6) and either send each such person to another room or discard them (if they cannot be played to any other room).



If any of the player's in-hand Life cards are green Person cards, they may roll to "call" the person to their room. A successful roll (3-6) gets them invited in; otherwise, they are discarded. Some people are "uninvited" (causing bad things to happen), and may be placed without a roll in any player's room. (See above for "getting rid of" these people.) Pet cards, such as Cats (which don't require a roll to enter a room) and Dogs (which may or may not need to be "called") can also be played in this round.



For each unit of free time the player's Job card gives them, they may perform one action (play a red Activity card) or go shopping (play any number of blue Thing cards). Some of these cards may have a cost; the total cost for all cards played in a round cannot exceed the income given to them by their Job card. (NOTE: Free Time and Income may be modified by certain Whenever cards played on the player by themselves or other players.)



At the end of a turn, if a player has more than five cards in hand, the player must discard cards until they have five or fewer. If desired, players can discard all the way down to one card. (NOTE: It is also legal for a player to play ALL the cards in their hand and have NO cards at the end of a turn.)



Additionally, some Life cards are orange "Whenever" cards which can be played at any time.



Activity cards and Thing cards typically list a Slack value which is added to the player's Slack total, though some have random Slack totals and some have Slack totals which vary during the game. TV Activity cards and some Whenever cards can be used to cancel cards as they are being played, and some cause previously-played cards to be discarded. Some cards add or subtract Slack from every player's total, while others cause a player to change their Job card (and hence Slack goal). Many cards alter the effects of other cards.


The first player whose Slack total equals or exceeds their Slack goal is the winner.

This edition of Chez Geek from Pegasus Spiele includes both the Chez Geek base game and Chez Geek 2: Blockparty – the Chez Geek sequel from Pegasus that included both of the expansions from Steve Jackson Games: Chez Geek 2: Slack Attack and Chez Geek 3: Block Party.
categories: Card Game
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That, Variable Phase Order
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Pegasus Spiele, Steve Jackson Games

name: 1825 Extension Kit K3: Phase Four
description:
1825 Extension Kit: K3 - Phase Four an expansion for 1825, an 18xx game. It provides tiles and trains to extend the basic game into a fourth phase, may be used with all units and contains:


14 Grey Tiles: 48 (1), 50 (2), 51 (3), 60 (2), 167 (4), 168 (2).
4 Grey/Russet Tiles: 166 (4)
3 trains of type 6.
2 trains of type 7.


Use of 1825: Extension Kit G1 – Supplemental Money is recommended. Ownership of 1825 Unit 1, 1825 Unit 2 or 1825 Unit 3 is required.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains

name: The Agents: MaVericks
description:
The MaVericks is a Kickstarter-exclusive expansion that adds 8 new cards.

The MaVericks will be shuffled into the main Agents deck and will cost both your actions to play from your hand. They will not award IPs to your opponents. Once used, they are placed face-up on the table, for any player to re-activate and use on their turn (again, using up both actions.)
categories: Card Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Looney Tunes Mayhem Extras
description:
This special box features beloved characters such as Porky Pig, Speedy Gonzales, Marvin the Martian, and much more! Enjoy different Toon options and new, exclusive mechanics to bring even more Mayhem to your gameplay!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cat Tower: Kickstarter Edition
description:
Seven Cat Cards are dealt to each player. The game starts with the youngest player.

In clockwise order, each player takes a turn to roll the die, and acts according to the image shown on the die result.

The game ends immediately when one player gets rid of all Cat Cards in hand.

This Kickstarter Edition combines the following in one package:

Cat Tower,
the Cat Tower Lite expansion,
the Cat Tower Plus expansion.


It also contains several Kickstarter exclusives, including:

Extra cats to play with seven players,
Champion Cat,
Boba Tea Cat,
Panda Cat,
Chihuahua,
Maine Coon Cat,
Three other exclusive cats.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game

name: L'osti d'jeu: François Pérusse
description:
The best of Pérusse.

Relive the albums of the people of François Pérusse, from Volume 1 to Volume 10. Have fun with Louis-Paul Fafard-Allard, Bob Hartley, Mona, a "galipeur", "Do not you like clementines?" and all that is heard in the accursed Bread & Fekfest. As a bonus, 10 white cards to write replicas of your favorite sketches.

French description:

Le meilleur de Pérusse.
Revivez les Albums du peuple de François Pérusse, du Tome 1 au Tome 10. Amusez-vous avec les Louis-Paul Fafard-Allard, Bob Hartley, Mona, un galipeur, "T'aimes pas ça les clémentines?" et tout ce qu'on entend dans les maudits Bread & Fekfest. En prime, 10 cartes blanches pour écrire les répliques de vos sketchs préférés.

Contained in L'osti d'jeu des humoristes.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Trek 12: Zen Trek
description:
Trek 12 Zen Trek is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in may 2021.

It consist in a new player board. To access the zenitude you will have to travel a very special route, passing through the river separating the two valleys and reaching the other side without using artifices. You will have to immerse yourself completely in the water without the help of ropes and come out of this journey grown !
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Joking Hazard: Trial by Trolley Exclusives
description: This pack of 20 cards was included as Kickstarter-exclusive promo content for the Trial by Trolley Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Deadlands: Invasion of Slaughter Gulch
description:
Things have gone from bad to worse in Slaughter Gulch.

Our once quiet little town has already been overrun once. Since they discovered the ghost rock there has been a constant struggle for control of the town. Unfortunately, it seems the mining has also attracted something else...Something EVIL!
Deadlands: Invasion of Slaughter Gulch adds new elements to the board game of Weird West fun!
Invasion of Slaughter Gulch adds:
New Monster Event cards
New Encounter cards
New Items
New and expanded rules

And a new card type: Hired Guns

Requires Deadlands: the Battle for Slaughter Gulch to play
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: +6 Bag o' Munchkins
description:
Munchkin pawns are plastic figures of the Munchkin Man in six different colors: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and purple. They were released with Munchkin Quest, then made available for purchase separately. The pawns have a special rule for use in any Munchkin card game:




Any time you are entitled to go up a level – or when you do something that WOULD earn you a level if you weren't already Level 9 – you may, instead, place a Munchkin pawn in front of you. In any combat, you may discard it for a 1d6 bonus. You may only have one in front of you at a time.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Drecksau: Sauschön
description: Drecksau: Sauschön, an expansion for the Drecksau card game, lets players decide how they want to participate in the pig parade, whether with full makeup and styling fit for a beauty pageant or a more traditional wallow in the mud.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: The Agents: Events
description: Things just got real. This new deck is filled with cards that are played during and throughout the turns of the game, introducing unexpected events that force you to think on your feet and be ready for anything. Events make the game unpredictable and volatile. You’ll need all your wits about you to stay ahead when everything around you is shifting.
categories: Card Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Fishing Lessons: Fabled Fish
description:
Leland loved telling tall tales of the ones that got away. It’s time for you to prove that these lost legends are real!

This 4-card expansion adds a legendary fish. One of these cards will be added to the Lake at the start of the day. Whenever the fabled fish card is revealed, its unique ability will have a powerful impact on the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Warhammer 40,000 Expansion: Battle Missions
description: Battle Missions is a supplement for Warhammer 40,000, planned for release in 2010, that expands on the basic missions found in the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook. Each of the thirty three scenarios detailed in Battle Missions has been designed to allow you to fight the sort of battles normally the subject of Black Library novels. From daring raids and assassinations, to breakthroughs and last stands, Battle Missions will allow your army to play in a way that reflects its background.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Mondo: Das Duell
description:
Mondo: Das Duell takes the components from Michael Schacht's Mondo and presents two players with new challenges in a head-to-head duel.

To play, a duel card is revealed that shows the current challenge – most forest, largest desert, largest landscape, etc. – and the player who meets this challenge best while following the standard placement rules for tiles wins the duel card. (Animals and volcanoes are not relevant in this game.) The first player to win two cards wins the game.

Mondo: Das Duell, which consists of ten duel cards and five rule cards, is a giveaway item in German game stores for customers who purchase Mondo.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Munchkin Zombies: Decay d6
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Munchkin Zombies Decay d6 features six custom six-sided acrylic dice previously available only in a limited release. Three of them are swirled pearlescent red with pus-yellow pips; three of them are swirled pearlescent ivory with blood-red pips, and all six feature a Munchkin head in place of the one. You want them so you can kill the monsters and take their stuff!

Munchkin Zombies Decay d6 also includes four exclusive new cards for Munchkin Zombies!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Endangered Orphans of Condyle Cove: Somewhere Down Lexington Drive Booster Pack
description: This booster pack contains 1 Cul-De-Sac card, 6 Acts of Desperation cards, 3 punchboard standees, and 3 bonus cards.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Modular Board, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Spyfall: The Box Is Not Enough
description:
Lately the spy has gotten relaxed. He can easily distinguish a church from a university. He breezes right through all the tricky resident questions. So a new mission that was just received from The Center is very handy: It's time to remind agent number one why it's exciting to be the spy!

The Box Is Not Enough is an expansion for the hit conversational Spyfall game. Mix in six new locations to the base box and catch the spy in a night club, at a hockey game, at the zoo...and even at a board game festival!

•••

Шпион расслабился — он давно отличает церковь от университета и как орешки щелкает все каверзные вопросы резидентов. Так что новая миссия, поступившая из Центра, очень кстати: пора напомнить агенту номер один, что такое настоящие шпионские страсти!

«И целой коробки мало» — дополнение для хитовой разговорной игры «Находка для шпиона». Замешайте 6 новых локаций в базовую коробку и ловите шпиона в ночном клубе и на хоккее, в зоопарке и на… фестивале настольных игр!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Pandoria: Artifacts
description:
As the five realms grow and thrive, you discover the remains of an ancient race that once inhabited Pandoria. The ancient artifacts left behind can be reassembled as magical relics to earn further glory for your realm!

Pandoria Artifacts includes new terrain tiles with the same terrain on both spots and artifacts that players can collect and trade for valuable relics. Once a region with artifacts in it is closed, the player who did so gains all artifacts. Players can also build mountain castles that block an exit path.

This expansion can be played with all versions of the game: beginner, standard, partnership, and family!

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: The Agents: Break the Rules
description:
Screw the rules! Spice up your gameplay with rule-breaking cards that set up new game conditions from the start of the game that make every game different and much more dangerous. This mega-expansion includes 3 different expansions; a new Break-The-Rules deck, Commanders deck and Sites deck.

The Commander Agents are cards that are given to players before the game begins. Each Commander bestows a special benefit to the player who owns it, and each benefit lasts throughout the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Fidelitas: Promo Cards
description:
In Fidelitas, players take on the role of faithful citizens in a medieval city exerting influence in order to gain the credibility needed to lead the charge against the corrupt crown. Players play character cards to various locations that make up the city in order to meet conditions of hidden objectives. Each type of character card is associated with a unique action that manipulates cards in the game; use the Butcher to bully other characters to new locations, use the Student to gain more cards, use the Soldier to keep the peasants from loitering too long.

These nine promo cards include the Candlestick Maker Promo Cards - a new Virtus Card and a new Missio Card; the Barkeep and the Tavern, two new Missio cards; and the Party Pack Promos that include 5 cards - The Bloody Butcher, The Chiselerwith two new versions of The Chiseler and The Herald with art by Jaqcui Davis, as well as The Bloody Butcher, The Chiseler, and The Heralds.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Myth: Kickstarter Exclusive Rewards
description:
This is a set of Kickstarter Exclusive rewards for Myth. These were given out to backers at the "Captain Pledge Level", together with several non-Kickstarter exclusive expansions and the Myth: Twilight Knight Mini Boss. The latter was only given out once per backer, backers could get these Kickstarter Exclusive Rewards multiple times.

This set includes:

Trickster Hero
Torchbearer Follower
Donnchadh Agent
Connor Mini Boss
Razorfiend Mini Boss
Keesi & Og Mini Boss
10 new Story Quests inside a small booklet with a small accompanying token sheet.
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Halloween Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Rather than rot the teeth of your trick-or-treaters this year, why not rot their minds with a Munchkin Halloween Pack? Each of the twenty packs contains four Munchkin cards — with the same four cards in each pack — and a quick explanation of the game. No one has to have a bellyache in the morning!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack
description:
Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack contains more than thirty previously published by James Ernest and Cheapass Games, as well as an essay and game bibliography.


Six Dice-Coin Games: Bogart; Crash; Flip; Dogfight; Pennywise; Road Trip
Six Card Games: Spots; El Paso; Hey, Bartender!; Following Suit; Last Man Standing; Brain Baseball
Three Bluffing Games: Big Dumb Five; The Lost Pueblo of Doctor Green; Candy
Four Board Games (with 3 Boards): Galaxy; The Celebrated Jumping Frog Game; Stumpy the Cave Boy; Tishai
Three Paper (and pencil) Games: Strange Words; WoRDWeRX; Divide and Conquer
Two Group Games: The Con Game; Love and Marriage
Keeping it Simple (a game design article by James Ernest)
Nine Poker Variants: Rosencrantz and Guildenstern; Suck; Girl's Best Friend; Countdown; How Stupid Are You?; Night Baseball of the Living Dead; Frankenstein; Rescue 9-1-1 with Media Crew; River of Blood; The Order of Poker Hands
Ludography (a list of games designed by James Ernest)




Gaming_Industry_Awards31

*2000 [[Origins Award Nominee: Best Abstract Board Game
categories: Card Game

name: Munchkin Quest: Big Box
description:
Kill the monster, grab the treasure, stab your buddy. That's what it's all about. Now, Munchkin has been transformed into a board game...

In Munchkin Quest, you can co-operate with the whole group, adventure with a partner, or strike out on your own. You don't know what's behind a door until you open it...then another tile is added to the dungeon. Battle monsters for power and treasure, or send them after your friends. Reach Level 10, then get out alive if you can!

Munchkin Quest: Big Box includes the original base game as well as Munchkin Quest 2: Looking for Trouble and Munchkin Quest: Portal Kombat.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Bruti: Ciurma
description: The first expansion for the card-game Bruti: hundreds of new cards featuring new sets of characters, weapons and combat moves, plus an improved set of rules featuring new features such as dual-wielding, followers and more.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Homelands
description:
Planeswalker Feroz tried to save this once-beautiful land from cataclysms, but he died in the process. Thousands of years later, the last people of Homelands face war, devastation, and a new vampire legion.

This 1995 expansion features 140 cards and explores the game's setting and initial characters more than any previous expansion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Cthulhu Wars: Cacodemon
description:
The Cacodemon is a Terror, costing 2 Power and 2 Doom to gain for your side. Once gained, if it is killed, it costs 4 Power to re-summon. It has Combat 3, but its real value lies in its Cosmic Terror ability.

Cosmic Terror (ongoing) no faction may move or retreat units into the Cacodemon's area, unless they are accompanied by a Great Old One. This includes movement-like abilities or spellbooks, except for Avatar.

The Cacodemon sculpt is credited to "Tidal 4".
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Kharnage: Guest Pack 1
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Reinforcement Set

A group of reinforcement cards illustrated by guest artists

Donk & Shot - The Orc Errant - Biboun
Undead Viking - The Unbearded Dead - Clem
Queen Mother Viktoria - The Lonesome Widow - Boulet
Abbamama - The Dancing Queen - Paolo Parente
General Delatour - The Rock - Yann
Hezibesanael - The Laying Death - Gobi
Scions - - Gobi
Red Bulk - - Naiade
The Owlbear - - Kovalic
Romauld - The Driller - Djib
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Catan Dice Game XXL Variant
description:
Another variant for the original Catan Dice Game, this one is played with all players on one map. Some rule variation is also involved, since you start with a street and you can build castles along the way which helps left behind players to keep up. Was published in the "Catan News 2008" for the Essen game fair 2008.

NOT to be confused with the "Catan Dice Game Deluxe Edition" which is a repackaging of "Catan Dice Game" and "Les Colons de Catane: Le jeu de dés" with some extras(like a dice cup)!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection

name: Catapult Feud: Hydra! Expansion
description:
Series formerly titled, 'Catapult Kingdoms'.

Ready the catapults! Wait, do you smell smoke? INCOMING FIREBALL!!!

Will your castle walls melt from the Hydra's fiery breath or will you tame the mythical beast and launch fireballs at your opponent's castle?!

Catapult Feud Hydra exapansion adds a fireball launching Hydra to the game.

This expansion requires Catapult Feud to play.

During setup, place the Hydra in the middle of the battlefield, at an equal distance between players. If you are also using the Volcano Expansion, then place the Hydra to the side of it. Shuffle the Hydra Cards and place them in a pile, face down, next to the Hydra.

Taming the Hydra: During your turn, as a free action you may decide to try and Tame the Hydra! To do so, shuffle the Hydra cards, reveal the top one and resolve it as per its rules.

BEWARE: Taming the Hydra is a risky task. You might end up getting a chance to deal extra damage to your opponent, but there is always the chance that the Hydra will retaliate and scare away your troops! It is possible to lose the game if the Hydra scares away your last troop! Every time you try to Tame the Hydra, one of its heads will respond to you. Depending on the head, there is a different outcome.

Right Head: The Hydra is extremely angry and retaliates! It scares your troops away and some of them desert you! Remove one of your troops from the game. If this was the last troop, you lose the game!

Left Head: You barely managed to control the Hydra to do your bidding. You may use it to launch one Ball of Fire to your opponent.

Center Head: You did an exceptional job taming this beast! You may use it to throw 2 Balls of Fire to your opponent!

Warning! This is a game of construction/destruction of plastic bricks and figures... NOT your opponent, pets, or people who may foolishly pass through the field of battle! Please play fair and be careful not to hurt each other or damage anything... other than your opponent's attempt at an impenetrable fortress!

Includes:
- 1 Hydra
- 4 x Fireballs
- 6 x Hydra Cards
- 1 Instruction Sheet

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Eaten By Zombies!: We Have the Bomb! Promo
description:
Hay, look what you found! It’s a safe cozy shelter to hide from all those pesky zombies outside… but what if you have a Bomb Shelter then who has their finger on the BOMB!
With the 'We have the Bomb!' promo pack the ante has just been upped. Now you don’t just have zombies to worry about because now someone is about to drop a bomb shell on them! You and the other survivors are about to become collateral damage … you better hope you have a shelter in that Safe House of yours!
The 'We have the Bomb!' promo comes with 9 cards; 8 'Bomb Shelters' Swag cards to add to any game of Eaten by zombies! & 1 'We have the Bomb!' a unique card that will be added to the bottom ten cards of the 'Zombie Deck' to be dropped on all the Survivors and Zombies at the same time.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Tavern Masters: Dirty Deeds Expansion
description:
The tavern is open and business is booming, but like your drinks, the competition is stiff! Time to employ some dirty tactics to ensure your tavern remains the best in town!

Tavern Masters: Dirty Deeds Expansion adds in 48 Dirty Deeds cards, as well as a handful of new Tavern and Patron cards, to help you get the edge on your competitors! With this Expansion, intended mostly for Competitive Play, the cards add in a "take that" element to game play.

Dump a bag of rats in your opponent's back door to taint their food, or hire a thug to poison their ale! Spread rumors to scare away their patrons, or rig your games to earn more gold!

Tavern Masters: Dirty Deeds is a great way to up the stakes between players by letting them target one another and pull some nasty pranks, from the light-hearted to the downright devious!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Trading

name: Altar Quest: Lurker Pack
description: This Pack contains 12 new Lurker cards + miniature that were offered during the Fantasy Series 1 Kickstarter by Blacklist Games.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: HeroQuest: Hero Collection – Commander of the Guardian Knights
description:
Prepare for battle! The Commander of the Guardian Knights has been summoned by Mentor to join the heroes in the fight against Zargon’s evil forces. As the head of an elite cadre of noble knights, the Commander’s first responsibility is to protect their fellow heroes from the dangers that lurk behind dungeon doors and can always be found in the thick of combat, leading the way with sword sharp and shield sturdy. The Guardian Knights are the King’s finest warriors and personal guard, devoted to protecting the realm at all cost. They are models of chivalry and honor, chosen to uphold the tenets and values of the kingdom all while pushing back against the armies of Dread.
- This HeroQuest character collection includes 2 finely-detailed miniatures and 12 game cards.
- With 3 unique powers and knight skills not possessed by any other HeroQuest character, this well-trained armored fighter is ready to stand between allies and danger, with sword and shield at the ready.
- Choose from 2 different sculpts of this Commander of the Guardian Knights hero
- Requires HeroQuest Game System to Play
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Telebohn
description:
Telebohn - On to the hostile takeover! - presents itself as a special Bohnanza variant; one in which - for once - the beans aren't traded. Instead, players don't pull any punches in trying to take over other players' fields in hostile takeovers. As such, the game plays more like Klunker than Bohnanza. Telebohn was released, unlike previous Bohnanza expansions, in a limited edition of 5000.

Telebohn is part of the Bohnanza family of games.

Expands:

Bohnanza
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Humor, Negotiation

name: Valdora: Special board 19
description:
A Valdora promo tile for Essen 2010

The special board is placed next to the game board. As long as it is next to the game board it can be claimed by discarding different-colored craftsman tiles. At the game end, before scoring, the player that collected the special board is allowed to take one extra turn after the last player finished his turn.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Loop Inc.: Expansion Tiles
description:
This Limited Edition expansion adds 16 tiles to the game.

Performance Goals (7 tiles)
At the beginning of the game, each player receives one randomly dealt tile as a secret goal, hidden from the other players. Players who have fulfilled the goal listed on their tile score bonus points at the end of the game.

Waste Memo (5 tiles)
At the beginning of the game, one Waste Memo tile is chosen at random. During the game, component penalties no longer simply count as -1 points, but rather carry the penalties indicated on the tile. Components are left face-up in the penalty area to prevent confusion.

Butterfly Effect (4 tiles)
After shuffling these tiles, they are placed, one by one, face down above trip cards, starting with the trip cards that take travelers the furthest back in time. One tile is placed for each player in the game (i.e. in a 3-player game, the three furthest-back trip cards will each have one Butterfly Effect tile placed face-down above them). When that trip card is visited, the player picks up the tile and places it face up above any trip card later in the timeline. No trip card may have more than one tile placed above it. A face-up tile affects both trips on a trip card, and rewards or subtracts points at the end of the game.

These tiles were included for free for all backers of Loop Inc. on Kickstarter. However, these extras are available for purchase separately. None are Kickstarter-exclusive.
categories: Science Fiction, Travel

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Reunion Island
description:
This fan made expansion is a 2-player map for Age of Steam, based on Reunion Island, with various mechanisms like a volcano, locked actions, etc.

It was released as a limited edition paper run of 180 copies and was packaged with the first edition of Age of Steam Expansion: The Moon in a special box.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Zpocalypse: Aftermath – Z-Team Alpha
description:
"It's been a year since the Zpocalypse started. All the cities are gone, and what few survivors remain are bedraggled and living off the remnants of what came before. Zombies still infest the wastelands without abandon and every death leads to an undeath. It's been survival of the meanest, baddest, and cleverest ever since. Standing apart from the fray is the Z-team, a special-ops group. They've been selected for their diverse zombie-slaying abilities and equipped to eradicate the infected zones so humanity can start the process of rebuilding civilization.”

Z-team Alpha includes four post-apocalyptic Z-team members. These miniatures are designed to work with the Zpocalypse Squad base stands, however there is nothing stopping you from using them for your own mischievous ends in any other tabletop games. Each miniature comes fully assembled and unpainted.

4 Survivors Miniatures ( each approx. 12 x 25 x 35mm )
4 Zpocalypse Survivor cards
4 Zpocalypse weapon cards
1 scenario card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Trial by Trolley: R-Rated Modifier Expansion
description:
In Trial by Trolley, one player acts as the Trolley Operator and must choose where to send a murderous, out of control, trolley. Every other player at the table plays cards and argues in order to convince the operator to spare their lives and condemn everyone on the other track to a gruesome death-by-trolley.

This dirty expansion for Trial by Trolley adds 100 awful R-Rated modifiers to spice up your trolley murders. There’s a lot of really bad stuff in here. You’ve been warned!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Panic Lab: Shower
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2016 for Day 17

Rules: When the amoeba meets this tile, the effects of the mutation rooms previously met are cancelled
