description:
Ascension Promo given out at April 2013 Game Days that can be used with any of the Ascension products that have been released sofar.

Text on card:
Shuffletron 2K13 - 2 Runes
Mechana Construct
Once per turn, when you play a Mechana Construct (including this one), you may shuffle your discard pile into your deck.
Whenever you would shuffle your deck, you may have an opponent shuffle your deck instead.
Reward: 2 Honor Crystals
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Wildlands: The Thorns & the Roses
description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo. Day 15.

A micro-expansion for Wildlands.

A magical tangle of briars is growing uncontrollably throughout the ruins of the Empire. Get to your crystal shards quickly, or you'll have to fight your way through.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Looney Tunes Mayhem: 4-Figure Pack
description:
The Looney Tunes Mayhem 4-Figure Pack introduces 4 more iconic characters to the Looney Tunes Mayhem board game. Sylvester, Tweety, Wile E. Coyote, and the Road Runner all come with their own unique dashboard and specialized gear, as well as a highly detailed painted figure. There dynamic duos will surely change the way players team up in the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Life & Death & An American Chainsaw
description:
An expansion to Games Workshop's Chainsaw Warrior. This expansion was printed in the April 1987, vol.88 edition of Games Workshop's White Dwarf magazine. It adds the following 9 new items of equipment:

Device - Temporal Disturbance Detector, Holographic
Imagizer, Dum Dum Bullets

Clothing - Chameleon Suit, X-O Skeleton

Hand-to-Hand - Smash, Stun-Nux

Gun - Combat Shotgun

Heavy Weapon - Reaper

Expands

Chainsaw Warrior
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Ascension: Theme Pack – Location Pack
description:
The Ascension Location Pack introduces a new card type to the Ascension Deck Building game. Locations can be shuffled into the center deck of any Ascension game. When they are revealed in a center row slot, they they permanently modify that slot to fundamentally change gameplay. Locations can change the cost of cards as well as create special events when a card in that slot is acquired or defeated. This promo pack is a great addition to any Ascension set.

This pack of thirteen cards contains doubles of Cetra's Shrine, Path Of Trials, Stone Circle, Hedron Sanctum, Rift's Edge and Arha Dojo plus a rules card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Dein Weg ins Abenteuer
description:
It's the story before "Quest: Zeit der Helden - Angriff der Orks". A small adventure (only 14 sections) to take the first time with the game.

One or two players take on the role of heroes while another player is their antagonist - the Questmaster. He controls all the challenges that the other players cooperatively have to master with the clever use of their skills and abilities.

Note: This is only a short quest, to show the object of the game.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Cards Against Humanity: Mass Effect Pack
description: The Mass Effect Pack is a collaboration between Cards Against Humanity and BioWare — 14 brand new cards about valuable intellectual property: Mass Effect™.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Camel Up Cards: Catch'Up-Trophies
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2016 for Day 14

Includes 6 trophies

From the second leg on, carry out the following additional setup during the setup at the start of each leg

3a. Place 1 catch up trophy on the final betting "overall winner" card of the camel currently in 5th place, but only if the card of that camel is still available above the race track.

3b. Place 1 catch up trophy on the final betting "overall loser" card of the camel currently in first place, but only if the card of that camel is still available above the race track.

At the end of the game, during the final payout round, the revenues of the the "overall winner" and "overall loser" cards that have 1 or more catch up trophies on them are adjusted accordingly
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: HeroCard Orc Wars: Sorceress Expansion Deck
description:
Sorceress Expansion Deck

As the Elven Nation reels under the Orc advance, a cry rings out for heroes. From ancient libraries hidden in the trees comes a Sorceress and her mystical companion. They pledge the full force of their arcane arts to the destruction of the Orc tide!

The Sorceress is a HeroCard expansion deck for HeroCard Orc Wars. The Sorceress can compete in any HeroCard game or can be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

Contains 33 character cards and 1 figure
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Cards Against Humanity: Theatre Pack
description:
As the Bard once said, “All the world’s a stage, and all the men and women merely members of our target demographic.” Hark! It’s the Theatre Pack, 30 cards about those things that are like movies but they happen right in front of you.

- We’d like to thank our parents, our amazing director, and of course, God.
- Lin-Manuel Miranda’s favorite pack.
- All profits fund a grant program for innovative theater and comedy run by the Theater Communications Group.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: HeroCard Orc Wars: Ranger Expansion Deck
description:
Ranger Expansion Deck

As destruction looms over the Elven Nation, a cry rings out for heroes to defend it. From the depths of the verdant forest a Ranger emerges. He pledges his twin blades and huntsman's prowess to fight the Orc scourge and carve a path to victory.

The Ranger is a HeroCard expansion deck for HeroCard Orc Wars. The Ranger can compete in any HeroCard game or can be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

Contains 33 character cards and 1 figure
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Car Wars Expansion Set #6, The AADA Vehicle Guide Counters
description:
"Over 150 black-and-white, color-them-yourself counters, ready for action . . . Counters for every vehicle in The AADA Vehicle Guide, and many of the variants - 153 in all! Everything from subcompacts to buses, with motorcycles, trucks, trailers, and helicopters too. And this set also includes trike counters, for three-wheeled combat on and off the roads!"

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
The AADA Vehicle Guide
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Cards Against Humanity: Saves America Pack
description:
It’s 2017, and the government is being run by a toilet. Last month, 150,000 people paid Cards Against Humanity $15 to save America with six days of incredible surprises.

Six sets of CAH cards were sent to subscribers: Cards Against Humanity Stops the Wall (6 cards), The Good News Podcast (6 cards), Cards Against Humanity Redistributes Your Wealth (2 cards), Cards Against Humanity Destroys Homework (6 cards), Cards Against Humanity's Pulse of the Nation (6 cards), and Cards Against Humanity Saves Baseball (6 cards).

--From the website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Run, Fight, or Die!: Jive Cat Boss Expansion
description:
This expansion adds components and rules players can use to replace the Base Game Mutant Boss.

It includes the following components:

1 Jive Cat Mutant Boss miniature
1 Location Card (The Jive Cat Lounge)
16 Jive Cat Mutant Boss Cards
1 Rules Sheet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Mamma Mia! con Ingredientes dobles
description:
Designer Uwe Rosenberg has a talent for dreaming up new and inventive card games, and Mamma Mia! is a perfect example of this talent, with players placing pizza ingredients into a combined pool, then trying to time their pizza baking in order to make use of what's available in the kitchen.

Each player starts the game with eight different pizza orders to fill, with one of those order cards in hand; each player also starts with a hand of ingredient cards (showing pepperoni, mushroom, pineapple, green pepper or olive). On a turn, a player lays down one or more ingredient cards of a single type into a common stack, then optionally adds a pizza order card to that stack. He then refills his hand by drawing as many cards as he played from either the shared ingredient deck or his own order deck.

After the draw pile is exhausted, the shared pile of cards is flipped over and sorted by ingredients until an order comes up. If enough ingredient cards are available to fill that order, the owner scores it; if not, the player can make up the difference by playing cards from his hand (and thereby scoring the order) or else return the card to the bottom of his order deck.

Once all the orders are scored or returned, shuffle the ingredients used in pizzas and start another round of play. After three complete rounds, the player who's filled the most orders wins!

It includes a promotional expansion consisting of 10 double ingredient cards, two in each of the five ingredients.

During game set-up, the double ingredient cards are substituted into the deck in place of two ingredients of each type. For game play, a double ingredient is handled exactly the same as the single ingredients, but of course count as two ingredients of that kind.

If an ingredient is needed to complete an order, double ingredients on display must be used first. If necessary, a player must overpay, which also applies to double ingredients played from the hand to complete an order.
categories: Card Game

name: Anno Domini: Mixed Edition
description:
A regular Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

This small expansion set Anno Domini - Mixed Edition was a free giveaway by the publisher. It only contains 12 event cards out of 72 mixed cards without a common theme. Since this is not enough for a real game, it only comes with a brief summary of the gameplay. Those six different bags of cards can be recognized by the number of each of the first card in a bag: U001, U013, U025, U037, U049, U061.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly. Anno Domini is a blast to play, it is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Part of the Anno Domini series
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Wie verhext!: Der brodelnde Theriak
description:
This small expansion adds three special victory point cards (4, 2 and 1 point) to the game.
A player can get the highest available card if he has at least one of any sort of potion cards.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Montana: Trade Post
description:
A mini-expansion for Montana released at Essen 2018.

Replace one of each player's settlement with a trade post during the setup.
During the game each player can build his settlement by paying its cost with money instead of goods.

-description from publisher
categories: American West, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Potion-Making (Gift Edition)
description:
This Gift Edition includes Practice, University Course and Guild of Alchemists. In addition, in the box there are also bonus materials that are absent in the regular editions of the game: the Alchemikote creature card and alternative sequences for creating the Philosopher's Stone for the Alchemists Guild.


In the card game Potion-Making: Practice, players take on the roles of apprentice mages studying in a Magic School. Each player tries to gather the necessary components in order to produce magic elixirs, powders, talismans and even magical creatures. For each completed creation the player scores points – and the harder the task, the more points a player scores.

The deck consists of 76 cards, with each card featuring one of 16 elements on its bottom half and a magic formula or spell on its top half. Each player start the game with four cards in hand, and four cards are laid face-up in the "Desk of Elements"; players can use these public elements to complete a formula in hand.

On a turn, a player draws until he has five cards in hand, then he plays one or more cards from his hand. He can:


Discard a card onto the Desk of Elements; he scores one point if that element is not currently present on the Desk.
Take elements on the Desk to complete a formula on a card in his hand. He scores points equal to the number shown on the formula, then places the element cards face-down over the bottom half of the card so that all players can see the formula. His turn then ends.
Use one or more previously completed formulas, along with any elements required and available on the Desk, to complete a more difficult formula. He can use formulas in front of himself or other players to do this. Any elements under formulas reused this way are returned to the Desk. Any opponent who loses one or more formulas this way scores half the points of the more difficult formula just completed. The player's turn then ends.
Plays a spell from his hand to take a card from the desk into his hand, to decompose one completed formula or to transform one formula into another. After playing a spell, he must take another action, which could be playing another spell.


After the deck runs out, players continue to take turns until no one has cards remaining in hand. The player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy

name: Turbo Drift: Ramped Up
description: Turbo Drift: Ramped Up adds another obstacle card to make tracks a little more difficult, two oil slick cards, a sweet 5th player truck and 2 ramps so that you can leap into the air.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Racing

name: Crossbows and Catapults: Trojan Horse and Battle Shield
description:
The Trojan Horse and Battle Shield expansions add a Trojan Horse Catapult and Battle Shield Crossbow to Crossbows and Catapults.

The expansions were available both separately and as a two part gift set.

The Trojan horse features a "tail" catapult launcher, and a compartment in the torso of the horse which houses "warriors". When the horse is hit at the front base of the unit, the horse flies open, ejecting its occupants to the ground.

The Battle Shield is a wheel mounted combat platform that mounts a semi-automatic crossbow in its undercarriage. This is probably the coolest weapon in the game. Striking the shield (with a catapult) causes the battle shield to explosively destruct by flinging it's shield down and pulling the frame back, ejecting any riders that may be on the shield platform.

May be used in a standalone game or added to C&C basic set as an expansion.

CONTENTS: (for the combined set)
1 Trojan Horse
1 Battle Shield
8 Vikings
8 Barbarians
4 red caroms
4 blue caroms
label sheet
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Warmachine: High Command – Into the Breach
description:
Bolster your armies with Into the Breach, the second expansion for Warmachine: High Command!

Into the Breach contains five copies each of 16 different cards, plus four additional warcaster cards to bring new strategies to your Cygnar, Khador, Protectorate of Menoth, and Cryx decks.

Requires Warmachine: High Command core set to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: One False Step Home
description:
In One False Step Home it's time for the unfortunate souls who blasted to the Moon in the original game to send a few lucky ones back home, with the help of their friendly neighborhood Moon Men.

This is an expansion for One False Step For Mankind - the original board game where absurdly wealthy Gold Rush towns race to the Moon - provides a new set of Moon-colored boards for the original game, plus a few twists on the basic rules.

In the expansion, people can be produced by Moon Caves. Rocket systems and Know-how have been removed. Instead, players purchase smaller rockets and may launch several of them per turn, earning one influence chip per successful launch (plus one chip per passenger). The changes reduce playing time from three hours to two.

Expands:

One False Step for Mankind
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Wok Star: Paige Turner Promo Character
description:
Paige Turner is from another game from designer Tim Fowers called Paperback. Paige Turner still needs to earn some money while creating her hit novel, so she has been working at the Wok Star Restaurant.

Paige turner is an exclusive character with a new ability for backers of the Wok Star Kickstarter.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Looney Bin: The North Wing
description: Looney Bin: The North Wing allows you to continue the insanity by expanding The Looney Bin game for further fun. Expansion set includes 27 new patient cards and 34 new staff and action cards. One more therapy, Rorschach Ink Blot, doubles the amount of possible cures with 70 new symptom tiles. Also included are more therapy tokens for up to 10 players.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medical

name: Sunrise City: Nights!
description:
Sunrise City: Nights!, the first full expansion for this much loved game. Isaias Vallejo, the designer, set out to bring a little bit of the night-life and casino flavor to the base game and to add a couple of fun mechanics to what many have called a "New Classic" board game.

The Sunrise City: Nights! expansion gives you more of what you love most in the base game.

The 16 new Role Cards give you more customizable player powers and more options for bending the rules to your advantage.
Two new meeple Roles have a familiar feel but their ability to roam through the city gives you new options to block your opponents.


The silver Benchmark Tokens are worth 5pts each so you'll never run out of stars.

Nights! also introduces two new game systems to enhance the game and add a casino-feel to your city-building adventure.

Each player starts the game with a set of five special One-Zone Building (OZB) Tiles that they can play over the course of the game. They play just like any other Building Tile but their size lets them fill in isolated zones or fit neatly onto the edge of a growing skyscraper. OZBs also present new scoring methods based on the current configuration of the city so their potential effect on your score and the city itself, is different each time they're played.
The Fortune Die is a six-sided die with the red, green, blue and yellow on four sides and purple on two sides. Certain Role Cards and new Building Tiles use the Fortune Die to create a casino-feel with probability-base rewards.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kisfröccs
description: Kisfröccs is an accessory to the fast-paced and fun Hungarian-developed party game. In addition to new characters and sucker cards, players can also gain special cup abilities.
categories: Card Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Negotiation, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Barbarians: The Invasion – Mystics Set
description:
The Mystics Set contains 3 new characters which each add their own rules and variety to the game:

Bones Diviner: The Bones Diviner's guidance is sought by all Clans. He prays and meditates for weeks at a time, just waiting for the players to meet him on the Honor track's milestones. Once reached by the most honorable player, the Bones Diviner grants them a bonus and calls forward the other Clans.

Trickster: The Trickster is a weird one. As it is true that a Clan may loathe him sometimes, it is also true that the other Clans are enjoying his show in the meanwhile...at least until it is their turn. The Trickster loves to fool around with the God, Warchief, and Building decks.

Time Weaver: The Time Weaver is a blessed and revered figure among the Clans, as only one in the whole world exists at any given time. She moves between the Volcano rings, and when a player's Champion finally meets her, they get the chance to grasp the future by performing actions from the ring below. Sometimes though, some Champions get also to relive the past.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Sea of Clouds: Lurch Cassidy
description: This is a promotional captain board for Sea of Clouds.
categories: Card Game, Pirates
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Insecta: Rainforest
description:
The Rainforest Expansion is a supplement for Insecta Second Edition that expands the game to encompass the tropics. It includes a replacement Hive deck with new jungle creatures, new mutant design cards, and extensive rules modifications for the rainforest environment. Also provided are complete (but optional) rules for pixies, with design displays and weapon cards. New rules and components cover poison flingers, armored wings, stink glands, trapjaw triggers, sticky tongues, horrifying new venoms, exploding bugs, blood-sucking fangs, samurai sickle mandibles, and more.

Contains:
4-page rules annex
80 Hive bug cards
13 bug design cards
11 venom cards
2 pixie displays
15 pixie design cards
assorted markers and counters

Expands:

Insecta
categories: Animals, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Simulation, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Fat Messiah Games, Sierra Madre Games

name: Colony: FLGS Promo
description:
Promo card (set of 4 cards) distributed in Essen 2016.

Cost: six sixes.
Value: 3 VPs, 4 VPs when upgraded. No special text.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Trading

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault – Forbidden Chambers Board Pack
description:
Give yourself extra tactical options in Warhammer Underworlds with this special double-sided board pack! This board section has been expertly designed to offer new challenges and opportunities for your warband. On one side, you'll find a group of three lethal hexes make for a deadly deterrent, while the other lets you keep your warband close together with three adjacent starter hexes. If you're looking to surprise your foes and shake up your strategy, this set is for you!

This board is exactly the same dimensions as those provided in the Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault game, and constructed from the same durable card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Crypt: The Book of Variants
description:
Crypt The Book of Variants is an expansion to the board game Crypt, featuring a rulebook with three new game modes and a set of game tiles. *A copy of Crypt is needed to play the game*

Game Modes:
1. Cursed Treasure adds a new dimension to the game, penalizing the player who takes the most 3 and 4 value cards.

2. Clash of Houses has teams of two fight over the most valuable treasure. Thee mode supports 6-8 players. *Requires two copies of Crypt*

3. Conspiring Twins is a co-operative mode where players work together to get the most valuable treasurer from the ghosts of their parents.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Renaissance
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection
publishers: GateOnGames, Road To Infamy Games (R2i Games)

name: Miskatonic School for Girls: Holiday Break
description:
It's holiday time at the Miskatonic School for Girls. Experience even more madness with this expansion to the base game.

It's been a while since we've last visited the Miskatonic School for Girls, and sadly, insanity has continued to fester in the minds of the students. Despite this, the girls have been keeping their spirits high and with the arrival of the holiday season, even some of the faculty have joined in on the festivities.

Holiday Break is an expansion to the deck building game where you build your opponent's deck. Adding Unique Houses and purchasable Abilities (not to mention more faculty, more students, and more madness) the Miskatonic School For Girls will never be the same.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Myth: Bones Expansion Boss
description: Contains the Bones expansion boss, two monster darkness cards, and 10 darkness event cards. Bones is the undead skeleton boss.

name: ICECOOL: Walrus Expansion
description:
Contained in Deutscher Spielepreis Classic Goodie Box

Preparation:
Put the three walruses together. Place one each in the middle of rooms 3, 4 and 5.

Playing the game:
Play ICECOOL/ICECOOL2 as usual. If you knock down at least one walrus on your turn, you immediately get 1 extra turn. You can also get several extra turns in a row if you knock down a walrus every time.

Note: Of course, you still get an extra turn if you show two fish cards with the value “1” at the end of your turn. Before the next player begins their turn, all knocked-over walruses are stood up again. Put them in the spot where they have landed.

Start a new round: At the beginning of the new round, place the walruses back in the middle of rooms 3, 4 and 5.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Cadwallon: City of Thieves – The Inn
description:
Before their nightly adventures begin, the gangs visit the Inn to equip themselves.
Each gang can choose any two equipment cards to use, but they’ll have to pay for them with the loot that they collect during the game!
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver

description:
Foil promo card for Hunk.
Health: 70
Level 1: When Hunk would take any Damage, you can give that Damage to your Partner insted.
Level 2: At the begining of your turn, if Hunk has no Partner, you get +2 Cards.

name: Cards Against Humanity: Fascism Pack
description:
An exclusive foil pack of Cards Against Humanity cards about YA literature's favorite type of government. Available only through this Kickstarter campaign.

From Secret Hitler Kickstarter

It has 15 white cards and 2 Black cards. The icon on the cards is a skull.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Scuttle!: The Curse of Black Jack
description:
Black Jack has been cursed to forever crave gold...but whenever he gains too much, his entire fortune disappears! This expansion adds even more diabolical ways you can amass wealth, including a new treasure of each value, three new crew members you can recruit, a Pirate Ghost, and Black Jack himself!

Scuttle! is a complete game in itself, but the expansion adds a whole new way to play the game - as an action, you can flip the top card of the deck. If it's treasure, add it to your stash! If it's not, discard it! But if your new bounty takes you above 21 treasure, you lose it all...
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: GPS: Expansion Pack
description:
GPS: Expansion Pack adds components to play GPS with up to 7 players. It also includes the Numberless Satellites Expansion and Speciality Satellites Expansion.

The Numberless Satellites expansion provides players with 3 additional satellites that are unnumbered. When choosing to place a satellite at the location of the spinning rocket ship, an unnumbered satellite may be placed instead of the typical numbered satellites. This increases the flexibility to arrange your satellites in a sequential orbit.

The Specialty Satellites expansion provides players with 3 additional satellites that break the standard rules and can interfere with your opponents' orbital plans. Use them secretly and wisely to efficiently stake your place amongst the stars.

Additionally, this expansion pack increases the maximum player count to 7 which can be applied to the base game, the Numberless Satellites expansion, or the Specialty Satellites expansion.

This was packaged together along with two other expansion in 10-Minute Games: Expansions and currently not available by itself.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Number, Space Exploration

name: Duel in the Dark: 3-5 Player Variant
description:
Allows Duel in the Dark to be played with three to five players. Additional players will split control of the German squadrons, with up to four players controlling the German fighters.

Content includes 1 Score Chart; 4 wooden scoring markers in blue, green, red, and yellow; and 2 MW50 markers.

Expands:

Duel in the Dark
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Disaster Looms!: CEOs and Corporations
description:
Disaster Looms!: CEOs & Corporations, is the first expansion for Disaster Looms!. In addition to providing pieces necessary to play with five or six people, it introduces two brand new gameplay concepts as well as providing additional tiles and new technologies for Disaster Looms!

The CEO and Corporation cards alter game play and strategy, and they can offer different and challenging ways to play the game. They are an optional expansion and can be set aside if you only want to play the 5-6 player base game.

name: Villages: Ghost Town
description:
From publisher blurb:



Did you hear that?After a long day of building and conquering, night has fallen over the land. But you won't get much sleep tonight...

Prepare for the invasion of the evil dark cards! New units like Zombies, Skeletons, and Vampires are on the prowl, hunting for unsuspecting victims. Pirates, Ninjas, and Psychics are here to help, but will it be enough? Or will you rely on divine light cards like the powerful Angel to thwart the forces of darkness?

Each deck of Villages: Ghost Town includes 39 unit, animal, and building cards, 1 Distant Lands location card, and a sheet of rules.
categories: Civilization, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Fridgecrisis Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: 1911 Amundsen vs Scott: Expansion 4 – Food Depots
description:
IMPORTANT UPDATE:
The second edition of "1911 Amundsen vs Scott" incorporates this expansion inside with 4 white cubes (not wooden tents).

A small expansion for backers of the Verkami crowdfunding campaign consisting of 4 food depots in the form of small wooden tents and a rules card.

Important: If you want to play with this expansion only need to print the rules and use 4 pieces (cubes, discs, peanuts :D ...)

The Rules:
1- Each player receives 2 pieces (Food Depots).
2- Each player rolls a die and place one of their Depots in the resulting track space ("1" is the space adjacent to the ship).
3- The players choose where they want to place their second Depot, exactly 2 spaces ahead or behind (if possible) the first one.
Ex: Amundsen rolls the dice with a "5" result and places his first depot in the fifth (yellow) space. The other depot may be placed in the third (green) or seventh (red) space.
4- At the begginning of the game each player receives 3 cards instead of 1. They must pick 2 of these cards to place face down next to each of their depots.
Note: If this expansion is combined with the "Expansion 1 - Patrons" (included with the game), the Food Depots must always be executed first.
5- When a player ends his turn in a space with a Depot, he takes the corresponding card.
Note: If the new card forces the player to exceed the hand limit, the player must exchange a card of his hand face down with the card of the Depot.

This expansion is called "Expansion 4," as the first three expansions are already in the base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration

name: Babylon 5 Component Game System: Reinforcements Pack #1
description:
In the Babylon 5 Component Game System, you take control of a certain faction which is trying to gain power in the galaxy. You play the role of an ambassador on board Babylon 5. You explore the vast stretches of space, lead huge fleets into battle, and control the economy of your faction. There are several ways to achieve victory ranging from economic growth to all out militaristic control of the universe. Diplomacy is not to be neglected either, as the more powerful game changes are brought up in Babylon 5 council vote to be decided.

You construct your playing 'board' using hexagonal shaped pieces that come with the game. The various pieces are different and can represent a multitude of things so that the game is different every time you play. In addition to the board and the ships that move on it, there are cards. Players may buy cards allowing special actions above and beyond the normal game, like an extra move or more EPs.

Using your faction's wealth and resources you play the game and explore the map. You search for planets to colonize and possibly conquer. Use your fleets to engage in battles and use characters to assist you in reaching your faction's goals. The choices are yours and will decide if your faction is successful.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Garbage Day: Dorm Room Expansion
description:
Shhhhhh! Don't tell the RA!

This expansion packs your college dorm rooms so full you may want to sleep in the commons area. Clear off the top bunk as the expansion takes Garbage Day up to 6 players!

Includes 15 new cards!
categories: Action / Dexterity

name: Shadows over the Empire: Promo Pack
description:
The Shadows over the Empire: Promo Pack includes three new Distinct Personalities with unique abilities — Priscilla: Mother of the Empire, Azarias the Conspirator, and Aribar the Loremaster — as well as twelve new level C cards that can be used with Shadows over the Empire. This mini-expansion also includes a player's aid that explains how some of the new cards change the rules.

(Azarias the Conspirator was distributed on its own at Spiel 2013 in addition to being included in this mini-expansion.)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): Instructor
description:
Fantasy Flight Games produced two bonus Adventure Cards which were made available as preorder bonuses when people ordered Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion via the FFG website or from their FLGS.

The Instructor Adventure card is a Stranger originally included in the Talisman: The Adventure for Talisman.

Though the card is unlikely to be reprinted in a future expansion, a similar Place card was released as an Adventure card called the Academy in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion.

It was available in various languages from FFG's international partners and given away either with preorders or at launch events.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Fantasy Flight Games, Galakta, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Hobby Japan, Nexus Editrice, Pegasus Spiele

name: Teomachia: Mity Cthulhu
description:
This expansion was an exclusive crowdfunding project in Poland and Germany, inspired by the success of Theomachy: The Ancients and Theomachy: The Warrior Gods, re-implementations of the original Teomachia game, released in coopeartion with Petersen Games. It brings gods from Cthulhu Mythos (Great Old Ones, Outer Gods and the Nightmares) as well as Aztec and Egyptian deities to the world of the war of mythological gods, without changing the main concept of a deck-building game with a drafting and bidding mechanism. It consists of several mini-expansions (available only in this bundle, not separately):

Heroes - one extra Hero card for each pantheon
Priests and Prophets - one extra Special Prophet or two extra Special Priests with unique abilities for each pantheon (wooden discs with stickers and reference cards)
Reward deck - new bonuses for the winner of a round (instead of a regular one)
Miracle tokens - acrylic crystals to replace the regular cardboard tokens

New Pantheons available:

Aztec (Quetzalcoatl, Nanahuatl, Coatlicue)
Egyptian (Anubis, Bast, Maat)
Great Old Ones (Cthulhu, Hastur, Ithaqua)
Outer Gods (Nyarlathotep, Shub-Niggurath, Yog-Sothoth)
Nightmares (Chaugnar Faugn, Ghatanothoa, Tsathouggua)

The Polish edition also includes a re-printed rulebook for the base-game and 4 Last Stand cards, originally available in the German and English editions of the base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Splendor: Thomas More Promo Noble
description:
Promotional noble offered by the publisher.

Requires 4 black and 4 green to claim this noble for 3 points.

Works like any other noble and is just mixed into any game of Splendor that includes nobles. Cannot be used with the "Cities of Splendor" module in Cities of Splendor expansion
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance

name: Pay Dirt: Spectral Mini-Expansion
description:
This expansion to Pay Dirt adds haunted workers and equipment that may spook your crew.

Will you fight for your claim or does the ghosts make you quit?
I know what I say to them! "From my cold, dead hands!"

Kickstarter supporter bonus.
categories: American West, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: We Didn't Playtest This At All: Blue Deck
description: Blue cards are crazy and random (surprise), and have four different effects on each card. When you draw a card from the pile, you flip it in a random direction before looking at it, and read the text that is facing you.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Humans!!! 3: ZombieCon
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Humans!!! 3: ZombieCon moves the brain-munching action to the happiest place on earth. That's right – your zombies have decided to look for lunch at the local gaming convention. Will you eat the CCG player? Maybe the RPG fan would be easier to catch. If all else fails, security looks tasty! So many choices!

Humans!!! 3: ZombieCon lets players explore a large gaming convention looking for more brains to eat or candidates to convert. This expansion also adds a new card type called "Personalities" that determine WHO you encounter and how much "fight" they have in them.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

description:
An additional set of coasters (purple) for Beer & Pretzels. Includes rules changes for six player play.

Winner of the 2009 Board 2 Pieces Expansion of the Year award!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: PARKS: Season of Tantrum Promo Card
description:
A promotional Season card that was obtainable through the "Tantrum House Board Game Media: Season 6" Kickstarter campaign.

Adds a new available season into the core game's existing deck of 10 Seasons.
categories: Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Travel
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Worker Placement

name: Illuminati: Brainwash
description:
This is the re-released third expansion of the popular Illuminati card game. This game set contains 108 play counters, one sheet of money counters, one 14" x 18" game mat and the rules set. This expansion allows players to brainwash the existing groups by changing their alignment (e.g. from Liberal to No-Liberal to Conservative). Special propaganda rules allow the player to change the base World sociological climate. Own more Media types to force propaganda to go your way. Other additions such as rules for building up power, resistance and income of a group and new illuminati groups suited for this expansion are included.

Expands:

Illuminati
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction

name: Kraków 1325 AD: 3-player expansion
description:
The 3-player expansion for Krakow 1325 AD adds an exciting new dimension to the basic game. When there are only three players, the team work typical of the standard game is reduced to a pleasant memory. Each player has his own set of Influence Tokens and faces both his opponents in the Intrigue Card game and the struggle for board domination. The rules changes involved are simple, but the tactical options and scope for treachery have multiplied. Of course, final victory still depends on the scores of the Secret Identities, which are not revealed until Game End.

"Now you're on your own..." is the motto of this expansion, again developed by Peter Struijf and Melchior van Rijn and self-published by Geode Games.

The 3-player expansion to Krakow 1325 AD will make its debut in October 2009 at Spiel in Essen (Germany). There are two versions: a ziplocked English/Dutch version and a boxed German version (which also contains a complete set of Intrigues and rules in that language).

Peter wisely decided not to rely on his own high-school education to create the German version. He was overwhelmed when he found Andreas Brandhorst, sci-fi author and translator of almost the entire Discworld (Scheibenwelt) series, willing to translate the texts of the Intrigue cards. The game rules were translated by fellow Boardgamegeek Christian Krach.

Ownership of the basic game is, probably obviously, required to play the expansion set.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: Ascension: Explosive Swarm Promo
description:
GenCon 2014
Set of 9 mostly-identical cards: 4 with black frames that are shuffled into the portal deck, and 5 with grey frames that wait in a reserve pile until needed.

NOTE: This is only an expansion to Superfight and requires the Superfight Core Deck to play.

Now this scenario book allows players to combine SOPAC, Eastern Fleet, Midway and Bomb Alley with extra scenarios. Plus, they can explore some of the alternative paths history might have taken.
Included are discussions of Italian aircraft carriers,the Royal Yugoslavian Navy, and the German helicopter carrier seen in Bomb Alley.

name: In a Bind: Expansions
description:
In A Bind Expansions contains 3.5 expansions that can be combined with the In a Bind base game in whatever combination(s) you like. The expansions are:


22 wild cards: Someone will make up part of the card, as in a Mad Lib, when it's played.
10 speech-based triggered binds: You need to say something whenever anyone draws.
10 physical triggered binds: You need to perform a movement whenever anyone draws.
12 communal (physical triggered) binds: These either apply to everyone, or to everyone but the person playing the card, depending on whether you're playing "Fast & Furious" or "Slow & Sadistic".
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Cards Against Humanity: Vote for Trump Pack
description:
We’re letting America choose between two new expansion packs about either Hillary Clinton or Donald Trump.

At the end of this promotion, Cards Against Humanity will tally up the sales of both packs, and depending on which pack gets more support, we will donate all the money in support of Hillary Clinton.

The Vote for Trump Pack contains 15 cards about Donald Trump, an enormous man who wears three suits at once.

This is a separate edition from the Trump Pack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Space Maze Rollercoaster
description:
Space Maze Rollercoaster is a mini expansion that contains 3 'Rollercoaster' cards which can be added to the deck of action cards in the base game. You should choose whether or not you want to use it before every game, because it changes gameplay considerably. If you do use it, make sure that in your board setup the relic tile is not on the edge of the board.

Effect: Take a tile at the end of any column the alien activating the card is in (up/down or left/right) and place it at the other end. Now shove all tiles in that column one place further. Aliens on tiles always move with them, even if they're moved to the other end of the board.

Adding the card to the base game changes the way you play in a way that it becomes more funny and chaotic and maybe a little less tactical. Therefore it's advised not to just add the card to your base game as if it's just one more action card.

'Space Maze Rollercoaster' was a free expansion when you bought the game at Essen 2011.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Saboteur: The Wardrobe Cavern
description:
This postcard sized expansion is placed 4 cards away from the starting card in such a way that it is also one card away from center goal card.
The first player to connect to this card is immediately forced to exchange their role card. They place their card back in the box and take the one that was set aside(saboteur base game) or a new card of the leftover roles cards from the deck (Saboteur 2)
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

Raving Prophet was sent out to participating Game Day stores earlier this week! Check with a Game Day store on February 2013.

Raving Prophet - 3 Runes
Enlightened Hero.
"Draw a card. Name a card, then reveal the top card of the center deck. If that card is the named card, you may acquire or defeat it without paying its cost."
Reward: 1 Honor Crystal.

name: Alien vs Predator: USCM Powerloader
description:
From the publisher:
Caterpillar P-5000 Powered Work Loader, commonly referred to as a Power Loader.
This useful piece of equipment can be found at most human colonies.
Primarily used to lift and relocate heavy objects the power loader is a true asset to Human engineering and infrastructure.
You can watch that puppy scream as you throw it out an air lock.

mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Bohnanza: Amigo Bohnentaler
description:
New expansion for Bohnanza from Amigo. Adds a plastic playing piece (the Bohnentaler itself) and some new rules.

Having possession of the Bohnentaler basically allows a player to draw 4 cards at the end of his turn instead of three.

AMIGO-Bohnentaler is part of the Bohnanza family of games.

Bohnanza

name: Talisman (Second Edition): White Dwarf #115 Cards
description:
In the run up to the release of the Talisman City for the 2nd Edition of Talisman, Games Workshop released a number of new cards as part of an advertising feature in their house magazine, White Dwarf #115.

These cards consisted of 4 "trigger" and associated Master Level Character cards -

The Champion of Chaos Adventure card and Champion of Chaos Character.

The Recruiter Adventure card and the Templar Character.

The Noble Adventure card and the Herald Character.

The Way of the Lotus Spell and the Mystic Character.

These cards were later reprinted in the Polish language publication, Magia i Miecz #4/93.

name: ESSEN the Game: Goodies
description: A small promo expansion for ESSEN the Game. It adds two new things: an event token that cancels the release of a game at the show, and a fire drill event at the end of the game.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Progress: Milestones
description:
Milestones is a mini-expansion for the base game of Progress:
Evolution of Technology. It consists of 16 cards:

7 Ancient Milestones
5 Medieval Milestones
4 Renaissance Milestones


Milestones depict major achievements in human history to which more than one nation contributed significantly.

With the Milestones shuffled into a face-up deck, players work cooperatively to achieve the current Milestone. Each player may use free actions to pay knowledge and thus contribute to the current Milestone and once a Milestone is completed, each contribution player gains specific advantages.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management

name: Bears!: Trail Mix'd
description:
Description from the publisher:

Just when you had that bear attack under control, things got all Trail Mix'd! See if you can adapt as the game changes with each roll of the die!

Before each round of Bears!, the expansion die is rolled and a new rule is in effect. One round you're scoring double for Runners, the next your rerolls are limited — or maybe you're trying for bonus points by shooting the most bears.

Think fast and roll even faster in this ever-changing expansion to Bears!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Gingerdead House: The Walking Bread
description: 10 New Monsters, Actions, and Defenses filled with zombies and resurrection related madness!
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Bohnedikt
description:
Jochen Steininger and Uwe Rosenberg designed this addition to the Bohnanza family.
As the title, a pun on Pope Benedikt, shows: Bohnanza goes ecclesiastic.
Players have two different Bean fields: God's acre and the Bisch-Hof (pun on bishop - translation would be bish-yard)
There are also 16 Bohn-edict cards that can be planted only on the Bish-yard. Each edict changes one of the rules for the upcoming trade phase.
God's Acre is the place where you can play Sacrifice cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Negotiation

name: Terraforming Mars: Prelude 2
description: Terraforming Mars: Prelude 2, the sixth expansion for Terraforming Mars, focuses on cross-expansion effects, prelude cards with ongoing effects and actions, and more project cards for your tableau...not to mention five new corporations.
categories: Economic, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tile Placement
publishers: FryxGames, Intrafin Games, Rebel Sp. z o.o., Stronghold Games

name: Munchkin Imaginary Frenemies
description:
Description from the publisher:

You can't clear thousands of dungeons without making a few frenemies...so that's what we did! As long as your imaginary frenemies are safely stored inside their blister, they help you in combat — but if you release them to get at the cards inside, you can't use their rule anymore. Oh, temptation!

As long as the Munchkin Imaginary Frenemies package remains unopened, you may keep your imaginary frenemies in front of you as a +2 combat bonus. It cannot be lost to Curses, Bad Stuff, or theft, and stays with you even if you die.

At any time, you may open the package, releasing your frenemies, and draw as many Treasures as there are players in your game. Keep one of the Treasures for yourself and give each other player one each. Sign the two Door cards inside, and put them in your hand as well. When you play a card that you have signed, it has double effect. Save this card so you remember this rule in the future!
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Rise of Cthulhu: Dark Secrets
description:
Darkness surrounds the shores of the world and seeps from caves deep beneath the Earth. The maddening howl of eldritch beasts echoes on the night air. Dangerous artifacts from strange eons call to you at all hours of the day. Your quest is nearly complete. So what if bands of enterprising “heroes” have started snooping around. The Old Ones have heard your prayers. Now all you need to do is finish your plans and set them free before these Investigators find you!

Rise of Cthulhu: Dark Secrets is the first expansion to last year’s successful Rise of Cthulhu card game. ROC: DS adds all new Monsters, Artifacts, and Old Ones for players to use in their shadowy path to victory. In addition, the expansion introduces a brand new mechanic: the Investigator. These “would-be heroes” set out to hunt down rumors of your corrupting influence and seek to stop you from awakening the Old Ones. When they appear, they force both you and your opponent to deal with the threat they bring, lest they halt the coming of the age of madness you seek to unleash.

When an Investigator card is drawn, it is placed on the corresponding Location printed in the upper right hand corner of the card. When an Investigator lands on a Location without an Old One, it banishes all the Cultists assembled there, effectively returning all Cultist cards in play to their owner’s hands. Any Monsters or Artifacts that are in play on that Location are removed from the game. The Location then resets to neutral (turns sideways so that it’s not facing either player).

Each Investigator has a number in a red circle in the upper left hand corner of their frame. This represents their resources they bring to bear against both cultist players. Players must play Cultist cards to equal or exceed the resource value listed to remove the Investigator from the Location. Until the Investigator is removed from the Location, players may not play any Cultist cards on any other Location except that one; furthermore, cards played on a Location with an Investigator present on it do not cause the Location to shift to face the player with the highest total value of cards. Once the resource rating is met or exceeded, the Investigator is defeated and removed, at which time the Location would face the player with the highest total Cultists in play there.

Lastly, this expansion adds a new player aide to the card, something the community asked for following the release of the core game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Chai: High Tea
description:
Celebrate the diversity of tea cultures in Chai: High Tea, an expansion for Chai! Merchants spice up their teahouses with new player powers, featuring afternoon tea to refreshing horchata, or a sip of yerba mate.

Tea merchants receive unique double-sided ability boards at the start of the game. Abilities are used as an optional free action on a turn, and the board flips over whenever an ability is used.

This expansion includes 6 ability boards with 12 unique abilities, in addition to 2 transparent dice. Additional rules make the expansion compatible with Chai’s solo and co-op gameplay.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: When Darkness Comes: The Most Dangerous Game
description:
You are a spy, a superspy if you will, working for a large world organization to sequester the political and not so political entanglements that threaten the calm and quiet existence of a world on the brink of disaster.

This game will take you on wild chases through the small streets of Europe as you run for your life or pursue your enemy. Failure is not an option, and sometimes it takes the assistance of others and a little luck to complete your mission. But trust no one, and proceed carefully.

The set contains a rulebook, scenario book, 8 tiles and 48 disks. You will find new rules for vehicles, chases, disguises and traps.

This is an expansion for When Darkness Comes. (But, the first scenario can be played without the core set.)
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Battle Damage: Code Red
description: Battle Damage: Code Red is a Star Fleet Battles supplement which provides an alternative card-based damage allocation system. The supplement includes rules, charts, and a perforated sheet with 64 damage allocation cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Superfight: The Anime Deck
description:
From Goku and Sailor Moon, to Ash Ketchum and a Colossal Titan, the Anime Deck adds 100 cards inspired by your favorite new and classic shows. It also includes ten Anime-based scenarios and locations so that you can have your fights at a Maid Café or during a beach episode!

This deck can be played on its own but we highly recommend playing it with the Core Deck.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Zombie Survival 2: There Goes the Neighborhood!
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Let's face it – zombies are many things, but graceful isn't one of them. Thankfully, you didn't listen when the wife told you to clean the yard. Those lawn gnomes and pink flamingos don't seem to stop them. They do, however, slow 'em down! Maybe it will be enough!

Zombie Survival 2: There Goes the Neighborhood!, an expansion to Zombie Survival: The Board Game, introduces Outside Item tiles, three additional Store Decks, a new card type ("The Fate Deck"), Damage tokens, and lots more Zombies!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Twilight Imperium: Armada – Stellar Matter
description:
Twilight Imperium: Armada is an ever growing game set in a universe in conflict. This is a new expansion to flesh out and expand the game. It requires the basic Armada game in order to be played.
It contains:
Complete new rules for using terrain
4 new scenarios
6 Control Panels
6 civilian ship disks
6 cargo transport ship disks
3 super battle station disks
150 other terrain disks, including:
Suns
Moons
Planets
Asteroids
Mines
Planetary defense systems
Gravity rifts
Wormholes

Expands:

Twilight Imperium: Armada
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Age of Mythology: The Boardgame – 5-6 Player Expansion
description: Composed of 1 bag of cubes, 1 set of tiles (buildings & resources), 3 card decks and 2 reference cards. The components are basically duplicates of what comes in the game allowing more players to play using the same cultures found in the base game. In a 6 player game 2 players will control each culture. When two players use the same culture, they are not allowed to sit next to each other.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon – War Runes
description:
Originally available as part of Man vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter.

War Runes are a set of 3 Runestones with various symbols on their sides. You may choose to cast the Ware Runes at the start of your Activation, before playing any cards. The result will alter the Encounter - sometimes for better, sometimes for worse.

You always have to throw all 3 Runestones, and you can do this only once per Activation. Once the runes are cast, spend them to trigger the effects described on the backside of this card. You HAVE to spend all the runes - even if some results may not be to your liking.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Push Your Luck, Role Playing

name: What Do You Meme?: Fresh Memes Expansion Pack #1
description:
Fresh Memes Expansion Pack #1 includes 115 Cards (90 caption cards & 25 photo cards)

Add the cards to their respective decks and play as normal.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
publishers: Peliko Oy, What Do You Meme?

name: Terrible Monster: Desperation
description: The Terrible Monster: Desperation expansion consists of twelve cards to add to your game of Terrible Monster. The additional monster and spells can just be mixed into the original game. The new heroes, however, are a brand new gameplay feature of this expansion; instead of playing a card, a player can choose to use the ability of their hero. These abilities cannot be countered by counter tokens!
categories: Unspecified

name: Golem Arcana: Urugal Expansion – The Khan's Pyre
description: Spun from the bones of the once-living, the Golems of Arcanum Urugal are fearsome fighters designed to close with their enemies and batter them into submission.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Luna: Metal Coins
description:
The new content includes 93 Metal Moon Coins, Wooden Priestess Figure, 4 Oversized Wooden Preacher Novice Meeples, and 1 embroidered drawstring bag.

Featuring new game play rules:

The new priestess figure moves around within the temple itself, giving bonuses to adjacent novices at the end of each round.

The larger novice "preacher" figures give players extra strength on the islands.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Decrypto: AI Serial – Rob Daviau 01
description:
This is a set of 8 promo cards: 7 code cards and 1 card with the rules to play them solo or cooperatively designed by Rob Daviau.
As in the regular game, players are trying to intercept twice the code from this artificial intelligence (AI).

This small expansion was initially provided as a promo with the first copies of the game.

The words on these cards are different from those on Decrypto: AI Serial – Bruno Cathala 01
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Entropy: The Ronin expansion
description:
Entropy: The Ronin is an expansion for the card game Entropy. The expansion makes it possible to play as a new character: The Ronin. The goal of the Ronin player is different, it's about complete another player's world. To do so the Ronin can use Wild Fragments, but also have two unique character abilities (one more skill then the other players). Although the Ronin does not have an own world panorama, the two ability cards combine makes a panorama.

The expansion also adds a set of action cards to fully support six players.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows over the Empire: Azarias
description:
Azarias - The Conspirator

"Move all adjacent Character cards one position clockwise or counter-clockwise. Then, Rotate or Reset a Character card adjacent to Azarias."

This promo was given away at Spiel 2013 (Essen).
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Magiczny Miecz: Krypta Upiorów
description:
An expansion based again on underground movement for Magiczny Miecz.

Krypta Upiorow (Crypt of Wraiths) brings a new board and cards to encounter, new professions (few "Knights of Gods").

This is very diffucult expansion, specially because of different type of exploring the board.

It is playable without Magiczny Miecz, with special rules.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Treasure of the Silver Dragon
description:
Treasure of the Silver Dragon was MicroQuest #4 in the Metagaming MicroQuests series, programmed adventures for Melee and Wizard.

This one included a real world treasure hunt.

Expands:

Melee
Wizard
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Puzzle, Wargame

name: Pulp Invasion X2
description:
Sending down landing teams aids in your search for the Super Weapons to prevent the Cosmic Hegemony from their nefarious plans. Beware though of 3 new Vassal aliens who have joined the Hegemony to rule the galaxy.

The Pulp Invasion X2 expansion adds new exploration cards, new captains, a new crew die, and a helpful landing team.

For this expansion there are 2 new Captain cards that use the new Landing Crew die, 3 new Alien Vassals that affect game play while in the various Hegemony sectors. 2 new Planets to explore and 2 additional Super Weapons with new actions.

Additionally there are 8 new exploration cards, which change game replay-ability since you only deal a subset during the game. Most have beneficial actions and allow for greater player strategy.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Board Royale: The Island – NSFW Expansion Pack
description:
Dirty, naughty and bizarre. This is not Coral Island and we are not kids. We are adults. We have our own ways of fun! So get ready for a flavor that you've never seen! Did you get high on the island or lost in the realm? Who knows! who cares?
This expansion comes with 60 cards pack full of dirty fun, bad surprises and silly items. You will never know what comes next but can't wait either! There is also a party mode just perfect for this pack!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Deirdre's Detoxifying Draught
description:
The Red Dragon Inn Organized Play (Season 1, 2015) Participation Promo card.
"Drink:

+ 1 Alcohol Content, +3 Fortitude"

The Organized Play Kits each contained 4 Tournament Prize Packs, consisting of twenty participation cards to be handed out to anyone who attends (this one and Compulsive Gambler's Grog) and three premium cards to be handed out as prizes.

The 2023 re-release of the Organized Play Kit contains only 1 Tournament Prize Pack.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Master Dater: Big Love Edition
description:
The Gamefound Exclusive Edition of Master Dater! You want it all and you can have it. Includes all Master Dater unlocks (like the Uncut expansion). The NSFW expansion (in its packaging), added cards, love letter, stickers, pins and other, upcoming, unlocks will come packaged inside the Big Love box.

CONTENTS
Rule sheet
95 Head Cards
95 Body Cards
217 “Interest” Cards
72 Flames
72 Sparks
73 Hearts
The Master Dater "Uncut" Expansion
Dating Hazzard: 10 Love-Themed Joking Hazard Cards

Also includes ALL Master Dater unlocks!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Singapore: Essen 2011 bonus tiles
description:
Released in october 2011.

This free bonus contains 6 bonus tiles for Singapore (a Spiel 2011 release from White Goblin Games) for even more variation. It contains 4 buildings with legal activities and 2 with illegal activities.

Available through:
Essen 2011 Show: purchase of the Singapore in the White Goblin Games booth 5-01 in Hall 5 or as a pre-order at www.whitegoblingames.com/spiel
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Risk 2210 A.D. Frontline: Season One – Mars
description:
Do you have what it takes to become the Warlord of Mars?

FRONTLINE: SEASON ONE: MARS expands upon Risk 2210 A.D. by adding two new maps: Mars and the Martian Moons (Phobos and Deimos). The maps are based off of actual satellite photos captured by the Hubble telescope. Martian territories are named after the regions of Mars.

The core Risk 2210 A.D. rules are retained, but the Martian maps differ from the standard Earth map by adding new neutral territories. The neutral territories do not belong to any continent, so no continent bonus can be gained from having control of them.

Expands:


Risk 2210 A.D.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Trek 12: Philitrek
description:
Trek 12: Philitrek is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the authors and a gameshop with the participation of Martin Vidberg.

It consists in a new player board and new ways to score. Go on the conquest of the PhiliMountain with this new ascension.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Sports

name: Heroes Wanted: Walrus Promo Card
description: Walrus is a mutant hero that can gain the vigilante special action Press. The promo comes in every Kickstarter copy of Ninja Camp, also by Action Phase Games.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes of Metro City: Sidekicks and Storylines
description:
The Heroes of Metro City: Sidekicks and Storylines expansion adds new Sidekick Power cards to the City Supply and includes expansion rules for creating a Storyline Deck in the City Supply that will expand on your Hero's legend, both in the past and present!

Ever wanted to make your OWN Super-Powered Hero from the ground up? In Heroes of Metro City, YOU get to pick your Hero's powers, craft an origin story and then start kicking some evil villainous butt! Make a hero in just a few minutes and start battling an Archenemy and his army of henchmen who are out to destroy your beloved city.

In the Sidekicks and Storylines expansion, 160 new cards are added to the mix. There are 7 new Power cards, such as the electrifying Charged Grip which delivers more damage the more you build up your Energy first. It also contains 3 new Energy Sources, such as Metamorphosis, which rewards you with Plot Points (the game's currency) when you use energy-supplying Power cards (like Martial Arts Mastery or Accelerating Superspeed). Perhaps you're looking for more Archenemies to fight? Sidekicks and Storylines has three new terrifying masterminds of evil, including the murderous Killswitch Supreme, a cold fusion-powered cyborg who is only weakened when the Heroic team (that's you) fights as one.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Crossbows and Catapults: Castle Outposts
description:
Castle Outposts expansion adds two outposts to Crossbows and Catapults. The outpost acts like a Catapult in the game as well as a fortification.

The castle outposts are included in Base Toys "Grand Battle" set as well as one of the three Tomy Battlesets.

May be used in a standalone game or added to C&C basic set as an expansion.

CONTENTS:
2 outposts (1 each color), 8 warriors (4 each), 12 battle caroms, label sheet
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Ascension: Rise of Vigil – Tinkering Monk Promo Card
description:
Tinkering Monk was sent out to participating Game Day stores on June 2013.

Text on card:
Tinkering Monk - 3 Runes
Mechana Hero
"Gain 2 Runes. You may have each player gain Powers equal to the number of Mechana Constructs they control"
Reward: 2 Honour Crystals
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: When Darkness Comes: This Is Not Happening
description:
What if everything you thought was real was a figment of someone else's imagination?

This is an expansion for When Darkness Comes. If focuses on cybernetic/dreamworld themes where players are not limited by the laws of physics and even reality itself can be altered.

Components: 5 New Scenarios, 2 board tiles, 24 New encounter disks, a self contained GM run adventure and new rules additions
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Let's Kill: A Pretty Corpse
description:
It adds 55 new cards to mix into the base deck, adding to the stick-figure, serial killer mayhem. New cards include, "Aneurysm", "Election Tampering", "Self-Defense Classes", "Gary Coleman", "Plague Rats", "Sledgehammer", "Trunk of a Stolen Car", and more.

From the publisher's website (used with permission):

"Live fast, die young, make a PRETTY CORPSE"

Sporks and weed whackers just not enough for to slake your blood lust anymore? Looking for a little more madness in your mayhem? Just mix the 55 cards from A Pretty Corpse into your Let’s Kill deck and add even more distinctive stick figure art and gruesome humor to your next game... because the great thing about dead bodies is that you can make your own.

Expands

Let's Kill!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Murder/Mystery

name: Teomachia: Mitologia słowiańska
description:
When gods fight, the blood of simpletons flows freely. Teomachia lets you become one of the ancient gods and spend one hour playing the lord of a group of devoted followers. You have one goal and one goal only: Annihilate your foe's believers and thereby move yourself one step closer to absolute power.

Drafting prayer cards and power cards allows you to slowly build your might. Using those cards, you send your followers into battles, build temples, and inflict terrible curses on the unfaithful. You face a tough decision in every single hand: Should you put your own power on the line to help your believers win their battles, or should you turn your back on them, sending them to a certain death? If no god yields, hurricanes will face off with deathly plagues, tempests will extinguish walls of fire, and the ranks of the faithful will grow smaller every second. Once you get rid of your opponent's last prophet, it's time to rest and listen to the cheerful song of your people. You have won the clash of gods.

Teomachia: Mitologia słowiańska (Theomachy: Slavonic Mythology) is the first expansion. It introduces the Slavonic pantheon to the game previously consisting of four mythologies: Celtic, Greek, Norse and Sumerian. The expansion provides three new gods of Slavonic pantheon (Mokosh, Perun and Veles), as well as four additional gods to previously existing pantheons (one to each). Also in package are new Slavonic myth cards, myth cards from basic edition reprinted using improved graphics, a player aid card and a small expansion Priests, consisting of ten wooden discs representing priests with special abilities (for all 5 pantheons).
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Uchronia Promo Cards
description:
At the 2012 Essen Spiel, the following 5 promo cards will be given to customers that pre-order Uchronia:


Nursery
Ranch
Canal
Pterodrome
Embassy


The Uchronia Promo Cards are a set of 5 cards to be added to those in the Uchronia base game. They are simply shuffled in with the other building cards, adding more variety from game to game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Coupell
description:
Co-operate, making the longest words you can, whilst staying in balance.

In this game you are a team, trying to get the best score you can! Work together, re-arrange cards and make words to
score points. The goal is to score the most, whilst ensuring your score piles are perfectly balanced at the end!

You can only move your partner's cards, but must make words using your own. Making longer words scores more points, but an overly-full hand will make you lose.

In the end, it's all about the planning and communication.
categories: Card Game, Word Game

name: Cards Against Humanity: House of Cards Pack
description:
Someone in the Netflix marketing department had an epiphany: House of Cards and Cards Against Humanity both contain the word "cards." When we got a phone call from Netflix, we enthusiastically agreed that the two products indeed contain the word "cards." One month and many brainstorming sessions later, we completed the House of Cards Pack: 25 brand-new cards about power, politics, passive-aggressive handjobs, and other scenes that we can never unsee. - Cards Against Humanity

The expansion packs include Mad Libs-style quotes from House of Cards and ribs against Netflix itself, while the cards for filling in those blanks include the type of over-the-top inappropriateness you'd expect from the game — this time with just a bit of a political twist.

Though Netflix and Cards Against Humanity were initially giving out printed sets of the expansion pack for free, they ran out of stock after just two hours. However, you can print out a PDF of all the cards for free.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Kingsport Festival: Terrible Old Man Promo
description:
The Terrible Old Man Promo is a set of three promo cards which were given out for free at Conventions.

It includes:

a card with rules
The Terrible Old Man (replaces Ancient One Nr.10)
The Ancient House on Water Street (additional offboard location)
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based
publishers: IELLO Games, KOSMOS, Passport Game Studios, Stratelibri

name: Tank Battles: A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
description: This Panzer Grenadier scenario book is a first for the popular tactical combat series, a book of 48 new scenarios. The centerpiece is a special module on Operation Mars, the 1942 Soviet offensive in front of Moscow. Despite heroic sacrifices, the Red Army failed to break through the German lines. Thirty-four new scenarios show the desperate fighting in this sector. There are also articles on German helicopter development and the Austrian Federal Army of 1938, plus scenarios for Austrian units. Finally, a set of six scenarios covers Operation Little Saturn, the Soviet attack against the Italian Eighth Army launched at the same time as Operation Mars.
