The back cover includes full-color counters for Austrian units and three different kinds of German helicopter. This book is a must-have for all Panzer Grenadier fans.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Heroica: Ganrash
description:
The LEGO Heroica series represents a classic dungeon game. The players move through tunnels, collecting treasure and fighting enemies. Conflict is resolved by dice rolls; the die results can be a number or a symbol, which might allow the player to use a special weapon. Instead of a character sheet, the players have equipment "backpacks" which can be filled with weapons, potions, keys, etc, depending on what they find during their adventure.

Heroica: Ganrash is a mini-expansion set packaged in a polybag, which was exclusively sold at Toys-R-Us Canada stores in 2012. It includes gold swords ('Blades of Bounty'), a Luck Potion, a goblin warrior, and a goblin guardian. It can be combined with any or all of the other games in the Heroica series; it is not playable on its own.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hollywood: The Other Side of Hollywood
description:
The Other Side of Hollywood is a Kickstarter exclusive add-on which consists of 21 brand new cards. All of these cards have a special ability: you can pass a card to another player or you can use this card in your own movie.

Why would you want to pass the cards? Because they affect usual movie production rules and impose some limitations! Here is an example. Producer’s Son is not very skilled and he will decrease your box office with his terrible acting. However, he is still an Actor. The decision to keep him or to pass him is yours!

Art House Actress, on the other hand, is quite experienced but you can’t add any green crew cards to her movie. Why? Well, art house movies usually don’t need any special effects or anything that high budget team can offer.

If you got an “Other Side” card from another player you have to use it in your movie. You can’t get rid of it by discarding it! All of the “Other Side” cards have a ten-pointed star in the background to be easily recognizable.

The Other Side of Hollywood shows you the darker side of Hollywood but does it in a light-hearted manner. It is worth mentioning that all of the add-on’s cards are optional to use. You can add all of the new cards in to the deck or try any combinations.

More interaction to the game. More strategies to try. More interesting decisions to make!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Conquest of Speros: Lost Treasures Expansion
description:
The Lost Treasures expansion brings exciting changes to the land of Speros with two new artifacts, four new generals, and 24 new terrain cards.

Open up new avenues for conquering Speros with these lost treasures!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Lupin the 3rd: The Expansion #1
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Lupin the 3rd: The Expansion #1 includes two new adventures for Lupin III in search of priceless treasures: Julius Caesar's golden coins and Excalibur, King Arthur's sword. In order to steal them, the gang must face tireless Inspector Zenigata again, who has made their capture his reason for existence.

This expansion integrates with the base game and increases the possibilities and the strategies with new equipment, vehicles and rules that can also be used in the base game. The characters' characteristics are strengthened and renewed with new cards, including five special cards which make Lupin more elusive, Jigen more infallible, Goemon more inflexible, Zenigata more stubborn, and Fujiko more unreliable and undressed than ever.

A milestone of the new imperfect cooperative game style, Lupin the 3rd shows in these new missions a variable and unpredictable structure for a profound and unique game experience!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Rush & Bash: Monster Chase
description:
Description from the publisher:

Rush & Bash: Monster Chase is the second expansion for Rush & Bash, the game about a crazy race set in the same world of games like Vudù, GodZ, and the Super Fantasy series.

This expansion transforms the base game into a fully cooperative experience and the game heaviness switches from casual to strategy-oriented.

Instead of bashing each other out of the road, players must now join forces in order to exorcise a feral spirit that possessed an old, abandoned vehicle. The monster truck, jeep, motorcycle and locomotive are running amok across the dirty roads of Baruffus, destroying ancient temples, frightening the local fauna and devouring harmless nature spirits.
Are you able to momentary put away your grudges in order to chase and chastise the monster before it crosses the finishes lane?

Monster Chase comes with 4 new double-faced track tiles, a co-op version of the 8 existing characters, 4 different monsters and 2 decks of tarot-sized cards that determines the monster's behavior and supernatural tricks.
categories: Fantasy, Humor, Racing
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Catan: Catan Day 2015 Exclusive Expansion
description:
The Catan Day 2015 Special is an expansion for Catan. This is an exclusive item only available to the attendees of Catan Day 2015. It commemorates the first annual Catan Con in Nashville TN.

You use this expansion with the Catan base game, the expansions Catan Seafarers, and Catan Cities & Knights. You can also play with the 5-6 player expansions for all the games and expansions mentioned.

Game Components:
2 Nashville Hexes
1 Lonely Cowboy game piece in 2 parts
Rule Sheet

Setting up the Game

Remove the Desert Hex from the game and replace it with the Broadway Hex. Build your board by randomly distributing terrain hexes, while ensuring that the broadway hex is in the center of the island.

Place the number tokens according to the game rules. Replace the terrain hex that receives the "2" token with the Gaylord Opryland hex and remove the "2" token as well.

Since neither Nashville hex has a number token, they do not produce resources when the dice are rolled.

The Lonely Cowboy

When the lonely cowboy visits you, he will sing for his supper and you will gladly pay him.

He consists of 2 parts. Slide both parts together so the musical notes are facing each other. The lonely cowboy replaces the robber. Place him on the Broadway hex during setup.

Advantage of the Nashville Hexes

Whenever you roll a "7", the usual actions are carried out normally. (Discards (if any), move the cowboy, "sing" for a card etc.). Then before you take the rest of your turn, activate the lonely cowboy.

The lonely cowboy gives one resource from the bank to each player with one or more settlements on a Nashville hex intersection (even if you have 2+ settlements/cities, you only get one card). You receive the card type matching the terrain hex the Lonely cowboy currently occupies.

Important: Once the lonely cowboy leaves the broadway hex, it can never be placed on either Nashville hex for the rest of the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Ember: From the Ashes
description:
Description from the publisher:

From the Ashes is an expansion to the popular card game: Ember.

Containing 55 all new and gorgeous cards, From the Ashes expands the gameplay by giving you many more options, including:

26 - Creature cards designed to enhance gameplay and supercharge your strategies.
12 - Legendary God cards: ultra powerful creatures with epic powers; combine all three aspects and gain their legendary ability.
7 - Wizard cards: the magical professors of Alastor's Academy, each with a powerful speciality; use it and the wizard is depleted for the rest of the game.
5 - Artifact cards: powerful equipment with multiple abilities.

There are countless new strategies and even more beautiful cards to look at with From the Ashes.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Memory, Mythology
mechanics: Memory, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Zombie Taxi Drivers
description: A Kickstarter exclusive add-on reward, of five alternative Class I ghosts.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Easy Street (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
A print and play expansion for T.I.M.E Stories.

Salvage Series: The Agency is facing budget cuts. You need to complete a series of covert missions to salvage the resources necessary to keep the operation running.

Easy Street Mission: Getting the largest pile of gold in history makes sense, but why is it in a small town suburb in 1952...?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Dungeon Busters: Power Pack
description: Dungeon Busters: Power Pack is a mini-expansion for Dungeon Busters that allows players to play a special card once per game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Warhammer 40,000 Battle Manual
description:
Between the original Warhammer Rogue Trader, released in 1987, and Warhammer 40,000 second edition in 1993, Games Workshop released the Battle Manual. This book combined most of the Rogue Trader rules, with an overhauled combat system and with new rules for shooting. The book also included most of the new weapons that had been published in White Dwarf during the five years for Rogue Trader.

One might argue that this book is REALLY Warhammer 40,000 second edition, but that would conflict with the system numbering that is widely accepted.

The 96-page book has 18 pages of rules, 68 pages of weapon stats, 4 pages of catalog, and 8 pages of pull out charts.

Expands:
Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Pirate Dice: Rough Waters Expansion
description:
This expansion adds 2 double-sided maps to expand your sailing horizons, as well as rules for a fifth player (included on the reverse side of the Rough Waters rules).

Great Horn: A long hook that bottlenecks navigation -- especially around map layouts with corners.

Cape of Lost Hope: A more difficult version of Great Horn that removes a center island, but adds some wind and waves.

Maelstrom: Arrr! What a tempest! This highly directional map will add some serious challenge to pilots who wish to navigate its waters -- especially if you're trying to tack against the wind!

King of the Sea -- Place a treasure-marker in the bottom-right corner, and have a whole new challenge to navigate! Players must use ingenuity and opportunity in order to race to the corner of the map, and whoever is able to stay afloat will be crowned King of the Sea!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: Draco Magi: Celestial Dragon and Alternate Art The Lake Promo Cards
description:
An add-on during Draco Magi's Kickstarter campaign, you received 2 copies of the Celestial Dragon and 1 alternate art "The Lake" battlefield card.

These will be available through CoolStuffInc

Celestial Dragon's Text:
At the start of melee, the Celestial Dragon allows you to discard up to 3 battle cards and draw an equal number of new battle cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting
publishers: Grey Fox Games, Robert Burke Games

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module F1 – The Jindarians
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

This module adds rules, ships, and scenarios for the Jindarians.

Publisher Blurb:

The Jindarians have been in space, flying huge ships built from hollow asteroids, for 100,000 years. They care little about borders, governments, and wars and just travel from system to system, mining asteroid belts. They push aside any competition using their warp augmented railguns to fire thousands of cubic meters of gravel and rock at your ship. This is the 2005 update of the original 1995 product with extra SSDs and several rules changes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Elixir: Mandragore
description:
This second expansion for Elixir provide some new spells and magic items.

The big improvement is "places" (cards giving to his owner a free component) and panels (cards indicate if a place is open or not)

This expansion no longer exist alone. You can find it in the box called 'la Compil' with the two others expansion.

Expands

Elixir
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Claim: Storage Box
description:
This sturdy box is large enough to hold lots of CLAIM cards with or without sleeves, with room to spare.

There are different sizes of compartments that can hold different number of cards.

The box also includes the 1st Scenario Card + 2 limited edition all-new 10 card promo sets (Awakeners and Satyrs)!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
publishers: SD Games, Vagabund, White Goblin Games

name: Superfight Superbox
description: The Superbox is the ultimate storage solution for the discerning SUPERFIGHT collector. With space for over 1800 cards, you’ll be able to fit all of our current decks plus four expansions that don’t exist yet! The Superbox also comes with twenty exclusive “Super Cards” to spice up your game, twenty double-sided score keeping chits for when you’re feeling competitive, and six blank deck boxes to stop your cards from sliding around like peasants.
categories: Fighting, Humor, Party Game

name: Wrong Chemistry: Element Expansion
description: Wrong Chemistry: Element Expansion includes ten cards that feature periodic table elements not included in the base Wrong Chemistry game. Mix these cards with the Elements of the Basic game in order to create a wide range of cards which will offer you more choices on how to form more molecules in the same turn!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: San Guo Sha: Fire
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




User Summary:

This is the second character expansion of San Guo Sha, aka Killers of the Three Kingdoms. As a character expansion, this expansion introduces 8 new character cards but no new playing cards.

In addition, this expansion also includes 2 Demi-God characters like the Wind expansion, randomly inserted into some boosters. Rarity is unknown.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Die Steinmauer (fan expansion for Carcassonne: Die Jäger und Sammler)
description:
Carcassonne: Die Steinmauer (The Stone Wall) is an unofficial expansion to Carcassonne: Hunters and Gatherers, created by JeuxParJe and is part of the Carcassonne series. It is available as a free download. The stone wall replaces the start tile and spans 12 tiles, as Carcassonne: The River does for Carcassonne. Since the tiles have no beginning or end, they may be played in any order, simply extending the wall.

Carcassonne: Die Steinmauer includes rules for Stone Wall & Scout, a variant of the Carcassonne: King & Scout expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Prehistoric, Print & Play

name: Pocket Imperium: Mech Worlds
description:
Pocket Imperium: Mech Worlds is a promo tile for Pocket Imperium, it adds more variety and a different way to take advantage of Expand and Explore actions.

Just before placing the 6 standard sector tiles around Tri-Prime, randomly select one to remove, and replace it with the Mech World sector tile. Complete the rest of game setup normally.

Yellow Mech Worlds
These systems have been completely taken over by self-replicating machines that will help whoever is controlling them to rapidly construct fleets. If, during the execution of an Expand action, a player adds one or more ships in a hex containing a yellow Mech World, 1 additional ship (if available) may be added. Yellow Mech Worlds have a system value of 0. This means that 0 points are scored for controlling them during the Exploit phase and only 1 ship may remain there at the end of a round.

Blue Mech Worlds
Endowed with life forms that thrive in the low-density atmosphere of these worlds, these systems and their launch facilities allow fleets that launch from them to rapidly reach deep space. If, during the execution of an Explore action, a player begins movement of a fleet from a blue Mech World, the fleet being moved may move 1 additional hex this turn.
categories: Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 10 Minute Heist: Scarab
description:
Kickstarter limited exclusive.

"Until the start of your next turn, players may not steal cards from the floor your Thief token occupies."
categories: Card Game, Fantasy
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection
publishers: Chronicle Games (Board Game), Daily Magic Games, Schwerkraft-Verlag

name: Coup: Socialist
description:
Dice Tower Season 13 kickstarter on Indiegogo

Provided x5 Socialist cards that can replace the Ambassador role.
categories: Bluffing

name: Catan Länderszenarien: Polen
description:
A special map for playing CATAN. The map displays Poland with some information about the major cities and Poland.
It's a pre-printed map and you need the original game to play.

The game follows the usual Catan rules with some differences:
- Players may only build cities in the round intersections denoting actual cities.
- Players can only build streets on pre-printed places. You have to build a settlement on the actual cities before placing another street.
- Instead of harbors there are some cities where a player can trade in 3:1 or 2:1.
- Victory points can be obtained by building the first road onto a "victory point crossing." These points are indicated by tokens (e.g. from the Catan: Seafarers expansion) placed there. Only with 3 or 4 players.
- The robber starts next to the board.

A player wins the game if it's his or her turn:
- 3 players - 13 victory points
- 4 players - 12 victory points
- 5 or 6 players - 10 victory points
categories: Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Munchkin Quest: Promo Coaster 1
description:
From Steve Jackson Games:

The first Munchkin Quest Promo Coaster gives you the choice of two bonuses: quaff an ale in the Tavern and get a health point back, or drink a potion from the Lab when you're down to one point and get them all back.

And, as an added bonus, it keeps your game table dry.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor

name: L'osti d'jeu: extension Denis Drolet
description:
Enter the Denis's head! The Denis Drolet expansion of L'Osti d'Jeu plunges you into the twisted universe of your favorite brown stars. It includes 70 cards written by the Denis and 10 empty cards to write your own nonsense.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Entrez dans la tête des Denis! L’extension Denis Drolet de L’Osti d’Jeu vous plonge dans l’univers tordu de vos vedettes brunes préférées. Elle inclut 70 cartes écrites par les Denis et 10 cartes vides pour écrire vos propres absurdités.

—description from the publisher (French)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Cards Against Humanity: The Human Pack
description:
This year for Black Friday, we taught a computer how to write Cards Against Humanity cards. Now we put it to the test. Over the next 16 hours, our writers will battle this powerful card-writing algorithm to see who can write the most popular new pack of cards. If the writers win, they’ll get a $5,000 holiday bonus. If the A.I. wins, we’ll fire the writers.

The Human Pack consists of 30 beautiful cards about the human condition straight from the hearts of our human writers.

UPDATE: The writers sold 2% more packs, so their jobs will be replaced by automation later instead of right now. Happy Holidays.

—description from the publisher (from Black Friday, 29th November 2019)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Bohnanza: Das Fanbuch
description:
This book describes the history and the different editions of Bohnanza and its Sequels.

There are also rules included for 2 players for the following games:
Bohnanza, Bohnanza Erweiterungs Set, La Isla Bohnita, High Bohn, Mutabohn, Ladybohn, Bohnaparte, Telebohn, Rabohnzel, Bohnröschen

Solitaire rules for the following games:
Bohnanza, Bohnanza Erweiterungs Set, La Isla Bohnita, Al Cabohne, Mutabohn, Ladybohn, Bohnröschen, and Space beans.
categories: Book, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Negotiation

name: The Voting Game: NSFW Expansion
description:
An expansion so rotten we’re afraid for your friendships. These questions will make your squirm in your seat and laugh uncontrollably.

Ever wonder which of your friends comments on the most porn videos? Or who has spent the most time grooming their pubic hair? There’s only one way to find out!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Myth: Quest Expansion 1
description: A small deck of cards containing new quests for Myth. These cards get shuffled into the existing deck.
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: The Brigade: The Way of the Wardens
description:
The Way of the Wardens expansion for The Brigade adds five new ways to play and a host of content add-ons including:

-Co-op mode: Team up with up to three friends to save Tinderbox.
-Solo mode: Go it alone for all the glory.
-All versus one mode: It's the Pyromancer against the Wardens in a four-player or five-player team competition.
-"The Rise of the Phoenix" campaign: Take on this four chapter campaign in co-op or solo mode and stop the evil Cult of the Cuckoo from summoning the dreaded phoenix!

-The Tinderbox Night Wardens: Choose from five new wardens to lead your crew to victory!
-Big buildings pack: Expand the town with eight new special locations!
-New crew members: Beef up your crew with six new recruits
-New brigade equipment: Visit the Firehouse Forge and buy a host of helpful items to use in co-op and solo games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Neuroshima Hex! Babel13 Artillery Outpost "THUNDER"
description:
The Artillery Outpost "THUNDER" is a special double-tile terrain supplement for Neuroshima Hex and Neroshima Hex: Babel13!. It was a promotion piece provided at Spiel 2008 and then added to the Neroshima Hex Babel13 expansion (only preorder).

"THUNDER" is a special terrain element. "THUNDER" covers two hexes. Place a Turret tile on one of the 2 hexes. "THUNDER" is armed with this Turret.

If a player occupies the second hex (the steering wheel) with a friendly unit, he can rotate the Turret during his turn. During a Battle the Turret does damage to every unit hit by it (no matter if its your or enemy unit).

The Unit which steers "THUNDER" does not perform any other action during the battle. If the steering unit dies or leaves the hex, "THUNDER" is unoccupied. The next player who moves a Unit there will gain control of "THUNDER". If during a battle nobody controls "THUNDER", the Turret attacks automatically in the direction it is aimed.

"THUNDER" can not be destroyed; you can only kill the unit that controls it. Features as Terrain: Turret, Control Panel.

Expands:

Neuroshima Hex! 3.0
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: La Guerre des Moutons 2
description: An aquatic extension to Wooly Bully. This expansion adds 24 new tiles with water element in them. Pastures can now be enclosed also with lakes. Closed pasture scores also the fish in closed lake adjacent to it - unless fisherman is placed on the lake. This is similar to wolves in the base game.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle

name: Dungeon Roll Hero: Time Traveler
description: The Time Traveller is a bonus hero that was first made available with the Eminent Domain: Microcosm kickstarter campaign. The Time Traveller has a pre-set party rather than rolling for companions at the start of a delve.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Timeline: Polska – Gdańsk
description:
You probably know the date of the Battle of Cedynia, but will you guess the date of the founding of the Free City of Gdansk?
 
There are 10 cards that deal with the events of over a thousand years of history in the region. Thanks to them you will get to know the history of Poland more and you will increase the attractiveness of the basic version of the game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Zapewne znasz datę Bitwy pod Cedynią, ale czy odgadniesz datę powstania Wolnego Miasta Gdańska?
Przed Wami 10 kart, które dotyczą wydarzeń związanych z ponad tysiącletnią historią regionu. Dzięki nim jeszcze lepiej poznacie historię naszej ojczyzny i zwiększycie atrakcyjność podstawowej wersji gry!

—description from the publisher (Polish)
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Posthuman: BGG Promo Cards
description: This 5 card set includes 2 new followers (The Hunter and The Hound) and 3 new weapons (Ripper Jack, FABS - Executioner, and The Rapier). These 5 cards were given to ALL Kickstarter supporters and are only available now via the BGG Store or possibly via the publishers at tradeshows.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
publishers: Mighty Boards, Mighty Box (Mighty Box Games), Mr. B Games

name: Yvio: Octago
description:
Octago is a game for the Yvio Boardgame Console. An Yvio Console is needed to play.

In Octago you move around the board trying to pick up points. The board consists of 12 spaces showing each a symbol in a certain color. The longer nobody steps on a space, symbol, or color, the more points you get for entering the space. The console does all the bookkeeping, which makes the complex scoring mechanism possible.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Electronic, Memory
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Munchkin 4.5
description: It is the Italian version of The Wicked Munchkin Die that besides the D10 Wicked Dice and the Bag includes 20 cards in Italian. Part of the cards are translation of promo cards and partly unique Italian cards like the Maledition "Tretatre Trentini".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Mint Works: Tantrum House Intern Promo Card
description:
A single promo card. Location on one side and AI on the other side.

Originally available as part of the Tantrum House Season 6 Kickstarter campaign, under the name "Dan the Intern/House of Tantrum".

Later available unbranded under the name "David the Intern/Work Study" as part of the Kickstarter campaigns of other games in the Mint series.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Trial by Trolley: Thank You Exclusive Pack
description:
20 modifier cards exclusive to the backers of the kickstarter campaign.

Marked "TY"
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Spain and Portugal
description:
Spain and Portugal is an Europa module covering Spain and Portugal during World War II: it consists of a map, counters, and chart set.

The 21" x 27" map covers the Iberian Peninsula from Portugal to Spain's Ebro Valley, linking with westernmost Spain on The Fall of France (Europa VIII) map. The map, at the standard Europa scale of 16 miles per hex, displays the wide variety of terrain types of Spain, from the many mountainous regions to the occasional lowland swamp.

The 240 counters cover the armed forces of Spain and Portugal at Europa scales. Ground units are divisions, brigades, regiments, and battalions. Air units represent groups of 40 to 60 aircraft, organized by model and type, such as HE 111B bombers, Spitfire V fighters, and JU 52 transports. Naval units represent individual large warships and flotillas of smaller vessels. The counters also include the British garrison at Gibralter and other British forces for use in the Battle for Spain scenario.

The charts include the Europa mobilization schedules for Spain and Portugal, and the Battle for Spain scenario.

Game Components:

One 21" x 27" Map (Europa Map 23)
240 Die-cut Counters (Counter Sheet #43)
One Chart Set
One Europa Scenario
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Arnhem: The Third Bridge
description:
"Arnhem: The Third Bridge is an Advanced Squad Leader module that depicts the battle for the bridge made famous in print and film by Cornelius Ryan's 'A Bridge Too Far'.

The British insisted that their airborne division take on the toughest assignment at the very point of the 60-mile salient which was Operation Market Garden. Montgomery said the operation was a 'springboard for a powerful full-blooded thrust to the heart of Germany.' But the plan had one fatal flaw: Allied intelligence had reported few German units in the vicinity of Arnhem--but it turned out that two SS Panzer divisions and Field-Marshal Walther Model, known as the 'Fuhrer's Firemen' were awaiting the British at ground zero. The one British battalion which was able to fight its way to the bridge was cut off, becoming 'a collection of individuals holding on' awaiting relief that would never arrive.

Arnhem: The Third Bridge includes a well-researched historical game map of the battlefield, eight new scenarios and a Platoon Leader 2.x campaign game. You will also receive extensive new rules providing the flavor of the battlefield and its combatants, including high walls, a new form of breach, and SS engineers. As a special bonus, ATB includes a sheet of color, die-cut game pieces providing Red Devil squads and SMC counters for historical leaders including Colonel Frost and armor leader Captain Grabner. Everything is included to play using your existing rulebook and game pieces. (Ownership of Beyond Valor and West of Alemein are necessary to play this game)."
Note the countersheet was a limited time offer with the first edition and was not included in the later 2nd edition of this game.
Module requires Beyond Valor and West of Alemein or For King and Country.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Elixir: Alchimie
description:
This third expansion for Elixir provide new mechanism.

Special cards are put on the middle of the table to form 5 alchemical formula (ex : dragon breath + fairy powder = effect).

This expansion no longer exist alone. You can find it in the box called 'la Compil' with the two others expansion.

Expands

Elixir
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Munchkin Cthulhu: Dice of Doom
description:
OverviewThe Munchkin Cthulhu Dice of Doom are produced by Q-workshop under license from Steve Jackson Games for the game Munchkin Cthulhu. It contains 1 D10, 2 D6s, and a dice bag with a picture of Cowthulhu.



Publisher's DescriptionMunchkins, meet your greatest challenge yet... the evil minions of Cthulhu! Will you survive? Will you retain your sanity? Will you... roll some Dice of Doom? Munchkin Cthulhu Dice of Doom have some special rules you can use during your game, to kill some Cthulhu monsters, steal their treasures, gain more levels, go mad and win! Because Madness doesn't matter. Winning matters!



Special rulesMunchkin Cthulhu d6 rules: Not usable by a Cultist. Reroll any Cthulhu die just rolled. Become a Cultist. Cannot be used if no Cultist card is available.

Munchkin Cthulhu d10 rules: Not usable by a Cultist. Use when you are about to die. Roll this die. If you roll higher than your level you stay alive, otherwise lose an additional level and die. Become a Cultist. Cannot be used if no Cultist card is available.



OtherPart of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor

name: Brettspiel Easter Basket 2016
description:
Brettspiel Easter Basket 2016 contains eight new expansions for eight games from eight publishers.

All expansions take the form of punch-out counters, except the colt express expansion, which is a mini game board.


Snowdonia: Wagons Expansion - a collection of 9 wagon tiles, which you can buy using the build action. Each awards a different end-game bonus.
Antarctica: Penguin Expansion - 8 identical counters, representing the extra point earned by the player who comes first in an area.
Haus Der Sonne: Lava Tiles Mini Expansion - 6 lava tiles.
My Village: Vagrants Expansion - 4 vagrants, distributed randomly to players grant a unique one-shot special ability, and a 5th "wandering" Itinerant Preacher tile which accumulates story points and passes to whichever player had the last death in their village.
Imperial Settlers: Council Promo - During the production phase, if all players agree put a meeple on the council tile, each player draws 1 faction card and the meeples go back to the supply.
Colt Express: Rock Promo - This Rock decoration can be used to place your common deck during your Colt Express games.
T.I.M.E Stories: Beacon Promo - 3 "beacon" tokens which you can spend to skip spending time points when you change location.
Dream Islands: Package Trip Promo - Each player gets a set of 3 tiles, each tile can be played once per game, and affects your move


This package also contains the microgame WH1CH GAM3 from Jürgen Karla and Oliver Grimm that can be played in order to determine which game should be played next.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Drecksau Total
description:
Only a dirty pig is a happy pig!

In Drecksau, each player has 3-5 clean pigs in front of him and three cards in hand. Each turn one card is played. By playing a mud card, one pig can be sent into the mud. The pig card is flipped over to show a dirty pig on the back. Rain cards clean all pigs, even your own! Barn cards protect pigs from the rain, while lightning cards destroy barns – but lightning rod cards protect barns from lightning cards. Farmer cards can be sent to dirty pigs: the farmer likes clean pigs... Pigs in a barn that are protected with a lock card are safe from the farmer. The first player who has dirtied all of his pigs wins!

Drecksau Total is 10 years anniversary edition in the practical Open & Play Magnetbox, includes two new action cards (extra mud and lipstick) and both the Drecksau base game and the Sauschön expansion that lets players decide how they want to participate in the pig parade, whether with full makeup and styling fit for a beauty pageant or a more traditional wallow in the mud.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game

name: Killer Bunnies Bunny Blanks #1
description:
The Bunny Blanks series introduces new cards and a new mechanic to the Killer Bunnies franchise as well as stickers and cardstock that will allow players to make their own cards.

Bunny Blanks #1 contains two Psi series cards, Spider Bunny and Bunny Eye for the Carrot Guy. These cards introduce the Kite and Arrow mechanic which will allow players to play these cards out of turn or move bunnies around the bunny circle when the arrow/kite colors match.

Expands:

Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Atta Ants: Expansion
description:
The expansion set for Atta Ants, providing twigs (movable paths), tunnels and rocks (path blockers).

Expands:

Atta Ants
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: The Haunting House 4: They Just Don't Build 'Em Like They Used To
description:
From the publisher's website:

The house doesn’t look like it’s going to be standing much longer and the only place you haven’t explored is...
The basement! Not that you haven’t tried. You just haven’t found the key. It has to be in the house somewhere, doesn’t it?
You and your hoodlum friends have decided to hit the Breitenstein house one last time. This time around the goal is the same...Well, there might be one slight difference... Unlocking the basement seems to have set something free...something evil!!!
The Haunting House 4 adds new strategic elements, Hidden bonuses and Automatically collapsing halls

Expands

The Haunting House
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror

name: Warhammer (Fifth Edition): Circle of Blood
description:
A campaign pack for 5th edition Warhammer: The Mass Combat Fantasy Roleplaying Game (1st Edition), Circle of Blood introduces a linked series of scenarios featuring the Bretonnian and Undead armies.

Extra rules and special characters are introduced in the campaign pack. Box contents consist of the campaign rulebook; 4 battle scrolls for each player; a roster pad and card buildings used in the scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Dark Darker Darkest: Radioactive Expansion
description:
This expansion to Dark Darker Darkest adds RadioactiveRed zombies and introduces a new scenario and new zombie abilities to the base game. Note that Dark Darker Darkest: Kickstarter Special already included a playable version on this expansion but did not include any of the "RadioactiveRed" creature or zombie miniatures.

It contains:

66 RadioactiveRed Miniatures (7 survivors [with colored bases], 4 nemeses, 5 creatures, and 50 zombies [10 of each of Standards, Guts, Disco Dolls, Chunk, and Tuff Guy])
10 Expansion Specific Equipment Cards
1 Reactor Room Tile
27 Radiation Markers
Rulebooks (1 English, 1 German, and 1 Spanish)
categories: Zombies

name: Napoleon's War: Battle Pack II – America's War
description:
From the publisher's website:

Includes four battles from the American War of 1812: Queenston Heights, Chippawa, Bladensburg and New Orleans. Each battle has it's own game board on card stock. The battle pack requires ownership of Napoleon's War Vol. I to play.

This Battle Pack uses the plastic miniatures from Napoleon's War Volume I: The 100 Days but provides custom game boards and battle rules for each of the four battles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Car Wars Expansion Set #8, Chopper Challenge
description:
"Nineteen full-color counters - helicopters, 'grasshoppers', pedestrians, and wrecks. Two color 21x32 inch wilderness maps. And five scenarios to get you off the ground! You need the Car Wars Deluxe Edition to play Chopper Challenge. You can also use this set with the basic Car Wars Pocket Box game, if you have the helicopter rules from Autoduel Champions and/or the off-road rules from The AADA Vehicle Guide."

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
The AADA Vehicle Guide
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Auf der schwäb'schen Eisenbohn
description:
Die schwäb'sche Eisenbohn (The Swabian Bean railway) cruises between 5 Swabian cities, giving players different incentives to sell their beans early... or not.

A new 33-card Bohnanza expansion that premiered at Essen in 2008.

Part of the Bohnanza family of games.

Expands:

Bohnanza
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Negotiation

name: Trivial Pursuit: RPM Edition
description:
This is an card set expansion to Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition containing musical questions with the following categories:

Cover Notes
Your Mother Should Know
Fifties
Sixties
After The Beatles
Anything Goes
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Munchkin Beisst! 1+2
description:
It's the World of Dorkness!

The Munchkins are now vampires, werewolves and changelings. Bash through the haunted house and slay the monsters – the other monsters, that is. You can't slay your fellow munchkins, but you can curse them, send foes at them, and take their stuff.

Munchkin Bites! is a standalone game, which can be combined with other Munchkin games. With illustrations John Kovalic, you'll see Igor, Gilly, and all the other Dork Tower characters in their munchkin-vampire finery, so bring along your Coffin (+3!) and wield The Sword Of Beheading People Just Like In That Movie. Face foes like the Banshee, the Heck Hounds, and the dreaded Were-Muskrat. Smite them all, and be the first to Level 10...

This edition of Munchkin Beisst! includes the first expansion – Pants Macabre/Höllenhose – in addition to the base game.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Gear & Piston: Overheated
description:
The second mini-expansion to Gear & Piston, it contains 2 Explosion tiles.

The two Explosion tiles are shuffled into the bottom half (roughly estimated) of the Junk Parts deck. If an Explosion tile emerges from the deck when refilling the Junk Yard the effect takes place immediately and the Explosion is resolved.

If a player draws an Explosion tile when drawing blind, then the player may decide to do one of the following:
1. Resolve the explosion immediately by showing it to all players and draw a new tile from the Junk Parts deck.
or
2. Keep the tile in hand for later use.
When a player decides to keep the tile in hand, then the player may then decide to discard it or resolve it during the “Adjust Volatility and discard a Blueprint” part of the “II. Resolve Actions” phase. If the tile is not used during the game, then it has no effect.

When an Explosion tile emerges from the Junk Yard deck or is revealed from a player’s hand, an explosion occurs. Players having the automobiles with the most Volatility must discard a part from their automobile. A player may choose the part to be removed but a junk part must be chosen if there are any in the automobile.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Munchkin Quest: Gold Piece
description:
From Steve Jackson Games:
Gold is awesome. How do you make gold more awesome?

Well, we've done it. Here's a gold piece you can spend over and over again.

Each player may use one, and only one, Munchkin Quest Gold Piece in a game of Munchkin Quest. It replaces one of your 100-gold pieces at the start of a game. It is considered a Magic Shiny. Place the gold piece in front of you with the "100" side up. Any time you spend gold, you may flip the gold piece over to the Munchkin side and count it as 100. If the Munchkin side is up at the beginning of your turn, flip the gold piece back to the 100 side. If any rule would make you lose the gold piece, it remains yours, but you cannot use it for the rest of the game.

How awesome is that?
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor

name: Coven: The Village
description:
From the box:

Coven: The Village adds a less abstract to your game of coven, with more flavor and storytelling. The game is set in early 16th-Century Europe, where you are a practicing witch living in a small village not too far from Innsbruck, Austria. Martin Luther has recently posted his 95 theses, setting off the firestorm of religious wars known as the Reformation. Malleus Mallificarum has been published and, although condemned by the church, is widely used in the persecution of witches.

Coven: The Village includes a new rotating Inner Wheel to replace the one from the base game. It also adds 36 Village Cards the replace the original Balance Cards, and a Village card is read when the new Inner Wheel triggers the Full Moon. Suspicion Tokens track how suspicious the villagers are of each player, and are gained whenever you increase Balance. Suspicion may also gain Personal Edict Cards, which are penalties that last for the remainder of the game, and may even prevent you from winning unless certain conditions are met. Coven: The Village also includes 36 Village Cards, 15 Personal Edict Cards, 30 Suspicion Tokens, 5 new Reference Cards, Rules, a six sided die, and an additional spindle.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Negotiation

name: Tabu: Deine Tabu Special-Edition
description:
Just start and get into the party game. Re-experience Tabu. This little edition of cards (22 cards of double-sided cards with terms and one rule card) is a stand-alone playable game of Tabu. It can also be used as very small expansion to the base game.

It has quick and easy rules like just set up two teams and explain the card given from the other team to your team members in 30 seconds. If you did it successfully your team scores 1 point; if not, or if you use one of the "Tabuwords", you get nothing.

(from back of the box and user summary)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: The Haunting House 3: A Ghost Story
description:
The House has fought back, and now your friends don't look so good...

This expansion contains: 16 Board Tiles, 12 additional cards, new rules and 6 CUSTOM SCULPTED GHOSTS.

Expands

The Haunting House
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Racing

name: Escape Room: The Game
description:
Similar to Escape Room: The Game, but 2 games have been replaced with ones that were originally sold as expansions.

Welcome to Funland and Murder Mystery have replaced Nuclear Countdown and Temple of the Aztec. Prison Break and Virus are still included.
categories: Electronic, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: San Guo Sha: Wind
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.





This is the first expansion of San Guo Sha, aka Killers of the Three Kingdoms. As a character expansion, this expansion introduces 8 new character cards but no new playing cards. In addition, this expansion also includes 2 Demi-God characters randomly inserted into some boosters. Rarity is unknown.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Star Trek HeroClix: Tactics 2
description:
Star Trek HeroClix: Tactics 2 puts you in command of some more Federation and Klingon vessels, and also adds a range of new races like Romulan, Cardassian, Dominion, Ferengi, and Vulcans. Is 100% compatible with the HeroClix core rules system. Tactics 2 and Tactics 1 are intended as a standalone game system. So even though Tactics operates by the same rules and Powers and Abilities that other HeroClix minitaure games are played with, it is played as its own game. (Eg. No Spiderman Vs USS Enterprise. There's Star Trek HeroClix: Away Team for that)

Tactics 2 features more than 30 pre-painted ships and will be available for sale in both a 4-Ship starter product and single figure boosters.
categories: Collectible Components, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pick-a-Polar Bear: Pig and Dog Expansion
description:
Expansion contains three additional cards with elements common with Pick-a-Pig and Pick-a-Dog games. As those cards are rare and hard to match with other cards from the base game, players get more (2 or 3) points for them.

The fourth card contains instruction with illustration of all cards matching with the expansion.

This expansion was published as a promo for the SPIEL 2013. Fair's name and date is printed on the instruction card.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Gear & Piston: Engineer Assistants
description:
The first mini-expansion to Gear & Piston, it contains 10 Engineer Assistant tiles.

At the start of the game each player is dealt one random Engineer Assistant tile. The players may look at the assistant tile they received but the tile is kept secret from other players. The tiles are placed face-down on the table, with the 1VP scoring symbol facing up.

Each Engineer Assistant has a unique special ability that may be used only once during a game. The special ability can be used by turning the assistant tile face-up thus revealing the assistant to the other players. An unrevealed Engineer Assistant is worth 1 VP at the end of the game.

Each tile is revealed either at the start of the round or at any time. If multiple assistants are revealed simultaneously, they are resolved in turn order starting from the first player.

Each portrait on each tiles will bear the likeness of a Gear & Piston Kickstarter backer.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Walk the Plank! Ghost Meeple Mini-Expansion
description:
By very popular demand Mayday is making this really silly and totally unauthorized (by the designer) expansion available. The ghost meeple will be awarded to the first pirate who is fully eliminated from the game. (All 3 pirates are out.)

This player will continue to push/shove and generally cause mayhem with his ghost pirate, haunting the rest of the crew. He can't do physical things like cut or extend the plank, but can push and shove, but can't be pushed or shoved himself.
categories: Humor

name: Runes & Regulations:  Nefarious Neighbor
description:
The Nefarious Neighbor expansion opens the Runes & Regulations game up to 5-8 players, and it completely changes the dynamics. In this expansion, a dark sorcerer with horrifying powers (and intentions) moves into the neighborhood, forcing other players to decide whether to team up or continue to quibble. The Nefarious Neighbor steals Creatures from other players and performs dark rituals to mutate them into frightening beasts. That neighbor plays with their own standalone deck (included in the expansion pack) which includes Corrupted Creatures, Curses, and Dark Runes.

The Nefarious Neighbor’s powers are so immense that their Corrupted Creatures cannot be destroyed, hexed, or stolen; however, the expansion also includes cards to shuffle into the Main Deck to help other players fight back and thwart that neighbor’s villainous plans.

One of the most interesting parts of the Nefarious Neighbor expansion is the introduction of player role cards. In addition to the Nefarious Neighbor, other players will have the opportunity to take on a new role (in secret). These roles provide you with a second win condition that nobody else knows about, giving you the opportunity to surprise your neighbors with an unexpected victory. Since only the Nefarious Neighbor’s role is known, each other player around the table is left to wonder what role their opponents might secretly be playing. These roles include things like Mr. Griffin (who wins if they successfully summons 3 Griffins), the Henchman (who wins if the Nefarious Neighbor wins and Henchman has no creatures on their Lawn), and the Humane Sorcerer (who wins by successfully saving a Stray Dog or Alley Cat).

Runes & Regulations by itself is a super fun and interactive game, and we designed it to stand entirely alone. I say this because the game really works without the expansion, and we didn’t even start working on the expansion until we had the original game completely finished and play tested. Getting to add on this expansion was a dream, though, and getting the opportunity to actually make it a reality because of the support so far on this project is incredibly exciting. The introduction of this expansion just makes the game so much more dynamic (and really creates two different games).

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Camel Up: The Referee Camel & Istanbul – Caravan Leader Mini Expansion
description: This mini expansion includes the same black camel and rules provided in Camel Up: The Referee Camel mini expansion and Istanbul: Caravan Leader Mini Expansion into one offering with the rules printed front to back on one sheet.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Racing
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: What Do You Meme?: Basic Bitch Pack
description: The Basic Bitch expansion pack includes 50 caption cards and 15 photo cards. You can add them to main deck and play with more friends and family members.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Spectral Ghostbusters
description: A Kickstarter exclusive add-on reward, of four alternate (glow-in-the-dark models) Class 3 ghosts.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Stworze: Zakazana Polana
description: The expansion "Forbidden Meadow" introduces new mechanics, e.g. Law Cards or new methods of finishing Missions. It also enables direct fights between Stworza and a new Stworze enters the fray: Drugost.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Area Movement, Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: City Council: Deluxe Edition
description:
In City Council each player takes the role of a council member of a newly founded city. The government will select the members of the city council for the first few years until the city rises and flourishes, by which time the most popular member will receive the position of Mayor.

In order to build the city, you and the other councilmen must maintain a low level of pollution, fight crime, create jobs, and sustain an adequate city budget. If you and the others don't keep up the good work, the city project might not succeed, the government will take over, and all players will lose.

As a member of the council, you must also strive to gain the favor of the different political groups who rule the streets of your city. As the game progresses and the city grows larger, more and more political interest groups will try to impose their will on the city by knocking on your office door and asking you for small "favors" in which you will have to act on their behalf. In return, they'll offer you their support and you'll receive victory points for your personal cause, possibly allowing you to become the city's first Mayor.

City Council: Deluxe Edition contains the original game along with one expansion:

• City Council: The Disaster Deck consists of ten event cards that disrupt "normal" city life by causing havoc everywhere, and it introduces a new game mode, creating a fully co-operative experience for City Council players. In each round of play, the players change roles, taking crucial steps to prevent these events from tearing apart the growing city.

City Council: Deluxe Edition was originally, erroneously, reported to contain the City Council: Government Agent expansion.
categories: City Building, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Tile Placement, Voting, Worker Placement

name: Havoc Expansion: The Character Cards
description:
This expansion for Havoc: the Hundred Years War consists of a collection of promos given out a various conventions brought together into one package. It is not playable without the base game. It features a new type of character card which is shuffled into the regular card deck and changes the game in interesting ways when one of them is drawn.

For example, the John of Gaunt card, when drawn, joins the game temporarily as a player, cries HAVOC! and starts a battle called The Chevauchées (a group of plundering raids.)
For those who have asked us, this expansion includes the premium cards that were given out at the game's release in Essen Germany in 2005, and at the first BoardameGeek Conference in Dallas, Texas.

In addition to these, a new card not seen before has been added, as well as two extra Dogs of War which can be added to the game or used as blanks for players that want to try out character ideas of their own.

Expands

Havoc: the Hundred Years War
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Magic: The Gathering – Unglued
description:
Unglued is the first silver-bordered Magic set. It includes 94 cards, of which only the land cards are tournament-legal.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor

name: Hoyuk: Anatolia
description:
The world is moving into a new era, and now more than ever the clans work for the progress and the evolution of their community. Everyone tries to find new ways to improve their lives, new means to grow their lands and new constructions that create an easier life. In Hoyuk: Anatolia, you must prove your quality through three different Achievements: build a Water Supply System for your village so the water can reach your land, throw the best Fest in the valley, and finally, build two Artifacts!

Each player chooses to complete two different Achievements at the beginning of the game. Each player who has managed to keep their Achievements intact until the end of the game will score additional Victory Points but most importantly each Achievement will score a different amount of points. The players use Drop counters in order to build the Water Supply System. Five Drop counters must be placed on five Houses of the same color and of the same Block. Furthermore these Houses must be connected to each other and at least one of them must be placed on the river or the lake of the game board. To place a Drop counter on a House, players must wait until the Construction phase and then choose not to build one of three Elements of their Construction board.

The Artifacts can be built easily but can be destroyed as easy as well because they are affected by all Catastrophes. Players can build an Artifact on the top of their Houses at the same way as the Drop Counters but in this case this House must be two stories high. If players do not complete this Achievement by the end of the game, they can still score Victory points. This is the only Achievement that has an advantage but it also gives less Victory Points.

This is an era where tribes search for a way to upgrade their social status, so they throw several Fests where they meet each other and celebrate. This is the last Achievement where players create the best Fest in the Valley by offering five different materials. These materials can be found on the Fest tokens but also on the Aspect cards. The Aspect cards have different images that must be matched with the Fest tokens. Once players have five Aspect cards that match with five Fest tokens, they discard them to score Victory points at the end of the game.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Prehistoric
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Warhammer 40,000 Expansion: Apocalypse Reload
description:
Publishers Blurb:

Apocalypse Reload allows you to take your games of Warhammer 40,000 Apocalypse to a whole new level. Command hundreds of men and squadron after squadron of vehicles in deadly battle formations. The greatest heroes of the age will march to war as huge, impossibly powerful, war machines stride forward, their super-heavy weapons reducing the enemy to a bloody mess. Use orbiting spacecraft to unleash weapons of planet-shattering power and employ devastating strategic assets. This is war on a scale undreamt of.

This 88-page large-format, supplement book contains additional material for your Warhammer 40,000 Apocalypse games, including: over 50 new datasheets, more than 40 new strategic assets, an overview of some useful tactics and a large gatefold spread featuring a titanic battle report.

You must possess a copy of Warhammer 40,000 and the Warhammer 40,000 Apocalypse supplement in order to use the contents of this book.

Apocalypse Reload was superseded by the 2013 and 2019 Warhammer Apocalypse rulebooks ans doesn't work with those rule books.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Es war einmal: Magische Märchen & Ritterliche Romanzen
description: Es war einmal: Magische Märchen & Ritterliche Romanzen seems to consist of Once Upon a Time: Knightly Tales and Once Upon a Time: Enchanting Tales, which can be added to the base game separately or in combination to add new storytelling possibilities.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Caravelas: "The Black Ship"
description:
Limited Edition - ESSEN 2010!
Small Postcard expansion with wooden ship (the black ship) for Caravelas that was offered ONLY in ESSEN 2010!

Short description :

"The Black ship is placed in the Port of Malaca, players can move the black ship by spending one Navigation Marker per space...
In case of encounter with other ships the owner(s) roll a die and suffer the consequences..."
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Travel
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Orcs Must Die!: Order Edition – Hero Pack
description:
Punch up your game with eight new heroes for Orcs Must Die! The Boardgame.

Each Hero comes with everything needed to play, including Weapon Cards & a Hero card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Warhammer 40,000 Compilation
description:
The second collection of articles from White Dwarf for Warhammer 40,000 (the first was the Warhammer 40,000 Compendium). This book introduced the Grey Knights, Chaos Terminators, the modern Eldar (including Aspect Warriors and Craftworlds), Genestealer Cults and a few odds and ends to Rogue Trader.

This book signaled the direction the game and background was to take for the next several editions, including the current 5th edition.

Expands:
Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Seasons: Geek d'Argos
description:
A promo card for Seasons.

Type: Familiar
Prestige Points: 8
Invocation cost: 0 crystals

Continuous effect: Every opponent must from now on address you formally and call you «My Lord» until the end of the game. Each time an opponent neglects this rule, he loses 2 crystals.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting
publishers: Libellud, Rebel Sp. z o.o., sternenschimmermeer

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Deluxe Limited Edition
description:
Killer Bunnies is a funny and satirical non-collectible, expandable card game. The new Epsilon Edition Starter Deck comes with a bonus Yellow Booster Deck. This game is played with only 1 copy of the game, so players do NOT need to bring their own decks to the table.

The object: Collect as many "Carrots" as possible, hoping that one of them is the randomly predetermined "Magic Carrot". In doing so, you must keep your bunnies alive as long as possible, while eliminating your opponents' Bunnies because once all the Carrots have been claimed you must have a living Bunny to win.

The problem: Your opponents are armed with outrageous weapons (from level 1 weapons such as a "Kitchen Whisk" to level 12 weapons such as the "Nuclear Warhead") and you must roll higher than these levels to survive.

Use cards to defend your Bunnies, such as the hilarious "Magic Spatula" or other special cards, or use a "Feed The Bunny" card to force your opponent to buy cabbage and water (if they have the money to do so...)

Your opponents, as the back of the box quotes, "will stop at nothing to keep you from winning the game, which can get dreadfully vengeful, horribly nasty, hilariously messy, and just plain fun!"

Includes: 770 large cards, 94 small cards, 11 dice, 9 pawns, 27 chips, 30 vouchers, 4 red card stands, 2 clear card stands, a Yellow Ball with a Red Stripe, Bunny Blanks with Stickers, Promo Cards, 4 Play Mats, and a Rulebook
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Negotiation
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Nistrim Raider Expansion Pack
description:
Technologically limited and outmatched by the Federation's Intrepid-class starship – indeed, on one occasion a raider was destroyed by a Federation shuttlecraft, albeit one that took them by surprise – an engagement with seven to one odds, in favor of the Kazon, against an Intrepid-class was considered "tactically unwise." The armaments aboard this class of vessel included two forward energy weapons and photonic charges with variable yields, and were protected with shields. The raider could be modified to employ a type of masking circuitry that could affect enemy sensors. They were also known to carry a small complement of Kazon fighters.

This ship is part of the 4th wave of expansion packs for the Star Trek: Attack Wing game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Carson City: Father Christmas Promo
description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo. Day 12.

When using Father Christmas, you immediately receive 5 victory points as a gift since you've been sweet this year.
Cash limit $10

Red side: Immediately receive 2 victory points and write a letter to Father Christmas. Throw a die to check if you have been naughty or nice:

1-2: you've been very naughty, you don't receive anything
3-4: you've been OK: receive $5.
5-6: you've been very nice: receive $5 and 1 cowboy in your player color (as long as the are available).


Cash limit: $10
categories: American West, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement
publishers: Frosted Games, Quined White Goblin Games

name: Imaginarium: Pandora
description: This is an expansion to the game Имаджинариум (Imaginarium) which adds 97 new cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Villages: Holiday Pack
description:
From publisher blurb:



You better watch out, you better not cry...Once upon a time, the world was at war. The ruthless battles between greedy kings and their armies grew more destructive by the day as they vied for control of newly discovered lands.

When one king went looking for reinforcements, he found a group of allies more powerful than any army he had encountered before. They were the mythological beings that were once thought to only exist in fairy tales. In the name of preserving the holidays and seasons they had come to represent, such legends as Santa Claus, Uncle Sam, and Mother Nature joined the fight, lending their aid to any who called upon them.

Villages: Holiday Pack includes 12 unique and powerful cards, one for each month of the year. Many of these cards were included as bonus cards in the base game, but now they're all here in one place.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: One Hit Kill: Death & Lore Expansion
description:
One Hit Kill: Death & Lore Expansion brings two new components, two associated special cards and 16 new weapons to build. Expansion pack supports up to six players.

Every expansion pack requires the Core deck. Most weapons in an expansion pack use a mix of core classes and expansion classes.

To use an expansion pack, shuffle its white cards in with the Core white cards. Do the same with the weapons. Rules and game objective same as Base game.
categories: Card Game

name: Order of the Stick Adventure Game: Sticky Shticks
description:
Designer Description:

Sticky Shticks is a mini-expansion for the Order of the Stick Adventure Game that centers around a single mechanic: Stuff sticking to you. The set features two shticks for each of the six characters that can be "stuck" to another character under the right circumstances, either giving them a penalty of some sort or allowing you to flip it later to just mess with them. It also includes seven new Monster cards that can get stuck to you if they win, forcing you to drag their lazy asses around the dungeon until you (or one of your allies) can defeat it. A Screw This! card that interacts with any sticky card rounds out the 20-card set.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Garbage Day: "Will You Marry Me?" Promo
description:
Promo card given out during the Kickstarter for Garbage Day.

One player asks another player to marry them.

If they answer YES:
Share your room and your life with your fiance! Your room Max Size is now 20 and you now clean your room together.

If they answer NO:
Place this card into the Garbage Can.
categories: Action / Dexterity

name: The First World War
description:
(From the box description :)

The first game-module to employ SPI's War in Europe maps. Depicts the titanic struggle which ultimately encompassed all of the major powers of the period.
The First World War is a division/corps level simulation of the first time the world went to war. Each game turn represents ten days of real time. Two thousand die cut counters represent the British, French, German, Austro-Hungarian, Russian, Belgian, Turkish, Serbian, Rumanian, Bulgarian, Greek, Dutch, and Italian troops that fought or could have fought in the war - and of course a comprehensive rules booklet and charts are also included.

Rules contain instructions for converting War In Europe maps for First World War use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Supremacy:  Boomers – Warlords and Pirates Blister Pack
description:
Expansion for use with Boomers Expansion, the Warlords and Pirates expansion, and the base game of Supremacy. This small expansion set contains 10 black plastic Boomer submarines used to identify that the Pirate has purchased a Boomer.

Expands:

Supremacy: The Game of the Superpowers
Supremacy: Boomers – Ballistic Missile Subs
Supremacy: Warlords and Pirates of the Neutral Zones
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – Musketeer Hero
description: A new Hero joins the fray! Add The Musketeer to your roster of Heroes to aid you against the many challenges of the Darkest Dungeon. Use his skills to safely dispose of enemies from a distance and carve your path through the darkness!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme

name: Warhammer 40,000: Planetary Empires
description:
From the back of the box:

Planetary Empires is an expansion for Warhammer 40,000 that provides players with a plastic map-building kit. Rules are included that allow players to carve out their own empire by fighting battles using the Warhammer 40,000 rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Cards Against Humanity: Retail Pack
description: Cards Against Humanity: Retail Pack is a 5-card expansion for Cards Against Humanity. It is included with a purchase of the base game from a physical store that was accepted into Cards Against Humanity's retailer program.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: San Guo Sha: Mountain
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




This is the fourth character expansion of San Guo Sha, or the Killers of the Three Kingdoms. This expansion introduces 10 new characters including 8 ordinary characters and 2 Demi-God characters randomly inserted into some packets.

The 10 characters are:

Shu Kingdom: Liu Chan, Jiang Wei;
Wei Kingdom: Zhang He, Deng Ai;
Wu Kingdom: Sun Ce, Zhang Zhao&Zhang Hong[1];
Qun: Zuo Ci, Cai Wenji.
Two Demi-God: God Si Mayi, God Zhao Yun.

[1] Zhang Zhao&Zhang Hong are two characters on the same card, like Yan Liang&Wen Zhou in the Fire Expansion）
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Viewpoint Reflections
description:
Viewpoint Reflections is the first expansion to the Viewpoint card game. It can be played as a stand-alone game or combined with the original Viewpoint. Viewpoint Reflections adds seventy additional cards and introduces new characters, including the Lazy Eye Guys - Dirk and Pedro - and the Evil Eye Pet.

The release of Viewpoint Reflections also sees the introduction of new keywords - PASS and REPLACE.

PASS is essentially a weaker version of the STEAL action because the player "targeted" gets to select the card to give to the other player.

REPLACE allows you to remove a card from your Field of View and "replace" it with another card from the top of the Draw Pile.

Viewpoint Prize Cards are also included in 1-in-10 Viewpoint Reflections decks.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Math, Party Game

name: Star Realms: Admiral's Tabletop Promo Card
description:
Promotional card given out at Tabletop day 2016.

Admiral's Tabletop
Event
Each player may shuffle their discard pile into their deck. If they don't, they gain 5 Authority.
(When an event enters the trade row, do what it says immediately, then scrap it.)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That

name: 'Ere We Go: Orks in Warhammer 40,000
description:
A supplement to the orginal Warhammer 40,000 Rogue Trader. Provides new rules for such things as Painboyz, After the Battle, Runtherdz, Boars & Cyboars, How to Paint Your Ork Warband, Weirdboyz, Madboyz, Ork Mekaniaks, Kustom Vehicles, Vehicles, Robots, Weapons and Wargear, Shokk Attack Gun, Kustom Weapons, and lots of fluff.

208 pages plus cards.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: MiniMonFa: Fairy Expansion
description:
This is the first expansion for MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)
Now its is possible to fill your dungeons with new incredible creatures like dryads, gnomes and ents. You also get 6 new heroes like an Warrior Elf and an Centaur.

With this expansion it is also possible to play the game with more than 2 players.

Expands:

MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)


Other Expansions:

MiniMonFa: Undead Expansion
MiniMonFa Espansione Mondo Sotterraneo
MiniMonFa Espansione Rigor Mortis
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Zauberschwert & Drachenei: Poison Expansion
description:
This collection of three cards, originally an Essen 2004 giveaway, adds 3 artifact "poison" cards that are shuffled together with the artifact cards. These cards may only be played on other players, and remain there until the end of the game.

Poison cards cause the poisoned player to lose one magic point each time he/she defeats a magical creature if the symbol of one of the poison cards in front of him/her match the symbol on the creature. If the player has no magic points after evaluating the fight, the poison card has no effect.

Expands

Zauberschwert & Drachenei
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Dark Darker Darkest: Zombie Expansion
description:
This expansion provides players with a set of mini modules, each adding a different species of zombies to the game. These special species modify the entire horde they are part of inside a room. However, before these type of zombies can be defeated, all other zombies in the room must be eliminated, as the other zombies in the horde will protect this more powerful species.

The following zombie species are introduced:

Disco Doll Zombies - The horde can move 3 instead of 2 tiles
Guts Zombies - One bite result of the horde cannot be dodged by a defense roll
Chunk Zombies - Horde can only be defeated in close combat
Tuff Guy Zombies - You need 2 hits to kill the zombies in this horde.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Zombies

name: Munchkin Stocking Stuffers
description:
Five identical sealed packs of holiday-themed Munchkin cards and five Munchkin-themed gift tags. Each pack contains one card providing a very brief explanation of the game of Munchkin, two Munchkin Door cards, and two Munchkin Treasure cards.

Packs are intended to be used as holiday stocking stuffers, hence the title.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Cards Against Humanity: Retail Product
description: The Retail Product is a 20 card expansion Pack for Cards Againt Humanity, available only at Target stores.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Ogre: Nightfall Sponsored Counter Sheets
description:
"Ogre: Nightfall" consists of three exclusive counter sheets compatible with Ogre Designer's Edition and a 16-page booklet of new scenarios that form a linked campaign to determine the fate of the world. Play a desperate humanity trying to stop the Ogre uprising or the cruel unstoppable rogue Ogres themselves.

This product includes an entirely new rogue Ogre faction including an exclusive black Mark III, Mark IV and Mark V Ogre available nowhere else. But it also includes a black AI controlled train, black AI laser towers and turrets, black AI control center, exclusive civilian counters, blue armor reinforcements and more! These counter sheets are designed by Steve Jackson Games, printed by the same company using the same processes as the counters included in the main box set so they are 100% compatible.

This product will be a limited edition and no more than several thousand will ever be made. Once they are gone, they are gone.

As of January 2015, Steve Jackson Games has resumed control of this product. Counter sheets are available directly from them, and they have stated they are working on a PDF of the rules / scenarios booklet.

NOTE: Do NOT attempt to order from Fire Mountain Games. The product was taken back by Steve Jackson Games after multiple failures on the part of FMG.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Fire Mountain Games, Steve Jackson Games

name: San Guo Sha: Forest
description:
