UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




This is the third character expansion of San Guo Sha, aka Killers of the Three Kingdoms. As a character expansion, this expansion introduces 8 new character cards but no new playing cards.

In addition, this expansion also includes 2 Demi-God characters like the Wind and Fire expansions, randomly inserted into some boosters. Rarity is unknown.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: City Council: Government Agent Expansion
description: This expansion will bring to the game a new interest group: the mysterious government agency. The government agent will strive to make some modifications to your new city planning. This expansion will also impact the playtime of the game, as more cards mean a higher scoring game with more variety.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wrong Chemistry: Custom Elements
description:
10 Cards are included in this awesome card set. The Custom Elements are not part of the basic Elements of the Periodic Table but imaginary ones and were created only for the KS Backers.

These cards carry the names of some Backers..but we changed them a bit.. Enjoy them!

You play these cards as you play and the rest Elements of the Basic Game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Supremacy: High-Tech Edge for Conventional Forces
description:
This expansion sets adds high-tech power to conventional forces by adding new movement and combat features to armies and navies. You secretly research and develop high-tech edge on opponents before battle begins. You can also sell the new technologies to your allies. The high-tech advances reduce movement costs, leaving more resources for selling, building, or fighting.
The expansion contains a deck of 40 Army cards and 40 Navy cards. Each card shows a Tech Level rating from one to five. Players must declare they are researching a specific technology and draw a random card from the army or navy deck at a cost of $200 Million per card. The player keeps the card secret until it is used in battle.

Expands:

Supremacy: The Game of the Superpowers
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Wargame

name: Last Night on Earth Special Edition Soundtrack CD
description:
New Special Edition Game Soundtrack for Last Night on Earth features 16 tracks of music created specifically for the game. This includes the entire original soundtrack plus five new songs inspired by upcoming expansions. The CD features new artwork and liner notes from the composer and two exclusive new game cards only available with the Special Edition Soundtrack.

Guitar - Force a zombie to re-roll any number of its fight dice.

Dance of the Dead - Roll a d6 and remove that many Zombies, all remaining zombies may move one space.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadowscape: Deeper Dungeon
description:
Delve deeper into the deadly depths of the Nightfather's labyrinth!

Expand the dungeon in Shadowscape: Deeper Dungeon, making it larger and more dangerous than ever before. Customize your heroes with a set of new skills and arm them with new gear as they step into the underworld Realm of Shadows. Face events ads recruit allies to help you once again emerge as the champion of Shadowscape!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Bobblehead
description:
The Munchkin Bobblehead adds a new rule to any game of Munchkin. By having him present, you are able to re-roll one die per game.



Publisher's DescriptionMunchkin has sold hundreds of thousands of copies, with more than a dozen different sequels and supplements, covering fantasy, sci-fi, chop-socky, horror, and more. With each set, the monsters get bigger, the curses stronger, and your party members no more trustworthy.

It's dangerous out there. You need a buddy.

The Munchkin Bobblehead will watch your back during your adventures, nodding encouragement to help you through the tough patches, and congratulating you on your treasure. Keep him on your desk at the office for inspiration - after all, what's the office but a dungeon with cubicles? The classic Munchkin figure, complete with horned helm, bag of loot, and enormous hammer (and his latest victim!) is a great way to spot your fellow Munchkin players.

But most of all, keep him around during your Munchkin games. Not only is he nifty in his own right... he gives you an advantage in play. And in Munchkin, you need every bonus you can get.

Munchkin Bobblehead - your nodding, bonus-giving, classic Munchkin buddy, 100% guaranteed to not stab you in the back.



OtherPart of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: We Didn't Playtest This at All with Chaos Pack Expansion
description:
This version of We Didn't Playtest This at All includes the Chaos Pack Expansion and comes in a sturdy 2-deck-playing-card-type box with a lift top.

The Chaos Pack Expansion contains a side deck of 15 cards you can use alongside We Didn't Playtest This at All. Every game, you randomly draw one Chaos card, and it becomes a rule that must be followed for the entire game.

From the publisher's website:

"The most aptly named game ever!

In this exceptionally silly and awesome game, your objective is to win! Simple enough. Sadly, all of your opponents have the same simple goal, and they're trying to make you lose. Between Rock Paper Scissors battles, being eaten by a random Dragon, or saved by a Kitten Ambush, there are many hazards to avoid."

Play Summary

Everyone starts with 2 cards. On your turn, draw one card from the deck, and then play one from your hand following the instructions on the card. There are many hazards to avoid, including: bombs, dragons, arrows, laser pointers, black holes, Rock Paper Scissors battles, number battles, zombies, etc. Luckily items abound that can save you, too: spaceships, science, shields, dinosaurs and a kitten ambush!

There are Star Cards: they are clearly superior to normal cards. Every player has an equal chance of drawing a Star Card from the deck.

Integrates with:

We Didn't Playtest This Either
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Asmadi Games, Board Game Leisure, Bureau de Juegos, Buró, Czacha Games, Nosolorol Ediciones

name: Supremacy: High-Tech Edge for Strategic Forces
description:
The High-Tech for Strategic Forces introduces new attack and defense features for nukes, L-Stars, neutron bombs and killer satellites. A player may secretly research and develop specific technologies to be used on, or sold to other players.
The expansion contains four decks of cards with 40 cards in each deck. There is a Nuke Deck, a Neutron Deck, an L-Star Deck, and a Killer Satellite Deck. Each card shows a Tech Rating from one to five and cost $400 Million per card.

Expands:

Supremacy: The Game of the Superpowers
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Wargame

name: Pergamemnon: Antebellum
description:
Pergamemnon: Antebellum, an expansion for the deck-building game Pergamemnon, adds two new nations to the game: the Germans and the Macedonians. In addition, the loser of a battle can now acquire one new skill, addressing the "problem" of a runaway leader that some players have experienced, while also strengthening the "weaker" nations.

Pergamemnon: Antebellum allows up to seven players to participate in the same game and comes packaged with PAX: Nocturnus, an expansion for the separate card game PAX.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: No Lo Testeamos Ni Un Poquito
description:
No Lo Testeamos Ni Un Poquito is an expansion for We Didn't Playtest this At All fully compatible with We Didn't Playtest This At All Legacies mechanics.

The game brings 42 new card 100% “meid in Argentina”, they are more Argentinian than ever!

This expansion mixes the best (and the worst) of argentinian culture and lots of winks to geek and pop culture with cards like "Mangazo", "Jodete", "Macanudo", "Mazinger Beta", "Heisenberg" and "Boda Roja" among others.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Salvation (fan expansion for Dominion)
description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion, is not considered part of the Dominion family, and is not affiliated with Rio Grande Games.***




From the Developer:

"The word of God has spread throughout the realm, leading to the rise of the church, and bringing peace and salvation to the faithful. Monks search their souls for illumination, priests seek to teach the grace of God, and grand towers and cathedrals are erected in his name.

But not all choose to follow in God's light - a host of heretics, pagans, and cultists threatens to destroy the sanctity of the church, risking damnation for their dark and sacrilegious ways. But who is truly without sin? The coffers of the church swell from tithe and indulgence, crusaders war and plunder in the name of God, while the inquisition silences their enemies in a wake of terror and blood.

The choice is yours: join ranks with forces of God to spread his holy word, or risk your eternal soul for unimagined power in this fan-made expansion to Dominion!"
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Religious
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig: Dice Tower Room Promo Tile
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Adds the "Dice Tower Room" tile, which scores 2 points for each of the following rooms built in the castle: "Scythe Room", "Vineyard", "Game Storage" and "Between Two Rooms".
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Supremacy: Field Marshall's Handbook
description:
84-page handbook for Supremacy players. Five sections:

1) Questions and Answers - FAQ for rules clarifications / errata
2) Rule Variants - Adds rules for convoys & escorts, multi-theater attacks, rocket technology, etc.
3) Strategy and Tactics
4) Rules for a Two-Player Game
5) Tournament Rules

Expands:

Supremacy: The Game of the Superpowers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Munchkin Fu (1+2)
description:
A compilation item containing both Munchkin Fu and Munchkin Fu 2.

Munchkin Fu won the Origins "Gamer's Choice Award" for the Best Card Game of 2003. How do you follow something like that? With more mooks, more mayhem, more monsters, more munchkins, more monks - especially more monks - in Munchkin Fu 2: Monky Business!

Learn new styles like Kong Fu, Fee Fi Fo Fu, Sna Fu, and the ever-perilous Stomach Fu! Pick up dangerous new weapons like the Auspicious Ivory Gutting Hook and the Tofu Tonfa. Garb yourself in the Hong Kong Sarong. Slay foes like the Sex Gaki, Clamera, and Genghis Cong... and take their stuff!

The team of Origins-Award-winning designer Steve Jackson (I) and mad cartoonist Greg Hyland (Lethargic Lad, Munchkin Fu) are back again for Monky Business. It's got 110 evil and overpowered cards, plus two blanks to create your own. And of course, like all other Munchkin products, this supplement is completely compatible with the original Munchkin and all its supplements and spinoffs, including Star Munchkin, Munchkin Bites!, and Munchkin Blender.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Fanhunter Assault: Fanpiro
description:
The auto-playable expansion to the Fanhunter Assault card game. Offering more enemies, more cards and the campaign mode has been improved and expanded.

Gameplay is similar to the base game, but it focuses on the background of the "Fanpiros." The narrative scenario is more developed and superior to the base game and, and because it can be integrated with the base game, it's a must-have for fans of the line.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Hoyuk: Obstacles
description:
Adds five unique pieces of terrain that can radically alter the developmental space of the game's board.

Choose 1-3 Obstacles depending the number of the players before the game begins and place them as you want on the board, inside the playing area. The Obstacles limit the space you have to build and make the game more difficult, as each piece will come with its own rule modifications.

You must be more careful how you will build your Block since your opponents will try to find a way and stop you from growing your Block!
categories: Ancient, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Prehistoric
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Dicemaster: Wilds of Doom
description:
Wilds of Doom is an expansion to the base game Dicemaster: Cities of Doom. It adds many new concepts and abilities to the basic game and enables players to use the wide variety of dice found in the Doom Cubes expansion.

Expands

Dicemaster: Cities of Doom


From the back of the box:
With Dicemaster, players can enjoy exciting fantasy adventures with nothing more than a beautiful set of custom-crafted dice.
Wilds of Doom is the master expansion set for Cities of Doom, the basic Dicemaster set. It's ideal for players interested in more challenging and flexible strategies. More importantly, it opens the door to the rich, diverse world of Doom Cubes.
This box contains 26 dice, including ten 16mm dice, eleven 18mm, and five 22mm dice (three 6-siders, one 10-sided die, and one 12-sided die). You also get 2 plastic dice trays for convenient storage of dice. Two players can play the "Wilderness Game" if, between them, they have one Wilds of Doom set.
Each player must have a Cities of Doom to use this product.
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: MiniMonFa: Undead Expansion
description:
The second expansion for MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy) brings a crowd of terrible monsters like zombies and a vampire. You also get a new set of heroes with unique special abilities.

Expands:

MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)


Other Expansions:

MiniMonFa: Fairy Expansion
MiniMonFa Espansione Mondo Sotterraneo
MiniMonFa Espansione Rigor Mortis
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: 12 Realms: Bonus Town Cards
description:
This expansion contains 10 additional city cards with a red banner instead of yellow.
Like the normal city cards, each card of this expansion has a unique abilitly and can be mixed up with the normal city cards.

For a balanced gameplay, it is recommended that the maximum of city cards is always 23.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: MidEvil III:  Subterranean Homesick Blues!
description:
The castle is nice but, let's face it, the entertainment options are limited. Besides, the skeleton army seems to be growing. And, they are very intent on seeing that you leave.

Maybe it's time to see if the wise man was right. Let's see, he said "collect the pages, find the underground altar, and say the words." If only you could remember WHICH words...

The object of this game is to find the correct spells in the dungeon and get to the altar to finally get home. But the wrong spells will only cause you trouble, to say the least.

Part of the MidEvil/Zombies!!! series

Expands:

MidEvil
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Scurvy! More Scuttle Fun
description:
Includes eight Disease cards:

Pox
Scurvy
Typhus
Beriberi
Fever
Sailor’s Bane
Sea-Sickness
Piratitis!

At the start of the game, you put one of them into play and shuffle the rest into the deck. Each disease has a different ability, and they affect all players. Disease cards don’t count as permanents, and whenever you draw one it goes into play immediately.

As your action in a turn, you can shuffle all Disease cards from play back into the deck - this is the only way to get rid of them, but it might be worth it...especially if all eight are in play!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: What Do You Meme?: Fresh Memes Expansion Pack #2
description: Treat yourself to even more memes! 115 Cards (90 caption cards & 25 photo cards) to be added to core game. You deserve this. You're pretty great.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Vanuatu: The Governor
description:
Effect of the Governor (goodies Tile):

Instead of playing an action, the player can move his ACTION markers on another action of his choice. He must moved all the ACTION marker placed on this action.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Variable Phase Order

name: BAM!: Ultra schmutzig!
description:
The party game BAM! challenges players to fill in the blank on a card text in order to impress the "BAM!-Master" as well as the other players. If, for example, the question is "Germany is looking for BAM!?", you try to find an answer card in your hand that fits the situation best – or worst, as the case may be...

BAM!: Ultra schmutzig! contains the best elements of the original BAM! as well as the standalone sequels BAM!: Extrahart and BAM! Ihr habt es so gewollt! with more than seven hundred cards that will allow players to fill those BAM!s in all kinds of ways
categories: Card Game, Party Game

name: Spicy Dice
description:
Twenty four unique dice and six dice rolling games to play. It also has a section on guiding the player to create their own dice games.

The six included games are:

Catch 6
Keep on Rolling
2 Out of 3 Ain't Bad
Grand Poorah
Perfecto
Diangle!


This would almost be considered a set of generic dice games, except that they are specifically modifed for the included games as each die has one side marked with red pips instead of white.
categories: Dice, Game System

name: Superfight: The '90's Deck
description:
WHASSUP! A 100-card Superfight expansion full of dope 90's cards? And it comes with locations and scenarios too? Off the hook! All that and a bag of okay yeah you get it.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Tic Tac Doh!
description:
A simple strategy game using Icehouse pieces. Players add pieces to a 3x3 grid whose boundaries are defined by the pieces played. A player wins by creating a line of 3 pieces of the same size. Nests of pieces count only as the top piece, Trees count as any piece in the tree.

A player loses if they have no legal move on their turn. Exception: if all pieces are played, the game is declared a tie.

This appeared in Hypothermia #15 and in the ICE-7 reference cards.

Rules are also available online or on the Icehouse Wiki.
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: No Lo Testeamos Ni Un Poco: Kinético
description:
This expansion's focus is on movement!

Dancing, moving the arms, clapping, staying still and thumb wars are just some of the things you will have to do in this expansion to win the game.

More cards, more randomness, more chaos but in a green box.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors
publishers: Asmadi Games, Bureau de Juegos, Buró

name: Rail Raiders Infinite: Old Tyme Religion
description:
Old Tyme Religion is an expansion to Rail Raiders Infinite, raising the player limit to 6.

The expansion includes 2 new Raiders (Dr. Umbra PhD, Mutha Superior), 6 new Lawbots (3x Pallbearers, 2x Preachers, 1x 999), 4 new train car tiles (chapel car, maintenance car, 2 mortuary cars), 5 additional poker dice, and cards for each deck (High Noon, Long Arm of the Law, Raider, and Loot).
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Trains
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ulisses Spiele

name: 3 Wishes: More Genies! Promo Card
description:
Promo card for 3 Wishes, that was given out at Spiel '16 with a purchase of the base game. Counts as 4 points in yellow suit.

Setup: Shuffle More Genies! into 3 Wishes. Place 3 cards face down in the middle instead of 2.

Ability: Ignore the ability and points of your Super Power card at the end of the game.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Mythology

name: +6 Bag o' Munchkin Level Counters
description:
+6 Bag o' Munchkin Level Counters describes exactly what you get in the package: six level counters for use with any of the various Munchkin games. As of May 2012, two sets of six counters exist, with each counter featuring artwork from a different Munchkin base set.

And as is custom for every Munchkin-related doodad, this accessory includes a unique game-related rule, namely that if you have the level counter matching one of the base sets being used in the current game, you start the game at level 2 instead of level 1. Determine who starts with which counter by rolling for high number before the game begins.

Part of the Munchkin series
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Violet Booster Deck
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Killer Bunnies return to pillage and burn with the addition of Specialty Bunny cards such as the Priscillan trio that allows players to play extra cards during their turn! Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Violet Booster Deck adds 55 new cards to the existing Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot set, as well as a clear 20-sided die.

New cards include: "Reno 911" which causes a police raid on your opponent's cards, "Campaign Contributions" for "influencing" (wink, wink) the votes of Senators, "Betty Botter" for increasing your Radish and Milk supplies and the "Grand Slam" which, combined with lucky die rolls, awards a player with three Carrots! The new Defense Cards can eliminate threatening weapons such as "Blipverts" or the ever-vengeful "Heathers"!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation

name: Cards Against Humanity: Trump Pack
description:
The Trump Pack is a pack of 25 cards that is included in the 'Donald Trump Bug-out Bag'. The pack contains 3 black cards, 22 white cards and one double sided 'Comedy Rations' card.

The publisher describes the Donald Trump Bug-Out Bag as: A pre-packed duffle bag with over a dozen items hand-picked to help you survive the collapse of civilization after Donald Trump is elected President of the United States. Includes the Cards Against Humanity Trump Pack with 25 new jokes about frightening demagogue Donald Trump.

This is a separate edition from the Vote for Trump pack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Anno Domini: Probespiel
description:
A regular Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

This small expansion set Anno Domini - Probespiel was a free giveaway by the publisher. It only contains about 8-15 event cards without a common theme. Since this is not enough for a real game, it only comes with a brief summary of the gameplay.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly. Anno Domini is a blast to play, it is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Part of the Anno Domini series

Contained as a free bonus in this German version of Such a Thing?, this German version of Zooloretto and this German version of Airlines Europe.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: ZombieTown 2: Road Rage
description:
Zombietown 2 adds cars and hidden agendas to the mix of the ZombieTown universe.

Cars and keys are distributed one per household at random. Players must find a matching key to use the car. Once the cars are in play they can be used to move quicker, run down zombies, or serve as makeshift barricades.

Hidden agendas are cards similar in size to the existing cards for the game. Each agenda has two possible conditions worth additional victory points. Players must choose one of them and reveal it when the conditions are met. If the conditions are later lost, the player retains his VP. The agendas on a card are related, so one might offer 5 points for having homes on two sides of the board and 10 for having homes on three sides.

Publisher's Page: http://www.twilightcreationsinc.com/zombietown/zombietown2.p...

Expands

ZombieTown
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies

name: Deep Dive: Wild Food
description: Deep Dive: Wild Food Tiles Mini-Expansion is a set of KS Promo tiles included with KS pledges. These tiles can be used in any game if Deep Dive by shuffling them into their respective depths during setup. Wild tiles act like any other tiles except they can be any of three colors (assigned to a specific tableau column when collected). If collected before all if the tableau columns have been defined, then they must be placed on the first row/set of the tableau and their color determined once the other two colors have been added to that row/set.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
publishers: Alderac Entertainment Group, Flatout Games, MINDOK

name: San Guo Sha: Overnight Fame
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




A 11 card expansion to San Guo Sha (Killers of the Three Kingdoms) adding 11 new characters. These include 3 for Shu, 3 for Wu, 3 for Wei and 2 unalligned. No new princes or demi-gods are included (therefore there are no random cards as with the other expansions.)

All cards are user-created and were submitted to Yoka Games as part of a contest to find the most interesting new characters.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Munchkin Cthulhu Cursed Demo
description:
Publisher's DescriptionThis tuckbox mini-set contains 56 cards to help you bring new victims . . . errr, gamers . . . into the wonderful world of Munchkin Cthulhu . . .

First, a special 17-card demonstration deck, drawn from the Munchkin Cthulhu set. The cards are numbered, so you can stack the deck and play out four scripted turns that show the basic mechanics. And it only takes a couple of minutes. Instructions, dialogue, and stupid jokes are included. Or use your own stupid jokes - we won't mind.

The other 39 cards are promos, to give away to friends, customers, or total strangers. These are completely new cards, each guaranteed to be more munchkinly, more insane, more cursed than the last. And we've included multiple copies. Every munchkin will want at least one of each. Will you be generous? Or will you demand tribute? Of course, you are a munchkin, so you will keep at least one of each for yourself, right?



OtherPart of the Munchkin series



CautionIf you have no experience with playing Munchkin-games this will NOT help you learn the game! It's meant to teach OTHER players how to play the game and it's NOT meant to be used as a demo for a totally new group of players since there are close to no rules explained.



Promo CardsThe 39 promo cards are as follows:


(5x) Curse! Shuggoth Shuffle (Door)
(4x) Embrace the Madness (Door)
(4x) Miskatonic University Honorary Degree (Treasure)
(5x) Mi-Go Mind Switch (Promo)
(4x) Monstrous Heritage (Door)
(4x) Research Assistant (Door)
(8x) The Stars are Cruel (Promo)
(5x) Trade Character Sheets (Promo)


This set introduces a new card type that has the word "Promo" on the back with the picture from the front of the Munchkin Cthulhu box. These cards are not shuffled into the deck; instead, at the start of the game, the owner of the "Promo" cards may choose one of them to place on the table and play when desired. (Each player can play one Promo card per game.)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Buccaneer Bones: Expansion Set
description:
This expansion set adds all material needed to play the game with up to 8 players (instead of the standard 4). The set adds four new colors (white, orange, pink and light-blue) and can also be used as a stand-alone 4 player game.

The stand-alone game has the same rules as the base game and requires players to reach different islands with their ships by rolling dice.

When a player has a ship on an island, if he has a three-of-a-kind matching that island number, the ship grabs one treasure, then returns to port.

If a player can't advance a ship, he can place his first mate (1) as a scout on an island to grant himself that power on his next turn, (2) as a thief on a treasure owned by a player with more treasure than him, giving him a chance to steal it next turn if he rolls any three-of-a-kind, or (3) as a defender to remove a thief on one of his treasures.

The game ends the round that a player collects his third treasure. If he's the only one with three treasures, he wins; if multiple players have three, then the tied player who has more ships farther from his ports wins.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: Attack! Deluxe
description:
We are pressed on all sides and the enemy is closing in. Word has come down from the Commander-in-Chief and our only order is "Attack!"

From designers Mike Selinker and Sean Brown comes the Attack! Deluxe expansion for Glenn Drover's Attack!, which adds to the base game by setting the stage for combat on the Pacific Front. Attack! Deluxe, which replaces the out-of-print Attack! Deluxe Expansion, places you squarely on the frontlines as you vie for world domination. Speak softly or swing your big stick in order to conquer your neighbors and expand your economy.

Attack! Deluxe introduces bold new mechanisms with expanded Naval Combat, player government styles, new technology research, and seasonal combat. As the leader of a world power, you can choose to control trade routes on all seven seas or you can blitz the sovereign shores of your nearest nations by land: build the biggest army and crush your enemies before they crush you, or choke the life out of them by cutting their economic supply. All is fair in love and war after all!

The cards in Attack! Deluxe replace all of the Attack! base game cards to ensure uniformity, with these cards having better quality base card stock and linen finish with playing card varnish. Attack! Deluxe includes a plastic insert tray to hold all of the pieces from both Attack! and Attack! Deluxe. To use Attack! Deluxe, you need these components from Attack!:


Western Theater game board
678 Army Unit miniatures (six sets of 113 pieces in six colors: infantry, artillery, tanks and planes)
8 Red Army battle Dice
2 Blue Order dice
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Negotiation, Political, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Trading

name: Killer Bunnies and the Journey to Jupiter: Laser Red Booster Deck
description:
From the box:
The KB Jupiter Laser Red Booster Deck kicks into space-warp speed with more deadly Beyea Aliens, more powerful ships and 3 additional sectors of space for your new and powerful Red bunnies to explore. Will you be subject to a devastating Cargo Blow or unleash a Solar Flare? Even innocent fruit may have consequences, as you discover that the Pineapples in space can be quite deadly. With cunning and danger behind every asteroid, this new booster is sure to deliver cosmic fun and strategy!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Massilia: Bacchus
description:
Massilia: Bacchus consists of four copies of one card, which are added to the other "Divinity" cards.

Card effect: The player can choose which color of goods a client buys from their stall. The player earns sesterces as usual, and reputation points based on the goods actually sold. Once played, the card is discarded.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Loot Box #1
description:
The Loot Box is a collection of promotional content and small modules for several games published by Board&Dice. Everything has been carefully crafted and designed with you—the players—in mind.

Teotihuacan: City of Gods
• 1 Book of Challenges

The Book of Challenges contains 6 variants for experienced players, all featuring a specific predetermined setup which puts the focus on a certain aspect of game play. Some of these variants also include special rules and victory conditions which add to the difficulty level and change the mindset of player on how to achieve victory.

Tekhenu: Obelisk of the Sun
• 1 Book of Challenges
• 1 cloth bag
• Module: Noble Buildings (including 4 Noble Building tiles)

The Book of Challenges contains 3 variants for experienced players, each adding a twist to the normal setup procedure and some additional flavor to the game play.

The Noble Buildings module gives each player a special Building tile. Once per game, when constructing a Building, whether as a workshop or quarry (Osiris God Action), around the Temple Complex (Hathor God Action), or in a foreign region (Seth God Action), you may place this tile underneath the newly constructed Building. If you do so, double the rewards received.

Tawantinsuyu: The Inca Empire
• 1 Book of Challenges
• 1 cloth bag

The Book of Challenges contains 3 variants for experienced players. Two variants were featured during the Tawantinsuyu Digital World Championship 2021 and are therefore uniquely balanced for 4 players. The third variant is not for the faint of heart, likewise representing an expertly crafted challenge.

Origins: First Builders
• Module: Ophiuchus, the 13th sign of the Zodiac (including a new Zodiac card and accompanying Zodiac tile)
• Module: The Voice (including 5 Voice cards and 1 card with rules)

Ophiuchus lets you choose to resolve the bonus action of an Encounter Site instead of one of the actions normally available.

The Voice gives special powers to the weaker (and, therefore, less desirable) Speaker dice. When taking a Speaker die of value 2 or 3, you may immediately receive the associated benefit depicted on the Voice card before placing the Speaker die in your player area.

Zapotec
• Module: Quick Start (including 10 Quick Start cards and 1 card with rules)

After performing all other setup steps as normal (including starting basic resources), each player is dealt 2 random Quick Start cards from which they will choose 1 card and receive its depicted benefits. Certain Quick Start benefits may even enable a simple Capital action on the first turn.

The Loot Box also contains a special QR code for Escape Tales (containing immersive audio introductions) and 4 custom Scoring markers and a First Player marker for Mandala Stones.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Alien Uprising: Zothren Expansion
description: Alien Uprising: Zothren Expansion contains 23 miniatures - namely 9 Slashers, 2 Archers, 2 Brutes, 2 Champions, 2 Scavengers, 2 Scouts, 2 Tunnelers, and 2 Leaders. Kickstarter buyers received additional miniatures, for a total of 49 — 18 Slashers, 5 Tunnelers, 5 Scouts, 5 Brutes, 5 Archers, 5 Scavengers, 5 Champions, and 1 Leader. In addition, this expansion contains damage tokens, hives, special tokens, and a new scenario — the very difficult Bug Hunt.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Politics in Flames
description:
Politics in Flames (PoliF) allows you to economically, politically and militarily bring minor countries into your sphere of interest during the critical years of World War II. Can you woo Czechoslovakia, Spain, Turkey and Brazil amongst dozens of other countries to help you in your war of liberation?

There are 200 Politics in Flames counters that include the political markers for Politics in Flames, heavy weapons units for Russia and China, warlord counters, friction markers, new carriers that include surface to air missiles, partisan headquarters, late war Soviet jets and night fighters.

PoliF is a World in Flames expansion and part of the The Millenium World in Flames Annual.

(ADG’s description)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Political, Wargame, World War II

name: Dicemaster: Doom Cubes
description: Doom Cubes is a collectable expansion to Dicemaster: Cities of Doom. The addition of many different types of dice creates a more complex and challenging Dicemaster game.
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Stonehenge: Nocturne Expansion
description:
The first expansion to the revolutionary Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game is Stonehenge: Nocturne. This expansion continues the tradition of bringing the best board game designers in the world together to work on different games using the same pieces.

Stonehenge: Nocturne features three wildly different games by four world-class designers. This expansion's designers are Klaus-Jürgen Wrede (designer of Carcassonne), Andrew Looney (designer of Fluxx), and the team of Bruno Cathala and Serge Laget (designers of Shadows Over Camelot). Plus there's a bonus solitaire game by Mike Selinker. The games uniquely showcase the personalities of their designers, giving players a wide variety of play experiences.

Nocturne also expands Stonehenge by introducing pieces for sixth and seventh players. Previously published games can also be played with these extra pieces.

Stonehenge: Nocturne contains 20 disks, 20 bars, and two pawns in two new colors, and one rule book with these brand-new games:


Sun & Moon (2, 4, or 6 players) by Klaus-Jürgen Wrede
The Star Gate (2-7 players) by Bruno Cathala and Serge Laget
Stonehenge Hippie Festival (3-6 players) by Andrew Looney
Battle of the Beanfield (1 player) by Mike Selinker


Expands

Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Game System, Medieval

name: Cards Against Humanity: PAX Prime 2013 Promo Pack
description: A total of 44 additional cards for Cards Against Humanity were released as promotional material during PAX Prime 2013. The cards were distributed in packs of 10 random cards. The card themes focus on video games, board games, sci-fi, and technology.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Railroad Dice: Crossing
description:
Railroad Dice - Crossing is an orange "complex" railroad die (one side of straight track replaced with a crossing) with an additional rules page with information about how to use this new die in Railroad Dice games.

Given for free during the Essen fair 2004.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Trains
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Cashflow 202
description:
Cashflow 202 is an expansion to Cashflow 101 that focuses on Technical Investing including a simple system for options and short sales. The expansion pack is a new set of four decks of cards and new player sheets to handle the new investments possible. It is unplayable without Cashflow 101.

Components:
Capital Gain Deal cards replace the Small Deal deck.
Cash Flow Deals replace the Big Deal deck.
A new deck of more punishing Doodad cards replaces the 101 Doodad cards.
42 Market cards replace the 101 Market deck.
Stock shorting envelopes for each player for the two major stocks players can make short sales in. (Unfortunately with glue still on the envelope flaps that people will invariably forget and lick shut.)
(4 cassette tapes on investing.)

Major rule changes
Market Deck is now reshuffled after drawing 25 cards, removing the guarantee that all Market cards will be played.
Also, a new rule exists that attempts to fix how the Market deck was under drawn with 2-4 players. Now landing in the Rat Race on either an Opportunity or Market space causes you to draw both a Deal card (your choice still large or small) and a Market card each time.
In the Fast Track, landing on a business you already own allows you to franchise it. Pay the down payment, add an additional token, and receive the additional cashflow listed on the board again.

Players not only start by filling out their sheet with a ?career? as before, but also randomly draw a starting investment portfolio as well.

The game is definitely more chaotic and not as idiot-proof as Cashflow 101, and investments can be entirely wiped out. The game teaches gambling theory and cash management. For instance, if a bet only wins 1 in 20 times, but pays off 50:1 when it does, this is a good bet. The issue then is cash management through the losing cycle placing bets steadily while waiting for the payoff.
categories: Economic, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Number
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation, Stock Holding

name: Killer Bunnies Bunny Blanks #2
description:
In the second set of Bunny Blanks, two more Psi series cards are released: Shazbot and After Darkness. Both are kite/arrow cards and use the same color matching mechanic introduced in the first set of Bunny Blanks. The set also includes blank stickers and cardstock for players to fashion their own Killer Bunnies cards.

Expands:

Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Munchkin Special Holiday Edition
description:
NOTE: This is the 2009 Holiday Edition, not to be confused with the 2010 Holiday Edition.

This special Holiday Edition comes in a box with a unique cover design. It includes all the classic Munchkin cards, in full color for the first time! It also includes the brand new expansion, Waiting For Santa, with 15 new monsters and treasure to add Christmas spice to the Munchkin fruitcake!

This product was released before May 2010.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Christian Fluxx
description:
These are 7 cards to add to a regular Fluxx deck. The cards in this set include Christian themes of The Cross and the Story of Jesus and give a player a bonus for knowing or showing their Christian faith.

Fluxx is a card game where the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game.

Part of the Fluxx series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Boat Wars
description:
"If you thought the roads were tough in 2038, you ain't seen nothin' yet. Boat Wars takes the action and excitement of Car Wars off the land and onto water. This supplement gives you complete, official rules for movement, combat and construction of boats and hovercraft. In addition, there are full-color counters for all the vehicles in the game, and a large, blue-water map to play on."

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: 6: Siege – Dead End
description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege. Gameplay is fast and frenetic, allowing players to feel the tension of a cinematic assault with simulated real-time gameplay. Players control a team of 5 operators (all attackers or all defenders), with each Operator boasting different gadgets and abilities. Building your team of 5 is a very rewarding step of the game, offering endless possibilities and strategic choices. As the attacker, you will use your explosive arsenal to tear down walls and obstacles to reach your objective! As the defender, you will shape the battleground to your advantage and seek to thwart your opponent’s plans by denying them chances to attack.

"Map Pack 2: Dead End, contains two more maps, Oregon and Chalet. Oregon is very open, with long hallways. It enables the most nimble Operators to make the most tactical plays, and that will force you to always think one step ahead. Oregon also has a lot of sniping spots, so… beware.

Chalet keeps Operators on their toes as no place is 100% safe. It is also quite vertical, and movement becomes even more tactical!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Real-time, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Variable Player Powers

name: Mighty Empires: Warhammer Expansion
description:
Mighty Empires, the first Warhammer Expansion, enables you to fight sweeping campaigns throughout the Warhammer World. The flexible tile-based map system ensures that no two campaigns need be the same. The plastic map tiles are extremely versatile and with the exception of the mountain tiles all the tiles are double-sided. This gives a staggering 90 tile options per kit. also included is a full rulebook on how to run and play Mighty Empires campaigns.

White Dwarf issue #330 (July 2007) is packed with 2 free tiles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Get Bit! Squid Die Expansion
description:
This expansion was released in connection with Mayday Games' 2012 Kickstarter campaign for their Deluxe version of Get Bit!.

You will use the special Squid die for this expansion. At the start of every turn, before cards are chosen, have the swimmer in front roll the die. Leave the die up for everyone to see for the entire round.

Consult the die:
• Calm Seas (Even number of 2,4 or 6 comes up): Oh how nice... no change at all! You are "even" with the sea. The round is played as normal.

• Tidal Wave (Odd number 3 or 5 comes up): What the heck happened? You are "at Odds" with the sea! After selecting cards and running the Get Bit! phase as usual, with the shark biting the swimmer in the back, and the swimmer jumping to the front, the shark then is also moved to the front, reversing the order of the entire line, so the front becomes the back and vice versa.


• Ink Cloud (Squid image comes up): It's chaos I tell you! Chaos! For this round, all cards played are randomly chosen, and the Get Bit! phase is skipped.

Sharkspansion Note: The shark also plays a random card, but it has no effect. The Ink Cloud does not cause the shark to “miss.”

(Squid Die: 6 sides, Numbers 2-6 with one side Ink Cloud icon)

For Walk the Plank:

The die has 6 sides, with The Calm Sea (3 sides), Tidal Wave (2 sides), Kraken (Squid) on one side. It is rolled any time someone falls off the end. Calm Sea nothing happens, Tidal Wave pushes all pirates that are furthest off the plank back toward the ship and Squid would mean anyone on the very last plank is pulled off into the sea by the monster!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Deck Building: The Deck Building Game – The Barbecue Grill Promo
description: Every deck needs a barbecue grill! Fortunately, this promo pack contains the four barbecue grill cards you need for Deck Building, The Deck Building Game.
categories: Card Game

name: 12 Realms: Ancestors Legacy
description:
Exciting adventure begins as 12 Realms return with an expansion entitled Ancestors Legacy! Four exciting new Realms lie hidden in the Fairy world and you must prepare yourself to explore them so as to defeat all of their enemies. Kievan Empire, Golden Caliphate, Olympia, and Nile Valley are the new lands you will get to explore to learn their secrets. Ruslan, Prince Ivan, Sinbad, Andromeda, along with the rest of the heroes, will unite to fight against Marid, Sobek, Anubis and the rest of the Dark Lords. Do not underestimate their power this time!


Ancestors Legacy will provide a much different game through its Plots. There are now seven different Plots for both the first edition and the new one, which will include a background story and will significantly increase the difficulty and excitement of the game – increasing the amount of decisions that players will have to make. Now, more than ever, team camaraderie will be necessary in order to reach victory! For each of the new Plots, you will discover different and customizable game set-ups.
The biggest challenge of this edition will be comprised of two specific plots which will take the game to an entirely different level. Plots are something completely new for 12 Realms. A Plot may have you playing with six Realms (combining old and new lands), facing all of the Dark Lords, or creating a really fast game with a unique set-up. No matter what your choice will be, Ancestors Legacy will take you to another world where your actions will determine the future of the Fairy lands and all the known Heroes.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 6: Siege – Year 1: Re-Enforce
description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege. Gameplay is fast and frenetic, allowing players to feel the tension of a cinematic assault with simulated real-time gameplay. Players control a team of 5 operators (all attackers or all defenders), with each Operator boasting different gadgets and abilities. Building your team of 5 is a very rewarding step of the game, offering endless possibilities and strategic choices. As the attacker, you will use your explosive arsenal to tear down walls and obstacles to reach your objective! As the defender, you will shape the battleground to your advantage and seek to thwart your opponent’s plans by denying them chances to attack.

Year 1 - Re-Enforce adds 8 operators to the base game. All of them being from the first year, or the first season, of the video game. They expand upon existing mechanisms and provide different options. And with the expanded roster, you’ll have more creative freedom while drafting your squad. Some Operators really benefit from synergies, while others are particularly suited for a specific environment

For the attackers, Blackbeard is a more resilient Operator while Buck and Hibana are wall-breachers above all. Last but not least, Capitão is all about creating – literal – chokepoints with his asphyxiating bolts!

On the defenders’ side, Frost and Caveira provide very powerful reactions the attacker doesn’t want to see triggered! On the other hand, Valkyrie and Echo are all about locating their targets: no one can escape their vigilant eye.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Real-time, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Variable Player Powers

name: What Do You Meme?: NSFW Expansion Deck
description:
Warning: Mature Content! This new expansion for What Do You Meme? party game includes 90 new ADULT caption cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Machi Koro: Fabrique de jouets du Père Noël
description:
Goodies webpublished by Moonster Game France on Christmas 2014.

The card is a monument built at the beginning of the game.

The card says:

Santa Claus's toys manufactures
Once per turn, if your dice land crooked, take 3 coins.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Dice

name: 6: Siege – Year 3: Hard Breach
description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege.

Year 3 - Hard Breach adds 8 operators to the base game. All of them being from the third year, or the third season, of the video game. They expand upon existing mechanisms and provide different options. And with the expanded roster, you’ll have more creative freedom while drafting your squad. Some Operators really benefit from synergies, while others are particularly suited for a specific environment

For attackers, Maverick and Nomad can help their teammates to move with their Orange Destroy ability. Maverick’s blowtorch especially enhances his wallbreaching capabilities. Finka and Lion use high-tech, respectively nanobots, to heal allies, or ping enemies with drones.

Defenders are all about preparing the field before the game starts. Evil Eye cameras from Maestro not only surveil, they also shoot! Rtila claws from Kaïd also deal damage. Clash’s shield protects her but also shoots stunning projectiles. Alibi is the least protected of the lot, but is a nightmare to locate with her holo prisma.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Real-time, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Variable Player Powers

description:
Arcane Magic expands and updates the magic rules for Warhammer - the game of fantasy battles.

Expands:

Warhammer (Fourth Edition): Battle Magic
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Igels 2: Waschtag
description:
Igels 2: Waschtag is an expansion to Igels: Das Kartenspiel and adds two new groups of animals: raccoons and birds. The fight for food is even more difficult now with 5 or 6 payers. But new munition is added as well.

Ages 10 and up. Released: Essen 2007

Expands:

Igels: Das Kartenspiel
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: +10 Bag o' Munchkin d6
description:
User SummaryContains 10 of the custom Munchkin d6s, one from every core set that currently exists:

Munchkin (cream with brown ink)
Munchkin Bites! (black with red ink)
Munchkin Booty (dark red with yellow ink)
Munchkin Cthulhu (green with yellow ink)
Munchkin Fu (white with red ink)
Munchkin Impossible (blue-gray with red ink)
Munchkin Zombies (pearlescent with black ink)
The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin (brown with tan ink)
Star Munchkin (black with blue ink)
Super Munchkin (blue with yellow ink).


Special Rule:

Horribly Unbalanced Rule

During combat on your turn, once per game, you may roll all 10 Munchkin d6 and take a +10 bonus in that combat for each die that comes up with a Munchkin head. You may not use this rule if you're fighting for the winning level at the time you roll the dice -- but if it turns into a fight for the win after you roll, you keep your bonus!



OtherPart of the Munchkin series
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Mint Cooperative: Double Mint & Ruth Canal Promos
description:
"Backers expressed a desire to see an 'easy villain to learn on/play with kids' and we included a matching stunt to help ease the difficulty. Since not everyone plays this way, we didn't feel like it made sense to included as a standard component of the game. That is why it is a Kickstarter exclusive that YOU can choose.

"If you thought Nick & Ginger were bad, meet the Mother of the Mother of Mouth Disease! A truly Gross Great-Granny, Ruth Canal is an aged antihero who still manages a bit of elderly evildoing. Good for kids and learning, Ruth might be a bit long in the tooth to put up a real ruckus, but rest assured her grandson, Nick, is ready to mistreat your mandible for making his grandma such an easy mark.

"Double the pleasure, double the fun! Double Mint is the promo stunt that you need to succeed!"

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: 12 Realms: Ghost Town
description:
The epic journey continues as 12 Realms return with an expansion entitled Ghost Town! A new Realm is now challenging the heroes of the Fairy world and you must be ready to face the dark forces lie hidden in it. In this realm there is no Town because the Dark Lords cursed it and one the Heroes is trapped in there.

Your object is to find the three missing items of the Marshall. You must complete this task before the Invasion Marker reaches number 16. When you find all the items, the Town will appear once again and then you will be able to travel to that Realm and help the trapped Hero to defeat all the Invaders.

You must be very careful! The Ghost Town invaders have different abilities. As long as the Town is not visible you have to fight their Ghost side..!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly Stock Exchange Add-on
description:
STOCK EXCHANGE was orignally marketed by Capitol Novelty Co. as a supplement for Monopoly, Easy Money, and Finance real estate trading games. It allows players to buy and trade stocks in addition to real estate. Players attempt to build a portfolio of stock which will pay them dividends and give them more monetary clout during the game.

Parker Brothers purchased the game from Capitol Novelty in 1936 and marketed it for a short time as a supplement for only Monopoly and Finance games (both Parker Brothers games), dropping Milton Bradley's Easy Money game. The 1937 version dropped the Finance reference and only listed Monopoly on the game box.

Contains: Stock exchange board space (fits over "Free Parking."), eleven new Community Chest cards, ten new Chance cards, thirty stock shares (five each of six different companies).

Expands:

Monopoly
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Capitol Novelty Co, Chessex, Copp Clark Publishing Company, John Sands Pty Ltd, Parker Brothers

name: Carnival: The Sideshow
description:
The Sideshow comes complete with three promotional products - expansion cards, collector's dice, and the game Lucky Dice. These products will never be offered for sale in stores by Dice Hate Me Games.

This six-card addition to your Carnival box is sure to add even more fun! These cards replace the Wilds from the base game and all feature a character from the carnival sideshow. In play, they can behave just as the original Wilds or they can be discarded to perform the event specified on the card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Conquest of Pangea: Atlantis
description:
An add-on to the Origins Award-Winning game, Conquest of Pangea, Atlantis introduces a new continent which attaches to the first subcontinent to break off from Pangea, as well as a new terrain type, Hot Springs, and a new Power card. Additionally, the ruleset outlines revisions and clarifications to the basic rule set.

Expands:

Conquest of Pangea
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Set Collection
publishers: Immortal Eyes Games, Winning Moves Games (USA)

name: I Hate Zombies: We Hate Zombies Too
description:
A crew of 6 more zombie loathers joins those from I Hate Zombies. to battle against the lowliest scum of the Earth.

This expansion also allows for a game of up to 18 players (versus the 12 afforded by the base game alone)!

The characters are:

Forewoman: When a zombie throws "Rock" against you, that zombie suffers 1 wound after applying the results of the battle.

Luchador: When a zombie throws "Paper" against you, that zombie suffers 1 wound after applying the results of the battle.

Lumberjack: When a zombie throws "Scissors" against you, that zombie suffers 1 wound after applying the results of the battle.

Miner: You may throw "dynamite". If you do, and the zombie throws anything but scissors, deal one wound to all zombies. Otherwise, you are infected.

Priest: Whenever the humans closest to your left and right are infected, flips a coin. On heads, the human is instead fully healed.

Salesman: At the start of the game, choose left or right. You cannot be attacked by a zombie from that side.

These promo characters were originally given for free to all Kickstarter backers of the base game, and later made available in the Geek Store on BoardGameGeek.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Party Game, Zombies
mechanics: Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: AEG Black Friday Black Box 2015
description:
AEG's second Black Friday Black Box, containing 7 games:

Bacon Wars
Lost Legacy (Kanai Factory version including Flying Garden and Starship)
Adventure Time: Love Letter (without the Jake sack)
Pretense
Empire Engine (Cold War edition)
Who Stole the Cookie? (Christmas theme)
one of:
Agent Hunter
Cypher



Plus a bag of AEG logo wooden tokens in scarlet, yellow, dark blue, and black (20 of each)
categories: Unspecified

name: Wrong Chemistry: Scientist Card Pack
description:
Wrong Chemistry: Scientist Card Pack includes eleven cards, ten of them represent new mad scientists for use in Wrong Chemistry and the final card stands as a reference card that explains how to use the scientists.

At the beginning of the game, each player chooses one of the available scientists, each of whom has a unique power. The player can use this power only once during the game. Then, that scientist card is discarded.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: We Didn't Playtest This at All: Dice are Fun
description: Dice are Fun is the second mini-expansion to We Didn't Playtest This at All. It works similarly to the Chaos Pack, in that it is a separate deck from the main cards. To play a card from the Dice are Fun deck, a player must discard two star cards (or four normal cards) from their hand. A card is flipped, lots of dice are rolled, and excitement is had. Why? Because Dice are Fun!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: 6: Siege – Concrete City
description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege. Gameplay is fast and frenetic, allowing players to feel the tension of a cinematic assault with simulated real-time gameplay. Players control a team of 5 operators (all attackers or all defenders), with each Operator boasting different gadgets and abilities. Building your team of 5 is a very rewarding step of the game, offering endless possibilities and strategic choices. As the attacker, you will use your explosive arsenal to tear down walls and obstacles to reach your objective! As the defender, you will shape the battleground to your advantage and seek to thwart your opponent’s plans by denying them chances to attack.

"Map pack 1: Concrete City has the Bank and Kafé maps. Bank is all about a claustrophobic and failsafe environment that protects defenders. However, as soon as attackers breach a few walls and get into the thick of the action… they can benefit from it as well. Kafé is quite the opposite: open, with a lot of destructible terrain. No one is safe there. The defenders will need to be nimble, and can’t rely on a shield wall, since it’s so difficult to hold a position. Of course it will come with a dedicated mission booklet for these maps.

—description from the publisher"
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Real-time, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Variable Player Powers

name: Supremacy: Colonial Legions and Merchant Marine
description:
Use Your Colonies to Supply Resources and Men
When you build armies, the number of troops you can deploy is limited by the number of territories you occupy. Now your colonies are important for their raw resources and manpower. The more countries you occupy, the more men you can send to war. When you need troops, you can draft any rogue from any colony.

Get Resources Quick, But Not Cheap
Use your merchant marine to ship your grain oil or minerals in a hurry. You can even get your precious cargoes when you're under attack. The more merchant ships you own, the more resources you can ship. If you have the ships and the money, you can buy anything, from anywhere.

Secure Your Sea Lanes or Else
Beware! The enemy may use his warships and subs to sink your merchant ships. Your days of war are numbered if you're cut off from your supplies of grain, oil and minerals. Remember: no ships, no sales, no money, no victory.

Playing Equipment
Colonial Legions and Merchant Marine come in eight different sets of cubes and oblongs, color matched to a superpower or middle power. Each cube represents one colonial legion or army. Each oblong represents one merchant ship or navy.
Decals with the letter „M" are provided to identify merchant ships. Each player receives twenty decals and places one decal on each of his merchant ships.
Mushroom clouds (18) are black and are shaped like mushrooms. A cloud is used to mark where a nuclear bomb has exploded.

Expands:

Supremacy: The Game of the Superpowers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Cards Against Humanity: PAX East 2014 Promo Pack
description: Given away at the PAX East convention in 2014, a small pack of cards were given in the swag bags, a small subset of the complete set. The set contains a total of 27 different cards, 22 white and 5 black.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Cards Against Humanity: Design Pack
description: This expansion for Cards Against Humanity has got 30 cards fully-illustrated by some of the best graphic designers in the world, including Milton Glaser (I ♥ NY), Susan Kare (the Apple Macintosh), Jessica Hische (Daily Drop Cap), and legendary printmakers including Jay Ryan, Yann Legendre, Olly Moss, Mike Mitchell, Paul Octavious, and Sonnenzimmer.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Cartoona: Heads on Tails Expansion
description:
The Heads on Tails Expansion includes 3 new tail tiles for the Cartoona game. But these are not regular tails, these are little head tails that will allow you to build two-headed creatures!

This expansion will also include 3 new cards:

Use a tail head as a main head or vice versa
+4 to any tail head tile
Use a tail head as front or back feet


This expansion will allow you to build even wackier creatures, and it also changes the game slightly to make 7 and 8 tile creatures easier to complete.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wizard Extreme: Revolution promo card
description:
Promo card given out for free at Essen 2010.

The card is shuffled into the normal playing deck. A player who plays the Revolution card must immediately declare a new trump suit. The card itself has a value of 0 and is colourless, so it cannot win any tricks.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Treasure of Unicorn Gold
description:
Treasure of Unicorn Gold was MicroQuest #6 in the Metagaming MicroQuests series, programmed adventures for Melee and Wizard.

This one involves a real world treasure hunt for a gold statue that was reportedly buried in the United States. The statue was never found (if indeed it existed).

Expands:

Wizard
Melee
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Rail Raiders Infinite: The Good, the Bad, and the Bot
description:
The Good, the Bad, and the Bot is an expansion to Rail Raiders Infinite, raising the player limit to 5.

The expansion includes 2 new Raiders, 6 new Lawbots, and 4 new train car tiles, as well as additional poker dice and cards for each deck (High Noon, Long Arm of the Law, and Loot).
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Trains
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Turn Order: Time Track
publishers: Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ulisses Spiele

name: 12 Realms: Bedtime Story
description:
From our earliest years onward, fairytales have an enormous impact on our lives. They entertain us with the daring deeds of colorful heroes and villains. They inspire us to go on adventures of our own and see the world in whole new ways. And they remind us that no matter how dark life gets, there’s always hope, always a reason to fight for our dreams. Inspired by the fairytale lore we’ve come to love. 12 Realms is a constantly expanding game that offers players the chance to act as fairytale heroes—everyone from Sinbad to King Arthur to Red Riding Hood, Nutcracker, Snow White, Hansel & Gretel, Pinocchio, Robin Hood and beyond—facing down villains and interacting with other lively characters and companions. There the players are tasked with leading their beloved heroes through a magical journey full of excitement and danger to save the Realms from the Dark Lords’ overwhelming hordes. Every hero is represented by a lovingly crafted miniature, already included in the box.
Bedtime Story continues to build on that legacy and brings four new realms: Tang Dynasty, Horrorville, Clockwork Shire and Atlantis. This time Heroes must destroy once and for all the Dark Forces! In Tang Dynasty a god has been born with unlimited power. Player begin their journey from the same realm and they must travel from one land to another but to do that they must destroy the Walls which separate each land. Each Wall has three parts and they can be destroyed by accomplishing different tasks: Find all Artifacts, destroy a Dark Lord or destroy the Black Fortress. When a part of the Wall is removed, the player who did wins some extra and new Talents: the Green ones. These Talents determine the vulnerability of the player at the end of the game. In each round archers on top of the wall attack and all players lose talents, making the game progressively more difficult! Things will become more challenging... As long as player try to destroy the Wall in a Realm, Invaders take over the rest Active Realms! When you get at the Palace, you must all face the god who born there and then one of you can take that power!

On the other other side of the fairy world, Atlantis is sinking and the flood affects all the rest active Realms. Each time you destroy Invaders the water level rise in more than one Realms and you need more Talents to travel there as for the Invaders, they become more powerful. Save as many people, sacrifice your character and buy some time trying to find the solution and save yourselves. The time is running but in Clockwork Shire there is no time. Pinocchio and Geppetto must work to find all the missing gear wheel and re-activate all the Areas and only then you can attack the Invaders who raid the Realm. Use speed, travel among all the realms and find the correct gear wheel but be careful! Steam Baron will be there and you must face his mechanical skills! Regroup your team, this war is not over yet. A madman is running loose in Horrorville, a doctor who transforms people into beasts. If he transforms them all, you lose, so you must work together and find the cure and then you must find this madman and cure him but he is way to strong!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Real-time
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Leaders In Flames
description:
(ADG’s description:)

Leaders in Flames (LiF) contains 140 total counters. It provides 66 counters for a new leader system for the participants in World War II. The counter sheet also includes 74 various other counters to incorporate into your next World in Flames campaign as well.

There are 58 leader counters. Each has a picture of the leader, and his name and rank, on the front. The back of the counter also includes his name and rank as well as the date he is added to the force pool and his abilities.

Leaders in Flames also requires the use of the 8 veto chits (one for each major power) provided, and a veto chart (which you cut into 6 mini-charts, 1 for each player).


LiF is part of the ADC 1998 WiF Annual that also includes;

a 1940~1945 Campaign Scenario,
an optional expansion to the US entry system,
more late war kit for all major powers (esp. France and Italy),
new minor country units (e.g. the Finnish Vainamoinen and Dutch Subs),
the Russian Guards Banner Armies,
and “those 17 pesky German a/c.”
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Political, Wargame, World War II

name: Pariah Missouri (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
Join Hiram, Nellie, Jean and Toro on an adventure to uncover the horror-western town of Pariah Missouri. Follow the graphic novels in this fan-made scenario for the hit game.

TIME Stories is a "deck-ploration" board game published by Space Cowboy games. They published a developer kit and with it I created a Pariah Missouri scenario, a full-fledged game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Novel-based, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Decade Brothers Studio, Rebel Sp. z o.o.

name: Episches Munchkin
description:
Episches Munchkin is a German-language set of 33 reference cards that contain the special Epic Munchkin rules for races and classes between levels 11 and 20. They are the same size as regular Munchkin cards. In addition, it includes a metal level counter, similar to the Munchkin Level Counter released by Steve Jackson Games.

The reference cards cover all classes and races for the following Munchkin games:

Munchkin 1-3
Star Munchkin 1 & 2
Munchkin Bites 1 & 2
Super Munchkin 1 & 2
Munchkin Fu


Note that nothing in this expansion has an in-game effect -- it's just reference cards and a level counter.

Part of the Munchkin series
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing
publishers: (Web published), Pegasus Spiele, Steve Jackson Games

name: 6: Siege – Year 2: High Impact
description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege.

Year 2 - High Impact adds 8 operators to the base game. All of them being from the second year, or the second season, of the video game. They expand upon existing mechanisms and provide different options. And with the expanded roster, you’ll have more creative freedom while drafting your squad. Some Operators really benefit from synergies, while others are particularly suited for a specific environment

The 4 attackers all have 2 Run and 5 Stamina. No one’s super tanky, no one’s super nimble. However, all four have abilities that will disrupt defense. Jackal and Dokkaebi are perfect for pinging and revealing enemies. With her Candelas, Ying can stun them while Zofia excels at ranged destruction with her rounds.

On the defenders’ side, the four profiles are very different. Mira improves defenses from her team at the beginning of the game, but can also pierce ceiling to help Operators shoot from Upstairs… Lesion and Ela, thanks to their Gu and Grzmot mines, are going to weaken attackers who cross specific thresholds. Vigil, however, will be able to stay in the shadows for as long as he wants, only to appear at the right moment.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Real-time, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Variable Player Powers

name: Mask of the Munchkin
description:
Publisher's DescriptionA Munchkin for every season, and a Mask for every Munchkin! This Munchkin freebie should be downloaded, cut, glued, and worn to your next Munchkin game. Put it on to avoid a Trap or Curse! Wear it on Halloween when you go trick-or-treating! Just don't drive wearing it.

Official Rules

You may use this Mask in any game of Munchkin or its sequels. It may be used whenever a Trap or a Curse is played upon you.


When a Trap or a Curse is played upon you, exclaim loudly "Mighty Mask of the Munchkin, I call upon your Power!"



Put on the Mask. The Trap or Curse no longer affects you.



You must keep the Mask on for the rest of the game. If you take off the Mask for any reason, you lose one level.



Special Halloween Rule: For any games played on October 31st, wearing the Mask of the Munchkin for the entire game allows you to win by attaining Level 9.


Wearing multiple Masks is legal, and very Munchkinly. However, you will lose one level per mask if they come off! Masks must be worn on your head, but not necessarily your face.

The winning level must always be attained by killing a monster, regardless of what exact number that level is. And no, you can't win at Level 8 by wearing two Masks on Halloween.



OtherPart of the Munchkin series.

Mask is a freebie from Steve Jackson Games and can be downloaded as a PDF from their e23 store. See the "Web Links" section, below, for the direct link to the Mask of the Munchkin download.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Get Bit! Dolphin Die Expansion
description:
