This expansion was released in connection with Mayday Games' 2012 Kickstarter campaign for their Deluxe version of Get Bit!.

You will use the Dolphin die for this expansion, as well as the special Dolphin card for each player. At the start of the game, give each swimmer the extra “D” card for their color, replacing the highest number in your hand. (So the swimmers should have the numbers 1 to however many players there are, plus the Dolphin card.)

When a “D” card is played, before swimmers are moved, that player rolls the Dolphin die. That player’s card is considered to be whatever number was rolled for all purposes, including tying with other dice/cards. Multiple “D” cards are NOT considered to tie each other unless they roll the same value.

The dolphin comes up if the player rolls a “6” but it is treated as if the player had played a "9", and the shark icon is considered a “0.” As these numbers are not present on cards, they only ever tie if multiple swimmers play their dolphin card in the same round and roll the same icon.

(Dolphin Die: 2, 3, 4, 5, Dolphin(6), Shark/(0))

For Walk the Plank:

This is a single D6 Die that will have on it the numbers 2-5 as well as a number 0 (with a shark) and a number 9 (with a dolphin). This shark/dolphin die would be fun for the first person to lose a man off the edge to roll a single time. If it is a 0 then he loses his guy for good and cannot do anything (eaten by the shark), if a number 2-5 comes in it is good luck for him, he can move that many pirates one length toward the edge of the plank, but cannot use it to push anyone overboard. If the #9 comes up with the dolphin, it is extremely good luck and his man actually gets pushed back onto the plank, but remains on the last plank spot. Additionally no one can play the "shorten the plank" on the round after the #9 comes up to protect this one man for one round.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Cartoona: Expansions – includes Heads on Tails and Long Necks
description:
Inside this box are two expansions for the creature-building, tile-laying game Cartoona.

The Heads On Tails expansion allows Cartoona players to build wacky two-headed creatures. Included are 3 new tiles and 3 new cards.

The Long Necks expansion includes neck tiles that can be placed in-between a head tile and a body tile. These neck tiles can be placed even when the head and body have already been connected, and multiples can be played for some seriously long necks! Neck tiles can also be placed on the creatures of your opponents to disrupt their strategy, or even take away points! Included are 6 new tiles and 4 new cards.

Both of these expansions require the Cartoona base game to play.
categories: Children's Game

name: Cards Against Humanity: Reject Pack 2
description: Cards Against Humanity: Reject Pack 2 is a Cards Against Humanity expansion for which each of the creators picked three favorite cards that didn't make it into the final game. The pack contains 24 white cards and 10 black cards, and each card bears a line drawing of one of the creators in the lower right corner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Set Dice
description:
Set Dice has three dice games in one box, and in all three games, the more sets you make, the higher your score. What's a set, you ask? To make a set, you need three dice on which the shape of the symbols on them are all the same or all different, on which the number of symbols are all the same or all different, and on which the color of the symbols are all the same or all different. The three games in this collection are:


Set Cubed: Players score points Scrabble-style by creating sets with their dice and with dice already on the game board.



Scramble Set: Drop all 42 dice from the bag onto the table, then start calling out sets as soon as you see them. When no more sets remain, tally the number of sets for each player, then start another round. Whoever has the high score after five rounds wins.



Crossword Set: Each player takes ten dice, then rolls them at the same time to start play, with players trying to combine their dice into a crossword-style grid made of sets. Whoever uses all of her dice first wins.
categories: Dice, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Afrikan tähti: Retkikunnat
description:
From the game box: "Answer the call of the diamond - A new game, to be played on the familiar board of Afrikan Tähti, which will take your adventure to a whole new level!"

Afrikan tähti - Retkikunnat is an expansion to Afrikan tähti, the most popular Finnish board game. Actually, it's more like a new game, played using the components of the old game. Instead of hunting directly for the treasure, players must first form a team, finding resources and allies. Once the team is ready, players can start hunting for the big diamond.

Finding the big diamond is not the end of it, like in the original game: now it's possible to steal the treasure from another player.

Also, players do not start with identical resources: each player has a different character, with special powers.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: BANG! Face Off
description:
From the publisher (edited):

BANG! Face Off features three characters: a Sheriff, an Outlaw and a Renegade; the latter will be moved by both the players and, as in the original game, will be an ambiguous character that will not openly take a side.

The two players take the outlaw and sheriff sides and face off on a board representing either a canyon of death or the OK Corral. The renegade is moved by both the players. The Bang! cards are used to move and fight with the characters.

The rules also explain how to use BANG! Face Off with the official expansions produced by daVinci Games.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Print & Play

name: The Sherlock Files: Demo Deck – Whereabouts Unknown
description:
The Sherlock Files is a cooperative mystery series. This demo deck is a quick introduction to the system that you can play with 1-8 players in 30 minutes.

Work together to follow the clues, piece together the evidence, and then identify who did it, how, and why.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory

name: 12 Realms: The Crab
description:
The Crab is a Special Edition Miniature and has special gameplay.

If players are able to defeat the Dark Lord of Bone Island, a Crab with a pirate hat remains.
To help you, the Crab follows you to every Realm. The Crab offers you additional blue talents to use. Which talents you can use depends on the Dark Lord you defeat on the Bone Island.
Used talents from the Crab didn't recover. If all talents from the Crab are spent, the Crab is gone.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Batman: Year One (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
New Job: Preserve the temporal continuity of an alternate universe.

New Boss: Step aside Bob. Oracle is in charge of this team.

New Mission: Remove every corrupt member of the Gotham City Police Department.

(No previous knowledge of Batman is required)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mega Man: The Board Game – Time Man & Oil Man
description: Adds Time Man and Oil Man to Megaman: The Board Game. Includes both figures, level boards for each, minion tokens for each robot master's level, and 2 additional Megaman figures and decks which expand the game to 8 possible players.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Doggy Go! (includes expansion)
description:
Doggy acrobats are coming to town! They practiced so hard before the show, but unfortunately, their trainer has fallen ill! What should they do without their trusted trainer? How can they keep the practice going? Oh! Maybe the new trainer can help them out! Come on! The doggy show is counting on you now!

Doggy Go! is a speed game in which players try to be the first to complete the patterns on acrobat cards with their doggy tiles. Whoever scores the most acrobat cards in the end wins!

This edition of Doggy Go! contains both the original Doggy Go! game and the Doggy Go! Plus expansion.
categories: Real-time

name: Vault: A Den of Thieves
description: This mini expansion for “Vault: A Solitaire Dice Game” was originally designed for BGA, however, you can now play the game at home as well! The rules are the same as the original game, the only difference is that all players get the same game sheet, and the same sets of rolls, as they compete to be the best safe cracker. Will you reign as the Pink Panther, or will your name be forgotten? Find out in Vault: A Den of Thieves!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Aeroduel
description:
Aeroduel introduces air power to Car Wars, with complete rules for the expensive but ultra-deadly aircraft of the 21st century. Includes rules for construction, movement and combat for everything that flies -- airplanes, ultralights, airships, helicopters, gliders, autogyros, balloon and even jet packs!

Part of the Car Wars Series.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Magiczny Miecz: Magia
description:
Sfera's last expansion for Magiczny Miecz.

This added a number a cards to various decks, much like the Dragons expansion did for Talisman.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Jewish Fluxx
description:
These are 7 cards to add to a regular Fluxx deck. The cards in this set include Jewish themes of The Torah and Shabbat and give the player a bonus for showing or knowing their Jewish heritage.

Expands:

Fluxx


Part of the Fluxx series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Superfight: The Loot Crate Deck
description: This is a 100 card version of the viral card game superfight, designed by Skybound for sale on Loot Crate . These cards are only available in this exclusive deck. Create hilarious fighters with these cards, then argue over who would win in a fight between them.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor

name: Evil Baby Orphanage: Crayon Manifesto
description:
10 Time Nanny Cards
5 Toy Cards
20 Action Cards
15 New Unique Babies
1 Time Machine Card

Requires base game to play.

The Crayon Manifesto is a supplement to the Evil Baby Orphanage card game. It introduces Time Nanny cards which give players alternate win conditions or special abilities, adding a whole new layer to the game! Be careful, there are also fifteen brand new toddlers to terrorize your orphanage.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Car Wars Tanks
description:
Tanks Expansion for Car Wars

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Racing, Science Fiction, Transportation, Wargame

name: Air War '80
description:
An update to the original SPI game Air War.

"16 pages of additional rules, additional scenarios (14), and addenda.
100 counters representing 15 new aircraft types.
72 page booklet of updated and expanded charts and tables, including performance characteristics of 15 new aircraft and 5 new missile types."
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: 12 Realms: Promo Invaders Pack
description:
The promo Invaders Pack includes twelve cards and twelve tokens, three cards and three tokens for each of the following Realms: Cherry Blossom, Fairy Forest, Bones' Island, Silver Kingdom.

You can mix the Invader Cards in the existed Realms' Deck but always keep the balance. Remove the number of the Invaders from the main Realms' Deck and add the equivalent number of the Promo Invaders in the same deck in order to play.

The Promo Invaders represent creatures of the game but in their petrified form. Their role in the game is pretty much the same as the normal Invaders but all of them have something common. To win such an Invader, you must exploit the double amount of the needed Talents.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Trivial Pursuit: Greatest Hits
description: Trivial Pursuit Greatest Hits takes 600 questions each "hand-picked" from three other Trivial Pursuit editions: The '80s, The '90s, and Pop Culture II. Players can choose to use questions from any one of the three games, or mix and match them all together.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Atmosfear: The Soul Rangers
description:
Continue the experience!
The Gatekeeper's been banished to a Black Hole by the deeply disturbed and demented dentist, Dr Mastiff and the Provinces have gone to the Dogs!
Get down and dirty with your new Game Host, Dr Mastiff, live from the depths of his dental surgery set in the stinking wastes of the sewers of The Other Side, in this exciting New Add-On game to Atmosfear 'The Harbingers,' with unique 'Scabby Dog Ranger' gameplay.
"Who'd ya expect - The Tooth Fairy?"
Join The Soul Rangers and become one of Dr Mastiff's six cohorts - Sep, Nof, Ja, Zass, Rott and Woks - as You turn Atmosfear upside-down and plunge The Other Side into absolute anarchy!
"I say let's play, my baby cakes... Surgery's open!"
The Harbingers are long gone and The Other Side is now ruled by Mastiff who runs a pirate 'Radio Riot' show from his surgery deep in the mosh pits beneath the Provinces. But rebellion is in the air again.
"Where's 'The Most Filthy One'?... Greetings, Face Stain!"
Now The Rangers are playing by their own set of rules with their very own 'Grunt' Numbskull to help do their dirty work! Brand new Fate Cards ensure more 'filthy' gameplay and with 36 'twisted' Ranger Weapon Cards, duelling has never been so dastardly between The Soul Rangers! Even the coveted Keystones that once unlocked great powers are now shackles in any Ranger's pursuit to win at Dr Mstiff's own game.
"I's Mastiff. Dr Mastiff... So, don't froth me up 'coz I'm Twisted!"
He calls his game 'The Operating Hour' and You have just 60 minutes before you become his next victim!
Atmosfear- The Soul Rangers. Bite off more than you can chew- Now!
Warning! You need a copy of Atmosfear - The Harbingers to play this game!
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Evil Baby Orphanage: Nerdfighteria Expansion
description:
John and Hank Time Nannies
5 Toys
20 Action Cards
6 Unique evil babies

The Nerdfighteria expansion is a supplement to the Evil Baby Orphanage card game. It lets you and your friends run your orphanages in true Nerdfighter fashion. Prevent your babies from being bullied with the nerdfighter gang sign, or unleash the giant squid of anger. But whatever happens, keep calm and don't forget to be awesome!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: T.I.M.E Stories: Tric Trac TV
description:
The Tric Trac TV scenario created by CROC is a short print and play (PnP) scenario available on the french gaming web site trictrac.tv. Link to the download page is https://www.trictrac.net/actus/le-scenario-de-la-tt-tv-en-te....

Agents need to resolve a mystery in the local offices of Tric Trac TV.
categories: Adventure, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Super Story War
description:
From the box:

"Super Story War is a hilarious party game where 3 to 8 players battle each other by telling stories, referencing pop culture, and making stuff up!

Play as a character like a Pirate, a Detective or a Mad Scientist. Each card is only as powerful as the story you build around it. No numbers, no dice, just your imagination!

Super Story War is designed to be played on its own, but the cards can be shuffled with other volumes of Story War for even crazier match-ups!"

In each round of play, one player is considered to be the Judge. The Judge draws a Battlefield card, that determines where the battles will take place. The other players split into teams, and play Warrior cards from their hand onto the table. Then the battle commences, with players on each team using their imagination to tell the Judge why their warriors would win in a fight against their opponents, or how they would defend against their opponents' attacks. Examples from the rulebook:

"Police Dog reads you your rights!"

"But the Ninja vanishes into the shadows!"

The Judge is the final arbiter of what is and isn't permissible, and also decides any challenges. Players can also use Item cards from their hand to add more collateral to the fight ("Alien uses this Jetpack to escape!"). When one team is completely defeated, or when the Judge is ready to rule in one side's favor, the round is over. Winning teams keep their used Warriors as victory cards. The game ends when everyone has had a chance to be the Judge once or twice (depending on the number of players), and the teams with the most victory cards is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Party Game

name: Trivial Pursuit: Walt Disney Family Edition Card Set
description:
This is an expansion to the Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition Master game featuring Disney questions.

It contains the following categories:

World of Places
World of People
World of Science
World of Music
World of Fantasy
World of Leisure


Like other expansions it contains two boxes of questions. The blue box has questions for adults and the gold box has questions for younger players. Every card has a mixture of generic trivia questions and Disney questions, with at least one Disney question per card.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: The Italian Campaign: Med War
description:
The Italian Campaign Series: MedWar, is the fourth & final game in the series. This game adds a strategic map of the Mediterranean Sea around Italy and adds full Air and Naval operations to the game system. The game cannot be played by itself... ownership of Sicily, Salerno, and Anzio, are required. This game was first published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #160.

Numerous scenarios and campaign games are provided. Each one uses counters and maps from all of the preceding games in the series. Victory is determined by the scenario being played.

Eleven pages of additional errata and clarifications for rules, maps, and counters are also included in the S&T magazine for all of the games in the series.

Game Scale:
Turn: 1 to 2 days
Hex: 5 miles
Unit: Company to Brigade

Game Inventory:
One 22" X 34" mapsheet
One countersheet (240 1/2" counters)
One 20 page rule booklet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Something Different: Kickstarter Exclusive Cards
description: This is a set of fifteen new cards for Something Different, distributed exclusively to people who funded the game on Kickstarter.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: What Do You Meme?: Game of Thrones Photo Expansion Pack
description:
Winter is here!
Our most binge-worthy expansion pack ever made
Your chance to meme Cersei, Jon Snow, Tyrion Lannister, and all your favorite Game of Thrones characters
75 Photo Cards to be added to core game


Requires What Do You Meme? core game to play


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Terraforming Mars: French Championship Promo Cards
description:
These two fan made promo cards were distributed during the 2019 Terraforming Mars France championship, organized by the association Ludophiles d'Asnières et d'Ailleurs and overseen by Intrafin.

"Cité hydraulique" was distributed to each participant; "Ludophiles d'Asnières et d'Ailleurs" to the 16 finalists.

Rules
- Cité hydraulique (Hydraulic city):
Requires 5 oceans. Place a city tile on an ocean tile. Decrease your energy production 1 step. The ocean tile beneath your city is still considered as an ocean.
Draw one card per two oceans on the board.

- Ludophiles d'Asnières et d'Ailleurs (corporation):
You start with 50 M€.
Effect: Duplicate the effect or the action of one of the corporations discarded by your opponents (production, ressources and are ignored).
categories: Economic, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Vanuatu: The Rising Waters
description:
Description from the publisher:

"Global warming threatens Vanuatu. Many islands are in danger of disappearing under the sea due to rising waters. Players will therefore have to unite to protect the islands by building dikes. However, the interests of one are not necessarily the interests of others."

Vanuatu: The Rising Waters, the first extension for Vanuatu, adds an option (as part of the Build action) for players to build dikes to protect islands from rising waters. Water can reduce a player's points from houses, submerge an island completely, and even end the game early with no winner.
categories: Environmental, Expansion for Base-game

name: Survival / The Barbarian
description:
This is a Task Force Games Double Game, consisting of two complete games within one package. Both games originally appeared in White Dwarf magazine, and were later released together as one of the pocket games. Altogether there are 108 counters.

Survival! is a science fiction game depicting the struggle of Jardine, a crashed Scout, to reach safety. Along the trek he will meet and fight various vicious animals. While Survival is an excellent solitaire game, there are scenarios for up to six players.

The Barbarian is a fantasy game for one or two players, depicting the quest of Vaarn the Barbarian to locate and recover the lost sword and shield of the Old Fathers.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Story War Deluxe
description: This is the Kickstarter exclusive promo edition of Story War. It's best played by mixing cards into other editions. The box contains 27 Warrior cards (including Grumpy Cat, Nyan Cat, and Keyboard Cat), 4 items (including Towel) , 1 Battlefield (Cyberspace), 40 blank Warrior cards, 20 blank Item cards, and 20 blank Battlefield cards.
categories: Card Game, Party Game

name: Svea Rike: Batalj
description:
An expansion for the game Svea Rike.

Box lid lists additions as: Rules for looting with map over central Europe; rules for arch-bishops; new rules of warfare with an extra board for the battlefield and sixty soldier pieces. Also 29 event cards, 6 regent cards and six history cards.

The extra cards are mostly concerned with adding things for the new games, and the rest are copies of present cards to increase their count.

The additions are separate and can be added one by one or all at once depending upon which ones are preferred.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Fallen City of Karez: Golden Dragon expansion
description:
The Golden Dragon Guild is one of the oldest guild houses in the known world, and its mysterious demeanor and deity fed the rumors tying them to the destruction of Karez. As the king leaves Karez to its ruins, the Golden Dragon's worshipers can finally construct their secret temple and resurrect their beloved deity.

Fallen City of Karez: Golden Dragon comes with a new deck of allegiance cards. The player who draws the Golden Dragon Allegiance will conspire to destroy the city of Karez! If Karez does not become a City by the end of the game, this player wins the game and all the other players lose.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Dominion: Fan-Edition I
description: Dominion: Fan-Edition I is a German language collection box, including promotional cards, blank cards and additional material.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Change!
description:
A series of three change-making games that takes place in Fridey's, the fast food restaurant of the damned. The games are as follows:

Game 1: Make Your Own Change Night In this one, you're all trying to score extra cash off a Zombie who's a little dim. If he hasn't got exact change for you, he'll give you more money than you gave him. Who can get the best deal?

Game 2: Boneyard There are buckets of money on the table, and it's a silent auction to grab them. Your bids fall back into the buckets, and the first player who can get far enough ahead wins.

Game 3: Diminishing Returns Simple, elegant, and the best of the set. Players start with the same collection of bills, and play money into a common pot until all but one player is out. It's a version of the old Cheapass standard (Fight!) played with bills in denominations of 1, 3, 5, 7, and 10.
categories: Card Game

name: Trivial Pursuit: Silver Screen Edition
description:
A subsidiary card set for Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition featuring all Classic Film questions.

The question categories are:

Settings
Titles
Off Screen
On Screen
Production
Portrayals


The set is comprised of two boxes of question cards - a Master Game is required for play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Trivial Pursuit: Sports Edition
description:
Originally published for the UK market, this expansion is separate from the North American All-Star Sports editions, the Sports mini pack, or any other sports-themed edition.

Categories include:

Soccer
Cricket and Rugby
Track Field and Swimming
Thrills and Spills
Ball Bashers
Extras


The expansion contains only one large (500 card) card box held inside the outer box. It requires a Trivial Pursuit Master Game to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game
description:
Stonehenge is an anthology board game, a new concept where five award-winning game designers, all using the same gaming components, create five very different games in one box. The ancient ruin of Stonehenge will never be the same. The five games are:

A magic game, Magic of Stonehenge, by Richard Garfield (Magic: The Gathering, RoboRally, The Great Dalmuti)
A political game, The High Druid, by Bruno Faidutti (Mystery of the Abbey, Citadels, Knightmare Chess)
A battle game, Arthurian Ghost Knights, by Richard Borg (Battle Cry, Liar's Dice, Memoir '44)
An auction game, Auction Blocks, by James Ernest (Kill Dr. Lucky, Diceland, Pirates of the Spanish Main)
A science-fiction game, Chariots of Stonehenge, by Mike Selinker (Risk Godstorm, Pirates, Axis & Allies Revised)


From racing through the ruins to auctioning them off, these five games and other new games designed for it, will keep Stonehenge fresh for years to come.

Rules for additional Stonehenge games can be found at the http://paizo.com/paizoGames/library.
categories: Game System, Medieval, Political, Science Fiction
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Spielzeit!, Titanic Games, Ubik

name: Miscellaneous Game Compilation
description: A placeholder entry for compendiums/compilations/collections of games released in one package. Typically these are traditional or children's games collected into one box. The most common is a chess/checkers/backgammon/pachisi compilation, though other titles are also highly represented.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Math, Party Game, Racing, Wargame
mechanics: Bingo, Connections, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Static Capture
publishers: (Self-Published), (Unknown), ABC Nürnberg, Abel Klinger, Adolph Holst A/S, Alga, Ambassador Games (Merchant Ambassador), AMIGO, Anker Play Products, Aquamarine Games (COMPUDID), ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Barco de Papel, Berliner Spielkarten, Bible Games Central, Bildgut-Verlag, Bonaparte, Cardinal, Carlit, Cartamundi, Chadwick Miller Inc., Chapters Inc., Clemens Gerhards, Clementoni, Drechsler, ecola: traditional games from around the world, Estrela, Excalibur Electronics, F.X. Schmid, Fame Puzzles, Flamenco, Galt Toys, Geste éditions, Good Play, Grafix Travel Games, H. Roeskes, HABA, Harlekin, Hasbro, Hearth & Hand with Magnolia, Heinrich Schwarz & Co, Hermann Kaniss, Heros, Heye Verlag, Heyne, Hirsbrunner, Holtschneider, Invicta Games, JAKKS Pacific Inc., John Sands Pty Ltd, Jumbo, K. Hjelm Förlag AB, Kemas, Kidconnection, Kirjalito, Klee, Knorr & Hürth, Kuvataide, Lademann Forlagsaktieselskab, Lakeside, Laurence King Publishing Ltd, Lebkuchen-Schmidt, Lemery Games, Lettlands Wertpapierdruckerei Riga

name: Warriors: Dragon Hordes Expansion
description:
The Dragon Hordes expansion (55 cards, two small pages of rules) to Warriors adds a new creature, the Dragon, along with additional Catapults and Attack Cards, and makes the game playable by up to 6 players.

Dragons, unlike other creatures, must attack and defend individually, but just one can wreak havoc. They roll two dice on both attack and defense, adding one to each die roll. Catapults have only one chance in 6 of killing Dragons, and their defense can be augmented by "Flames" (basically, extra lives that must be eliminated before the Dragon can be killed). Having the most Dragons at the end of the game also gains victory points.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That

name: Dungeon Dice: The Lost King
description:
Description from the publisher:

The final Dungeon Dice expansion, adding dungeons, shrines, traps, and new potions to the all-dice game!



StoryThe philosopher’s stone sits atop a pedestal in the greatest temple of Elorim, bathing the
chamber in green light. Purportedly, the jewel fills the hearts of the people with peace,
protects the entire kingdom from evil, and even has the power to grant immortality.

Sadly, the jewel can’t do any of those things, because it is a fake.

The first king of Elorim stole the real jewel. However, no one noticed at the time. It may
have seemed odd when the first king disappeared, but his successor became a casuality of
the ensuing monster epidemic. And the third king soon after, and so forth.

So it wasn’t unusual for a king to be missing.

No one thought much about it, until the recent competition for the throne. As adventurers
made their way into the far reaches of the kingdom, stories began to circulated of a
crowned skeleton clutching a green jewel.

These sightings prompted the clergy to inspect the philosopher’s stone, which proved to
be a clever forgery.

Should a warrior such as yourself defeat the lost king and return the true philosopher’s
stone, it might put a quick end to the blight of monsters. It would be mighty impressive
too!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Magia i Miecz: Jaskinia
description:
This expansion is the only professionally produced expansion NOT to be produced by Games Workshop (or licensees of Talisman.

Jaskinia or the Cave, adds a new board to the game along with a new deck of cards to encounter.

It is thought to be a very difficult expansion as many of the enemies within the Cave have very high scores for Might or Magic.

It seems that the production of this expansion brought about an end to relations between Sfera and Games Workshop, as the license was revoked shortly after this.

Sfera went on to produce a Talisman-esque game, Magiczny Miecz.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Monumental: African Empires
description: African Empires is an expansion to Monumental with new civilizations and game play mechanisms including quests, a new continuous play mode and advanced economics.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Trivial Pursuit: All Star Sports Edition
description:
A subsidiary card set for Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition featuring all Sports questions. The expansion consists only of two boxes of cards; a Master Game (including the board and game pieces) is required to play.

The question categories are:

Nicknames
Baseball
Football
Basketball or Hockey
Catch All
Numbers


American and Canadian versions of the expansion were both published in 1983. The brown category in the U.S. edition is Basketball. In the Canadian it is Hockey. It is unknown whether questions in the other five categories were changed.

The boxes of the two versions are slightly different. In the American version, the letter A in the word "Star" is replaced by a star. In the Canadian, a maple leaf. The Canadian version also omits the Selchow & Righter logo and related indicia from the side of the box.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Trivial Pursuit: Baby Boomer Edition
description:
This is a card set expansion for Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition with the following categories:


Television
Stage and Screen
Nightly News
Publishing
Lives & Times
R.P.M.


Questions are all from the 50s and early 60s.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Parker Brothers, Selchow & Righter

name: Madeira Collector's Edition
description: Madeira, the classic strategy game returns in a KickStarter’s exclusive Collector’s Edition Big Box including 4 new modular expansions, the Ambassadors and Harvester expansions, new premium components.
categories: Dice, Economic, Farming, Nautical
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Super Dungeon: Legends
description:
Super Dungeon Legends provides all the tools you need to create your own adventures, roleplay, and tell epic stories about your Heroes.

Super Dungeon Explore is a combat board game inspired by classic hack-and-slash video games. But that is only the beginning. Super Dungeon is also built upon a deep love for classic Japanese roleplaying games (JRPGs), adventure games, and traditional pencil-and-paper tabletop games. Super Dungeon Legends draws its inspiration from these well loved genres to allow players to craft their own stories in the world of Crystalia.

Super Dungeon Legends is a campaign and roleplaying expansion for Super Dungeon Explore. In Legends, Heroes brave a series of adventures as part of an overall narrative campaign. Between adventures, Heroes spend crystals they have earned from their exploits to unlock new skills and abilities or to craft bizarre and powerful artifacts. Legends introduces new and more powerful battle dice and deep tomes of information about the races, realms, organizations, and—of course—monsters that populate Crystalia.

Legends not only provides the tools to build your own adventures, it also comes with two campaigns, each consisting of multiple adventures and an exciting story for your Heroes to take part in.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Carcassonne: Expansion 7 – The Catapult
description:
The seventh "large" expansion for Carcassonne.
12 new tiles with a faire symbol are added to the game. When a player draws a faire tile, they place it and then a "catapult round" begins.
For the first time, action/dexterity is added to the Carcassonne series. In a catapult round, players attempt to launch special tokens with the wooden catapult. Players have one each of four different kinds of tokens that determine what kind of catapult action is to be taken: Knock out tokens try to remove meeples; Seduction tokens try to swap meeples; Target tokens try to hit the faire tile; Catch tokens must be caught for points.

Expands:

Carcassonne
categories: Action / Dexterity, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Flicking, Tile Placement
publishers: 999 Games, Devir, Enigma (Bergsala Enigma), Giochi Uniti, Hans im Glück, Lautapelit.fi, MINDOK, Piatnik, Rio Grande Games, Schmidt France, Stupor Mundi, Venice Connection

name: CLAC
description:
A high quality trivia board game for young and adults (15 years and older), made of wood. It is innovative in both the dynamics and the questions. To obtain the correct answers the players must figure them out rather than just search in their brains. Thus, the questions are sorted by the abilities required to answer them instead of their corresponding area of knowledge.
The game is played by teams and it is conceived to minimize the frustration: most the questions can be answered by all the players, granting them the pleasure of the intellectual activity carried out successfully.
categories: Memory, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Line Drawing, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Singing, Storytelling, Voting

name: JZ
description:
If you are an Avalon Hill collector, this game is certainly one of the Holy Grails, and may well be the proverbial IT. The big one. Certainly one of the harder titles to track down. This is JZ, a.k.a. WJZ, the game created by WJZ-TV channel 13 in Baltimore, copyrighted by the Robert Goodman agency.

According to AH's Silver Jubilee guide, "WJZ was never in the Avalon Hill line; having been the only game Avalon Hill ever published as a private-label job. [p.25]" Aside from copies retained by Avalon Hill personnel, this game was distributed solely as a promotional item by WJZ-TV in Baltimore, MD (USA).

JZ bills itself as, "The TV ad man's game." Two to six players compete for high score in the form of advertising accounts and advisory fees. Players can make their accounts more valuable with fortunate advertising time purchases.

Contents for the game are as follows:


Instruction sheet
Game board
2 dice
6 pawns
6 strips for marking each accounts' class
24 pink "Buy Time" cards
12 green "Regional" account cards
12 blue "Local" accounts
8 brown "National" account cards
2 small cardboard storage inserts


JZ comes in the standard flat box form typical of AH games made in the late 1950s and early 1960s.

The "Buy Time" cards, of course, are an exercise in shameless self-promotion by WJZ's advertising department -- both for the station and its parent company, Westinghouse. Some of the cards are now a bit dated, with references to buying time on the Buddy Deane Show and the Steve Allen Show.

Luck plays a far greater role than skill, as JZ is a simple roll-and-move game. Each player hopes to land on favorable spaces or draw cards that will allow them to land on and upgrade advertising accounts, going along the board until they bail out at "Retirement" or reach "THE BITTER END". The person with the most valuable advertising portfolio at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Economic, Humor
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Karter Peanut Shell Game
description:
The Karter Peanut Shell Game invites players to 'JOIN THE TAXPAYER'S REVOLT!' with the promise of "over a million laughs." The object of the game is to "waste, squander, throw away and spend all the taxpayer's money."

References to 'Silly's Beer' and 'Panama's Golden Toll Lake' may be found on the playing board and the play money. These serve as reminders of 'Billy Beer' and the return of the Panama Canal to Panama, and insure that the players are well aware of which President is being lampooned.
categories: Humor, Political

name: Drip Dragster
description: Drip Dragster is a racing competition. Each player takes a turn by placing a drop of water on the game board, then maneuvers the drop along the indicated path in the least possible time.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Racing

name: Cut Mat
description:
A small box game for 2 players, Ages 6 and up.

Contents: Gameboard, 12 playing pieces, 12 bases, 32 cards.

Chess-like game where each player has 6 pieces - 3 Sir Cut (Scissors), 2 Stone Head (Rock), and 1 King Paper (Paper). Movement on the 24 space board is diagonally backwards and forwards and capturing opposing pieces is determined the same way as rock-paper-scissors:

Sir Cut defeats King Paper
Stone Head defeats Sir Cut
King Paper defeats Stone Head

The winner is the player to defeat their opponent's King Paper or to place their own King into the opponent's Castle.
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: Big Bucks Baseball
description:
An alternate title for this game might be, "How to Win at Baseball Without Fielding a Winning Team." In Big Bucks Baseball, getting to the playoffs and the World Series can bring you financial rewards. However, it is the player who has the most money at the end of the game that wins.

Each player is tasked with building a baseball team by drafting rookies, acquiring free agents, trading, etc. Free agents go a long way towards fulfilling the requirements for a post-season team, but cost money. Injuries can knock a key player off your roster, forcing you to acquire a replacement.

Shrewd and cunning trades, plus a bit of luck, can either give you the edge to clean up on post season bonuses or to squeak into the financial lead with a cheap non-contender.
categories: Humor, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Them Bones
description:
A game similar to Operation in that you have to avoid touching a metal contact with your tweezers as you try to extract "bones" from the skull. In "Them Bones", however, successfully extracting a "bone" allows you to move further ahead on the game board. Bumping the contact will cause a buzzer to buzz and the eyes to glow red.

The set of glow-in-the-dark "bones" associated with this game includes "T-bones", "Ham Bones", "Trombones", and "Funny Bones".

First player to reach the end of the board wins.

For an extra challenge, players can take advantage of the fact that the skull and "bones" glow in the dark by turning out the lights during the extraction attempts. (The skeletal hand on the spinner also glows in the dark, but you can't read the dial with the lights off.)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Horror
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Skyhawks
description: Messerschmidts face off against Spitfires in this simple game of the Battle of Britain. Printed in Warhawks comics module number 8.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Chicken Soup for the Family Soul
description:
"The Game of Sharing, Caring and Fun with Family and Friends!"

Object: Be the first player to finish "cooking your soup" by collecting any eight cards.

Players draw cards of different types and move around the board performing different actions to earn ingredients to make their bowl of "chicken soup". Players may have to draw pictures, sing lines of songs, tell jokes, make telephone calls, etc.

A very simple, pleasant family game with slightly different rules for big and little folks. Any number can play via use of teams.
categories: Party Game

name: Choices
description:
From the box:

A values oriented, moral dilemma game of discussion & evaluation of challenges that an individual encounters from childhood to old age. The situations & questions appear on cards with choices to make. Players can create their own responses and more situations to enter into the game. Any group that gathers for some learning about living will find this game a useful tool to stimulate values discussion in a non-competitive framework.
categories: Party Game

name: Together
description:
From the box:

Children work together to solve world and human problems presented in a simplified way. Good for a small or large group. Children are divided into simulated social groups (tribes, nations, etc). Each group gets Problem Cards and a share of Solution Cards. Through discussion, trade agreements, world councils... the players try to solve all the problems facing them. The debriefing session at the end allows for everyone to learn from each other. Our most popular group game! Good for repeated uses.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game

name: Co-Op Marble Games
description:
A book of 30 marble games that are played co-operatively. Each one is described in detail. Line drawings illustrate the text. If you have marbles in the house, you will want to learn how to play these games. And if you don't you'll want to get some after reading this book!

There are 9 Circle Games, 10 Hole Games, and 11 Variety Games. All are played together, not against each other. Some can be played with as few as two people and others work well with a large group or in tournaments.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game

name: Fuzzy Math
description:
From the box:

Twenty-four felt pieces that form a long caterpillar of numbers and math signs. Educational fun for the clever child. Use as a puzzle or try one of the several co-op games provided. 5 x 36 inches.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Jason-1: Voyage on the High Seas
description:
Jason-1 Oceanic Adventure - Voyage on the High Seas. You pilot an Ocean Research Vessel from the Mediterranean Sea to Seattle, Washington, USA. Along the way you must earn at least 150 Discovery Points!
This game is suitable for play both within and outside of the classroom, and although designed for Ages 9 - 13, it offers a fun, learning opportunity for the entire family. In addition to being a game, it is an eye-catching poster showing continents, oceans and all of the major ocean currents. On the reverse, there are black and white educational activities designed to be reproduced directly from the poster for use in the classroom.
This game is fully downloadable from the provided website.
categories: Educational, Environmental, Exploration, Nautical
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation, Tile Placement
publishers: California Institute of Technology, N.A.S.A. Jet Propulsion Laboratory

name: Staccato
description: The object of this game is to remove all of your balls from the board. Each player, in turn, inserts his pop-stick through any one of the openings as far into the board as he pleases. The insertion of the stick causes the balls to pop up. The player must remove all of the balls that pop up, even his opponents. The stick may not be removed until his next turn. The stick acts as a block for the opponent. The white block-ball is a barrier and may not be raised. or removed from the position it fell into at the beginning of the game. The winner is the first player to have all his colored balls removed from the board.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity

name: Missile Game
description:
A travel game similar to Battleship, but with ballistic missiles and aircraft as the theme. Unlike Battleship, the game is played on a 5x11 grid and the units are made up of separate markers allowing for diagonal placement as well as horizontal and vertical.

Each player's squadron is composed of 13 pieces, separated into a transport aircraft (3 pieces), fighter jet (4 pieces), helicopter (3 pieces), and reconnaissance plane (3 pieces).
categories: Memory

name: Filmstar
description:
This is a trivia game about movies. Each time a player gets a turn, he can choose for a card with value 1,2,3 or a random value. He can try to earn this card by answering a question or fulfilling a task.
If the question is answered correctly (or the task is fulfilled), the player gets the card. In addition, he may play a card on his playing board. This board contains 20 squares, each of a specific color. When a card is played, the player gains points equal to the value of the card, with two points bonus in the card color matches the board space color.
The game ends when one player has filled his entire board with cards. The player with the most points wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: What's Up?
description:
Players form two teams. One team devises a phrase or title for the other team to guess. The phrase is spelled out with the letters face down on the gameboard.

Guessing one letter at a time, the team has to guess the secret phrase. The players gain more points for guessing the phrase by taking fewer turns.

The game ends after five rounds. The team with more points wins.
categories: Trivia, Word Game

name: Aussie Animal Sanctuary
description:
Aussie Animal Sanctuary is a collection of trivia cards about Australian animals. The questions on the illustrated cards are separated into 4 levels of expertise to test the players' knowledge. Each game has various themed pieces that go along with it.

The five games are: Zoo game, Mimicry, Quiz capture, Lucky landing, and Sanctuary. All of these games are primarily educational games for school-aged children.
categories: Animals, Trivia

name: Countdown
description:
Countdown is a mathematics educational game centered around the theme of sending a rocket into outer space.

Players roll dice and draw cards based on the dice's results. Even cards carry addition and multiplication problems that when answered correctly, move the answering player's token forward on the track (which is patterned like our solar system). Odd cards have subtraction and division questions; answering them correctly moves the player's token backwards. When a token lands on certain spaces with instructions, the player must carry out what was printed as well (lose a turn, move the token to another space, etc).

The game ends when a player's token reaches Pluto, making him or her the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Math, Space Exploration

name: CWARDS: The Ultimate Card & Word Game
description:
CWARDS is a card game and a word game mixed into one, combining the pastime of the former with the challenge of the latter. It is made up of 104 cards, divided into four series of the 26-letter alphabet so that every letter appears four times, once in each suit.

Each player is dealt 10 cards, and a turn is as in many rummy games: draw, play, and discard. An initial play must include a word and either a run or set of letters; after that players can use their to to play more runs, sets and words, and/or add to existing ones. A draw can only be done from the discard pile if the card can be used in a meld, and all the discards above it in the pile are added to the hand. Sets and runs score the sum of the values of their letters, as do words, but words also have bonuses: letters beyond 4 are doubled; a word of one color is double, while a word of one suit is trebled.

When a player empties their hand, all other players subtract the value of the cards in their hand from their score. All cards on the table stay there, while all the others (in hands, deck, and discard pile) are shuffled together for another hand, in which players must still do a new opening play before playing to cards on the table. After there are no cards left in the deck, and a player empties their hand, then the game ends with the highest score winning.
categories: Card Game, Word Game

name: Bärenwald
description:
3 fun children's games in one box. All concern racing wooden bears round a spiral path to collect berries and honey. Very nice wooden pieces (bears and trees)
One game is 2-player only, the other 2 games are 2-4 players. Age range 5+ with adult support. Quite a lot of rules for a 5 year old to take in.

English rules available
categories: Children's Game

name: GiochEuro
description:
GiochEuro is a game about conversion from old currency to Euro and about price levels.
There is only a pawn in the game - an Euro coin - that moves around a path. In each of the 24 boxes of the path there is an item - a pen, a motorbike, a comic book, a cinema ticket and so on - with its price in liras. 24 counters depict the same item and price on one side, and the price in Euros on the opposite one: they are put on the table with the Euro side up.
The player in turn rolls the dice. All players have to guess where the coin will land and to put the finger on the Euro price matching the reached item. After they have done it, the coin is moved and the touched counters are turned to check which one is the right one. The players touching it keeps it. In the following turns, it is also possible to take counters from the other players if the same item comes out. The winner is the one reaching a given number of items.
There is a "calmer" variant of the rules where only one player at a time tries to guess.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Economic, Educational, Math, Memory

name: El juego de los animales
description:
This is a trivia game about animals: players have to cover continents with tokens, and can do that if they correctly answer questions about animals of that region. Wrong answers bring tokens to a zoo, where they have to be kept until other questions are correctly answered.
The movement on the board can be done in several directions and allows players to choose which action they can take in the turn.
Sarpe is a publisher from Barcelona. The game has been divided into several issues, sold weekly in the Spanish newspaper kiosks together with a collection of information cards about animals.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Trivia

name: Interface
description:
A three-player chess game played on a large Y-shaped board.

Components: rules folder, double-sided sheet of movement diagrams, large 26x30" board, and 3 sets of large chess pieces (red, white, and black, with 3.5" kings).
categories: Abstract Strategy
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Static Capture

name: Pacific Passage
description:
Pacific Passage: Trade & Piracy Across the Pacific

From the 1993 edition:

Pacific Passage brings these days of seaborne adventure to life as a boardgame which combines trade, piracy, and warfare into a challenging and enjoyable reminder of a bold and ruthless age. The rules of Pacific Passage are simple and flexible, allowing a variety of scenarios and play strategies. This new, revised edition includes stand-up counters for six players, record sheets and a large 34×33 inch map with all the game charts printed on it for easy reference. The new edition of the rules has been expanded with advanced rules for plunder, raiding, and crew training.

Pacific Passage focuses on trading between Europe and the Far East. The game can be combined with Middle Passage (Atlantic Ocean) and Passage to Cathay (Indian Ocean) for a larger game.
categories: Age of Reason, Economic, Napoleonic, Nautical, Pirates, Transportation
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Passage to Cathay
description:
Passage to Cathay: Trade & Piracy in the Indian Ocean

From the 1993 edition:

Passage to Cathay brings the era of seaborne adventure to life as a boardgame which combines trade, piracy, and warfare into a challenging and enjoyable reminder of a bold and ruthless age. The rules of Passage to Cathay are simple and flexible, allowing a variety of scenarios and play strategies. This new, revised edition includes stand-up counters for six players, record sheets, and a large 17×33 inch map with all the game charts printed on it for easy reference. The new edition of the rules has been expanded with advanced rules for plunder, raiding, and crew training.

Passage to Cathay focuses on the Indian Ocean and surrounding regions. The game can be combined with Pacific Passage (Pacific Ocean) and Middle Passage (Atlantic Ocean) for a larger game.
categories: Age of Reason, Economic, Napoleonic, Nautical, Pirates, Transportation
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Duel Magical
description:
Duel Magical: Battle in the Arena of Dark Magic

Duel Magical is a simple little game which brings to life the fantastic world of high sorcery. Players take the roles of talented spell casters matching wits and conjuring to see who can dominate in an arena of magical power. The rules of Duel Magical are simple, but the strategies are sophisticated and will provide hours of entertainment and challenge."
categories: Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Seize the Realm
description:
In the card game of Seize the Realm, two or more players each take the role of a local baron in the chaos of medieval Japan. The Emperor is powerless, and the office of his sworn protector, the Shogun, is an empty shell. The realm is in turmoil as you and your rival lords struggle for control. Only one can seize the realm… will it be you?

Cards have different powers depending on how they are played: strong one-shot abilities, or lasting effects while they stay in play. First player to start their turn with five Provinces or to eliminate all other players wins.

Currently available as a free download from Second Banana Productions.
categories: Card Game, Medieval

name: Uncle Remus Game: Zip!
description:
Uncle Remus is a primitive pinball-type (Bagatelle) game based on the Walt Disney character of the same name.

Marbles are launched into the playing area by use of a simple metal lever. The goal is to will your 7 marbles to land on top of one of several holes, each with a different point value. The game board rests at a slight angle so the marbles will gather near the bottom, in the Brier Patch, if they don't settle on a point value. After all of your marbles have been launched, you tally up your score to compare with others. There is also a ZIP! spot that allows you to relaunch a marble.

The name Zip! was likely incorporated as Uncle Remus was the character who sang the song "Zip-a-dee-doo-dah".
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: ReelGenius
description:
ReelGenius is a game that puts you and your friends in the roll of a big-time Hollywood producer.

Starting with $15 million in cash, you must "make your movie" by acquiring your four required movie elements: a Screenplay, a Director, a Lead Player, and a Supporting Cast

But making your movie is only half the battle…

Next you must release your movie nationwide…score big at the box office…and take home more ReelGenius movie awards than your opponents – and while avoiding the scandals and pitfalls that can sink your film in a hurry.

Just how successful you are depends on how shrewdly you manage your movie’s budget…how savvy you are in acquiring talent…and on your ability to wheel and deal your way to the top.

But that’s not all…

Your ability to answer creatively-crafted movie questions can make or break you. And just like real-life Hollywood, you’ll have to deal with negative publicity, scathing reviews and all the other things that can hinder your movie’s success.

Two to 6 players or teams can play ReelGenius in under an hour or over several. You decide how long the game will last by deciding how many ReelGenius movie award statues you want to play for.

ReelGenius comes with a game board, $330 million in ReelGenius cash, 32 talent cards, 24 "Player" cards, 24 "Publicity" cards, 1800 movie questions of varying difficulty, 30 ReelGenius Awards, 6 gme tokens, 2 game dice, and rules sheet.
categories: Dice, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation, Trading

name: Supergeroi (Superhero)
description: Russian cardboard book of 5 games, with a built-in, electronic die. This particular book, clever titled in half-Roman, half-Cyrillic letters, Superhero, comprises five superhero-themed games.
categories: Children's Game

name: Let's Be Safe!
description:
A children's game about safety. It's mainly consists of spinning a spinner, and moving that many spaces. Cards are also matched, in the tradition of Memory. Children are asked questions about safety, and the game actively encourages discussions about safety.

(Back of the box)

Let's Be Safe! Is a matching game the family plays together. It gives you, as a parent, an opportunity to discuss sensitive issues with your child in a fun, relaxed manner. Best of all, the game makes it easy for your child to practice safe and sound decision-making. A Parent's Guide is included with hints for more effective play. In it you will learn to tailor the game to suit your child's stage of development. Your child will learn to be aware, not afraid with Let's Be Safe! A very different kind of matching game."
categories: Children's Game, Educational

name: Dennis the Menace
description: Be the first player to capture Switchblade Sam. You’ll need to collect rope, tape, and your wagon in order to do so.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Agri-Venture
description: Agri-Venture acquaints players with many facets of farming while encouraging the use of services and loan funds provided by Federal Land Bank Associations, Production Credit Associations and the Bank for Cooperatives. During the game obstacles and hazards, as well as successes, will be encountered so that any player could become very successful, moderately successful or go broke. Managing one's assets to achieve the greatest dollar net worth at the end of the game is the objective of every Agri-Venture player.
categories: Economic, Farming

name: Assert with Love
description:
Assert with Love is a unique board game where everyone can be a winner!
It is a role playing game in which two players always compete for the votes of others.
The players are facing situations involving school bullies, drunks and people who act like they know it all among others
in their attempts to come on top! Each player has to speak up for himself in order to get the votes of the others.

This game is for 3 to 12 players and in each round two players participate in a scenario.One of them is the asserter and the other the antagonist.
The asserters role is to be loving and respecting and the antagonists role is to be nasty and sneaky.
At the end of each round a winner is chosen and everyone offer a score from 1 to 10 along with the reasons why the ranked each player.
Each voter has a maximum of 15 points to offer.This means that if one player is rated as 10 the other can not go higher than 5.
categories: Unspecified

name: Entrepreneur's Accessory to Monopoly (fan expansion for Monopoly)
description:
This game, subtitled "The Power-Business Venture Game", is an unofficial expansion to Monopoly. It comes with a small board that fits exactly into the center of a standard Monopoly game board. The game plays like regular Monopoly but adds Corporations, Leverage Buyouts, Corporate Takeovers, Casinos and Financial Coups into the mix.

Expands

Monopoly
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Playmaker's Football
description: Table Top football for the solitaire gamer. Plays in an hour and has some new features like qb performance against the blitz and red zone performance for all offensive players.
categories: Sports

name: Button-Button
description:
This is an old game in which players use letter tiles to spell the phrase "BUTTON, BUTTON, WHO HAS THE BUTTON?" The tiles contain all the letters in this phrase (including extras), the punctuation marks (commas and question mark), blank tiles (which are useless), and a tile with a picture of a button on it. The tiles are shuffled and dealt evenly to all the players.

On your turn, you play as many tiles as you can to spell out the phrase line-by-line. If you don't have a play, you may draw a tile from the player on your left, and should this tile be the desired letter, you may place it and continue playing from your hand. Points are scored as a line is completed.

The word "BUTTON," together with the comma makes up the first (and second) line, and scores 10 points for the player playing the comma. The words "WHO" "HAS" "THE" make up the third, forth and fifth line, and score 5 points for the player playing the the last letter in each word respectively. The word "BUTTON?" makes up the sixth line and scores 10 points to the player playing the question mark. The tile with the picture of a button makes up the seventh line and is worth 20 points. The first player to score 100 points is the winner.
categories: Word Game

name: Trip Hammer
description:
Trip Hammer is a game of speed requiring an accurate eye and a fast hand to score points on your opponent by being the first player each round to trap and lock the “trip hammers” on your opponent’s side of the board.

The game begins with two “trip hammers” on each side of the board; each player then attempts to strike their respective hammers with a game ball. When struck correctly, each hammer will flip to the opponent’s side. When a player has all the hammers on his opponent’s side, he or she must push a red knob to lock the hammers and freeze the action, scoring points. The first player to 10 points is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity

name: Universal Combat System
description: The Universal Combat System is an expandable miniatures battle system. The UCS is a system of combat rules meant for any number of players in an infinite amount of settings. The players determine what kind of universe their games will be set in, whether it's classic fantasy, sci-fi, or even modern warfare. The UCS provides the basic template for the game, and the players work out the details of what types of units will be involved in the campaigns. Players can then adjust certain rules to fit the setting and units they have chosen for their games.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Movie Studio Mogul
description: According to Sid Sacksons "A Gamut of Games": Eight studios, each with a space for a star, director and writer, are located along a path, together with other spaces. Players acquire personnel by landing or trading. With a set, players can produce up to six movies, each increasing the landing fee.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Math and The Beanstalk
description:
From the Publisher:

Here is a unique activity that incorporates basic math drill, using addition and subtraction facts with the growth and development of a bean! Players solve problems correctly and use markers to cover various plant parts including the root, seed, shoot, stem, leaves, and flower. Using addition facts through 9+9 and subtraction facts through 10-10 players become familiar with parts of plants while mastering addition and subtraction facts. The player who covers all sections of his or her plant wins!
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Schnappi Das Kleine Krokodil Schnipp-Schnapp
description:
Translated from the package:

The funny card game with Schnappi, the little Crocodile. Who can call out SNAP at the right moment sna-sna-snaps up the most cards and wins the round.

Contains 33 cards.

Appears to be an updated version of SNAP using the little cartoon crocodile made popular through a song in Germany.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game

name: Poker Royal
description:
According to Sid Sackson's "A Gamut of Games":

Each player has an area on the board that ends with eight face-up cards. In turn a player can place a card from his hand into his own area or an opponent's. Poker hands win bonuses and pots in various ways.
categories: Card Game

name: Jubilee
description:
A game released to coincide with the golden jubilee of the reign of King George III of Great Britain, who came to the throne in 1760. The game board consists of a spiral track. The spaces contain pictures showing events which took place during the reign of George. These include his wedding, the birth of his children, various wars (with Spain, France, and the American colonies), the discovery of the source of the Blue Nile, riots in England, the founding of Botany Bay, the king’s first alarming illness (1788), and the abolition of the slave trade among other events.

One of the many games inspired by the Royal Game of Goose, described in RC Bell's "Board and Table Games of Many Civilizations".

Players race down a spiral track, all starting from different corners, collecting rewards and paying fines. The first player to reach the middle space, "Jubilee", wins. The Jubilee space depicts George III on his throne.
categories: Educational

name: Grand Slam
description: The game that lets you hit, walk and score runs by answering questions about big league baseball. In Grand Slam, you make hits and earn runs like a true baseball fan. Through knowledge of baseball's interesting facts, from World Series to record holders, to All-Star games to Hall-of-Famers, play a nine-inning game against your biggest rival, or form a league and play a season.
categories: Sports, Trivia

name: Zombie from the Hole
description:
A negotiating game that is very simple and intuitive to play, with a novel negotiation mechanism that benefits players that are kind and friendly rather than selfish and self-centred.

It reflects the interdependent world we live in, where unrestrained selfishness can bring the world crashing down around us.

Children love the simplicity of the game and adults love its openendedness.

The game is also ideal for practising foreign languages at all levels.

Plus five more games that are played on the same board.

The six games included in the pack are:

- Rescue: a negotiating game, for ages 9 and up

- Walk like a Zombie: a crazy chasing game, for ages 5 to 10

- Easy Money: an easy game with lots of money, for ages 6 and up

- Half your Money: for those who like the Rescue game, but don't feel like negotiating, for ages 7 and up

- Zombie from the Hole: all the adventure of the Rescue game plus a zombie! for ages 10 and up

- Party Game: a cool party game for teenagers, for ages 15 and up.

For orders and enquiries, send an email to holeadventures@gmail.com

Source: Publisher's website
categories: Dice, Negotiation

name: Wardogs!
description: A skirmish level wargame for fantasy armies. The key component of this ruleset is to create your own stats from the figure in front of you. Certain stats are basic and germain to a figure, size, armor, weapon that is used by the figure. Others are picked and could include magic or "special" powers. This mini's game style is simplistic to allow large number of figures to combat each other without the bounds of a historical past, but could be utilized to depict historical battles. A light Beer & Pretzels game. Skirmish
categories: Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tiere auf dem Bauernhof
description: Roll the die to build farm animals. A horse, sheep, cow and a pig.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Puzzle

name: Die Koala Brüder: Auf Geht's Nach Haus!
description:
KOALA BROTHERS - LET'S GO HOME is a childrens memory game based on the animated children's television series.

What a mess! The vehicles belonging to the Koala Brothers and their friends are completely mixed up and little by little, as night falls, the way home is hard to find. Where is the scooter? Who knows where Frank and Buster’s house is? Your mission is to help the friends to get themselves and their vehicles back to the right house.

The game is comprised of five small boards representing the homes of the Koala Brothers and their friends. Each house has three spaces on it. The (two) Koala brothers and four of their friends appear on six red counters and their preferred means of transport are represented on five blue counters (the koala brothers fly a twin seater plane).

At the start of the game the counters are mixed up, one of the red ones removed, and the remaining ten distributed at random between the houses.

Players take it in turns to roll a special die and take actions accordingly:

• If it shows a number then the player moves a piece of his choice the number of free spaces indicated on the die. Movement can be in either a clockwise or anticlockwise direction.
• If it shows an eye the player can secretly look at a counter of his/her choice.
• If it shows an arrow the player selects a playing piece of his/her choice and turns it up so that everyone can see.

Players may also gamble tokens by secretly peeking at counters. If the counter is at the right house then it wins tokens, if not it loses tokens.

Play proceeds until all the friends and their vehicles are face up in the right location. The player with the greatest number of tokens is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: SPACE BASTARDS! From outer space!
description:
The Galactic Wars are over. Treaties have been signed, pacts made and peace is spreading throughout the galaxy. What the hell are you supposed to do now?

Become a SPACE BASTARD! , a galactic warrior whose only claim to fame is being good at reducing other Bastards to their base molecular structures.

Rather than face the unspeakable horrors of a desk job you can cruise the galaxy meeting interesting aliens and kill them for nothing more than the glory of battle... and the skyrocketing ratings of the Galactic Network that televise their epic struggles.

SPACE BASTARDS! From outer space! Coming soon to a planet near you... perhaps you should move.

SPACE BASTARDS! is a miniatures game that pits you against your fellow players. You only need one miniature in addition to the rule book and some foolish opponents to get you started.
(Above is from the homepage)
Comes with:
rulebook
6 character sheets
3 dice
cheat sheet
categories: Dice, Fighting, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Fantom Electronic
description:
2 or 4 players can play the game in 5 grades of difficulty.

On a board with 7 x 7 squares each player has a number of meeples in a starting line. The object is to get to the other side. The specal effect of "Fantom electronic" is the "Fantom field" - a special "hidden" space which is wandering around. This movement is done by the small computer-unit at the one side of the board. There are different acoustic hints where this field can be and in which direction it wanders, so you have to calculate it. If you manage to step on this space with one of your meeples, you can do another step.

So it's not much strategy but calculating and deduction ...
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction

name: Bugs! Bugs! Bugs!
description:
This is one of the games in the Tiny Tins series from Patch Products.

During a turn, a player draws a card. If that player draws a bug card, he takes the matching bug finger puppet and puts it on a finger. If he draws an ant, the turn is over. If the player draws a stinkbug, he must take the stinkbug, even from another player. The winner is the person who has the most bugs but does not have the stinkbug.
categories: Card Game

name: Bas-Celik Junior
description: These is a first adventure board game based on Slavic mythology for young players, aged 6 -12 years. Younger brother of Bash-Chelik, board game published last year. All images are adapted for kids and rules are less difficult, but again very interesting and amusing. There is no explicit violence and main target is to collect as much courage as possible, to face young Bash-Chelik in his tower between the sky and earth.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Fantasy, Mythology

name: Boating Trivia
description:
Trivia game that is all about boating. Game can be 3 different ways, but players primarily roll and move around the board answering boating or boating related questions.
Some sample questions:

Who Was the author of Moby Dick?

A boat whose bow and stern have dropped from the original shape is called?

How many points are there on a compass?

What color are Sternlights?

Away from the direction the wind is blowing is called?

Which wind creates a smaller wave - On-shore or Off-shore?

The voyage of the Mayflower to America took a)1 year, b)18 months, or c)67 days

A ship's journal is called a _______

The name of a person in charge of a commercial vessel is called?

Includes game board, 1 six sided die, 6 metal playing pieces (anchor, propeller, etc - all boating related), 2 boxes of trivia questions and answers, and instructions<
categories: Nautical, Trivia

name: The Sky's the Limit
description:
"The Sky's the Limit" is described as a game of aircraft trading and management. It was published by BAE Systems, the British aerospace and defense company, as a promotional product.

The aim of the game is to travel from your starting city, purchase at least one aircraft from the bank whilst at a city in each continent, and then return to your starting city, making the most of all business opportunities en route. Along the way, you will encounter opportunities to improve you journey or your financial situation, or events that conspire against you.

An interesting extract from the rules: "The most trustworthy player is chosen as the banker. If a trustworthy player can't be agreed upon, the banker shall be the oldest player."
categories: Aviation / Flight, Industry / Manufacturing, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Galebari
description:
From the box cover:
It's summertime at Adriatic coast. Beautiful girls from all over the world came to enjoy sea, sun and good fun. And here they are... who will have more success? Local guys Roko, Stipe, Ante, Borna, Sale... or maybe you?
In this easy learning standalone card game player takes a role of "GALEBAR" - summertime playboy who competes in winning over lady tourists of most intriguing desires. (Based on true stories from Adriatic beaches.)
Deck consists of 94 cards (36 Ladies, 30 Approaches, 11 Places and 17 Events). When a Lady comes into play, each GALEBAR plays one of his available Approaches. Depending on Lady's Interests (Romance, Sex, Fun and Money), active Place and Event, each player counts his score. The player with the highest positive score wins over the Lady. The end winner is the player with the most Ladies won during the game.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Break Down
description:
The object of this game of words is to: score more points than your opponents by forming words from a starter word, stopping the round of play, and by predicting whether your opponents found the same words.
