Restrictions: found words must appear in a standard dictionary, without using proper nouns or abbreviations; Letters may be used in each found word more than once--up to the number of times that letter appears in the starter word; and found words may not be formed by adding an "s" to an existing found word.
categories: Word Game

name: Woidz
description: A guessing game with seventeen rounds, where opponents try to determine the secret word of the opponent by asking questions and wagering guesses.
categories: Word Game

name: Alley Cat
description: Alley Cat is a game for cat lovers of all ages. Take on the role of a domestic house cat and try to collect the various items that have been scattered over the rooms of the house. Beware of the dog!
categories: Animals

name: Hierarchy
description: This is a game where you try to get a suitable place in heaven via roll and move. The pieces are wooden angel meeples and there are tokens you collect to put you in a particular choir placement.
categories: Unspecified

name: Round House
description:
A childrens action Roulette game.

The game is essentially a circular roulette style plastic dish with a central dimpled scoring track surrounding a "bullseye" track. Using the corner mounted spring loaded shooters the aim of the game is to shoot your plastic balls (green or yellow) into the roulette wheel aiming to score as many points as possible.

The version I have includes 4 different scorecards which sit in the center straddling the "bullseye" track. The games are aceball, cannonball, cue ball, and fruitball each having its own scoring system

Aceball - Probably the most advanced game variant having a rising multiplier style score for face cards and picture cards, bullseye track representing a joker.

Cannonball - My personal favorite, rising scores nearer the center of a ship, gaps between ships score 0 and the bullseye scores 25.

Cueball - Based on a snooker scoring system with 1 point for reds and rising values for the colored balls , "bullseye" track representing a pocketed cue ball and no score.

Fruitball - A fruitmachine scoring system with points awarded for tricks of three same symbols.

The copy I have is incomplete (as far as I can tell) and I cannot tell you how many balls came with the game nor any of the exact rules as these were printed on the inside of the box lid which has long since disappeared.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Math, Nautical

name: Tell
description: Players form words using cards. They meld them for points starting with a 5 letter word. Three letter words can be added to to form a new word. The first player to reach 5,000 points wins.
categories: Card Game, Word Game
publishers: Tell Products Company, The Hart Vance Co.

name: VCR Hockey Night in Canada
description:
Goal: Win the hockey game

Players move around the board drawing cards and doing what is says on the space. If you land on "VIDEO ATTACK" you go to the VCR to see what happens. It shows a great play from a game in the past. Either a goal or a save. If you see a goal you score a point.

Components:
1 hour long VHS video cassette
1 gameboard
40 coaches corner cards
40 wild cards
40 scoring pucks
2 dice
4 play pieces
1 official rule book
categories: Sports

name: Nauplion
description:
Nauplion is an ancient city in Greece and also a board game of Nauplion's "Pessoi". Nauplion is the land of the ancient Troyan game creator "Palamides".

This is an ancient board game from the ancient city of Nauplion (Nau+plion = ship + ship) with boards and ancient Greek letters for 2-6 players. Each player has ancient letters from Nauplion Greece. Also there are three dice with the ancient shapes of Nauplion. Highest roll starts the game.

Nauplion has the following items:
1. Some Colorful Boards (Grids).
2. Ancient Hellenic Nauplion letters connected with numbers for each player.
3. Three dice with shapes.
4. Other materials.
5. A leaflet with some information for this game along with photos from the ancient Nauplion region.
categories: Ancient, Dice, Memory

name: Cosmic Runar Dice
description:
Cosmic Runar (Runic) Dice

In ancient Europe there was a very popular dice game with the name Cosmic Runar (Runic) Dice. At first at the Orpheus period was only three cosmic dice. At the Homeric period there were four dice. At last there were totally twelve dice, for the 12 Gods. The Europeans create the runar (runic) scripts, so the Cosmic Runar Dice created.

The game comes with 12 cosmic runar dice and the explanation for predicting your future according to the ancient Greek and European philosophers.
Also given is an explanation of how to use this game as a Rune Casting and fortune telling according to the scripts.

Cosmic Runar Dice has the following items:
1. A colorful grid.
2. 12 dice with runar (runic) scripts and letter.
3. A small book.
4. Many other items and a research book about runar script.

The full game which will be issued in the next version will have 25 cosmic dice and much more information about the ancient philosophy of fortune telling.

This board game have been proposed to The UK Parliament for Olympic games in London 2012.
categories: Dice, Educational, Memory

name: Il Vigorelli
description: Italian cycling game issued in September 1961. It was titled 'Il Vigorelli' after Milano's famous velodrome. It was re-issued in 1966 under the name 'Il Gioco Dei Campionati Mondiali su Pista'. The game contains a track of 90 squares and eleven riders, and the possibility to play two races: Sprint (up to 11 players) and Team Pursuit (2 player game). Apart from the move & roll mechanics there also is a deck of cards to add some variety in the game.
categories: Racing, Sports
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Top Cat
description:
Whitman #4806. The game board is changed by rotating the wheel inside the game board (and spaces on the board are indicated by color). Referenced and pictured in Malloy's American Games : Comprehensive Collector's Guide

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

A matter of interest.....
In Britain, Top Cat was a leading name in the business of selling cat food for a pet. So the BBC changed the name to Boss Cat. However they did not change the words in the intro song. Thus The song sang "Top Cat" whilst the name on the credits said "Boss Cat".
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Jagabongo
description:
From the Box:

A new intergenerational board game for family and friends. A game of luck, chance and strategy. Can be played in combinations of two, four or eight players. The object of the game is to fill your chosen colored areas, and to collect opponent's Jabongs.

Contains two Jagabongo boards, 64 Colored Jabongs and 3 Jates, one rule card and one bag.

Age 7+
categories: Abstract Strategy
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Mushmouse and Punkin' Puss Game
description: Mushmouse & Punkin' Puss were characters on the Magilla Gorilla show for a while. Apparently they deserved a game made in their honor. This once again is a very simple roll and move game where up to 4 characters try to get up to the top of the hill and into their homes.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Route 66
description: This game based on the Television series of the same name featuring George Maharis as Buzz Murdoch and Martin Milner as Todd Stiles came with a simple board, 8 plastic playing pieces, 4 plastic cars, play money, a double spinner and road map instructions. The map had famous towns listed on it and the road map which was located inside the box had special instructions for the player who landed on particular spaces. The object was to get your car located on the gameboard to complete the trip across the country.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel

name: The Game of Checko
description:
This is Milton Bradley game #4046, The Game of Checko, 1938. Object is to skillfully place CHECKS on the CHECKO Board so that each row horizontally, vertically and diagonally will produce the highest score possible.

There are 8 CHECKO boards, 8 sets of colored CHECKS, each set having four of each number, 1 to 13. 1 Deck of CHECKO cards, four of each number, 1 to 13.

CHECKO boards consist of 5 rows and columns.

Score for each row, column and both diagonals as:
2 checks alike in a row = 1 point
2 sets of two checks alike in a row = 2 points
3 checks alike in a row = 3 points
sequence or any run of five checks in a row = 5 points
3 checks alike and 2 checks alike in a row = 7 points
4 checks alike in a row = 12 points
add one point for a score made diagonally.
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: Parallilogrammon Zatrikion
description:
Parallilogrammon Zatrikion is an ancient and Byzantine chess game. This chess game has seven variations according to the more ancient board game of "Pessoi".

These versions have all the known pawns of modern chess with a bigger grid and in some variations there are many other pawns connected to ancient philosophy.

Played with Parallilogrammon Zatrikion in some versions are three dice with the ancient shapes of various (eras) and in this version the highest roll starts the game.

Parallilogrammon Zatrikion has the following items:
1. One colorful Board (Grid)4x16.
2. The pawns of each player are a different color. Colors are the veneti (red color) and the greens (green color).
3. Three dice with shapes.
4. Other material.
5. A book with some information for this game along with photos.
categories: Dice, Educational, Medieval, Memory
mechanics: Acting, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hook, Line & Sinker
description:
From the back of the box:

Hook Line & Sinker is an easy to play, fun game that will entertain the entire family and you don't have to be a fisherman to enjoy playing Hook Line and Sinker. It is a game of chance that depicts most aspects of a day's fishing in a boat. In the box are 82 colorful playing cards representing ten varieties of fish. Each fish is worth a set amount of points from the low scoring Garfish to the mighty Marlin which can score you 100 points. Every cast of the dice will put you in an hilarious and exciting fishing predicament. The winner is the person who catches the most amount of fish with the highest points score, which means you can finish last around the board and still win the game. Try fishing in the lounge room, it's sure to get you in, Hook Line and Sinker.
categories: Animals

name: Go Fetch It
description:
Go Fetch it is an exciting race game which uses an audio tape for both a full explanation of the rules & continuous instructions and music throughout the game play. The game consists of a game board, four dogs and a cassette tape. The dogs are set up on the board, then the tape is played. The players follow the instructions on the tape, as in "Dog X! Move forward two squares!" or "All dogs on yellow squares move back one square!" etc.

There are also some large plastic bones which have to be hidden or searched in other rooms than the ones the game takes place in. While one player is out for that task, the others continue - so the player outside should hurry. This unique & exciting game can be played at many different levels of difficulty & has numerous permutations of game play. You can start the game anywhere through the one hour tape !
categories: Animals, Children's Game

name: The Game of Love
description: Players start with their own set of love tokens and try to win the game by collecting a set of 7 love tokens from another player. They do this by moving round the board - some squares command you to swap, give or take love tokens others command you to pick up a card with a multi-choice dilemma on it which players answer, resulting in an exchange of love tokens.
categories: Trivia

name: Reading and Writing: The Toronto Research Game
description:
"Reading and Writing" is a simulation of what the Toronto Research Group goes through writing *their* essays. Now you can experience the excitement of the competitive search for knowledge as you vie with other players to find and read books that will help you garner the groundbreaking might into the process of READING and WRITING. In the campaign version of the game, you'll have a chance to build a REPUTATION as the *real* thinker in the Toronto Research Group!

Published in Steve McCaffery and bpNichol, Rational Geomancy: The Kids of the Book-Machine (Vancouver: Talonbooks, 1992).
categories: Educational, Political
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Simulation, Storytelling

name: WordBURST
description:
Players divide into two teams, and take turns trying to come up with as many word association matches in a given category as possible, scoring points for correct matches. The game ends when either team reaches a predetermined score, or when a predetermined time limit is reached.

There are four categories:

Visual Imagery: Try to come up with as many items as you can from the list on the card before your time runs out. (Example: Things you see in a mall")

Synonyms: Try to come up with the indicated synonym for each entry in a list of words. (Example: given the word "talk", come up with the word "speak"; given the word "big", come up with the word "large")

Word Association: Try to come up with as many associated words as you can from the list on the card before your time runs out. (Example: Come up with words associated with the word "beach")

Sound/Letter Cueing: Try to come up with the indicated item from the list on the card, given the initial letter or sound of the word. (Example: Things that are soft - starts with the letter "m" (marshmallows); starts with the "f" sound (fur))
categories: Party Game, Word Game

name: Hajj Fun Game
description:
The Hajj Fun Game offers you entertainment and fun and at the same time makes it easy for you to learn the meaning and message of Hajj. It helps you to acquire a knowledge of the important historical places associated with it. It will enable you to learn how the acts and rites are performed during Hajj, and what its do's and don'ts are. In short, the Hajj Fun Game will bring alive the annual pilgrimage of Hajj.

Ages 8 and up

More info at
http://onlineislamicstore.com/a4529.html
categories: Religious, Trivia

name: Screw the I.R.S.
description:
From the box: "A fast moving, exciting game for 2 to 6 people collecting deductions to equal salary and pay no tax! This game was designed for fun! The makers of this game do not advocate cheating on taxes or paying less than anyones share."

Game is played over several rounds and the winner is the player that hits a target point limit. You play a salary card and on subsequent rounds, play deduction cards to equal your salary (leaving you with $0 to pay the IRS).

Contains 105 cards and three inventory cards.
categories: Card Game

name: Tombstone
description:
The game is played by taking a tour of the town of Tombstone; the first person to complete the tour by traveling all the way around the board is the winner.

CONTENTS:
Game board
1 six-sided die
Six game pieces
Twelve "Miner's Chest" Cards
Twelve "Gamble" cards

This game was created as a tie-in to tourism in Tombstone Arizona.
categories: American West

name: Hispaniola
description: This is believed to be a very rare and unusual "historical" game. The box cover with beautiful artwork states that it is "Fun For All Ages." The players use replica Spanish galleons to sail the Caribbean in a race for island strongholds and pirate gold. The game states that the treasure locations are based upon historical facts.
categories: Educational, Exploration, Nautical, Pirates, Racing

name: Chippendale's After Hours Game
description: Adult game where players land on spaces and then have to do certain things in order to make money. Take it off, tell a dirty joke, play charades, make a toast, go to the dance floor etc.
categories: Mature / Adult

name: Shrewd
description:
From the Rulebook introduction:

Shrewd is a fast-paced game where deal making, strategy, manipulation of other players, and a little luck, leads to success. the object of Shrewd is to maximize your own wealth, at the expense of your opponents. The player with the most money wins. The player increase their wealth in two ways.
First... by ARBITRAGE, which simply means: "gains made through buying and selling".
Second... by meeting the requirements for winning the monopoly fund, greed fund, shrewd fund or by winning one of the five equity finds.
categories: Economic, Negotiation

name: Stellaluna Memory Game
description:
A children's memory game with a theme based on the children's picture book by Janelle Cannon. Stellaluna loves her baby bird friends, but hates those icky bugs they have to eat in Mother Bird's nest! She needs to find her own bat family again and feast on yummy mangoes. Help Stellaluna learn the skills she needs to be a bat again.

Players take turns turning over memory chips. If it is a helper chip, they place it the sky path and move Stellaluna one space forward. If it is not, they turn it back over again and leave it in place. When Stellaluna reaches home, all players win! There is a more advanced ruleset for older players.

This game is intended to teach young players to develop memory and story-telling skills as well as important social skills: taking turns, following rules, sharing and respecting others.
categories: Memory

name: Thieves Guild
description: The Thieves Guild is a game, where players act as thieves, rob themselves and compete who will collect the biggest number of gold coins.
categories: Card Game, Mafia, Party Game

name: Bonnie McBonzo, the Hieland Juggler
description: This is a children's ring toss game features a dog on his hind legs. The ring can catch on a bone on the dog's nose or land on one of four scoring areas at the dog's feet.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game

name: The Prisoner Board Game
description:
Brief Synopsis from the rules: The Prisoner Board Game recreates, for 2 to 6 players, the structure and workings of the outwardly beautiful yet deeply sinister "Village" as featured in the celebrated 1960s TV series.

Each player assumes the role of a "Prisoner" who, having resigned from a secret government job, has been abducted, awaking to find him/herself in the "Village".
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deduction, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Seadogs and Darlings
description:
Seadogs and Darlings is a social climbing game akin to En Garde! There is no duelling in the game and a greater emphasis on entertainments and events to try to gain a better position in life. You may start life as a lowly bakers boy or be the son of a count, you still will be of little consequence until you have made your mark as a socialite.

Diverse entertainments include, playwriting, cricket, bowling, carousing, joining the muster, joining the army and of course holding parties.
categories: Unspecified

name: Middle East Smackdown
description:
Middle East Smackdown is a 2-4 strategy board game set in the middle east. Players take control of the USA, Israel, Syria, Iran, Iraq and Lebanon for the final conflict in the middle east. Terrorism sponsored by Iran and Syria have pushed the US too far and now it is full scale war. The US and its allies are now out to conquer Iran and Syria completely. They have overwhelming technological superiority and the best trained troops in the world.

But Iran has some good defensive ground, lots of men for canon fodder, militant groups, terrorist insurgents and its most potent asset of all, the liberal politicians within the US house and senate. Can Iran manipulate the media and its liberal allies to get Congress to cut funding from the US military in order to stave off conquest and win the war? Can the US military complete the war with the forces it has in the fields if funding does get cut?

Middle East Combat Comes with:

1) 3 piece 16.5" x 31.5" full color game map.
2) 432 cut-out full color game counters on chipboard.
3) Game Rules
4) 1 Six Sided Die.
5) Resource Chart
categories: Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Der Weltkrieg
description:
The World War:

Without an exact translation this is an estimation of the actual rules. The games main mechanic is jumping other pieces and is a game for 2 or more players.

Each side gets 30 pieces. Alternatively each player puts one piece (name tag down) on an enemy land square. Once all the pieces have been placed they are moved alternately either to an adjacent empty space or by jumping over an adjacent piece; multiple jumps can be made as long as empty spaces exist. As each piece makes its first move it is turned upright so that the name shows. If a player is able to get a piece to the city on the map that matches the name tag of the piece then he turns it back over to signify it no longer moves.

If a player can be the first to have only his units present in cities of his home country then the game ends and that player is declared the winner.
categories: Wargame, World War I

name: Cuckoo, A Society Game
description:
A card game from the J.H. Singer Company of New York , copyrighted 1891. Each player is provided with a card which he or she must place in front of themselves on the table in plain view of all, he or she is also provided with 9 counters. The players throw a die in turn and the color thrown must be covered on the card by a counter. The die is six-sided die with 2 sides green, 2 sides red, 1 side white and 1 side black. If "black" is thrown the players must take a counter off of his/her card, if he should have none to take he/she loses the next turn.

The player who first succeeds in covering all of the spaces on his/her card calls out CUCKOO and wins the game.
categories: Card Game

name: The Little Mermaid Treasure Trove card game
description:
Add treasures to Ariel's Treasure Trove by collecting the most sets of cards. You will lose your cards if you talk when Ursula is around, so be careful.

The game works like "Go Fish", except that when you draw an Ariel or Ursula card, place it face up on top of the Discard Pile, then draw another card. The card that is showing on top of the Discard Pile tells you whether you can use your voice or not.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: The Diners' Club Credit Card Game
description:
Published in 1961 as part of a campaign to promote the Diners' Club Credit Card (this promotion also included a film in 1962).
The game contains a foldable board, paper money and player markers as well as charts for various repayment schedules. Players roll and move in turn investing money and making returns, with the first player to have made $5000 of investments, own a house and car, and have paid Diners' Club at least $5000 declared the winner.
categories: Economic, Educational
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Friday Night At The ER
description:
From the publisher's website:

The Friday Night at the ER team-learning game is a simulation tool for gaining powerful insight in an engaging group experience. It's a board game played at one or more tables of four players and led by a facilitator. The game teaches people to:
* consider the effects of their decisions on the larger system,
* to collaborate with an openness to redesign, and
* to develop sound data on which to base decisions.

Who is it For?
* Work Teams, Retreats, Classes....for Improvement Work, Restructuring, Planning, Team Building
* Any group whose members have to work together
* Minimum group size is 4; maximum is 200

How Does it Work?
The game simulates the challenge of managing a hospital during a typical 24-hour period. Players perform distinct functions, but they come to realize that they also depend on each other. The game play (2 hours) is followed by an interactive debriefing (1 hour or more).

What Can it Teach?
* Systems Thinking: managing interdependence, complexity, delay
* Collaboration: shared accountability, coordinated action across functions
* Innovation: working with mental models, openness to redesign
* Use of Data: system performance data, measurement
* Structural Thinking: designing for performance

Based on The Beer Game
categories: Economic, Educational, Medical, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Gladius Miniatures
description:
A rules supplement designed to be used in conjunction with the Gladius card game and its supplement Gladiator School.

The Miniatures Rules “provide a way of using miniature figures to show the relative distance between the fighters and give the game a little more color and realism with only a moderate increase in complexity. The only extra equipment needed for this variant are miniatures representing the gladiators and a rectangular card (the Display) that is divided into three equal parts across its length.”
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Battle for the Universe
description:
“Millions of years in the future, admits a universe dying a cold, premature death, mankind has overcome great challenges. They have conquered and outlived every alien race. They have overthrown a millennial reign of a cruel quasi-immortal tyrant. They have occupied all the remaining habitable galaxies of the Universe. But their greatest challenge is now themselves. The Human species has evolved into two different peoples: the Morlocks and the Eloi. And now they battle each other to determine which of them shall be masters of the universe.”

“One player plays the space fleets of the Eloi. The Eloi are a gentle, yet determined people, under the vigilant care of their Empress. They seek to liberate the six galaxies from the cruel Morlocks. One player plays the space fleets of the Morlock Empire. The Morlocks are a fierce and technologically advance people. The only way they wish to serve the Eloi, is on their dinner tables. Each player uses an identical deck of cards. Six sided dice will also be required.”

“Goal: To win, one player must possess all six of the inhabitable galaxies of the Universe. To capture (or recapture) a galaxy card, one must win a battle by destroying all of the opponent’s ships.”
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction

name: Custom Space Fury
description:
“Quick & Dirty Tactical Space Fighter Combat Rules. Special rules for pilots: 10 Skills, Panic, Quirks, Special maneuvers. Very easy ship construction system. Supplies: A space hex map is required. Use painted miniatures or chits to represent ships. 10 and 6 sided dice are used.”

The game includes rules for Morale, Cloaking, Detection, and Critical Damage. Pilot Experience rules provide for Experience Points, Skills, Quirks, and Panic.
categories: Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Robotech Skirmish
description:
"Board & card game for 2 players. Battle between Zentradi and the Robotech Defense Force. Takes place in the Robotech Universe. Each figure represents a single Battle Pod, Armor Suit, Veritech Fighter or Destroid. Victory: Destroy 10+ of the Hits of the opposing side or the opposing Commander."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units.

The game presents statistics for seven Robotech units and five Zentradi units. Each is rated for movement, hits, and up to ten special abilities (related to weaponry, defenses, or movement.) Each player purchases sixteen hits worth of units to start the game. One unit is designated the Commander.

A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw hands of cards from the shared deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, and defend.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Spelljammer Skirmish
description:
"Board & card game for 2 players. Takes place in the Spell Jammer Universe. Pick your Fleet: Humans, Neogi, Elves, Beholders... Abstract skirmish level Ship combat. Each figure represents a single Ship (unit). Victory: You win if you Destroy the opposing Flagship."

There are seventeen different fleets that the players may choose from. The fleets have between three and eight ships, each of which is rated for hits, class, and special abilities.

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the ships. A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw hands of cards from the shared deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, and defend.
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Ninja Havoc Machines
description:
Ninja Havoc Machines is a print and play game played on a standard chess/checkers board with some extra components.

The object of the game is to destroy all other Ninja Havoc Machines on the board. This game is very similar to Roborally in that players select a sequence of five movements (move, fire, rotate) before enacting the commands.

There is a point buy system to build your "machine" giving it different engines and weapons. The type of engine determines how fast you move. The engine also may determine the type of armor your machine has. The type of weapon how much damage you deal. Special abilities are purchased in "cpu" components.

Available for download from the designer's github:
https://github.com/larsiusprime/boardgames/tree/master/ninja...
categories: Abstract Strategy
mechanics: Player Elimination, Programmed Movement, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: HolyQuest
description:
"This one player game was originally used as a solo adventure system for HOLYQUEST Fantasy RPG (which uses FUDGE). But it is simple enough for anyone to pick up and play as a solo card and dice game. You play a group of four adventurers fighting evil in dungeons and wilderness settings."

The game provides long and short game victory conditions and a campaign game suggestion.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Dear Abby: I have a problem, my boyfriend keeps playing your GAME!
description: First game printed under the Dear Abby name, allowed for up to 6 players to guess the response of the current player reading from a possible 3 answers. Has 60 letters printed back to back on 30 cards, uncategorized. Each right answer gives 5 points, the reader gets 5 points for each wrong answer compared to his/hers. Object is to get 100 points.
categories: Party Game

name: The Base Ball Card Game
description:
The Base Ball Card Game, designed by the Allegheny Card Company, is an unpublished prototype boxed card game. The prototype contained 112 cards featuring 104 players with an additional eight team "ball counter" cards. There is exactly one original copy of the game, discovered in the 1980s, and it has since had the cards auctioned separately by Lew Lipset in April of 2000. There seem to have been a set of rules found with the prototype, but what became of them after the components were split up is unknown.

The game was registered on April 5th, 1904. It was never published.

"In 1904, the Allegheny Card Co. produced a 112 card boxed set including 104 National League players and 8 team “ball counter” cards. This issue is believed to be the “sole” produced prototype, having never been distributed to the general public."
categories: Card Game, Sports

name: Richard Petty Grand National Champion Race Game
description:
"A hilarious, family fun game for up to six players of all ages. It combines the grand sport of competitive racing with total craziness, for a race you will never forget."

"No player has an advantage no matter what their age. Just because you are ahead, it doesn't mean you will win the race. You may be within half a lap of winning and be sent to the pits, by your best friend; or you may be cruising along minding your own business when some blockhead behind you involves you in an accident and WACKO! off to the pits you both go; or you may draw the dreaded 'Blown Engine' card and be put out of the race."

"There are 30 'fate' cards you may have to draw from -- some are good, some are bad, and some are downright awful. No one is safe from the 'fickle finger of fate', so don't get mad -- get even!!"

Components: game board, six miniature race cars, thirty fate cards, two standard dice, twenty-four green lap chips, twenty-four yellow lap chips, and an instruction sheet.
categories: Racing, Sports

name: Il Campionissimo
description:
Italian cycling game published in the 1960's.

When the game is set up, the road cards are turned one by one, starting from the one that is farther away from the finish line. Most road cards have a rider underneath, each of the twelve different riders appears under four different cards.Every player is supposed to manage one (or more) riders. When one rider shows up, he loses strength and therefore has less chances to be the winner, which is the last rider to appear, the one under the finish line banner. The game includes items like banners, public & price money. The track is formed by cards.
categories: Sports

name: Mega Merger
description:
(from instructions)

"Megamerger is a game where industrial empires are built through strategy and finesse, by merging single industries into powerful conglomerates. Players acquire control of selected industries, collecting higher fees as their empires become more powerful. Along the "Road to Riches" they find greater challenge as opponents build competing conglomerates and as each one formulates strategies for financial supremacy."

In MegaMerger players move around the board buying up shares in various industries. They can own anywhere from 5% of an industry, up to 100% in an industry. Players want to control many industries in the same color in order to make a "conglomerate" which will help them expand how much money they get from players who land on their industries.

However, just because a player owns a part of an industry does not prevent it from being bought by another player. Unlike Monopoly, as long as the player has something, they are in the game. This could be as little as 5% ownership in an industry with no money in front of them.
categories: Economic, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Serpentine
description:
Serpentine ... a 2, 3, or 4-player abstract strategy family board game.

The board consists of streamers with missing intersections and played with 84 tokens, in 4 colours, that are 2-sided with a straight streamer on one side and a curved streamer on the reverse.
In turn, players place their colour tokens on these spaces.

The goal is to form the longest possible same-colour Serpentine streamer.

The game has 3 levels of play:
Level 1 – in turn, players place one of their tokens on an empty space - and the turn is over. When the board is full or there are no more tokens to be placed, in order to form the longest possible streamer, on their next turn, players rotate or invert one of their own tokens in place.

Level 2 – players place one of their tokens on an empty space. During the same turn, a player may either:
1) Rotate or invert an opponent’s token without breaking a continuous streamer.
2) Move one of their own colour tokens to an empty space, thereby possibly breaking their own streamer.

Level 2 – players take these actions in the following order:
1) Place one of their tokens on an empty space.
2) Move any one of the opponent’s tokens to an adjacent empty space without rotating or inverting it.
3) Move any one of their tokens to an empty space on the board without rotating or inverting it ~ or, rotate or invert one of their own tokens in place.

The player with the longest continuous Serpentine streamer is the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Blak Dragon
description:
Parental Advisory: This game has has a maturity rating equivalent to the ESRB video game rating of MATURE due to content of warfare and technology that may be considered too explicit for children.

Blak Dragon: A Game of Space Warfare

Blak Dragon brings players to the war for Sol system. Fight strategically and tactically in the orbital cities, asteroid bases, Martian jungles and all the icy vacuum in-between. This game is set in the time after the Earth's cities were destroyed by the evil Warpigs.

Players can control cities and capital ships that are deployed on a simple 3 dimensional hex-board. As well these larger areas have their own tactical maps for simulation of boarding party battles, weapon strikes and tactical deployment information like command center locations, hangar decks, and storage areas.

Game in development. Please geekmail the designer if you wish to be a testplayer!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Sword & Sorcery Slugfest
description:
A simple tactical game of fantasy combat between individual wizards and warriors. It has nothing to do with Sword & Sorcery.

The game is played on a hex map with spaces large enough to accommodate miniature figures.

Characters are rated for Attack, Damage, Defend, Hits, Speed, and Range (hand to hand). Warriors carry a magical melee weapon with a randomly determined special ability. Wizards have a randomly determined assortment of spells.

Characters earn experience by defeating opponents. Experience can be used to enhance traits or to acquire additional spells.
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Space Fury
description:
"Quick & Dirty Tactical Space Fighter Combat Rules. Special rules for pilots: 10 Skills, Panic, Quirks, Special maneuvers. Very easy ship construction system."

"A space hex map is required. Use painted miniatures or chits to represent ships. 10 and 6 sided dice are used."

The rules cover concepts such as stealth, detection, missiles, guns, morale, factions, and formations. There is also a random skirmish scenario generator.
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Monopoly: Mob Rule Expansion Deck
description:
Here at last we have something that has been sorely lacking from Monopoly since its initial release. One of the things that soon sees it consigned to the cupboard once again to gather dust is the fact that, regardless of what little tweaks you make here and there, each game is essentially the same deja-vous experience.

With this brand new pack of thirty cards, players are once again put back in charge and are given the chance of adding some new flavour to the game. Designed to either replace one of the existing two decks (Chance or Community Chest) or act as a supplementary third deck, these new cards bring some Mafia clout to the table.

Each pack includes a set of instructions describing all the different ways in which these can enhance the game.

'15 Different Cards:'
Speed
Tommy Gun Confession
Change Of Management
Swimming With The Fish
Fire Bomb
Protection Money
Bootlegged Booze
Money Laundering
Getaway Plan
Cash Drop
Gambling Den
Eviction
Eviction: Heavy Handed
Heist
Heist: Double Crossed

'Example: Heist'
Card Wording:
You're feeling lucky and decide to carry out a bank heist.

Roll a dice.
1 & 2
Close escape - miss a turn.
3 & 4
Planned to perfection - collect £500 from the bank.
5 & 6
Caught red handed - go to jail.

Expands:

Monopoly
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Mafia, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Starmageddon
description:
A simple game of tactical spaceship combat.

Eleven types of ships are presented in the game. Each ship is rated for movement, hits, and the number of weapons systems carried. Seventeen different weapons are available, each rated for size, damage, range, and ammunition supply. Defensive systems which may be installed on ships include armor, missile defense system, and a self-destruct mechanism.

The players build fleets of ships which have an equal number of hit points, as set by scenario.
categories: Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Duel of the Sun Slayers
description:
This is a tactical space combat game in the Warriors of the Dark Star: The Age of the Neutron Wars series, and includes the second edition rulebook for that game (as a series rulebook).

From a GFG catalog (reproduced verbatim):


This "WD" Game pits the powerful Omega Ship Constitution Class against the Deadly Unruk Dreadnaughts of the N'Dridds and the Sumnul Betas. Scenarios such as the "Attack on the Outposts", "Seige of the Frontiers", "Plunder Raids of the Brain Slaves", etc. This is a detailed comparison of what occured in the BFA "Deliverance from Beyond the Stars".




Geomorphic Map—Sections, Hardbacked, solid boards, each one 11x14 inches, can be combined into a 22x28-inch mapboard, or a 44x14-inch, 64x11-inch mapboard, or any other combination. The Boards here have 9 different kinds of Space Obstacles and Vortexes. The amazing thing about WD boards is that the four boards in this game can be connected to the mapboards of other WD games, and ALL WD GAMES have their boards so made that they can be interconnected with all the other WD versions. Counters are on 8 1/2 x 11-inch large sheets showing the weapons systems in detail that the silhouettes on the BFA counters only implied. THIS GAME CAN BE PLAYED BY ONE OR MORE PEOPLE (UP T0 11 can play). Each player handles one ship. Sun Slayers specializes in OutPosts, Beacons, Omega Ships, Monitors; all are enclosed and utilize the drama of the long-term duties of the Star Forces in the defensive OutPosts that might be raided at any time to poke a hole into Federation territory, for Taal Battle Cruisers to rush through and how fast Thetan and Alliance ships can rush to the aid of the Defensive Line.
categories: Science Fiction, Wargame

name: De copa en Copa por... Barcelona
description:
The object of the game is to get to know if the more significant night spots of Barcelona and at the same time learn to mix some of the most famous cocktail recipes in the history of the bar.
Through the game you will discover a world of new night spots to enjoy a drink, or simply share an evening at home with friends, tasting the cocktails you have made yourself.

The game comprises of:
1. One board with 60 squares.
2. 10 cocktail cards an recipes.
3. 2 jockers to barter for penalties.
4. 6 colored counters in the form of a cocktail glass.
5. 1 dice
6. A map of the city where each night spot is indicated by a number which tallies with the number on the appropriate square of the board game.
categories: Party Game
publishers: Andres i Andreu Produccions, S.C.P. (Andreu Toys)

name: To The Top
description: To The Top is a game where you try to top a victory ascension chart through Bluffing, voting and Co-operation. Voting is the main form of ascension through the chart however more people voting for a single item can have adverse ascension consequences. Through moderate co-operation ascension is guaranteed.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Economic

name: Woods & Waters Trivia Game
description:
Each player answers questions correctly in order to be the first to advance from start to finish.

There are four trivia categories: Shooting & Hunting, fishing, Camping & Survival, Potpourri.

Contents: Playing board, 2 volumes of Questions & Answers, 2 bookmarks, 2 footprint dice, 4 shotgun playing pieces, and a dice rolling cup.
categories: Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Thunder Gods: Kamikazes at Okinawa
description:
Game uses a standard deck of cards to resolve activations and combat between the Japanese planes trying to destroy US Navy ships, and the American planes and ships in defense. Simulation of kamikaze action off Okinawa in April, 1945.

Published in Panzer Digest #5
categories: Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Symposion
description:
"A Symposion is a Greek word meaning a Wine drinking party. These were popular in ancient Greece. Depending on the Host (Symposiarch), the emphasis of the gathering could range from purely Intellectual discussion to Hedonistic debauchery."

The players score points by hosting a Symposion. This is done by playing a set of cards and declaring whether the Symposion is intellectual, social, or hedonistic. The type of Symposion determines how points are calculated for the particular cards played.

The game ends when the deck has been gone through three times and no player has a Symposion to play. The player with the most points wins the game.
categories: Ancient, Card Game

name: Tour de Francia
description: Spanish cycling game about the Tour de France produced at the end of the 1950's with artwork by Lizarraga.
categories: Racing, Sports

name: Table Bowls
description:
Played seriously in parts of Northern England and Australia, Table Bowls gives Snooker and Pool players something new and fun. The game is played just like bowls on a lawn except each wood is carefully aimed using a special wooden chute.

A skillful game for two players, table bowls is designed to be played on a billiards table or other flat surface.

There are two different sizes of table bowls - 5.1cm (2 inch) and 5.7cm (2 1/4 inch) in diameter and two corresponding sets. Each set consists of a hardwood chute, an unbiased jack and 4 pairs of table bowls.

The 2 inch set features 4 pairs of bowls, each pair with a different bias. Jack is 1.25 inches diameter.
The bowls in the 2 1/4 inch set all have the same bias. Jack is 1.5 inches diameter.
categories: Action / Dexterity
publishers: (Unknown), F. H. Ayres, John Jaques of London, Mancho, Sandham Brothers

name: Pluto's Big Bike Racing Game
description: American cycling themed racing game. Each player has his own track and he who reaches the end first is the winner. No dice are used though, movement is determined by a set of seven race cards for each player.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Onset
description:
Dale's Woodcraft has manufactured a visually appealing wooden folding game board with 6 rows of 12 columns numbered 1 - 12 with each of the 6x12 intersections a depression to fit the marbles. The game stores 24 marbles (12 each of 2 colors), 4 dice, and 4 scoring pegs. Each round consists of 12 points and first to win 2 rounds wins the game.

Depending on the roll of two die, the optional use of a decreasing "reinforcement" number, and the management of the lower non-scoring columns to absorb part of the roll, each player moves a combination of marbles across the board towards and into the opponent's territory scoring points along the way and eventually blocking the movement of their opponent (unless the opponent blocks them first!).

This game involves luck of the dice along with the management of a reinforcement number and non-scoring columns to enable a strategy of movement for a fast moving game that is simple to play.
categories: Dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Million Dollar Challenge
description:
The Million Dollar Challenge is a new board game based on the teachings of legendary commodities trader Larry Williams, which allows players to enter trades using actual market indicators, such as ADX and Percent R. You'll wait for the correct entry, place your buy/sell order and exit at an opportune time.

This fun and popular board game improves the family's understanding of the many considerations that go into trading the markets.

Begin by moving around the board collecting entry and indicator cards. Determine which market you'll enter by rolling the market die. Markets include gold, T-bonds, wheat, copper, coffee, S&P 500 and more. Wager your contracts, place your protective stop and enter the trade. Watch for changing market conditions. Reach an exit space to determine if your trade is profitable.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: LinguaFun!
description:
From the game insert: "LinguaFun is an exciting learning tool that combines the effectiveness of audio language tapes and flash cards with the fun of many popular card games. From the very first game you play, you will be speaking a foreign language using this unique and proven method. Available in Italian, French, Spanish, German, and Ingles."

The game comes with cards and a pronunciation CD. The cards come in three colors, are numbered with digits and the word for that number in the foreign language, and contain a word or phrase with a phonetic guide and English translation. Rules come for using these cards to play Solitaire, Crazy Colors, Concentration, Gin Rummy, Go Fish, and War.
categories: Card Game

name: Roll Dice Kill Monsters Have Fun Dungeon Crawler
description: ROLL DICE KILL MONSTERS HAVE FUN DUNGEON CRAWLER is a fresh take on mazes, this game is more than just finding a path from start to finish, it's also about overcoming the obstacles along the way. The obstacles come in the form of traps and adversaries. The traps are whatever the players imagine them to be they could be a pit of spikes, a falling boulder, etc. The adversaries are met by the players by means of a random encounter system, defeating adversaries will most certainly garner usable rewards for the players. In ROLL DICE KILL MONSTERS HAVE FUN DUNGEON CRAWLER there are two kinds of mazes. The first is to successfully reach the finish from a set start point. The second is to successfully meet and defeat a boss type character. ROLL DICE KILL MONSTERS HAVE FUN DUNGEON CRAWLER is the groundbreaking amalgamation of a board game and an analog role playing game, without any of the convoluted aspects of analog role playing games.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Maze
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Count Your Peanuts! Math Game
description:
From the box:

"We’ve made counting practice more fun than ever, with a super-involving game kids will love to play! Children just roll the die to move around the board collecting or giving away cute peanuts along the way. At the finish line, kids count up the peanuts in their bags and the player with the most peanuts wins the game! 2-4 players; with 4 rugged vinyl bags, plastic peanuts and more. Game board is 16" x 16".
categories: Children's Game, Math

name: Mythomachy
description:
Mythology is a subject of never-ending fascination! Myths of creation, of floods, of heroes - these and many others crop up in the myths of numerous cultures throughout the world. Mythology has inspired painters, sculptors, writers and other artists over the centuries.

Now, world mythology is encompassed, as is reasonably possible, within Mythomachy, the top educational, brain development and family-friendly entertaining brand designed to teach children about mythology as well as to help them discover new ways to foster their intelligence. Mythomachy intends to be represented across all major categories of youth products with focus on toys, publishing and other consumer product categories, including apparel, accessories, back-to-school and more as this exciting property has enormous branding and licensing potential for the boy and girl audience.

There is a lot of excitement behind Mythomachy Trading Card Game distributed first across retail venues nationwide in Greece. Unlike most trading card games, which are based on fantasy, Mythomachy is solidly anchored in the global universe of authentic myths and legends.

Mythomachy TCG first edition includes a 350-card set available in 6-card booster packs, providing a tremendous base of consumer-tested artwork and game play, taking into account the age-sensitive profile of its target, kids Ages 7 and up.

In an already male-saturated market, Mythomachy is enjoyed as much by female fans as male because of its directly educational quality profile and learning benefits.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: Tarzan de los Monos
description: Tarzan of the Monkeys. Roll and move adventure game from Sony for young children.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Novel-based

name: Sinaps
description: Players take turns adding tiles to the board to create pathways to the center of the board. Once a player completes a path, he moves a chip along the path to the center. The first player to stack two chips in a row in the center is the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Capture the Flags
description:
This is a mathematic game where players roll 3 dice at a time and try to match any combination of the dice to any of the face up flags. Players can use any combination on the dice using addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division. When a match is made, the player "captures" that flag. The turn ends when a player either captures a flag or fails to make a match, and play passes to the next player. When all flags are captured, the game ends.

Game includes 3 dice and deck of "flag" cards.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Math

name: Bridget's Diet Game
description:
Roll and move around a colorful board and draw from a variety of cards to find out how much weight you can lose.

Unbelievable, the box advertises this game as "For Chubby Folks ages 12 years and older".
categories: Educational, Humor, Medical

name: Shadow of the Colossus Card Game: Forbidden Lands
description:
To play Forbidden Lands players use cards to recreate the epic battles of the Playstation game.

Shadow of the Colossus: Forbidden Lands utilizes four main types of cards:

Character Cards- These are the cards used in battle.
Event Cards- These cards allow the player to draw/discard/exchange cards or alter character card stats.
Item Cards- Can be equipt to character of light cards to boost their ATK or HLT points.
Power Cards- Are used to pay for the use of character cards.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Video Game Theme

name: Spuren im Wald
description:
from the publisher's website:
Tracks through the forest. Throughout the forest, you can find signs that animals live here: Under the tree lies a gnawed fir cone, and there are tracks left by little paws on the wayside. In winter you can clearly see the tracks through the snow. But it's also easy to find signs on animals in summer if you pay attention. However, you need to know a lot if you want to identify the animals that have passed by.

Contents:


1 game board
8 animal cards
4 track searchers
16 feed pieces
4 info sheets
categories: Children's Game

name: Phil Silvers You'll Never Get Rich
description:
"You'll Never Get Rich - Can You Beat Bilko?"

Based on the 1950's CBS TV show. Roll and move around the board and take your chance with what card you might draw. Make enough money and you've beaten Bilko!
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 2000 Jaar Later...
description: This is a quiz about the Christian religion. You learn about the stories of the Bible and to understand them. The game can be played in three difficulties.
categories: Educational, Religious, Trivia

name: Future Focus Game
description: Future Focus is a diabetes game that helps families learn a diabetic diet and diabetic friendly foods. It also teaches about the two types of diabetes such as Type1 & Type2. In addition, it aslo educates about diabetic symptoms, nutrition, when to take a shot of insulin, hypoglycemia and hyperglycemia, and blood sugar levels (also known as blood glucose). Future Focus is a unique one of a kind diabetes game that also explains how the pancreas does not produce enough insulin for the body when someone has diabetes and how obesity is a risk factor for diabetes. These are some of the aspects that make up Future Focus. It is used by hospitals, homes, camps, and schools all over the world.
categories: Educational

name: Jenga: John Deere Collector's Edition
description:
Nothing runs likes a Deere! Play Jenga a fun new way - with John Deere blocks and custom dice that add excitement to the game! It’s the same great game with a John Deere twist. Build your tower with yellow and green blocks. As the tower builds so does the difficulty. Custom John Deere Jenga rules make the game even more challenging and fun! Roll the dice to determine your next move... "tractor" reverses the direction of play; "silo" allows you to remove any piece and "tire" means you remove only a yellow block. Game comes complete with 54 hard wood Jenga blocks, 1 custom dice, custom John Deere rules and a loading tray for assembly.

Ages 6+
1 or more players
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game

name: Book Of Mormon Football
description: After teaching a Book of Mormon lesson, divide the group (or family) into two teams. Place both footballs on the 50 yard line (one above the large football in the center of the board and one below). Each team takes a turn picking a question from the "Question" sack. If they answer it correctly, they then pick a yardage amount from the "Yards" sack. They move their football the indicated amount. Continue taking turns until one team reaches the goal line. Then the team can pick an additional card from the "Extra Point" sack. On a chalk board or piece of paper, keep score. Each team receives 6 points for each goal and the amount of extra points they pick from the "Extra Point" sack. When all the questions have been answered (or time is up), the winners are determined by their score.
categories: Educational, Religious, Sports

name: On a Roll
description:
ON A ROLL is a dice game for two or three players. Components consist of a 9x9 board, five standard dice and chips in three colors. Each square on the board is printed with either a dice combination or a special rule.

The object is to align five chips in a row on the board to form a "run". The winner will be the first player to form three "runs".

The player rolls all five dice one to three times, setting aside dice during the previous rolls. The player must use the highest combination of the final roll. After the final roll, the player places a chip on the board that matches that roll. If all matching squares are already filled, that player's turn is over and may not place a chip on the board.
Play then proceeds to the next player.

Additional team action: Four players are divided into two teams of two players. Team members sit opposite each other. In addition, the board is divided with a neutral zone separating team members. Team members may only play in their own zone and the neutral zone.

Six players may divide into two teams of three or three teams of two. Team members sit opposite of each other. The neutral zone is optional.
categories: Dice

name: Card Board
description: “Card Board” is a fun little pocket-sized game. Whatever surface you can find becomes the playing field, and the cards make up the board (tile-fashion) which is different every time. Each player has a hand of card to choose from in building the board. Strive for points, follow the safe routes, build traps for your opponents, and try to stay out of those traps yourself. Some cards allow you to revise the layout and turn traps into a chance to score. A game of 50 points can last about 20 minutes and will get most of the cards in play.
categories: Card Game, Dice
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: European Travellers
description: A race through Europe. The instruction book describes the various places where players can land. Numbered from 1 Greenland to 122, with pictures of Ships, Bears etc. Lithographed and hand colored, size 26 in. X 30 in. cut into 15 sections and mounted on canvas.
categories: Racing

name: Jomino
description: Dominoes variant. The tiles show faces of clowns, but these are not complete: They contain 1 to 7 components (hat, hair, eyes etc.). Tiles can be placed at the top or right side only when they contain more components than the last tile; at the bottom or left side only when they contain less. The object is to get rid of the tiles as quickly as possible.
categories: Children's Game

name: China Doll: The Card Game
description:
China Doll is an action game based on the short film ‘China Doll’. Choose between four mafia families from New York City’s Chinatown and Little Italy battle to take over the sacred Xin-Lu sword and slaughter other player’s family members.

The game is composed of the following cards:
Family, Character, Action, Immediate and one Xin-Lu Sword Card.
The purpose of the game is to posses the Xin-Lu Sword card, fighting for it and/or stealing it.
The player who has the Xin-Lu sword and kills all other player’s family members is the winner. If a player has the Xin-Lu sword and all his or her family members are killed, he or she also wins (because no-one else will ever find it).
So whether you kill everyone or everyone kills you, as long as you have the sword, you win.

You may play up to 3 cards during each turn. It is recommendable to play at least 1 character card to defend your self against attacks. Character cards have 3 different numbers (red, green and white) that will determine their value depending on who they are fighting against. You may only use characters that belong to your family.

This game is ideally played with 2 to 3 players (specially 3 players), but can also be played with 4 to 5 players if two decks are mixed together and used.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Mafia, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Jai Alai
description:
Jai Alai is based on the fastest sport in the world!
Jai Alai (aka Cesta Punta) is a sport with origins in the Basque Country, where the ball reaches speeds of up to 300kms per hour (180mph) and injure or even kill a player.
Now you can bring the excitement of this amazing sport to your living room, without having to risk your life doing it too! It includes all the small details that make this sport so amazing, such as the ancient traditional team selection, two-wall shots, and even jumping off the wall in order to reach a high ball.
It is played on a accurate small-scale replica of a cancha/fronton (Jai Alai court) with a grid.
During each turn the player rolls a special "DosDados" roll to move, catches the ball, selects the distance and rolls another "DosDados" to determine the total and finally chooses the direction of the ball.
It is a fast-paced game with plenty strategy and excitement. The objective of the game is similar to that of tennis. For example; if your opponent does not reach the ball before the second bounce, it will be a point in your favour.
The game is played with two teams of two pelotaris (Jai Alai players) and can be played with 2 to 4 players.
categories: Dice, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: National Derby
description:
Very simple spin the spinner to show a color and then move the horse of that color along the track to the finish line.

The track itself is a straight line track with 17 landing areas and then the finish line. First accross the finish line wins
categories: Children's Game

name: Travellers map game to Chicago and the World's Fair
description:
This is an instructive game board called The Travellers Map Game to Chicago and the World's Fair published by G. WM. Baist Philadelphia.

It was made for the 1893 Columbian Exposition / Chicago Worlds Fair.

Board size: 21 7/8 Inches long (open), 14 1/8 Inches tall
categories: Educational

name: 100 Points: The Card Game
description: The players try to get a four-card hand totaling 100 points. Each time they do they score the hand. The first player with 400 points wins the game.
categories: Card Game

name: The Greatest Gift
description: A card game about trying to figure out what the other players would most like out of real life, and offering these things as gifts. Players are rewarded when their offered gifts are chosen above the others. Gifts range from wealth, skills, and acts of kindness to super powers and objects of absolute ridiculousness, and even a few "promises" for real-life things. Fast-paced and simple to learn and play.
categories: Card Game

name: Brothers Divided: Skirmishes in the Gettysburg Campaign
description: The book is a collection of eight wargaming scenarios, primarily of the skirmish variety, designed ideally for Brother Against Brother but also suitable for any other system. It begins with some background information about the Gettysburg campaign, and then has the various legends (map, Order of Battle, and formations.) The book then gives the background story, forces, map, and scenario details for each scenario.
categories: American Civil War, Wargame

name: Cosmic Convention
description:
Cosmic Convention is a metagame to be played at conventions; first created for Consummation, but also played at TowerCon and one or two other UK conventions.

Rules

The power of chaos - each guest at Consummation will be issued with one Cosmic Encounter-style power, which may be used in any game played at the con - if all other players agree. We will try to choose powers which are interesting and perhaps add a little bit of chaos, but are not totally unbalancing. If your power would unbalance the game you are in, please don't use it - or find a different game!

The power of courtesy - clearly, use of these powers is optional. If anybody at your table doesn't want to use the powers, then please respect their wishes. Also, we suggest you check all the powers in play at the start of a game, and try to resolve any potential conflicts before the game starts. Finally, all of the powers are likely to be useless in some game or another; we're afraid you're either going to have to live with it, or choose your games carefully!

The power of mutability

Powers may be freely traded
At the start of the convention, you will be allocated one power, but this is not a limit. If you can accumulate more, feel free to use them!
At the end of a game, the winner may trade one of his/her powers with a power of his/her choice belonging to any other player in the game.
categories: Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Spooner's Pictorial Map of England & Wales
description:
A roll-and-move game with 36 pages of rules. In the book of rules each county is described.

'Arranged as An Amusing and Instructive Game for Youth'. 'Illustrated with upwards of One Hundred and Twenty hand-coloured Views'. It is dissected and mounted on linen. Players start at the very top (space 1) and must reach London (space 104)first to win the game.
categories: Dice, Educational

name: Betts's Tour Through England and Wales
description: A roll-and-move game, where the towns are marked with symbols for the population. Out and return from London through 91 stops.
categories: Dice, Educational

name: Crowned Heads or Contemporary Sovereigns
description: A roll-and-move game educating history.
categories: Dice, Educational

name: little BIG city
description:
Your city is on the verge of becoming a Super City and this little BIG city faces some BIG challenges.

How will your city bring together the huge range of communities with their differing cultures, incomes, desires, goals? Will the new city model be able to reduce mistakes of the past? How will the built environment develop and grow?

Little big city is played in 16 rounds, with each player assuming a role in the city. Mayor, Urban Designer, Engineer or Architect. After each round players roles change, with the Mayor choosing their next role and other players swapping theirs.

The game is designed to give each player the flexibility to make their own decisions and also work with each other. Consent applications are applied for and buildings built using various shaped blocks. Built environment features are added which help the city manage Social, Environmental and Economic issues and sometimes natural and unnatural disasters. Players strive to build a thriving city and gain the most points to win.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Environmental, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Staying Alive
description:
Players will be able to identify basic automotive shop safety rules.

This is a basic race track design where the competitors follow a serpentine course using a die to move forward to the various spaces. These spaces contain an image depicting the category of safety rules to be learned.
categories: Educational, Racing, Trivia

name: Heavenly Ham House: The Safe-Sex Virtual-Reality Role-Playing Game!!
description:
Straight from San Francisco, where anything goes, come Heavenly Ham House, the kinky, sexual-innuendo abstinence-aid board game, where players spin for turn-ons and fetishes, and bounce from one steamy situation to the next!

A very silly PG-17 game by underground cartoonist Lloyd Dangle. One of the ten very limited silk screen game boards produced by Wild Wigout Comix Game Boards (less than 100 of each game was produced).
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: PODS the space race
description:
NiMeMo is an abstract strategy game. Now, 2023, after some testing and theme research, I have decided to give it a Sci-Fi theme.

PODS the space race

It is set in the year 2222, when humanity has overpopulated earth and we have to expand our habitat, terraforming satellites and planets.

Through a combination of sliding boards and moving pieces, you must gather all of your pieces, pods, on one of the space stations before any other player does.

You might be near the end and think you are about to win but beware, things can change drastically!!!

Two or three players.
categories: Abstract Strategy
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Trade the Market
description:
Includes comes with
22 Ticker Tape Cards
26 News Cards
Stack of Money
Account Pad
Insert Trays
Playing Board
Instructions
The Idea of the Game is to Trade Stocks...Buying, Selling, and Selling Short...so profitably that one becomes the richest trader and the Winner.

A player is chosen to "function" as the Stockbroker. The Market is Opened with the turning up of the top Ticker Tape and Unlimited trading, in Lots of 100 Share, may begin. Brokerage Commission is paid on every trade.

News Cards affect Stock Prices "UP" and "Down". A Record is kept of every trade and each change in price. Stocks may be bought on Margin (credit". A Market Closing Time is set, at which time all trading Stops.
categories: Economic

name: Jagd auf Kohlenklau
description: Very rare propaganda board game print published by Lepthian-Schiffers in the 1930s that sought to promote economy in the use of raw materials in Germany.
categories: Economic, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: TowerRun
description:
TowerRun is a standard issue Open License Print and Play Dungeon Crawl Adventure Game for 1 (solo) to 4 players. It attempts to make use of several distinguishing mechanics.

First, no DM player is required. All monsters obey simple AI/automatic rules, which can be performed by anybody willing to do it. Second, dungeon crawl games often take a very long time to play due to a lot of dice rolling. TowerRun attempts to minimize this by eliminating dice rolling wherever possible, including during combat. The (hopeful) end result is not only a faster game, but a more strategic method of play. Third, there is a built in “score” system that single or multiple players can attempt to beat whenever they play. The game is not designed to be “beaten” on the first attempt, so multiple attempts are necessary, and each time you can try and beat your previous high score. Finally, a core mechanic of the game revolves around random pairings of objects and enchantments. Quite often objects have unknown enchantments that can be revealed in a calculated or risky method. Players do not know what the enchantments are until they use the item, but if they use the item without first identifying it they run the risk of it being cursed.

These mechanics make for heightened tension, faster game play, and a depth of balance and strategy.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Place Value Mystery House Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Students search a haunted house for golden numbers—and take the mystery out of place value! In this skill-building math game, players solve place value problems to move around the game board…then check their answers in the mystery decoder and write each answer on their place value cards. The first player to reach the golden numbers wins the game!"

Game Components:
Game board
50 Mystery cards
Mystery decoder envelope
4 write & wipe place value cards
4 dry-erase markers
4 game pawns
categories: Educational

name: Assault of the Dead
description:
Rulebook:
You and your companions are a ragtag bunch of zombie-fighting survivors waging a battle against a horde of the dead engulfing the city. Your team will travel across the hotspots, stemming the tide of hungry dead and helping the remaining survivors to safe houses. You must work together, using whatever skills are available to save the survivors before the dead rise up and destroy the city. The clock is ticking as every moment in the hotspot their hunger grows. Will you be able to succeed before the attack of the dead?
categories: Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Dédalo
description:
In this game two armies clash and the only thing that will discourage them is the fact of losing their king in battle. All the king’s men will fight to death for him, regardless of the fact that even the king is a fierce fighter.
This last battle takes place in a very strange land, long tunnels that are always changing to confuse anyone that wanders in them.

With similar mechanics as in “NiMeMo” you have to move your army around the board and try to eliminate your opponent’s pieces by blocking them.
As soon as you eliminate the other’s king you win.

Dédalo (in Spanish) comes from Daedalus. In Greek mythology Daedalus was a skilful craftsman and artisan. The Labyrinth on Crete was created by him.
So as in this game we have an ever-changing labyrinth I decided to give it Daedalus’ name on his honour.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Maze

name: Royal Geographical Amusement or the Safe and Expeditious Traveller Through all the Parts of Europe by Sea and by Land
description:
The gameboard showing a map of Europe with the principal and capital cities numbered. Together with printed sheet of rules and descriptive text.

He who has the highest number in spinning the totum, is to begin, and the others are to follow according to their respective numbers. Three Gentlemen or Ladies are supplied to make the tour of Europe. They are represented by the three Turned Pillars, called Travellers, each of the players having one of these, which is to be placed at the stage corresponding to the number turned up. The four counters, of the same colour with the Traveller, are to be employed as Markers, and take the name SERVANTS. The player is to lay down as many of these as he is ordered to wait turns, and when it comes to his turn to spin again, instead of spinning he must take up one Marker, and so on, till they are all taken up.

Published December 1st, 1823.
categories: Unspecified

name: Satori
description:
From the publisher of Satori: the Radical Forgiveness Board Game. . .

Satori is a really fun way to let go of emotional baggage — forgiving yourself and others in the process — easily and quickly. It promotes laughter, enlightenment, insight and growth — both spiritual and personal.

Quite amazingly, 'Satori' gives us the exact insights we need to move beyond vicitimhood and to heal our lives. The game mirrors for us our own wisdom in having created the very circumstances of our own healing. It leads us to where we can reframe the past and see the perfection in it. It can be prophetic in showing us issues we didn’t even know we had. And It connects us to the truth of who we are. It’s quite a game!

OBJECTIVE

The goal is to proceed through four levels of consciousness in order to get to Satori — total awareness.

EVENT AND CONTEXT CARDS

Each player picks an Event card and a Context card. (9 times out of 10 these are a direct hit on an issue the person needs to work on). Each player in turn creates a victim story around that situation and places his/her playing piece in Victimland to start the game.

THE LANDING SPACES

Of course the journey is one fraught with difficulties and repleat with blessings, depending upon which space you land. The landing spaces will direct you to look at your beliefs, blocks, karma, stories and projections etc., with instructions or by drawing cards.

NEW STORY CARDS

These help you shift out of your victim story - with all its negative beliefs and energy blocks, and move into a new story.

'SATORI'

No matter who gets there first, we want for everyone else to come to Satori. At that point, each player gets a chance to reframe their story and to read an affirmation.

THE RESULTS

People report feeling lighter, feeling free from pain or the weight of guilt and anger, more compassionate and more loving.
categories: Unspecified

name: Conflickt: Field of Slaughter
description:
Inspired by games from Crokinole to Catacombs to Taktika, Conflickt: Field of Slaughter is a two to six player dexterity game of strategic and tactical combat with a fantasy war theme. Asymmetric in design, each player leads a faction of warriors (melee, ranged, and special units) with unique colors and properties in both team and free-for-all battles to rout the other armies.

Players of Conflickt can command the Humans (yellow), Goblins (green), Elves (blue), Orcs (red), Dwarves (orange), or Undead (purple). Each option plays differently, with varying numbers of warriors and unique special units employing awesome powers that can completely change the game.

Any relatively smooth table can serve as the eponymous Field of Slaughter. Strike quickly and strike true, or death awaits from an enemy with a better plan!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fantasy

name: Uh-Oh Mountain
description: Uh-Oh Mountain is a roll & move game that has players depicting snow skiers racing down a mountain. Each player will roll two dice to move and if they land an Uh-Oh space (about 1/3 of the space) they draw an Uh-Oh card which will transport them to another space on the board (either being a reward or a punishment.
categories: Racing

name: Linebacker 2
description: This is a strategic level wargame of the 1972 bombing campaign against North Vietnam. Includes one map and 150 counters. This game from Sweden originally appeared in issue #8 of "Combat" magazine.
categories: Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: King's Row
description:
The Chess, Checkers, and Poker Board Game according to the box. King's Row is a Checkers mutation. Each checker has a playing card value on it. This value has two effects. First, a jump can't be made against a checker with a higher value.
